translated: If you are attached to the other, covered by skin and so forth, then also to that uncovered . . .

original: gal te pags pa la sogs pas g-yogs pa'i phyir rgyu des khyod mi gtsang ba la chags par gyur na de'i tshe ci'i phyir gzhan te gzhan gyi rus pa la 'khyud par byed /
analyzed: gal te pags pa la sogs pas g-yogs pa'i phyir rgyu des khyod mi gtsang ba la chags par gyur na de'i tshe ci'i phyir gzhan te gzhan gyi rus pa la 'khyud par byed /
translated: If you are attached to the impure because of being covered by skin and so forth, then why do you embrace the bones of another?

original: gzhan ni sngar bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhan ni sngar bzhin du'o //
translated: The other is as before.

original: 'di la yang ci'i phyir mi rigs zhes /
analyzed: 'di la yang ci'i phyir mi rigs zhes /
translated: Why is this not reasonable?

original: khyod nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: khyod nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The root text] states, “You yourself . . .”

original: rang nyid de bdag nyid mi gtsang ba shin tu mang ba ni mchil ma dang snabs dang glang rgyas dang gci ba dang bshad pa rnams khyed la yod pa yin la /
analyzed: rang nyid de bdag nyid mi gtsang ba shin tu mang ba ni mchil ma dang snabs dang glang rgyas dang gci ba dang bshad pa rnams khyed la yod pa yin la /
translated: You yourself have a great deal of impurity, such as saliva, mucus, grease, urine, and feces.

original: mi gtsang ba de nyid kyis dga' bar gyis shig / de'i phyir mi gtsang ba'i rkyal pa ste bshad pa 'byung ba yin la /
analyzed: mi gtsang ba de nyid kyis dga' bar gyis shig / de'i phyir mi gtsang ba'i rkyal pa ste bshad pa 'byung ba yin la /
translated: Therefore, it is a bag of impurities, as explained.

original: gzhan ni tha dad pa bud med kyi lus kyi rang bzhin mi gtsang zhing btsog pa'i bshad pa za ba'i rang tshul can yin la /
analyzed: gzhan ni tha dad pa bud med kyi lus kyi rang bzhin mi gtsang zhing btsog pa'i bshad pa za ba'i rang tshul can yin la /
translated: Another is one who has the nature of a different, impure, filthy woman’s body, who eats the explanation, and who has his own way of being.

original: rnam dran byed na yid la bsam par byed ba'o //
analyzed: rnam dran byed na yid la bsam par byed ba'o //
translated: If he is mindful, he thinks about it.

original: bdag gi sha 'di la zhes pa la sogs pas yang spang ba'i ched du gzhan gsungs pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag gi sha 'di la zhes pa la sogs pas yang spang ba'i ched du gzhan gsungs pa yin la /
translated: “My flesh” and so on is stated again for the purpose of abandoning it.

original: gang gi sha la dga' ba 'di ni sha la dga' ba ste /
analyzed: gang gi sha la dga' ba 'di ni sha la dga' ba ste /
translated: He who delights in flesh is one who delights in flesh.

original: @159b bdag yin la 'di ni rus gong gi'o //
analyzed: @159b bdag yin la 'di ni rus gong gi'o //
translated: This is the skeleton of the self.

original: yang na sha la dga' ba ni sha la dga' ba yin la sngar bzhin du bdag ni 'di la'o zhes te bdag 'di'i sha la dga' ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yang na sha la dga' ba ni sha la dga' ba yin la sngar bzhin du bdag ni 'di la'o zhes te bdag 'di'i sha la dga' ba yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Or, one who delights in flesh is one who delights in flesh. As before, “I am this” means “I am the flesh of this,” which is the meaning of the statement.

original: de ltar na de la zhen pa'i phyir ram slar phan 'dogs pa'i blos reg dang lta bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar na de la zhen pa'i phyir ram slar phan 'dogs pa'i blos reg dang lta bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: Thus, because of attachment to that, he desires to touch and see it with the intention of benefiting it again.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa la dga' ba'o //
translated: It is delightful to see and to touch.

original: 'dir gsungs pa sems med pa ni sems kyis stong pa yin te 'jim gong bzhin du rang bzhin gyis tha mal pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa sems med pa ni sems kyis stong pa yin te 'jim gong bzhin du rang bzhin gyis tha mal pa'o //
translated: Here it is said: “The mindless one is empty of mind, like a lump of clay, naturally ordinary.

original: yang sems dang ldan pas sems so zhes ji ltar gzhan gyis brjod pa de ltar sha la khyod ni zhes pa ltar rang bzhin ma yin pa ni ma yin no ;
analyzed: yang sems dang ldan pas sems so zhes ji ltar gzhan gyis brjod pa de ltar sha la khyod ni zhes pa ltar rang bzhin ma yin pa ni ma yin no ;
translated: And, as you say, ‘the one with mind is mind,’ it is not that he is not naturally so.

original: /'dod pa can khyod de cis mi 'dod /
analyzed: /'dod pa can khyod de cis mi 'dod /
translated: O lustful one, why don’t you accept that?

original: de 'dod pa na 'jim pa'i dum bu la yang 'gyur la de bzhin du yang khyod kyang sems dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'dod pa na 'jim pa'i dum bu la yang 'gyur la de bzhin du yang khyod kyang sems dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you accept that, then a lump of clay would also be so, and likewise you would be without mind.

original: de la sems kyi rang bzhin gyi sems yod pa de la nges 'dod pa yin no zhes pa ni /
analyzed: de la sems kyi rang bzhin gyi sems yod pa de la nges 'dod pa yin no zhes pa ni /
translated: If you say that the one who has the nature of mind has mind,

original: gal te sems ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: gal te sems ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: then the verse says, “If the mind . . .” and so forth.

original: gal te sems de sems kyi rang bzhin 'dod na de gzugs med pa'i phyir blta bar mi nus la /
analyzed: gal te sems de sems kyi rang bzhin 'dod na de gzugs med pa'i phyir blta bar mi nus la /
translated: If you assert that the mind has the nature of mind, then it cannot be seen because it is formless.

original: lus med pa'i phyir reg bar mi nus te /
analyzed: lus med pa'i phyir reg bar mi nus te /
translated: And it cannot be touched because it is bodiless.

original: gang sha dang rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus reg pa dang blta bar nus shing grub pa la de dang ldan pa'i shes pa med pa yin te /
analyzed: gang sha dang rus pa'i rang bzhin gyi lus reg pa dang blta bar nus shing grub pa la de dang ldan pa'i shes pa med pa yin te /
translated: That body which is of the nature of flesh and bones, which can be touched and seen, and which is established, is without consciousness.

original: sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is devoid of mind.

original: de'i phyir ci zhig ces te /
analyzed: de'i phyir ci zhig ces te /
translated: Therefore, what?

original: sems med pa de la 'khyud par byed cing sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sems med pa de la 'khyud par byed cing sbyor bar byed /
translated: One embraces and unites with that which is mindless.

original: rmongs pa zhes pa ni 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'khyud par rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: rmongs pa zhes pa ni 'bras bu med pa nyid du 'khyud par rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: “Foolish” means that it is not right to embrace that which is fruitless.

original: gzhan du na bong ba la sogs pa la yang 'khyud par thal lo //
analyzed: gzhan du na bong ba la sogs pa la yang 'khyud par thal lo //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that one could embrace a clod of earth and so on.

original: gzhan yang 'di yang shin tu smad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi gtsang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang 'di yang shin tu smad pa yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir mi gtsang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, in order to show that this is also very contemptible, he says, “What is contemptible,” and so on.

original: gzhan gyi lus la mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du gang mi rtogs pa de la ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med par rigs pa nyid de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi lus la mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du gang mi rtogs pa de la ngo mtshar cung zad kyang med par rigs pa nyid de /
translated: It is reasonable that there is not the slightest wonder in the case of one who does not understand that the body of another is of the nature of filth.

original: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi rigs pa de bdag nyid la bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgyud kyi rigs pa de bdag nyid la bskal pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that which is reasonable in the continuum of another is far away in oneself.

original: 'di ni shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba'i gnas yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni shin tu yang ngo mtshar ba'i gnas yin te /
translated: This is a very amazing thing.

original: rang ste bdag nyid la mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i lus khyod kyis rtogs par ma gyur te ma go ba'o //
analyzed: rang ste bdag nyid la mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gang yin pa'i lus khyod kyis rtogs par ma gyur te ma go ba'o //
translated: You have not understood, you have not comprehended, the nature of the body, which is impure.

original: da ni bstan bcos mdzad pa de la skyo bar mdzad pa /🔽sprin bral zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bstan bcos mdzad pa de la skyo bar mdzad pa / sprin bral zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, the author of the treatise makes a statement of weariness with this:

original: sprin bral nyi zer gyis bye ba @160a * //
analyzed: sprin bral nyi zer gyis bye ba @160a * //
translated: The fresh lotus opened by the sun's rays free of clouds,🔽Having abandoned that, who would delight in the cage of impurity, with a mind attached to impurity?

original: ni gsal bar byas pa ste de lta bu'i padma gzhon nu ste mngon par gsar ba'i mtsho skyes bor nas mi gtsang zhen pa'i sems kyis mi gtsang ba'i gzeb la su zhig dga' ste rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: ni gsal bar byas pa ste de lta bu'i padma gzhon nu ste mngon par gsar ba'i mtsho skyes bor nas mi gtsang zhen pa'i sems kyis mi gtsang ba'i gzeb la su zhig dga' ste rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: The fresh lotus opened by the sun's rays free of clouds, having abandoned that, who would delight in the cage of impurity, with a mind attached to impurity? It is not reasonable, that is the meaning.🔽Moreover, the author of the treatise says:

original: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Moreover, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: The word etc. refers to being soiled, etc.

original: mi gtsang gis gos pa'i phyir gal te reg par mi 'dod na /
analyzed: mi gtsang gis gos pa'i phyir gal te reg par mi 'dod na /
translated: If one does not desire contact because of being soiled by impurity,

original: gang las te lus las yin la de byung ba ni mi gtsang ba 'thon pa ste lus de la ci ltar khyod reg par 'dod /
analyzed: gang las te lus las yin la de byung ba ni mi gtsang ba 'thon pa ste lus de la ci ltar khyod reg par 'dod /
translated: From what? From the body. And what comes from it is the filth that emerges from it. So how can you desire to touch that body?

original: de ltar gyur na yang bdag la brgal zhing brtag pa 'di rigs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang bdag la brgal zhing brtag pa 'di rigs pa'i ngo bo ma yin te /
translated: Even if that were the case, this objection and analysis of mine is not of the nature of logic.

original: gang gi phyir mi gtsang ba gcig la yang mngon par zhen pa med do zhes gal te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir mi gtsang ba gcig la yang mngon par zhen pa med do zhes gal te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Because I do not cling to any filth at all.

original: mi gtsang ba'i zhing ni ma'i mngal yin te mi gtsang ba du ma'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mi gtsang ba'i zhing ni ma'i mngal yin te mi gtsang ba du ma'i gnas yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The field of filth is the mother’s womb, because it is the abode of much filth.

original: der byung ba ste der skyes pa'o //
analyzed: der byung ba ste der skyes pa'o //
translated: Arisen there means born there.

original: de'i sa bon ni mi gtsang ba de nyid de pha dang ma'i khu ba dang khrag gi rang bzhin gang gi sa bon yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: de'i sa bon ni mi gtsang ba de nyid de pha dang ma'i khu ba dang khrag gi rang bzhin gang gi sa bon yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The seed of that is that very filth, which is the nature of the father’s semen and the mother’s blood. That which has that seed is called that.

original: des bskyed pa zhes pa ni mas 'thungs pa dang zos pa skyugs pa dang 'dra ba'i mi gtsang ba'i ro des 'phel bar byas pa ste /
analyzed: des bskyed pa zhes pa ni mas 'thungs pa dang zos pa skyugs pa dang 'dra ba'i mi gtsang ba'i ro des 'phel bar byas pa ste /
translated: What is produced by that is the filth that is increased by the taste of filth, like what is vomited by the mother after drinking and eating.

original: mngal na gnas pa bskyed pa'o //
analyzed: mngal na gnas pa bskyed pa'o //
translated: It is produced in the womb.

original: phyir byung ba na yang rang gis zas zos pa dang 'thungs pa'i yongs su smin pa'i mi gtsang ba'i ros kyang bskyed /
analyzed: phyir byung ba na yang rang gis zas zos pa dang 'thungs pa'i yongs su smin pa'i mi gtsang ba'i ros kyang bskyed /
translated: And when it comes out, it is produced by the taste of the mother’s impure nutriment that she has eaten and drunk.

original: gzhan khyod ci'i phyir bar du 'khyud ces pa dang 'brel te gzhan gyi bud med kyi lus so //
analyzed: gzhan khyod ci'i phyir bar du 'khyud ces pa dang 'brel te gzhan gyi bud med kyi lus so //
translated: “ And why do you embrace another?”

original: de ltar na khyed la brgal zhing brtag pa yod do //
analyzed: de ltar na khyed la brgal zhing brtag pa yod do //
translated: Thus, you have a dilemma.🔽But if you accept the position that “I am not attached to impurity,” then the dilemma is the same.

original: 'on te bdag mi gtsang pa la chags pa med do zhes pa'i phyogs khas len na de'i tshe yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid do zhes mi gtsang las byung zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'on te bdag mi gtsang pa la chags pa med do zhes pa'i phyogs khas len na de'i tshe yang brgal zhing brtag pa mtshungs pa nyid do zhes mi gtsang las byung zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, he says “You do not desire,” and so on.🔽You do not desire even an insect, a type of living being that arises from an impure substance such as feces, and so on.

original: bshad pa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas las byung ba'i srog chags kyi rigs srin bu yang mi 'dod de zhen par mi byed par yang ma'i lus kyi tshogs mi gtsang ba shin tu mang ba'i rang bzhin mi gtsang ba las byung ba las byung ba la
analyzed: bshad pa la sogs pa mi gtsang ba'i rdzas las byung ba'i srog chags kyi rigs srin bu yang mi 'dod de zhen par mi byed par yang ma'i lus kyi tshogs mi gtsang ba shin tu mang ba'i rang bzhin mi gtsang ba las byung ba las byung ba la
translated: You do not cling to the body of your mother, which is a collection of many impure substances, which arises from an impure source,

original: yang sngar gyi rim pa bzhin du 'dod par byed /
analyzed: yang sngar gyi rim pa bzhin du 'dod par byed /
translated: Again, as before, one should desire it.

original: 'on te 'di ltar yang 'gyur te 'dir lan ci zhig 'debs par byed /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar yang 'gyur te 'dir lan ci zhig 'debs par byed /
translated: Or, in this way, what answer is there?

original: gang gi phyir bdag kyang de'i lus de lta bu yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag kyang de'i lus de lta bu yin la /
translated: Because the self is also that kind of body.

original: @160b des na mi gtsang ba mi gtsang ba dang phrad pa la nyes pa ci yod de gnod sbyin ji lta bar gtor ma la de bzhin no zhe na /
analyzed: @160b des na mi gtsang ba mi gtsang ba dang phrad pa la nyes pa ci yod de gnod sbyin ji lta bar gtor ma la de bzhin no zhe na /
translated: Therefore, what is wrong with impure things contacting impure things? Just as with a yakṣa, so it is with the sacrificial cake.

original: 'dir khyod ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir khyod ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, “you” and so on is stated.

original: 'dir ni rmongs pa chen po'i mthus bdag nyid la yod pa'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gang la re zhig smad par mi byed cing /
analyzed: 'dir ni rmongs pa chen po'i mthus bdag nyid la yod pa'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gang la re zhig smad par mi byed cing /
translated: Here, through the power of great delusion, one does not at all disparage the impure nature that exists in oneself.

original: slar yang gzhan gyi mi gtsang ba'i rkyal pa la 'dod par byed de /
analyzed: slar yang gzhan gyi mi gtsang ba'i rkyal pa la 'dod par byed de /
translated: Moreover, one desires the impure bag of another.

original: 'di ni don dang bral ba shin tu smad pa'i gnas yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni don dang bral ba shin tu smad pa'i gnas yin no //
translated: This is a very disparaged state devoid of meaning.

original: mi gtsang rkyal pa zhes spyo ba'i tshig gis de nyid la 'bod pa yin no //
analyzed: mi gtsang rkyal pa zhes spyo ba'i tshig gis de nyid la 'bod pa yin no //
translated: The word “impure bag” is a term of reproach. It is an address to him.

original: da ni mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin mngon sum du byas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the nature of impurity to be directly perceived,

original: ga bur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ga bur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares “camphor,” and so on.

original: gtsang zhing gtsang sbra'i dngos po 'di lta bu gang phyogs gcig dang phrad pa las byung ba'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po de re zhig gzhag ste de dang phrad pa las gzhi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yang mi gtsang ba nyid du 'gyur ro
analyzed: gtsang zhing gtsang sbra'i dngos po 'di lta bu gang phyogs gcig dang phrad pa las byung ba'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin du gyur pa'i dngos po de re zhig gzhag ste de dang phrad pa las gzhi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yang mi gtsang ba nyid du 'gyur ro
translated: Having set aside for the time being the thing that is pure and clean, which is the nature of impurity that arises from contact with one part of it, that which is in contact with it, the basis that has the nature of purity, will also become impure.

original: // de ltar re zhig tha snyad 'di mngon sum gyis grub pa de lta na yang gal te mi rtog cing yid mi ches na ste mthong yang dad par ma gyur na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: // de ltar re zhig tha snyad 'di mngon sum gyis grub pa de lta na yang gal te mi rtog cing yid mi ches na ste mthong yang dad par ma gyur na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, although this convention is established by direct perception in this way, if one does not understand and does not believe it—the meaning is that one sees it but does not have faith—🔽then at that time, when one is staying in a charnel ground, one should look at it.

original: de'i tshe dur khrod du so sor gnas pa na blta bar gyis shig / ji lta bur gyur pa la zhe na /
analyzed: de'i tshe dur khrod du so sor gnas pa na blta bar gyis shig / ji lta bur gyur pa la zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'jigs pa ste /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ste /
translated: It is frightening.

original: rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par myags pa dang ; rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jigs su rung ba'am 'jigs par byed pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par zos pa dang / rnam par myags pa dang ; rnam par rnags pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis 'jigs su rung ba'am 'jigs par byed pa'o //
translated: It is terrifying by nature as something that is eaten, putrefied, and festering, and so forth.

original: gzhan yang zhes pa ni 'di bas lhag pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang zhes pa ni 'di bas lhag pa'o //
translated: Moreover means more than this.

original: gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis mi sdug pa thams cad du sbyar te lus po 'di nyid mi dga' ba'i gnas su sbyar ro zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: gzhan yang rang bzhin gyis mi sdug pa thams cad du sbyar te lus po 'di nyid mi dga' ba'i gnas su sbyar ro zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: Moreover, all that is naturally unattractive is to be applied everywhere, and this very body is to be applied as a place of revulsion.

original: gang zhig pags pa'i kha phye zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang zhig pags pa'i kha phye zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having wished to teach this, [the Bhagavān] declares, Whoever opens up the skin, and so forth.

original: kha phye ba ni rnam par bral ba ste /
analyzed: kha phye ba ni rnam par bral ba ste /
translated: Opening up is separating.

original: gang las zhes pa ni lus las so //
analyzed: gang las zhes pa ni lus las so //
translated: From what? From the body.

original: de'i tshe 'jigs pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'jigs pa chen po skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, great fear arises.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin shes kyang ji ltar de nyid kyi gnas la 'jigs pa'i gnas su nam zhig na yang ma rtogs par phyir zhing dga' zhing mngon par zhen pa skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur pa'i rang bzhin shes kyang ji ltar de nyid kyi gnas la 'jigs pa'i gnas su nam zhig na yang ma rtogs par phyir zhing dga' zhing mngon par zhen pa skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Like this means of this kind. Even though one knows the nature of this, how is it that one never understands that this very place is a place of fear, and that, again and again, joy and manifest attachment arise?

original: de ltar gyur na yang mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gyi lus su gal te mngon sum du gyur pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gyi lus su gal te mngon sum du gyur pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though it is like that, if the body were to become manifest in its nature of impurity,🔽then, even though it is smeared with sandalwood and so forth,🔽it would not be desirable.

original: tsandan la sogs pa dang shug par lus po @161a * //🔽la bskus pas 'di 'dod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: tsandan la sogs pa dang shug par lus po @161a * // la bskus pas 'di 'dod par bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Smearing the body with sandalwood and so forth

original: lus yang bskus pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus yang bskus pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: does not make the body desirable.

original: lus la bskus pa yang tsandan la sogs pa las byung ba'i dri 'dis gang la bsgos pa'i lus la 'dod par bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lus la bskus pa yang tsandan la sogs pa las byung ba'i dri 'dis gang la bsgos pa'i lus la 'dod par bya ba'i blo skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Smearing the body with the scent that arises from sandalwood and so forth does not make the body that is smeared with it desirable.

original: tsandan 'ba' zhig las yin la /
analyzed: tsandan 'ba' zhig las yin la /
translated: It is only the sandalwood that is desirable,

original: gzhan min na zhes pa ni lus kyi ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan min na zhes pa ni lus kyi ma yin pa'o //
translated: not the body.

original: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dri tsandan la sogs pa las byung bas 'dir dri zhim par mi 'gyur ba gzhan dag la ci'i phyir mngon par dga' bar byed /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan gyi dri tsandan la sogs pa las byung bas 'dir dri zhim par mi 'gyur ba gzhan dag la ci'i phyir mngon par dga' bar byed /
translated: Therefore, why be attached to others, since their scent of sandalwood and so forth does not become their pleasant smell?

original: gzhan yang tsandan la sogs pa'i legs par sbyar bas kyang bdag nyid la gnod pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang tsandan la sogs pa'i legs par sbyar bas kyang bdag nyid la gnod pa 'ba' zhig tu 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, even anointing oneself with sandalwood paste and so forth is only harmful to oneself.🔽It is not for the sake of benefit.

original: phan pa'i ched du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: phan pa'i ched du ni ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate this,

original: gal te rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “If it is naturally foul-smelling,” and so on.

original: rang bzhin gyis dring ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rul ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis dring ba ni lhan cig skyes pa'i rul ba'i rang bzhin gyi phyir ro //
translated: It is naturally foul-smelling because of the innate nature of its rottenness.

original: 'dir zhes pa ni lus la'o //
analyzed: 'dir zhes pa ni lus la'o //
translated: Here, “this” refers to the body.

original: gal te 'dod chags ma skyes na de'i tshe legs min nam ste legs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'dod chags ma skyes na de'i tshe legs min nam ste legs pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: If desire does not arise, then is it not good? It becomes good.

original: 'di lta bu'i yon tan yod bzhin du don med pa la sred pa'i 'jig rten rgyu cis lus de la dris skud par byed de rnam pa thams cad du de rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i yon tan yod bzhin du don med pa la sred pa'i 'jig rten rgyu cis lus de la dris skud par byed de rnam pa thams cad du de rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: While having such good qualities, why does the world, which is craving for the meaningless, anoint that body with perfume? The meaning is that in every way it is not reasonable.

original: stong phrag du mas mngon par 'du byas kyang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes 'on te dri zhim zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: stong phrag du mas mngon par 'du byas kyang rang bzhin gzhan du 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes 'on te dri zhim zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Even though many thousands of people try, the nature of something does not change.

original: lus po rang bzhin gyis dring ba las ci zhig byung ste ci lta bur gyur pa cung zad kyang byung ba ma yin no //
analyzed: lus po rang bzhin gyis dring ba las ci zhig byung ste ci lta bur gyur pa cung zad kyang byung ba ma yin no //
translated: What happens to the body, which is naturally foul-smelling? Nothing at all happens.🔽The phrase fragrant sandalwood is a bahuvrihi compound meaning that which has a beautiful scent.

original: dri zhim tsandan na zhes pa ni gang la mdzes pa'i dri yod pa zhes 'bru mang po pa ste de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin la nyams pa med do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: dri zhim tsandan na zhes pa ni gang la mdzes pa'i dri yod pa zhes 'bru mang po pa ste de lta na yang de'i rang bzhin la nyams pa med do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Even so, its nature is not diminished. This is the meaning.

original: 'on te de'i dbang gis de la 'dod par bya ba nyid du bzung nas mngon par 'dod pa skye ba'o zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de'i dbang gis de la 'dod par bya ba nyid du bzung nas mngon par 'dod pa skye ba'o zhe na /
translated: But if you think that desire arises because you apprehend it as desirable due to its influence,

original: gzhan gyi dri yis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan gyi dri yis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: the root text states,🔽In that case, it is not the body's nature.

original: 'di ltar yang mkhas pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di ltar yang mkhas pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that you are still not wise.

original: skra la sogs pa mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgo nas kyang lus 'di don med pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: skra la sogs pa mngon par 'du byas pa'i sgo nas kyang lus 'di don med pa'i rgyu yin no zhes tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Also, through the process of styling the hair and so on, this body is a cause of meaninglessness. Two verses to show this.

original: gal te 'di skra sen zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te 'di skra sen zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If it is hair and nails, etc.,

original: ring ba na lhan cig skyes pa ma bcad pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ring ba na lhan cig skyes pa ma bcad pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Long means not cut together.

original: so skye ba ni bring ba dang bcas @161b pas te so shing dang sog le la sogs pas 'dus ma byas pas so //
analyzed: so skye ba ni bring ba dang bcas @161b pas te so shing dang sog le la sogs pas 'dus ma byas pas so //
translated: Uncut means not cut with a saw, a razor, etc.

original: 'dam gyi dris bsgos ni dri ma nyid 'dam ste rdzab yin la des bsgos pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: 'dam gyi dris bsgos ni dri ma nyid 'dam ste rdzab yin la des bsgos pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: Muddy with the stain of dirt means that the stain itself is mud, and it is so called because it is smeared with that.

original: khrus dang byug pa la sogs pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: khrus dang byug pa la sogs pa dang bral bas so //
translated: It is free from bathing, anointing, etc.

original: gcer bu zhes bya ba ni gos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcer bu zhes bya ba ni gos dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Naked means free from clothes.

original: ji ltar skyes bu bzhin du ste ji ltar gyur pas gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ji ltar skyes bu bzhin du ste ji ltar gyur pas gnas pa'o //
translated: Like a person means like one who is born.

original: gal te lus rang bzhin gyis 'jigs pa yin na yi dags bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'jigs par byed pa la 'bad pas te skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bcom pa'i khyad par dang / so shing dang so rtsi dang khrus dang byug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'di lta bur gyur pa de ci'i phyir byi dor byed /
analyzed: gal te lus rang bzhin gyis 'jigs pa yin na yi dags bzhin du rang bzhin gyis 'jigs par byed pa la 'bad pas te skra dang sen mo la sogs pa bcom pa'i khyad par dang / so shing dang so rtsi dang khrus dang byug pa la sogs pa rnams kyis 'di lta bur gyur pa de ci'i phyir byi dor byed /
translated: and by means of tooth wood, tooth cleaner, bathing, anointing, etc.?

original: ji lta bur zhe na /
analyzed: ji lta bur zhe na /
translated: In what way?

original: rang la gnod pas mtshon bzhin te bdag nyid la gnod pa'i don du ral gri la sogs pas ji ltar 'dus byas pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: rang la gnod pas mtshon bzhin te bdag nyid la gnod pa'i don du ral gri la sogs pas ji ltar 'dus byas pa de ltar ro //
translated: Like a weapon, for the sake of harming oneself, as if one were to make a sword, etc.

original: 'di lta bu rnams rmongs pa'i dbang du gyur ba'i spyod pa la mya ngan mdzad pa /
analyzed: 'di lta bu rnams rmongs pa'i dbang du gyur ba'i spyod pa la mya ngan mdzad pa /
translated: These are the activities of one who is under the influence of delusion, and they are the cause of sorrow.

original: bdag la rmongs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag la rmongs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning with To oneself, etc., is stated.

original: 'bad pa dang ldan pa'i smyon pa sems rang bzhin du mi gnas pas bdag nyid kyis bsams nas bdag nyid la rmongs pa bskyed cing yang 'di ltar phyin ci log gi lam nyams su blangs pas nyon mongs pa 'di rnams sems rang bzhin du mi gnas so zhes
analyzed: 'bad pa dang ldan pa'i smyon pa sems rang bzhin du mi gnas pas bdag nyid kyis bsams nas bdag nyid la rmongs pa bskyed cing yang 'di ltar phyin ci log gi lam nyams su blangs pas nyon mongs pa 'di rnams sems rang bzhin du mi gnas so zhes
translated: The insane who are endowed with effort, because their minds do not abide naturally, having thought it themselves, generate delusion for themselves and, moreover, by practicing the path of error, these afflictions do not abide naturally in the mind.

original: bstan bcos mdzad pas mya ngan mdzad pa'o //
analyzed: bstan bcos mdzad pas mya ngan mdzad pa'o //
translated: The author of the treatise is sad.

original: 'di na bdag nyid shes pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di na bdag nyid shes pa 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, there is no one at all who knows himself,

original: smyon pas 'khrugs pa ste sa yongs su gang ba yin no //
analyzed: smyon pas 'khrugs pa ste sa yongs su gang ba yin no //
translated: but the insane are agitated and the earth is completely filled.

original: dris pa la zhar la byung bas lan btab nas skabs su bab pa /
analyzed: dris pa la zhar la byung bas lan btab nas skabs su bab pa /
translated: Having answered the question with a digression, the present context is

original: rus gong zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: rus gong zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: stated in the verse that begins bones.

original: ro rnams kyi rus gong 'ga' zhig ste so so na gnas pa'o //
analyzed: ro rnams kyi rus gong 'ga' zhig ste so so na gnas pa'o //
translated: Some of the bones of corpses remain individually.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is said:

original: gang las pags pa phral byas ni //
analyzed: gang las pags pa phral byas ni //
translated: Having stripped away the skin,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs nas /
translated: and so on is said.

original: gang shes kyang ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa der gzhan gyi len yin no //
analyzed: gang shes kyang ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa der gzhan gyi len yin no //
translated: But if you know how to do it, then it is the other's turn to do it!

original: gang gis de bzhin du 'di la yang chags par mi 'gyur ba dur khrod kyi lus dang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gis de bzhin du 'di la yang chags par mi 'gyur ba dur khrod kyi lus dang 'dra ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But there is no one who is not attached to this body, which is like a corpse in a charnel ground.

original: dur khrod du de mi gtsang ba'i gnas yin la 'dir ni ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: dur khrod du de mi gtsang ba'i gnas yin la 'dir ni ma yin no zhes so //
translated: For, In a charnel ground it is a place of impurity, but not here!

original: 'dir brjod par bya ba ni rus gong zhes pa la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dir brjod par bya ba ni rus gong zhes pa la sogs pa yin no //
translated: Here, the point is to be made with the words, skeleton, etc.

original: grong gi dur khrod ces pa la 'dir @162a * //
analyzed: grong gi dur khrod ces pa la 'dir @162a * //
translated: In a charnel ground, etc.

original: khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference here.

original: dur khrod du btsog pa'i gnas ni lus po de nyid yin la /
analyzed: dur khrod du btsog pa'i gnas ni lus po de nyid yin la /
translated: For, In a charnel ground, that very body is a place of impurity,

original: grong du yang yin te mngon par dga' ba'i gnas gang yin zhes zur gyis 'dri ba'o //
analyzed: grong du yang yin te mngon par dga' ba'i gnas gang yin zhes zur gyis 'dri ba'o //
translated: and in a village it is a place of delight.

original: 'di la mkhas pa'i blo can gyis mnyam par rigs so zhes bsams pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di la mkhas pa'i blo can gyis mnyam par rigs so zhes bsams pa'o ;
translated: The wise should consider them equal!

original: / g-yo ba'i rus gong gis khyab pa zhes pa 'dis de nyid ston pa yin no //
analyzed: / g-yo ba'i rus gong gis khyab pa zhes pa 'dis de nyid ston pa yin no //
translated: This is what is being taught by the words, pervaded by moving skeletons.

original: 'di tsam khyad par yin gyi khyad par 'dis mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gyis mi gtsang ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam khyad par yin gyi khyad par 'dis mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin gyis mi gtsang ba'i rgyu las bzlog pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is the only difference. This difference does not reverse the cause of impurity with the nature of impurity.

original: gang gis ni 'jug pa'i yan lag gi rang bzhin du 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gis ni 'jug pa'i yan lag gi rang bzhin du 'gyur /
translated: By what is it that becomes the nature of the branch of engagement?

original: khyab pa ni yongs su 'khrugs pa'o //
analyzed: khyab pa ni yongs su 'khrugs pa'o //
translated: The pervasion is the complete disturbance.

original: 'di lta bu'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yang phag la sogs pa rnams la bzhin du mngon par dga' ba'i gnas su gyur na yang de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu de nor dang bral bas rnyed par sla ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i mi gtsang ba'i rang bzhin yang phag la sogs pa rnams la bzhin du mngon par dga' ba'i gnas su gyur na yang de lta na yang rnam pa de lta bu de nor dang bral bas rnyed par sla ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir
translated: Even though the nature of impurity is like that of pigs and so forth, it becomes the basis of manifest delight, and even so, that kind is not easily obtained by one who is devoid of wealth.

original: / de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: / de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, it is said:🔽“Thus, without wealth, it is not obtained.”

original: rin med par de nor dang bral bas rnyed cing thob par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: rin med par de nor dang bral bas rnyed cing thob par mi 'gyur la /
translated: Without wealth, it is not obtained and not attained.

original: de'i phyir de don du gnyer bas dang po kho nar nor nyid bsags par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir de don du gnyer bas dang po kho nar nor nyid bsags par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one who strives for that should first accumulate wealth.

original: de sogs pa la ngal ba'i sgo nas son ma dang tshong dang bsnyen ba la sogs pa la yang dag par brten pas yongs su ngal ba las 'di nyid du chos ma yin pas kyang tshol ba'i phyir dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su sdug bsngal skyed par
analyzed: de sogs pa la ngal ba'i sgo nas son ma dang tshong dang bsnyen ba la sogs pa la yang dag par brten pas yongs su ngal ba las 'di nyid du chos ma yin pas kyang tshol ba'i phyir dmyal ba la sogs pa rnams su sdug bsngal skyed par
translated: By means of such toil, he is completely exhausted by the proper pursuit of agriculture, commerce, service, and so forth. In this very life, he creates suffering in the hells and so forth, because he seeks wealth by means that are not Dharma.

original: byed do // de ltar de tshol ba ni 'jig rten gnyi gar don med pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
analyzed: byed do // de ltar de tshol ba ni 'jig rten gnyi gar don med pa'i rgyu nyid yin no //
translated: Thus, the pursuit of wealth is the cause of futility in both worlds.

original: bsags pa des bde ba 'thob pa yang ma yin te /🔽sdug bsngal nyid 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bsags pa des bde ba 'thob pa yang ma yin te / sdug bsngal nyid 'ba' zhig yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And it is not the case that he obtains happiness by means of that wealth.🔽It is only suffering, he shows.

original: byis pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: byis pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, he says the fool, and so forth.

original: byis pa'i gnas skabs na gnas pa la nor spel ba'i nus pa med de /
analyzed: byis pa'i gnas skabs na gnas pa la nor spel ba'i nus pa med de /
translated: In the stage of being a fool, he lacks the ability to increase wealth.

original: byis pa nyid kyis nor gang gis sam rnam pa gang gis byis pa 'di dar la bab pa ste lang tshol bab pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
analyzed: byis pa nyid kyis nor gang gis sam rnam pa gang gis byis pa 'di dar la bab pa ste lang tshol bab pa'i gnas skabs na'o //
translated: By what means, or in what manner, will this fool, in the stage of being a youth, that is, in the stage of being in his prime, prosper?

original: bde bar 'gyur te nor dang bral bas cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bde bar 'gyur te nor dang bral bas cung zad kyang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is not at all the case that one becomes happy through wealth.

original: gang yang pha dang mes po la sogs pas bsags pa'i nor gyis lang tshol bab pa na bde ba nyid thob pa de lta na yang thams cad la so sor nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gang yang pha dang mes po la sogs pas bsags pa'i nor gyis lang tshol bab pa na bde ba nyid thob pa de lta na yang thams cad la so sor nges pa nyid ni ma yin no //
translated: And even if one does attain happiness in youth through wealth accumulated by one’s father, grandfather, and so on, still, it is not the case that this is so for everyone.

original: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis las grol bar yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dir sngar brjod pa'i sdug bsngal gnyis las grol bar yang ma yin no //
translated: And here, one is not freed from the two kinds of suffering mentioned above.

original: dang por nor sog pa nye bar mkho ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: dang por nor sog pa nye bar mkho ba nyid yin te /
translated: First, it is necessary to accumulate wealth.

original: @162b bde ba sgrub pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir de bsags pa nyid na yang lang tsho las nyams pa las 'ga' zhig la yang mkho ba'i yul ma yin no //
analyzed: @162b bde ba sgrub pa'i thabs yin pa'i phyir de bsags pa nyid na yang lang tsho las nyams pa las 'ga' zhig la yang mkho ba'i yul ma yin no //
translated: And when it is accumulated, it is not a useful object for someone whose youth has declined, because it is a means of achieving happiness.

original: 'on te de ltar gyur na yang de sogs pa na 'dod pa'i bde ba myong bar byed do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar gyur na yang de sogs pa na 'dod pa'i bde ba myong bar byed do zhe na /
translated: But even if that is so, one experiences the happiness of desire while accumulating it.

original: 'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: 'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: In response, [Nāgārjuna] says, “The desirous one,” and so on.

original: 'ga' zhig dman pa'i 'dod pa la g-yengs pa'i sems kyis shing dang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa len pa bran gyi las byed pa'i nyi ma'i mthas gtugs par las khur gyis lus sems dub ste spro ba med la /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig dman pa'i 'dod pa la g-yengs pa'i sems kyis shing dang rtsva dang lo ma la sogs pa len pa bran gyi las byed pa'i nyi ma'i mthas gtugs par las khur gyis lus sems dub ste spro ba med la /
translated: Some, with minds distracted by inferior desires, gather wood, grass, leaves, and so forth, and, like servants, their bodies and minds are exhausted by the burden of work until the end of the day, and they are without joy.

original: nyi ma nub pa na rang gi khyim du 'ongs nas ro dang 'dra bar gnyid log pas nyal bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nyi ma nub pa na rang gi khyim du 'ongs nas ro dang 'dra bar gnyid log pas nyal bar gyur pa'o //
translated: When the sun sets, they come home to their houses and, like corpses, they go to sleep and lie down.

original: yang tho rangs langs nas dman pa'i las de nyid la sbyor ro //
analyzed: yang tho rangs langs nas dman pa'i las de nyid la sbyor ro //
translated: Then, having risen at dawn, they apply themselves to just that inferior work.

original: gyur zhes pa'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan yin te /
analyzed: gyur zhes pa'i sgra ni tshig gi rgyan yin te /
translated: The word “also” is an ornament of the verse.

original: 'das pa'i don yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'das pa'i don yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is because the object is a past matter.

original: 'dod pa can 'ga' zhig de ltar tshe 'dus byas pas skyel bar byed kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba'i ro ni myang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa can 'ga' zhig de ltar tshe 'dus byas pas skyel bar byed kyi 'dod pa'i bde ba'i ro ni myang ba ma yin no //
translated: Some who are desirous spend their lives in this way, but do not taste the flavor of the bliss of desire.

original: gzhan bstan pa'i dbang du byas te /
analyzed: gzhan bstan pa'i dbang du byas te /
translated: With regard to others,

original: tshar gcod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: tshar gcod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [the root text] declares, “They are destroyed,” and so on.

original: kha cig ni sngar gyi rnams las gzhan ngan pa la chags pa can yin te bsten pa po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kha cig ni sngar gyi rnams las gzhan ngan pa la chags pa can yin te bsten pa po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Some are attached to what is worse than what they previously had.

original: tshar gcod bgrod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dpung las rgyal ba'i don du bgrod pa ste 'gro ba'am /
analyzed: tshar gcod bgrod pa la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan gyi dpung las rgyal ba'i don du bgrod pa ste 'gro ba'am /
translated: The meaning of “those who go” is that they go for the sake of victory over the armies of others through the means of conquest, etc.

original: gzhan gyi yul gyi nor blangs pa'i don du 'gro ba'o ;
analyzed: gzhan gyi yul gyi nor blangs pa'i don du 'gro ba'o ;
translated: Or they go for the sake of taking the wealth of others’ lands.

original: / de la sogs pas gang dag mgron du btang ba la sogs pa rnams mthar gyis yul gzhan du bgrod pas nyon mongs pas yongs su ngal ba yin la /
analyzed: / de la sogs pas gang dag mgron du btang ba la sogs pa rnams mthar gyis yul gzhan du bgrod pas nyon mongs pas yongs su ngal ba yin la /
translated: Those who are sent out as envoys, etc., by such kings, are exhausted by the afflictions of gradually going to other lands.

original: des sdug bsngal gyis yongs su gdung ba can yin no //
analyzed: des sdug bsngal gyis yongs su gdung ba can yin no //
translated: And they are tormented by suffering.

original: rnam pa thams cad du de ltar gyur pas khyud kor las kyang ste du mar zad par gyur kyang bu dang chung ma mi mthong ste spyod yul du ma gyur to //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du de ltar gyur pas khyud kor las kyang ste du mar zad par gyur kyang bu dang chung ma mi mthong ste spyod yul du ma gyur to //
translated: In every way, they are like that, and even more so. Although they have gone many times, they do not see their children and wives, because they are not in their domain.

original: 'dod bzhin du zhes pa ni des bu dang chung ma la sogs pa rnams don du gnyer bas /
analyzed: 'dod bzhin du zhes pa ni des bu dang chung ma la sogs pa rnams don du gnyer bas /
translated: “As they wish” means that they strive for the sake of their children, wives, and so on.

original: de la 'dod pa rnams yin la ste de'i don nyid du gzhan bsten pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la 'dod pa rnams yin la ste de'i don nyid du gzhan bsten pa la sogs pa khas blangs pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that they are attached to those desires, and for the sake of that very purpose they agree to serve others and so forth.

original: kye ma 'di rnams 'bras bu med par nyams su len pa yin no zhes shin tu mya ngan mdzad par bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: kye ma 'di rnams 'bras bu med par nyams su len pa yin no zhes shin tu mya ngan mdzad par bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Alas! They practice without result, he says.  I am very sad, and so forth.

original: bdag nyid 'dod pas bslus pas gang gi don te bde ba thob pa'i rgyu mtshan du btsongs shing gzhan gyi bran byas nas /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'dod pas bslus pas gang gi don te bde ba thob pa'i rgyu mtshan du btsongs shing gzhan gyi bran byas nas /
translated: Since I myself am deceived by desire, for whose purpose, for the sake of attaining happiness, do I sell myself and serve others?

original: de ma thob pa ni bde ba de ma thob pa yin la /🔽tsho'i 'du byed pa nyid kho na @163a * //
analyzed: de ma thob pa ni bde ba de ma thob pa yin la / tsho'i 'du byed pa nyid kho na @163a * //
translated: Not attaining that, not attaining that happiness,🔽I have only exhausted myself in meaningless activity.

original: don med par gzhan gyi las nyams su len par zad par byas pa ste /
analyzed: don med par gzhan gyi las nyams su len par zad par byas pa ste /
translated: I have only exhausted myself in practicing the activity of others without purpose.

original: legs pa'i las 'ga' zhig la ni sbyar ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: legs pa'i las 'ga' zhig la ni sbyar ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to /
translated: I have not applied myself to any good activity, is the meaning.

original: bde ba thob par 'dod pas zhugs pa rnams slar sdug bsngal de nyid la 'di rnams lhung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bde ba thob par 'dod pas zhugs pa rnams slar sdug bsngal de nyid la 'di rnams lhung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that those who engage in the desire to attain happiness fall back into just that suffering, he says:

original: la la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: la la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning “Some, through the power of their merit” indicates the second cause.🔽

original: gang gi bde bar spyad par 'dod pas gzhan rnams la btsongs te gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi bde bar spyad par 'dod pas gzhan rnams la btsongs te gzhan gyi dbang du byas pa yin te /
translated: Those who are desirous of enjoying themselves sell themselves to others, and become the slaves of others.

original: rang gi lus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: rang gi lus gang yin pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: That which is one’s own body is called “that.”🔽It is like that for others.

original: de ltar gzhan de rnams kyis yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan de rnams kyis yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: That is the meaning of “thus.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skul bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can dag bdag po gzhan pha rol po'i dgos pa la 'gro ba na bud med rnams lam nyid du bu byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rtag tu skul bar byed pa'i ngang tshul can dag bdag po gzhan pha rol po'i dgos pa la 'gro ba na bud med rnams lam nyid du bu byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, when the women are going to the place of the other master, who is always in the habit of urging them on, they give birth to children right on the road.

original: shing drung dgon sogs bab bab ces pa la /
analyzed: shing drung dgon sogs bab bab ces pa la /
translated: “Here and there under a tree, in a forest, and so on.”

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri'i phrag gam chu klung gi 'gram la sogs pa dka' ba'i gnas rnams su'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni ri'i phrag gam chu klung gi 'gram la sogs pa dka' ba'i gnas rnams su'o //
translated: The words “and so on” include difficult places such as the side of a mountain or the bank of a river.

original: de rnams la gzhan phyin ci log 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de rnams la gzhan phyin ci log 'di yang yod pa ma yin no zhes bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: In order to teach that this error of others does not exist,🔽it is said:

original: 'dod pas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Desire is not the cause of the bodhisattvas’ going forth.”

original: rang gi dngos po btsongs nas mche ba bzhi 'khrigs pa'i yul du 'jug go //
analyzed: rang gi dngos po btsongs nas mche ba bzhi 'khrigs pa'i yul du 'jug go //
translated: He enters the realm of the four-tusked elephants, having sold his own self.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa cig ce na /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa cig ce na /
translated: What is the condition of that?

original: srog stor dogs bzhin pas te /
analyzed: srog stor dogs bzhin pas te /
translated: As if fearing for his life.

original: der zhugs pas na gson par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes /
analyzed: der zhugs pas na gson par 'gyur ram mi 'gyur zhes /
translated: Because of entering there, he thinks, “Will I live or not?”

original: stor dogs pas 'di ltar byas nas so //
analyzed: stor dogs pas 'di ltar byas nas so //
translated: Fearing for his life, he does this.

original: 'dir rnyed pa thob pas 'tsho ba'i rgyur brtags shing 'tsho bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'dir rnyed pa thob pas 'tsho ba'i rgyur brtags shing 'tsho bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Here, he thinks that he will live by obtaining wealth, and that is the meaning of “he should live.”

original: khengs phyir bran du 'gro bar byed //
analyzed: khengs phyir bran du 'gro bar byed //
translated: For the sake of pride, he becomes a slave.

original: ces pa ni stobs dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis gnod pa byas pa'i dus su rang gi nga rgyal dbyung ba'i phyir sor mo bcad pa dang ; dus kyi tshod 'dzin pas bsnyen pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ces pa ni stobs dang ldan pa 'ga' zhig gis gnod pa byas pa'i dus su rang gi nga rgyal dbyung ba'i phyir sor mo bcad pa dang ; dus kyi tshod 'dzin pas bsnyen pa khas len pa'i phyir ro //
translated: When he is harmed by someone powerful, he cuts off his fingers for the sake of his own pride, and he accepts servitude in order to determine the time.

original: rmongs pa ni shes rab kyi mig gti mug gis mun par byas pa'o //
analyzed: rmongs pa ni shes rab kyi mig gti mug gis mun par byas pa'o //
translated: He is confused, his eye of wisdom is blinded by delusion.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is that?

original: 'dod pas bslus pa rnams te 'dod pa'i ched du'am 'dod pas bslus pa ste spyos pa'o //🔽'dod pa la zhen pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba 'di nyid la'ang sdug bsngal mthong ba de bstan pa'i phyir /🔽'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod pas bslus pa rnams te 'dod pa'i ched du'am 'dod pas bslus pa ste spyos pa'o // 'dod pa la zhen pa'i sems dang ldan pa rnams la skye ba 'di nyid la'ang sdug bsngal mthong ba de bstan pa'i phyir / 'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Those who are deceived by desire, for the sake of desire, or who are deceived by desire, are deceived by desire.🔽In order to show that those who have minds attached to desire see suffering in this very life,🔽he says “those who desire,” and so on.🔽🔽

original: gzhan gyi chung ma dang nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'o //🔽lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽gzhan yang 'di bde ba sgrub pa nyid kyis nor len par byed pa na yang @163b don med pa rgud pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid do zhes bstan par 'dod nas /🔽bsags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sogs pa ni med pa la sogs par byed pa'o //🔽bsrung ba ni dka' bas bsags pa de yang chu dang me la sogs pa chud za bar byed pa lnga las yongs su skyong bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi chung ma dang nor 'phrog pa la sogs pa'o //🔽lhag ma ni go sla'o //🔽gzhan yang 'di bde ba sgrub pa nyid kyis nor len par byed pa na yang @163b don med pa rgud pa skye bar 'gyur ba'i rgyu nyid do zhes bstan par 'dod nas /🔽bsags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽sogs pa ni med pa la sogs par byed pa'o //🔽bsrung ba ni dka' bas bsags pa de yang chu dang me la sogs pa chud za bar byed pa lnga las yongs su skyong bar byed pa'o //

original: shin tu dka' ba de ltar srung ba yang brgya la rkun ma la sogs pa rnams kyis brlag par byed pas gdung zhing yid mi bde ba sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu ni phung khrol yin la de nyid don med pa rgud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu la brtags🔽nas nor nyid phung khrod du brjod do //
analyzed: shin tu dka' ba de ltar srung ba yang brgya la rkun ma la sogs pa rnams kyis brlag par byed pas gdung zhing yid mi bde ba sdug bsngal ba'i rgyu ni phung khrol yin la de nyid don med pa rgud pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir rgyu la brtags nas nor nyid phung khrod du brjod do //
translated: Therefore, wealth is the cause of suffering and is the cause of meaningless misfortune.

original: bsags pa la sogs pas rtag tu rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir dang / nor la zhen pa'i sems kyis skad cig tsam yang ting nge 'dzin la brtad pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir 'khor ba la brten pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'i skabs med de /
analyzed: bsags pa la sogs pas rtag tu rnam par g-yengs pa'i phyir dang / nor la zhen pa'i sems kyis skad cig tsam yang ting nge 'dzin la brtad pa'i skabs med pa'i phyir 'khor ba la brten pa'i skye ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal las grol ba'i skabs med de /
translated: Because one is always distracted by accumulating wealth and so on, and because one has no opportunity to practice concentration for even a moment due to the mind's attachment to wealth, one has no opportunity to be free from the suffering of birth and so on that is based on cyclic existence.

original: rtag tu de la yid zhugs pa nyid kyis tshe 'du byed zad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtag tu de la yid zhugs pa nyid kyis tshe 'du byed zad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because one's life is exhausted by constantly being absorbed in that.

original: 'di thams cad mjug bsdus nas 'dod pa la zhen pa yongs su spang ba'i ched du skyo ba'i gtam gyis spro bar byed pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad mjug bsdus nas 'dod pa la zhen pa yongs su spang ba'i ched du skyo ba'i gtam gyis spro bar byed pa /
translated: In order to completely abandon attachment to desire, the Buddha concludes all of this with a discourse on disenchantment in order to inspire us:

original: 'dod ldan rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod ldan rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Those who are desirous, etc.

original: de lta bu ni brjod pa'i rnam pa la blta'o //
analyzed: de lta bu ni brjod pa'i rnam pa la blta'o //
translated: This is how it is.

original: nyes dmigs ni phung khrol yin te mang ba ni rnam pa du ma yin la /
analyzed: nyes dmigs ni phung khrol yin te mang ba ni rnam pa du ma yin la /
translated: The drawbacks are the many kinds of misfortune.

original: 'dir bde ba skyed par byed pa ni gtam tsam yang med de /
analyzed: 'dir bde ba skyed par byed pa ni gtam tsam yang med de /
translated: There is not even a word here about the creation of happiness.

original: de ltar na yang phyin ci log las brgya zhig la 'di ni bde ba'o zhes snang ste /
analyzed: de ltar na yang phyin ci log las brgya zhig la 'di ni bde ba'o zhes snang ste /
translated: Nevertheless, because of delusion, it may seem to be happiness.

original: de ltar na gyi na'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gyi na'o //
translated: But it is not.

original: shin tu lci ba'i khur gyis mnan pa bas ngal ba'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyugs rtsva cung zad tsam 'dzin pa bzhin du shin tu gsog gyur cing mnog chung ba'i bde ba'i cha 'di lta bur gyur pa de phyugs dang yang thun mong ba gang yin pa de'i
analyzed: shin tu lci ba'i khur gyis mnan pa bas ngal ba'i lus dang ldan pa'i phyugs rtsva cung zad tsam 'dzin pa bzhin du shin tu gsog gyur cing mnog chung ba'i bde ba'i cha 'di lta bur gyur pa de phyugs dang yang thun mong ba gang yin pa de'i
translated: Like an animal, whose body is exhausted from carrying a heavy load, and who is only interested in a little grass, this body of ours is a great accumulation of impurities, and the pleasure it experiences is insignificant.

original: don du ste /
analyzed: don du ste /
translated: It is shared even with animals.

original: de'i rgyu mtshan dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa ste mi khom pa brgyad las grol ba 'di bcom zhing nyams par byas te /
analyzed: de'i rgyu mtshan dal 'byor phun sum tshogs pa ste mi khom pa brgyad las grol ba 'di bcom zhing nyams par byas te /
translated: For the sake of that, we have destroyed and wasted this perfect human existence of leisure and opportunity, which is free of the eight conditions of nonleisure.

original: don med par byas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: don med par byas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is rendered useless.

original: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ji lta bu zhe na /
translated: What is the distinction?

original: rnyed dka' ba yin te bshad zin to //
analyzed: rnyed dka' ba yin te bshad zin to //
translated: It is difficult to obtain, as has already been explained.

original: gang gis zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis zhe na /
translated: By what?

original: las kyis mnar ba ste las ni sngon gyi las yin la /
analyzed: las kyis mnar ba ste las ni sngon gyi las yin la /
translated: By the torment of karma, where karma is past action.

original: des mnar ba'i ni phan pa dang mi phan pa shes pa la phyin ci log pa'i blo yin te rmongs pas byas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des mnar ba'i ni phan pa dang mi phan pa shes pa la phyin ci log pa'i blo yin te rmongs pas byas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The torment of that is the mind that is mistaken about what is beneficial and what is not, which is to say, it is done out of delusion.

original: 'di dngos po la ni spyod pa'i tshig @164a * //
analyzed: 'di dngos po la ni spyod pa'i tshig @164a * //
translated: This is a term for one who is engaged in things,

original: yin te bskal pa mnar ba nyid du brjod do //🔽nges par 'jig cing chung gyur pa //
analyzed: yin te bskal pa mnar ba nyid du brjod do // nges par 'jig cing chung gyur pa //
translated: and it is said that he is tormented by eons.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid du ston par byed de /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gnyis kyis phyin ci log gi ngo bo nyid du ston par byed de /
translated: The two verses beginning with “certain to perish, and small” teach the nature of error.

original: nges par 'jig cing zhes pa ni mi brten pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
analyzed: nges par 'jig cing zhes pa ni mi brten pa'i rang bzhin yin la /
translated: “Certain to perish” means that it is by nature unstable.

original: chung ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa la ltos nas yin te /
analyzed: chung ba ni 'jig rten las 'das pa la ltos nas yin te /
translated: “Small” is in relation to the supramundane,

original: shin tu khyad zhugs pas chung ba yin no //
analyzed: shin tu khyad zhugs pas chung ba yin no //
translated: because it is very inferior.

original: dmyal la sogs par lhung byed cing //
analyzed: dmyal la sogs par lhung byed cing //
translated: It causes one to fall into the hells and so on.

original: zhes pa ni dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal bsten pas rang gi bde ba skyed pa la yang nus pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ni dpag tu med pa'i sdug bsngal bsten pas rang gi bde ba skyed pa la yang nus pa med do zhes bya ba'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: even for the sake of generating one’s own happiness, one is not able to endure immeasurable suffering.

original: lus ni rang gi lus te 'di'i don ni bde ba skyed pa'i ched du'o //
analyzed: lus ni rang gi lus te 'di'i don ni bde ba skyed pa'i ched du'o //
translated: “Body” refers to one’s own body. The meaning is: for the sake of generating happiness for that body.

original: gang 'di ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma brtsis par byas pa ste dus thams cad du 'khor bar sngar byas pa'i bye bar yongs su nga la zhing nyon mongs pa yin la /
analyzed: gang 'di ni dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal ma brtsis par byas pa ste dus thams cad du 'khor bar sngar byas pa'i bye bar yongs su nga la zhing nyon mongs pa yin la /
translated: “Even a hundredth part of that” refers to the suffering of the hells and so on, which is not taken into account. It is the affliction that has been produced in cyclic existence in the past, for a hundred times ten million eons.

original: de las te bye ba'i brgya'i cha yongs su ngal bas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur la /
analyzed: de las te bye ba'i brgya'i cha yongs su ngal bas sangs rgyas nyid du 'gyur la /
translated: “From that” means that from a hundredth part of that, one attains buddhahood through complete hardship.

original: de la ltos nas shin tu chung ba'i tshe yis sangs rgyas nyid 'thob ste /
analyzed: de la ltos nas shin tu chung ba'i tshe yis sangs rgyas nyid 'thob ste /
translated: In comparison to that, the time required to attain buddhahood is very short.

original: de ltar na de'i don du blo gros dman pa rnams spro bar mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i don du blo gros dman pa rnams spro bar mi byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is: for that purpose, those of inferior intellect do not engage in the practice.

original: 'on te byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa yang dka' ba brgyas rtsom pa'i phyir shin tu sdug bsngal stong phrag du ma skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa yang dka' ba brgyas rtsom pa'i phyir shin tu sdug bsngal stong phrag du ma skyed pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: But since the practice of the bodhisattva deeds is undertaken with hundreds of hardships, it generates many thousands of sufferings.

original: 'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dod ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, “Those who desire the objects of desire,” and so on.

original: gang zhig 'dod pa'i don du 'khor bar spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ltos nas 'di nyid sdug bsngal shin tu chen po yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig 'dod pa'i don du 'khor bar spyod pa ni byang chub spyod pa'i sdug bsngal la ltos nas 'di nyid sdug bsngal shin tu chen po yin te /
translated: Those who engage in samsara for the sake of the objects of desire, in comparison to the suffering of the practice of the bodhisattva deeds, this is a very great suffering.

original: de rnams mnar med par lhung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis yun ring por nyams su myong ba'i phyir la /
analyzed: de rnams mnar med par lhung bar byed pa'i phyir dang / gzhan gyi dbang gis yun ring por nyams su myong ba'i phyir la /
translated: Because it causes them to fall into the Avici hell, and because they experience it for a long time under the power of others.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni dus so sor nges par rang nyid 'dod pas nyams su myong ba nyid yin pas na de lta ma yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams la ni dus so sor nges par rang nyid 'dod pas nyams su myong ba nyid yin pas na de lta ma yin no //
translated: But for the bodhisattvas, it is not like that, because they experience it themselves at the appropriate time, as they wish.

original: de ltar na gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi don du sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba de ni byang chub tu 'gyur ba yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na gang byang chub sems dpa' rnams gzhan gyi don du sdug bsngal nyams su myong ba de ni byang chub tu 'gyur ba yin la /
translated: Thus, the suffering that the bodhisattvas experience for the sake of others becomes enlightenment.

original: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i don du sdug bsngal myong ba ni byang chub tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to /
analyzed: 'dod pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis 'dod pa'i don du sdug bsngal myong ba ni byang chub tu 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes pa'i don to /
translated: The meaning is that the suffering experienced by those who have desire for the sake of desired objects does not become enlightenment.

original: yang khyad par du 'dod pa'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: yang khyad par du 'dod pa'i rgyus sdug bsngal ba nyid du rab tu bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Moreover, in order to demonstrate that suffering is caused by desire in particular,

original: dmyal sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dmyal sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “The weapons, etc., of the hells, etc.,” and so on.

original: mtshon la sogs pa 'di rnams sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du rab tu grags @164b pa dang / 'dod pa rnams mtshungs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mtshon la sogs pa 'di rnams sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa'i rgyu nyid du rab tu grags @164b pa dang / 'dod pa rnams mtshungs par 'gyur ba ni ma yin no //
translated: It is well known that these weapons, etc., are the causes of the production of suffering, but they are not the same as the desired objects.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal lung las bshad pa dran pa las te /
analyzed: dmyal ba la sogs pa ngan 'gro'i sdug bsngal lung las bshad pa dran pa las te /
translated: Because of remembering the suffering of the miserable realms, such as the hells, as explained in the scriptures.

original: dran pas yul du byas pa las so //
analyzed: dran pas yul du byas pa las so //
translated: From the perspective of the object of memory.

original: mtshon cha la sogs pa yang dus nges par 'chi ba la sogs pa 'di rnams sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa po yin la /
analyzed: mtshon cha la sogs pa yang dus nges par 'chi ba la sogs pa 'di rnams sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa po yin la /
translated: The weapons, etc., are the producers of suffering for those who are definitely going to die, etc.

original: 'dod pa ni dus yun ring por dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i rgyu rnams yin te /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni dus yun ring por dmyal ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal mi bzad pa'i rgyu rnams yin te /
translated: Desires are the causes of the unbearable sufferings of hell and so on for a long time.

original: ji lta bur de rnams kyi dper 'gyur /
analyzed: ji lta bur de rnams kyi dper 'gyur /
translated: How can they be an example of those?

original: de ltar lus rnam par dben pa'i rjes la sems rnam par dben pa brjod nas /
analyzed: de ltar lus rnam par dben pa'i rjes la sems rnam par dben pa brjod nas /
translated: Thus, after the body is isolated, the mind is isolated.

original: skabs su bab pa la sbyar ba'i ched du /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa la sbyar ba'i ched du /
translated: In order to apply it to the present context,

original: da ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ltar 'dod pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “Now, the desires . . .” and so on.

original: 'dod pa ste 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa ste 'jig pa'i rgyu rnams so //
translated: The desires are the causes of destruction.

original: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas skyo zhing skrag par byas nas sngar brjod pa'i dben pa'i dga' ba la mngon par dga' ba bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar brjod pa'i rim pas skyo zhing skrag par byas nas sngar brjod pa'i dben pa'i dga' ba la mngon par dga' ba bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having become weary and frightened by the process of expression, one should generate the joy of the previously mentioned isolation.

original: gang du gnas nas bya zhe na /
analyzed: gang du gnas nas bya zhe na /
translated: Where does one stay in order to do that?

original: de la gsungs pa /🔽rtsod pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la gsungs pa / rtsod pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, it is said:🔽In a place free of conflict . . .

original: 'gran zla med pas de rtsod pas stong pa dag yin la /
analyzed: 'gran zla med pas de rtsod pas stong pa dag yin la /
translated: Since there is no rival, it is free of conflict.

original: stag dang ri dags dang sbrul dang rkun po la sogs pa dang bral bas dga' ba yin no //
analyzed: stag dang ri dags dang sbrul dang rkun po la sogs pa dang bral bas dga' ba yin no //
translated: Since it is free of tigers, deer, snakes, thieves, and so on, it is delightful.

original: de'i phan yon skal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phan yon skal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The benefits of that are stated in the line beginning “fortunate ones,” and so on.

original: skal ldan ni legs par spyod pa rnams yin la /
analyzed: skal ldan ni legs par spyod pa rnams yin la /
translated: “ Fortunate ones” are those who engage in good conduct.

original: zla ba ni zla ba nyid yin la /
analyzed: zla ba ni zla ba nyid yin la /
translated: “ Moon” is the moon itself.

original: 'od ni 'od zer yin te /
analyzed: 'od ni 'od zer yin te /
translated: “ Light” is the light rays.

original: de nyid dkar zhing bsil bar chos mthun pas tsandan yin la /
analyzed: de nyid dkar zhing bsil bar chos mthun pas tsandan yin la /
translated: That itself is white and cool, and is similar in its properties to sandalwood.

original: gang rlung bsil ba rnams dang ldan pa'i rdo leb de rnams la 'chag bar byed ces pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: gang rlung bsil ba rnams dang ldan pa'i rdo leb de rnams la 'chag bar byed ces pa dang 'brel to //
translated: It is related to the line “they walk on those flat rocks that are endowed with cool breezes.”

original: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
analyzed: khyad par ci lta bu dang ldan pa zhe na /
translated: What kind of distinction do they have?

original: nyams dga' bar te /
analyzed: nyams dga' bar te /
translated: They are delightful.

original: rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing dag pa rtsub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba rnams so //
analyzed: rang bzhin gyis gtsang zhing dag pa rtsub pa la sogs pa'i nyes pa dang bral ba rnams so //
translated: They are naturally clean and pure, free from the faults of roughness, and so on.

original: yangs pa'i rdo leb khang bzangs ni khang bzangs dang 'dra ba ste yangs pa rnams so //
analyzed: yangs pa'i rdo leb khang bzangs ni khang bzangs dang 'dra ba ste yangs pa rnams so //
translated: “ The spacious flat rocks are like mansions” are the spacious ones.

original: ji lta bur gyur pa'i dam pas 'chag par byed ce na /🔽sgra med pa ste /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur pa'i dam pas 'chag par byed ce na / sgra med pa ste /
translated: What kind of excellent ones walk on them?🔽They are soundless.

original: mi mthun pa'i sgra dang bral bas so //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i sgra dang bral bas so //
translated: They are free from discordant sounds.

original: zhi bde rtsub pa ma yin pa bde ba'i reg pa dang ldan pas zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhi bde rtsub pa ma yin pa bde ba'i reg pa dang ldan pas zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of not rough is that it is endowed with the touch of bliss.

original: nags kyi rlung ni g-yob par byed pa'i rlung ngo //
analyzed: nags kyi rlung ni g-yob par byed pa'i rlung ngo //
translated: The forest wind is the wind that moves.

original: 'chag par byed pa ni yang dang yang du dal bas 'chag pa'o //🔽'chag pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te /🔽'on kyang gzhan la phan pa'i ched du sems can rnams @165a * //
analyzed: 'chag par byed pa ni yang dang yang du dal bas 'chag pa'o // 'chag pa tsam 'ba' zhig ni ma yin te / 'on kyang gzhan la phan pa'i ched du sems can rnams @165a * //
translated: Walking is walking slowly again and again.

original: la bde ba skyed pa'i sems pa'ang yin no //🔽rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni 'di thams cad 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: la bde ba skyed pa'i sems pa'ang yin no // rnal 'byor ba rnams kyis ni 'di thams cad 'bad pa med par 'grub pa yin la /
translated: It is not just walking alone, but also the intention to generate happiness in sentient beings for the sake of benefiting others.

original: 'dod pa can rnams kyis ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa can rnams kyis ni 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin no //
translated: The yogis and yoginis accomplish all of this effortlessly, but for those with desires, it is to be accomplished through effort.

original: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par dben pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi bde ba las kyang khyad par du 'phags par bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis ni rnam par dben pa'i bde ba dbang phyug gi bde ba las kyang khyad par du 'phags par bstan to //
translated: Thus, this shows that the happiness of solitude is superior even to the happiness of the powerful.

original: dben par gnas pa rnams la bde ba thun mong ma yin pa gzhan 'di yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dben par gnas pa rnams la bde ba thun mong ma yin pa gzhan 'di yang yod par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: To show that there are other uncommon types of happiness for those who dwell in solitude, it is said:🔽The happiness of the yogis and yoginis is not shared by others.

original: khang stong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
analyzed: khang stong zhes pa la sogs pa smos te go sla'o //
translated: The meaning of “empty house” and so forth is easy to understand.🔽“

original: rang dbang spyod cing zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad pa nyid kyi don gsal bar byed de /
analyzed: rang dbang spyod cing zhes pa la sogs pa ni bshad pa nyid kyi don gsal bar byed de /
translated: One who acts with independence” and so forth clarifies the meaning that was just explained.🔽“

original: bdag ni rang nyid yin la rang dbang du spyod pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni rang nyid yin la rang dbang du spyod pa ni 'dod pa yin te /
translated: Self” is oneself, and “acting with independence” is what is desired.

original: des rang dbang du spyod pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni rang dbang du spyod pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: des rang dbang du spyod pa'i dang tshul gang la yod pa de ni rang dbang du spyod pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “one who acts with independence” is that which has the manner of acting with independence.

original: de ltar rnam par dben pa'i yon tan bshad de /
analyzed: de ltar rnam par dben pa'i yon tan bshad de /
translated: Having explained the qualities of solitude,

original: skabs su bab pa bshad par 'dod nas /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa bshad par 'dod nas /
translated: now, wishing to explain what is relevant,

original: de las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: he says “from that” and so forth.

original: de las zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: de las zhes bya ba ni sngar brjod pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: “From that” is the previously mentioned process.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan yang de ltar yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gzhan yang de ltar yin la /
translated: The word “and so forth” also includes other such things.🔽“

original: rnam pa yis zhes pa ni lus dang sems kyis rnam par dben pa yin la /
analyzed: rnam pa yis zhes pa ni lus dang sems kyis rnam par dben pa yin la /
translated: In every way” means that the body and mind are secluded.

original: yon tan bsgom pa ni 'di ltar yang bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu ni bde ba yin no zhes sems la yang nas yang du mngon du byas pa'i rgyus so //
analyzed: yon tan bsgom pa ni 'di ltar yang bde ba phun sum tshogs pa thams cad kyi rgyu ni bde ba yin no zhes sems la yang nas yang du mngon du byas pa'i rgyus so //
translated: The cultivation of good qualities is as follows: The cause of all perfect happiness is happiness.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nye bar zhi ba ni gang gi dam pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa de ltar gyur pa na byang chub kyi sems bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i rgyu nye bar zhi ba ni gang gi dam pa ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa de ltar gyur pa na byang chub kyi sems bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The pacification of the cause of conceptualization is as follows: When the mind is not in a fit state due to improper mental attention, one should cultivate the thought of awakening.

original: 'di ltar sems yongs su byang ba bsgom pa na byang chub kyi sems phul du phyin pa'i go 'phang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ni'i sgras khyad par stan to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sems yongs su byang ba bsgom pa na byang chub kyi sems phul du phyin pa'i go 'phang skye bar 'gyur ro zhes ni'i sgras khyad par stan to //
translated: For when the mind is cultivated in this way, the thought of awakening will arise in an excellent form. The word “for” indicates a reason.

original: de la re zhig gcig tu gzhan du bdag nyid ma byas pa de srid du gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la re zhig gcig tu gzhan du bdag nyid ma byas pa de srid du gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba'i sems phun sum tshogs par mi 'gyur te /
