translated: In this regard, as long as one does not make oneself one with others, one will not have a perfect mind of benefit and happiness for others.

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni bdag nyid la khyad par du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa ni bdag nyid la khyad par du 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For the conception of self operates with a distinction between self and others.

original: de'i phyir 'di bzlog par bya ba'i ched du dang por te thog mar bdag dang gzhan du mnyam po bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di bzlog par bya ba'i ched du dang por te thog mar bdag dang gzhan du mnyam po bsgom par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, in order to reverse that, first, at the very outset, one should cultivate the sameness of self and others.

original: phyi nas ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: phyi nas ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that later, after that, one should exchange oneself for others.

original: 'di ltar zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhes pa ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: In this way means in the manner that will be explained.

original: 'bad pas zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa chen pos so //
analyzed: 'bad pas zhes pa ni mngon par zhen pa chen pos so //
translated: With effort means with great intensity.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal mnyam @165b pas zhes pa ni de nyid kyi rnam pa ston pa yin no //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal mnyam @165b pas zhes pa ni de nyid kyi rnam pa ston pa yin no //
translated: Because of the sameness of happiness and suffering shows the aspect of that.

original: bdag las 'di dag la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag las 'di dag la khyad par cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: There is not the slightest difference between oneself and others.

original: gang las ji ltar bdag sdug bsngal zhing gnod pa de bzhin du 'di rnams la yang ngo //
analyzed: gang las ji ltar bdag sdug bsngal zhing gnod pa de bzhin du 'di rnams la yang ngo //
translated: Just as one’s own suffering and harm are to be warded off, so too are those of others.

original: ji ltar bdag gi bde ba yongs su bzung ba ste /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi bde ba yongs su bzung ba ste /
translated: Just as one’s own happiness is to be adopted,

original: de bzhin du 'di rnams la yang zhes srog chags thams cad la bde ba dang sdug bsngal mnyam par 'gyur ba yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'di rnams la yang zhes srog chags thams cad la bde ba dang sdug bsngal mnyam par 'gyur ba yin te /
translated: so too is that of others. In this way, one should make one’s own happiness and suffering the same as the happiness and suffering of all living beings.

original: de'i phyir bdag bzhin du bdag gis bskyang bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag bzhin du bdag gis bskyang bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, you should protect others as you do yourself.

original: dper na bdag sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'byin pa de bzhin du sems can gzhan yang gnod par bya ba dang dper na bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'dod pa de bzhin du gzhan yang bdag bzhin du yongs su bsrung bar bya'o
analyzed: dper na bdag sdug bsngal dang sdug bsngal gyi rgyu las 'byin pa de bzhin du sems can gzhan yang gnod par bya ba dang dper na bdag nyid rnam pa thams cad du bde bar 'dod pa de bzhin du gzhan yang bdag bzhin du yongs su bsrung bar bya'o
translated: Just as you want to be free of suffering and the causes of suffering, you should protect others as you do yourself, since they are the same as you in wanting to be happy in every way.

original: // 'o na bdag nyid las 'gro ba du ma'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i sems can rnams gcig tu 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: // 'o na bdag nyid las 'gro ba du ma'i rnam pa tha dad pa'i sems can rnams gcig tu 'grub par mi 'gyur ba ma yin nam /
translated: But if you are the same as many beings, how can you be a single person?

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha mi dad par yang ji ltar 'dod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha mi dad par yang ji ltar 'dod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: And how can you claim that there is no difference between your happiness and theirs?

original: 'di la lag pa la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: 'di la lag pa la sogs pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: In response to this, the text says that just as you protect your various limbs, such as your hands, and so on,

original: lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo bo la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa mang po ji ltar lus gcig tu zhen pas yongs su bsrung bar bya bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: lag pa dang rkang pa dang mgo bo la sogs pa dbye ba rnam pa mang po ji ltar lus gcig tu zhen pas yongs su bsrung bar bya bar 'gyur te /
translated: how is it that you protect your many different limbs, such as your hands, feet, head, and so on, as a single body?

original: sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la gtod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal las bzlog pa'i phyir dang / bde ba la gtod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of turning away from suffering and because of being directed to happiness.

original: de bzhin du 'gro ba ste sems can gyi 'jig rten tha mi dad cing gcig pa nyid du zhen pas bdag gis yongs su bsrung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du 'gro ba ste sems can gyi 'jig rten tha mi dad cing gcig pa nyid du zhen pas bdag gis yongs su bsrung bar bya ba nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: In the same way, the world of sentient beings, i.e., the world of living beings, is not different, i.e., is the same, because of the attachment to a self, i.e., because of the attachment to a self that is the same as the world of living beings.

original: bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha mi dad par yang gi sgra mi mngon par byas pas ston to //
analyzed: bde ba dang sdug bsngal tha mi dad par yang gi sgra mi mngon par byas pas ston to //
translated: The word “also” shows that there is no difference between happiness and suffering.

original: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin du 'di thams cad ces te rnam pa mang po'i 'gro ba'i bye brag tha dad pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar lag pa la sogs pa'i dbye ba bzhin du 'di thams cad ces te rnam pa mang po'i 'gro ba'i bye brag tha dad pa yang ngo //
translated: In this way, all of this, i.e., the many different kinds of living beings, is like the division of the hand, etc.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: lus po 'di la gcig pa nyid med kyang ji ltar goms pas gcig tu zhen pa de bzhin du 'gro ba rnam pa du ma las yang yin te /
analyzed: lus po 'di la gcig pa nyid med kyang ji ltar goms pas gcig tu zhen pa de bzhin du 'gro ba rnam pa du ma las yang yin te /
translated: Just as, although there is no oneness in this body, there is attachment to oneness because of habit, in the same way, there is no difference between the many kinds of living beings.

original: khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: khyad par cung zad kyang med do //
translated: There is not the slightest difference.

original: 'di de ltar du gyur na gal te khyed dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar khyed kyi sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rgyud la gnod par mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: 'di de ltar du gyur na gal te khyed dang lhan cig tu 'gro ba gcig gi rang bzhin yin pa de'i tshe ji ltar khyed kyi sdug bsngal gzhan gyi rgyud la gnod par mi 'gyur la /
translated: If it were so, then if you and the other are of the same nature, how could your suffering not harm the other’s continuum?

original: de bzhin du bzlog pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes dogs nas /
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlog pa la yang sbyar bar bya'o zhes dogs nas /
translated: And the opposite should be applied in the same way.

original: gal te gzhan gyi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gal te gzhan gyi lus te gzhan gyi @166a * //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi lus zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / gal te gzhan gyi lus te gzhan gyi @166a * //
translated: If the other’s body, etc.,

original: lus po dag la bdag gi sdug bsngal gal te gnod par ma gyur pa de ltar na yang sdug bsngal de nyid bdag gi yin no //
analyzed: lus po dag la bdag gi sdug bsngal gal te gnod par ma gyur pa de ltar na yang sdug bsngal de nyid bdag gi yin no //
translated: If the other’s body, i.e., the other’s physical body, is not harmed by my suffering, then that suffering is still mine.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: bdag la chags pas bzod par dka' ba yin te mi nus so zhes pa ste 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin la /
analyzed: bdag la chags pas bzod par dka' ba yin te mi nus so zhes pa ste 'di ni gtan tshigs kyi tshig yin la /
translated: Because it is hard to bear, i.e., impossible, due to attachment to self. This is a statement of the reason.

original: cha'i sgo nas 'jug na yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid mi 'dor ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: cha'i sgo nas 'jug na yang sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid mi 'dor ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: And if it is applied in terms of parts, the nature of suffering is not abandoned. This is the meaning.

original: de bzhin du bzlog pa yang bshad par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bzlog pa yang bshad par bya'o //
translated: And the opposite should be explained in the same way.

original: de'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi khyad par dor nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la gang sdug bsngal yin pa de bdag gis bsal bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i phyir rang dang gzhan gyi khyad par dor nas sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid bzlog pa'i gtan tshigs bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la gang sdug bsngal yin pa de bdag gis bsal bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, disregarding the distinction between self and other, the reason for the reversal of the nature of suffering is stated in the words “I” and so forth.🔽

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal bzhin no //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal bzhin no //
translated: Therefore, having set aside the distinction of self and other, the reason for the reversal of the nature of suffering is stated in the words “I” and so on. Whatever is suffering, that I will remove, just like my own suffering.

original: sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yin pas zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba yin te /
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi sdug bsngal yin pas zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs kyi sbyor ba yin te /
translated: Since it is the suffering of other sentient beings, this is the application of the reason of nature.

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba spong bar bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba spong bar bya ba nyid do //
translated: The mere nature of suffering is to be abandoned.

original: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gtan tshigs ma grub pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is the reason unestablished,

original: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid du khyad par med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyi rang bzhin nyid du khyad par med par bsgrub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is established that there is no distinction in the nature of suffering.

original: ma nges pa yang ma yin te //
analyzed: ma nges pa yang ma yin te //
translated: Nor is it uncertain,

original: khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag gi sdug bsngal yang spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzlog na gnod pa can no //
analyzed: khyad par med pa'i phyir bdag gi sdug bsngal yang spang bar bya ba ma yin par 'gyur ro zhes pa ni bzlog na gnod pa can no //
translated: because there is no distinction. My own suffering would not be to be abandoned. This is the reductio argument.

original: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di nyid kyi phyir 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: For this very reason, it is not contradictory.

original: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan 'di yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du sbyor ba gzhan 'di yang yin te /
translated: In the same way, this is another syllogism:

original: gang sems can yin pa de thams cad la bdag gis phan par bya ste /
analyzed: gang sems can yin pa de thams cad la bdag gis phan par bya ste /
translated: “Whatever is a sentient being, all of that should be benefited by me,

original: ji ltar sems can bdag nyid bzhin no //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can bdag nyid bzhin no //
translated: just like my own self.”

original: srog chags gzhan yang sems can yin pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid de /
analyzed: srog chags gzhan yang sems can yin pa zhes pa ni rang bzhin gyi gtan tshigs nyid de /
translated: The reason, “because it is a sentient being,” is a natural reason.

original: sems can gyi bdag nyid tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba la phan gdags par bya'o //
analyzed: sems can gyi bdag nyid tsam 'byung bar 'gyur ba la phan gdags par bya'o //
translated: It is to be benefited just because it is a sentient being.

original: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ma grub pa ma yin te /
translated: This is not unestablished,

original: sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi phyogs grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi bdag nyid kyi phyogs grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the side of being a sentient being is established.

original: bdag nyid la yang phan mi 'dogs par thal bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yang ma yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid la yang phan mi 'dogs par thal bar 'gyur bas ma nges pa yang ma yin la /
translated: Nor is it uncertain, because it would follow, absurdly, that one would not benefit even oneself.

original: sngar bzhin du 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: sngar bzhin du 'gal ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it contradictory, as before.

original: sdug bsngal la mngon par zhen pa zhes pa bdag dang gzhan la khyad par yod pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: sdug bsngal la mngon par zhen pa zhes pa bdag dang gzhan la khyad par yod pa ma yin nam /
translated: Isn’t there a difference between oneself and others in terms of attachment to suffering?

original: de'i phyir de ltar na gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na /🔽gang tshe bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: de'i phyir de ltar na gtan tshigs ni ma nges pa yin no zhe na / gang tshe bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: Therefore, in that case, the reason is indeterminate.🔽With respect to “When there is a desire for happiness, etc.,”

original: bde @166b ba ste dga' ba 'dod par mtshungs shing mnyam pa nyid la de dag dang gzhan la khyad par ci yod de cung zad kyang med do //
analyzed: bde @166b ba ste dga' ba 'dod par mtshungs shing mnyam pa nyid la de dag dang gzhan la khyad par ci yod de cung zad kyang med do //
translated: what is the difference between oneself and others in that they are the same in desiring happiness? There is not the slightest difference.

original: gang gi phyir bdag nyid la bde ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir brtson la gzhan la ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag nyid la bde ba bskyed par bya ba'i phyir brtson la gzhan la ma yin zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one strives to generate happiness for oneself, but not for others.

original: gtan tshigs dang po la ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: gtan tshigs dang po la ma nges pa nyid spang ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to abandon the indeterminacy with respect to the first reason,

original: gang tshe bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang tshe bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “When there is a desire for happiness, etc.”

original: 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yin la /
translated: Fear is the cause of suffering.

original: gzhan min zhes pa ni gzhan la ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: gzhan min zhes pa ni gzhan la ma yin pa'o //
translated: “Not for others” means not for others.

original: de ltar gyur na yang sdug bsngal gcig gi bdag nyid du khyad par med par gyur pa de lta na yang /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang sdug bsngal gcig gi bdag nyid du khyad par med par gyur pa de lta na yang /
translated: Even though that is the case, there is no difference in the nature of a single suffering.

original: gang la sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa de nyid kyis bsrung bar 'os kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gang la sdug bsngal gyis gnod pa de nyid kyis bsrung bar 'os kyi gzhan gyis ni ma yin no zhe na /
translated: It is proper to protect that which is harmed by suffering, but not that which is not harmed by suffering.

original: gal te de la zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te de la zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: But if you are attached to it, etc.

original: gzhan de'i sdug bsngal gyis bdag la gnod pa dang gdung ba med pa'i phyir rgyu 'dis gal te gzhan ma bsrungs na gzhan 'di nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan de'i sdug bsngal gyis bdag la gnod pa dang gdung ba med pa'i phyir rgyu 'dis gal te gzhan ma bsrungs na gzhan 'di nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Since the suffering of others does not harm or torment me, if I do not protect others, I will be ruined by this cause.

original: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa ste 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dmyal bar skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid 'dir skyes pa'i lus po 'di la cung zad kyang gnod par mi srid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir ma 'ongs pa ste 'jig rten pha rol gyi lus dmyal bar skyes pa'i sdug bsngal gyi bdag nyid 'dir skyes pa'i lus po 'di la cung zad kyang gnod par mi srid de /
translated: Because the suffering of the body born in hell in the future, i.e., in the next world, cannot possibly harm this body born in this world in the least.

original: de gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gzhan yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because that is different.

original: de zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa'am de'i don to //
analyzed: de zhes pa ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa'am de'i don to //
translated: The word “that” refers to the expression of the world or its meaning.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir bsam pa gang gis 'dir bsrung ba lus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de'i phyir bsam pa gang gis 'dir bsrung ba lus kyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Since that is so, by what intention is it protected here? Because of the nature of the body.

original: sdig pa las ldog pa'i phyir dang dge ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdig pa las ldog pa'i phyir dang dge ba la 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of turning away from evil and engaging in virtue.

original: bdag ni dus thams cad du gcig yin te /
analyzed: bdag ni dus thams cad du gcig yin te /
translated: I am the same at all times,

original: lus ngag la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: lus ngag la tha dad pa yod pa ma yin la /
translated: because there is no difference in body and speech.

original: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
analyzed: de'i phyir nyes pa 'di med do zhe na /
translated: Therefore, this fault does not exist.

original: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gis zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “I” and so on.

original: bdag ni 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / cung zad bkag pa'i yang phyir gang zhig nga'o zhes rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
analyzed: bdag ni 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / cung zad bkag pa'i yang phyir gang zhig nga'o zhes rtog pa'i yul du 'gyur /
translated: Because I am obstructed and because I am partially obstructed, what is the object of the thought “I am”?

original: de'i phyir nga'o zhes shes pa'i yul gang la yang gcig ces pa med pa'i phyir zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni log pa'o//
analyzed: de'i phyir nga'o zhes shes pa'i yul gang la yang gcig ces pa med pa'i phyir zhen pa'i rnam par rtog pa 'di ni log pa'o//
translated: Therefore, since there is no “one” that is the object of the thought “I am,” this conception of attachment is false.

original: bdag nyid de'i tshe yang zhes pa ni 'di srid pa gzhan yin la /
analyzed: bdag nyid de'i tshe yang zhes pa ni 'di srid pa gzhan yin la /
translated: “At that time” means at the time of another existence.

original: sgyu ma lta bu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bu nye bar len pa'i phung po lnga tsam dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the mere five aggregates appropriated, which are like an illusion, are observed.

original: 'di yang zhen pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhen pa'i dbang gis brjod pa yin te /
translated: This is also said by the power of attachment.

original: yang dngos po la ni dmigs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin @167a * //🔽pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dngos po la ni dmigs pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te rnam par rtog pa'i bdag nyid yin @167a * // pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, it does not at all observe an entity because it is the nature of imagination.

original: yang 'di ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di ci'i phyir rnam par rtog pa log pa yin zhe na /
translated: Why is this imagination erroneous?

original: 'di ltar shi bzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar shi bzhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because it is said that the dead are reborn.

original: bdag gcig tu phung po lnga po tsam nyid yin la /
analyzed: bdag gcig tu phung po lnga po tsam nyid yin la /
translated: The self is only the five aggregates.

original: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar srid pa tha ma ma yin pa de'i tshe nges par phung po de 'di nyid du 'jig par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bdag la sogs pa 'ga' zhig 'jig rten pha rol du 'gro bar srid pa tha ma ma yin pa de'i tshe nges par phung po de 'di nyid du 'jig par 'gyur ba ni ma yin te /
translated: When it is possible that some self goes to another world, then it is not the case that the aggregates definitely perish in this world.

original: de nyid 'jig rten pha rol du skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid 'jig rten pha rol du skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That very self is born in another world.

original: 'on kyang snga ma 'gags nas des rkyen 'dis khyad par du gyur pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa bar ma do'i srid pa sngar med pa'i rgyud skyed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'on kyang snga ma 'gags nas des rkyen 'dis khyad par du gyur pa'i las dang nyon mongs pas 'dus byas pa bar ma do'i srid pa sngar med pa'i rgyud skyed par 'gyur te /
translated: However, after the prior self ceases, the aggregates that are conditioned by that self and are distinguished by this condition are produced in a continuum of an intermediate existence that did not previously exist.

original: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'jug pa'i log pa'i rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis phyir phyin ci log pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir thog ma med pa'i 'khor ba nas 'jug pa'i log pa'i rnam par rtog pa la goms pa'i bag chags kyi dbang la sogs pa'i rkyen gyis phyir phyin ci log pa nyid skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, due to conditions such as the power of habitual tendencies of being accustomed to false conceptions that have been operating since beginningless cyclic existence, the false conceptions arise.

original: gzhan yang gnod par byed pa gzhan 'di yin no zhes gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gnod par byed pa gzhan 'di yin no zhes gang gi tshe zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Moreover, this is another harm:

original: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyi sdug bsngal bsrung ba'i don re zhig zhog la /
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i lus kyi sdug bsngal bsrung ba'i don re zhig zhog la /
translated: When the suffering of the body that will occur is set aside for the time being,

original: 'dir lus po gcig la yan lag tha dad pas sdug bsngal tha dad pa yin te /
analyzed: 'dir lus po gcig la yan lag tha dad pas sdug bsngal tha dad pa yin te /
translated: here, in one body, the different limbs have different sufferings.

original: de'i phyir gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhan gyis bsrung ba la 'bad bar mi rigs na /
analyzed: de'i phyir gang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gzhan gyis bsrung ba la 'bad bar mi rigs na /
translated: Therefore, since it is not reasonable for one to strive to protect the suffering of another,

original: rkang pa la sogs pa la phangs pa gang zhig mthong ba na ci'i phyir lag pa la sogs pas skyong bar byed de /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa la phangs pa gang zhig mthong ba na ci'i phyir lag pa la sogs pas skyong bar byed de /
translated: when one sees that the foot, for example, is dear, why does one protect it with the hand and so on?

original: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir 'di rigs pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that this is not reasonable, because there is no difference in otherness.

original: 'on te 'di rigs pa yin na yang lus po 'di la bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'di rigs pa yin na yang lus po 'di la bdag gir 'dzin pa ste /
translated: But even if this is reasonable, the thought of self-possession with regard to this body,

original: bdag ces pa bdag tu 'dzin pa las bdag med kyang 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bdag ces pa bdag tu 'dzin pa las bdag med kyang 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: the thought of self with regard to the self, will occur even without a self.

original: rkang pa la sogs pa la bsrung ba'i yid la byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: rkang pa la sogs pa la bsrung ba'i yid la byed pa 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: The thought of protection will occur with regard to the feet, etc.

original: 'di yang legs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang legs pa ma yin te /
translated: This also is not good.

original: ji ltar gang mi rigs pa ste rigs pa dang mi mthun pa de bzlog par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar gang mi rigs pa ste rigs pa dang mi mthun pa de bzlog par bya ste /
translated: Just as what is unreasonable, what is not in accord with reason, is to be rejected,🔽so too what is reasonable, what is in accord with reason, is to be accepted.

original: bdag dang gzhan gyi yang bsal bar bya ste /🔽nan gyis ni nus pa ci lta bar ro //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan gyi yang bsal bar bya ste / nan gyis ni nus pa ci lta bar ro //
translated: One should strive to the best of one’s ability.

original: nus pa dang bral bas ni 'dir btang snyoms nyid du bya bar rigs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: nus pa dang bral bas ni 'dir btang snyoms nyid du bya bar rigs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: When one is unable, it is reasonable to be indifferent. This is the meaning.

original: gal te bdag la sogs pa med par gyur pa de lta na yang rgyud ces pa gcig yod pa yin te /
analyzed: gal te bdag la sogs pa med par gyur pa de lta na yang rgyud ces pa gcig yod pa yin te /
translated: Even if self, etc., do not exist, still there is a single continuum.

original: de bzhin du lag pa dang @167b rkang pa la sogs pa mang po rnams la yang tshogs pa'i lus gcig yod pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du lag pa dang @167b rkang pa la sogs pa mang po rnams la yang tshogs pa'i lus gcig yod pa yin la /
translated: Likewise, many things such as hands and feet exist as a single body in the collection.

original: gnyis po 'di 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du ji ltar srid par bdag sdug bsngal khyer bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nges par byed par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnyis po 'di 'jig rten 'di dang 'jig rten pha rol du ji ltar srid par bdag sdug bsngal khyer bar byed pa la sogs pa'i nges par byed par 'gyur te /
translated: These two are certain to carry the self’s suffering to this world and the next world.

original: de'i phyir khyad par ci zhig yod ces pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir khyad par ci zhig yod ces pa'i gtan tshigs ma grub pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, the reason “what difference is there?” is not established.

original: snga ma ni ma nges pa yin no zhes dogs nas rgyu dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: snga ma ni ma nges pa yin no zhes dogs nas rgyu dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Since the former is uncertain, the root text states “the continuum” and so on.

original: rgyud ces pa 'ga' zhig don dam par srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyud ces pa 'ga' zhig don dam par srid pa ma yin te /
translated: A continuum does not exist ultimately.

original: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'jug pa skad cig brgyud pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin nyid 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu'i dngos po 'jug pa skad cig brgyud pa'i rgyun gyi rang bzhin nyid 'di yin te /
translated: However, this is the nature of the continuum of the stream of the engagement of the entity of cause and effect.

original: de la tha dad pa de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la tha dad pa de ma dmigs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since that is not observed to be different, it is not different.

original: de'i skad cig ma 'di rnams tshig gcig gis blo'i tha snyad bya ba'i don du rgyud ces brdar byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de'i skad cig ma 'di rnams tshig gcig gis blo'i tha snyad bya ba'i don du rgyud ces brdar byas pa yin te /
translated: The continuum is a conventional term for the purpose of designating the moments of this with a single word.

original: de ltar na 'di ni brtags par yod pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni brtags par yod pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, this is a mere imputation.

original: des na 'dir mngon par zhen pa spong bar bya ste /
analyzed: des na 'dir mngon par zhen pa spong bar bya ste /
translated: Therefore, one should abandon attachment to it here.

original: gzhan du na gang gis khas mi len par 'gyur ba bdag gis gnod pa ci zhig byas /
analyzed: gzhan du na gang gis khas mi len par 'gyur ba bdag gis gnod pa ci zhig byas /
translated: Otherwise, what harm have I done that you do not accept me?

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa can la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig pur gyur pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa can la sogs pa'i dngos po gcig pur gyur pa yod pa ni ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, a single entity such as an aggregate does not exist,

original: de rnams las de tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: de rnams las de tha dad par ma dmigs pa'i phyir la /
translated: because it is not observed to be different from those.

original: de nyid dang gzhan du brtags pa'i cha shas kyi rnam par dpyad pas mi gnas pa'i phyir 'dir brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid dang gzhan du brtags pa'i cha shas kyi rnam par dpyad pas mi gnas pa'i phyir 'dir brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: Since it does not endure when analyzed into parts that are examined as being the same as or different from those, it should not be expressed here.

original: de'i phyir 'di yang sngar bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di yang sngar bzhin du kun rdzob tu yod pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, like the previous examples, it exists conventionally.

original: 'di dag go rims ji lta bar dper brjod pa /
analyzed: 'di dag go rims ji lta bar dper brjod pa /
translated: The examples for these are stated in order,

original: phreng ba dmag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: phreng ba dmag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: beginning with “a garland, an army,” and so on.

original: rgyud ni phreng ba bzhin du yin la /
analyzed: rgyud ni phreng ba bzhin du yin la /
translated: A continuum is like a garland.

original: tshogs pa ni dmag la sogs pa bzhin yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras phreng ba dang / nags la sogs pa bzung ngo //
analyzed: tshogs pa ni dmag la sogs pa bzhin yin pa la sogs pa'i sgras phreng ba dang / nags la sogs pa bzung ngo //
translated: An aggregate is like an army. The words “and so on” include a forest and so on.

original: ji ltar grog mo la sogs pa du ma 'di rnams snga phyi'i rim pas gnas pa rnams la rang gi ngo bo las ma gtogs pa me tog brgyus pa bzhin du rgyud gcig ni yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ji ltar grog mo la sogs pa du ma 'di rnams snga phyi'i rim pas gnas pa rnams la rang gi ngo bo las ma gtogs pa me tog brgyus pa bzhin du rgyud gcig ni yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Just as a garland is not a different object from the flowers strung together, a continuum is not a different object from the individual moments.

original: gang gi tshe glang po che dang rta dang rkang thang la sogs pa bsdus pa rnams las tha dad pa'i dmag la sogs pa gzhan cung zad cig kyang der yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe glang po che dang rta dang rkang thang la sogs pa bsdus pa rnams las tha dad pa'i dmag la sogs pa gzhan cung zad cig kyang der yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as an army is not a different object from the individual horses, elephants, and foot soldiers, an aggregate is not a different object from the individual forms and so on.

original: de bzhin du tshogs pa'ang yin la 'di yang gzhan du rgyas par dpyad pas 'dir dpyad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshogs pa'ang yin la 'di yang gzhan du rgyas par dpyad pas 'dir dpyad par mi bya'o //
translated: Just as an anthill is not a different object from the individual ants, a collection is not a different object from the individual members of the collection.

original: de'i phyir shes pa 'di ni brdzun pa yin te /🔽rtag @168a * //
analyzed: de'i phyir shes pa 'di ni brdzun pa yin te /🔽rtag @168a * //
translated: Therefore, this consciousness is false.

original: tu dngos por dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir don la dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tu dngos por dmigs pa dang bral ba'i phyir don la dpyad mi bzod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from the observation of any entity, and because it cannot withstand analysis of the object.

original: de de ltar na bdag la sogs pa bdag po gang yang med pas gang dang 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med do //
analyzed: de de ltar na bdag la sogs pa bdag po gang yang med pas gang dang 'brel pa'i sdug bsngal la sogs pa yang med do //
translated: Thus, since there is no self, etc., as a master, there is no suffering, etc. that is related to it.

original: de'i phyir sdug bsngal de'i bdag por gang zhig 'gyur te gang yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //🔽gal te bdag la sogs pa med na de'i tshe bdag sdug bzhin zhes pa dang / sems can yin phyir bdag lus bzhin //
analyzed: de'i phyir sdug bsngal de'i bdag por gang zhig 'gyur te gang yang ma yin no zhes pa'i don to // gal te bdag la sogs pa med na de'i tshe bdag sdug bzhin zhes pa dang / sems can yin phyir bdag lus bzhin //
translated: Therefore, what would be the master of that suffering? None at all.

original: zhes bya ba'i dpe ji ltar 'thad ce na /
analyzed: zhes bya ba'i dpe ji ltar 'thad ce na /
translated: If there is no self, etc., then how can the example be tenable in the statement, “Just as one says ‘my suffering’ . . . ” and “Because it is a sentient being, the self is like the body”?

original: 'di ni bden te 'on kyang phongs pa'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni bden te 'on kyang phongs pa'i sgo nas sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin te /
translated: This is true, but it is not established on the basis of need.

original: 'on kyang gzhan la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa spang bar bya ba'i don du yin te /
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhan la bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa spang bar bya ba'i don du yin te /
translated: Rather, it is for the purpose of eliminating the manifest clinging to self in others.

original: gal te gzhan gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa de ldog pa nyid du yin pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba la dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gal te gzhan gyi bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa de ldog pa nyid du yin pa de'i tshe rjes su dpag pa'i sbyor ba la dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: If that manifest clinging to the self of others were to cease, then there would be no need at all for the application of inference.

original: 'on te ma log pa de'i tshe bsam pa de nyid kyis rang gi cha dang gzhan gyi char byas nas de rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa dang dpe dgod par bya ba ste /
analyzed: 'on te ma log pa de'i tshe bsam pa de nyid kyis rang gi cha dang gzhan gyi char byas nas de rtogs par bya ba'i don du sgrub par byed pa dang dpe dgod par bya ba ste /
translated: But if it does not cease, then, having made a distinction between one’s own and others’ parts, one would have to posit a proof statement and an example in order to understand that.

original: de ltar na dpe ma grub pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na dpe ma grub pa yin te /
translated: In that case, the example would not be established,

original: tha snyad la 'jug par bya ba'i don yin pas so //
analyzed: tha snyad la 'jug par bya ba'i don yin pas so //
translated: because it would be the meaning of engaging in conventional expressions.

original: gzhan yang zin pa'i phung po nyid la dgongs nas dpe mdzad pa la nyams cung zad kyang med pas 'di nyid du bdag gi sgra 'jug par mdzad do //
analyzed: gzhan yang zin pa'i phung po nyid la dgongs nas dpe mdzad pa la nyams cung zad kyang med pas 'di nyid du bdag gi sgra 'jug par mdzad do //
translated: Moreover, intending the appropriated aggregates themselves, the example is made without the slightest fault, and so the word “self” is used in this context.

original: da ni skabs su bab pa bsdu bar bzhed nas /
analyzed: da ni skabs su bab pa bsdu bar bzhed nas /
translated: Now, intending to summarize the relevant points,

original: sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: sdug bsngal dpag tu med pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: he says “infinite suffering” and so on.

original: gsungs pa'i rim pas gang rnams la bdag po med pa zhes pa'i tshig sdud pa yin te /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i rim pas gang rnams la bdag po med pa zhes pa'i tshig sdud pa yin te /
translated: The term “without a self” is a compound that is a sequence of terms.

original: bdag gi ba ma yin pa gang dang yang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi ba ma yin pa gang dang yang 'brel pa ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that it is not related to anything that is not mine.

original: gang cung zad thams cad nyid kyis ma yin no zhes khyad par du byed de /
analyzed: gang cung zad thams cad nyid kyis ma yin no zhes khyad par du byed de /
translated: It is specified that it is not anything at all.

original: gang du yang gang gi yang bdag gi ba nyid yod pa ma yin la 'di las khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid bdag dang gzhan gyir dbye ba ma byas par bzlog par bya ba nyid du 'gyur la de la bdag gi ba la
analyzed: gang du yang gang gi yang bdag gi ba nyid yod pa ma yin la 'di las khyad par yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir sdug bsngal nyid bdag dang gzhan gyir dbye ba ma byas par bzlog par bya ba nyid du 'gyur la de la bdag gi ba la
translated: Since there is nothing anywhere that is mine, and since there is nothing that is different from this, suffering is to be averted without making a distinction between self and other.

original: sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te des na gang gi bdag gis bdag gi pa nyid ni bzlog par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: sogs pa rgyu mtshan gzhan ni yod pa ma yin te des na gang gi bdag gis bdag gi pa nyid ni bzlog par bya ba yin la /
translated: Since there is no other reason for mine and so on, it is certain that mine is to be averted by me,

original: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin zhes pa 'di nges par 'gyur bar gang gis byas @168b te khyad par gang gis byas /
analyzed: gzhan dag gis ni ma yin zhes pa 'di nges par 'gyur bar gang gis byas @168b te khyad par gang gis byas /
translated: but how is it certain that it is not to be averted by others? By what distinction?

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nges pa ma yin no zhes smras pa yin no /
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal nyid kyi phyir zhes bya ba'i gtan tshigs nges pa ma yin no zhes smras pa yin no /
translated: Thus, it is said that the reason, “because of being suffering,” is not ascertained.

original: ci ste sdug bsngal can 'ga' zhig kyang 'khor ba na gal te yod pa yin na /
analyzed: ci ste sdug bsngal can 'ga' zhig kyang 'khor ba na gal te yod pa yin na /
translated: But if there were someone who is suffering in cyclic existence,

original: de lta na sdug bsngal bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
analyzed: de lta na sdug bsngal bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa nyid du 'gyur te /
translated: then it would follow that suffering would not be reversed,

original: snying rje'i zhing sdug bsngal can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs nas /🔽ci'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: snying rje'i zhing sdug bsngal can 'ga' yang yod pa ma yin pa'i phyir zhes dogs nas / ci'i phyir sdug bsngal zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te / bzlog par bya ba ma yin pa nyid yin te /
translated: because there would be no field of compassion, that is, no one who is suffering.

original: bdag med pa'i phyir ro zhes gal te sems na /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i phyir ro zhes gal te sems na /
translated: If you think that it is not to be reversed because of selflessness,

original: de'i tshe 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe 'dir rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: then that is not logical here.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why?

original: thams cad rtsod med phyir te /
analyzed: thams cad rtsod med phyir te /
translated: Because there is no dispute.

original: rgol ba thams cad la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir la log pa med par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgol ba thams cad la rtsod pa med pa'i phyir la log pa med par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because there is no dispute for all disputants, and because there is no realization of the unreal.

original: tshu rol mdzes pa yang 'dir rang gi sdug bsngal spong bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mdzes pa yang 'dir rang gi sdug bsngal spong bar zhugs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And the beauty of the present is also rejected, because one is engaged in the rejection of one’s own suffering.

original: de rnams kyis bdag khas blangs pa nyes par ma gyur pa ni ma yin te ;
analyzed: de rnams kyis bdag khas blangs pa nyes par ma gyur pa ni ma yin te ;
translated: It is not the case that there is no fault in accepting the self,

original: de'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas so //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ma dmigs pas so //
translated: because its nature is not perceived.

original: khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas de yod par grub pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: khas blangs pa tsam gyi sgo nas de yod par grub pa ni ma yin te /
translated: It is not the case that it exists because of mere acceptance,

original: de la sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa du ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la sgrub par byed pa med pa'i phyir dang / gnod par byed pa du ma brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because there is no proof of it, and because many refutations of it are stated.

original: de ltar na sdug bsngal thams cad bzlog par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe thams cad bzlog par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na sdug bsngal thams cad bzlog par bya ba yin pa de'i tshe thams cad bzlog par bya'o //
translated: Thus, when all suffering is to be rejected, then all is to be rejected.

original: gal te bzlog par bya ba ma yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang ste zin pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te bzlog par bya ba ma yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid kyang ste zin pa'i phung po lnga'i rang bzhin gyi sdug bsngal yang bzlog par bya ba ma yin te /
translated: If it is not to be rejected, then the self also, i.e., the suffering which is the nature of the five aggregates that have been appropriated, is not to be rejected,

original: thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes mjug sdud do //
analyzed: thams cad du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro zhes mjug sdud do //
translated: because there is no difference between them. Thus he concludes.

original: ci ste thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa snying rje gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba yin pa de lta na lhur sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu de nyid dang po nyid du bskyed par bya ba
analyzed: ci ste thams cad kyi sdug bsngal bsal bar bya ba'i phyir brtson pa snying rje gzhan gyi dbang du gyur pas gzhan sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba yin pa de lta na lhur sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu de nyid dang po nyid du bskyed par bya ba
translated: If, in order to remove the suffering of all, one strives with compassion, which is under the control of another, and suffers from the suffering of others, then it is not right to apply oneself first of all to the cause of suffering.

original: nyid du sbyar bar mi rigs so zhes gzhan gyi tshig gis dogs par byas nas /
analyzed: nyid du sbyar bar mi rigs so zhes gzhan gyi tshig gis dogs par byas nas /
translated: Having thus anticipated the objection of another,

original: snying rje zhes ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: snying rje zhes ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says Compassion, etc.

original: nan gyis zhes pa ni rtsol bas so //
analyzed: nan gyis zhes pa ni rtsol bas so //
translated: Forcefully means with effort.

original: 'dir lan gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir lan gsungs pa /
translated: Here he gives the answer:

original: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pas byas pa'i rnam pa mang po bsam par byas na snying rje byas pa'i sdug bsngal 'di ci ltar mang ste /
analyzed: 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal la sogs pas byas pa'i rnam pa mang po bsam par byas na snying rje byas pa'i sdug bsngal 'di ci ltar mang ste /
translated: If one considers the many forms of suffering, etc. of the world, how much is this suffering of compassion?

original: snying rje can gyi sdug bsngal ni mang ba ma yin no zhes dgongs so //🔽gzhan yan @169a * //
analyzed: snying rje can gyi sdug bsngal ni mang ba ma yin no zhes dgongs so // gzhan yan @169a * //
translated: The suffering of the compassionate one is not much.🔽This is the idea.🔽Another answer is:

original: lan 'di yang yod do zhes /
analyzed: lan 'di yang yod do zhes /
translated: There is this, too.

original: gal te sdug bsngal gcig gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te sdug bsngal gcig gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The response to that is stated in the lines beginning “If one suffering . . .”🔽

original: skyes bu gcig gi sdug bsngal gyis gal te sems can mang po rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par 'gyur zhing bzlog par 'gyur na de'i de lta bu'i sdug bsngal bskyed par bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: skyes bu gcig gi sdug bsngal gyis gal te sems can mang po rnams kyi sdug bsngal med par 'gyur zhing bzlog par 'gyur na de'i de lta bu'i sdug bsngal bskyed par bya zhing bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: If the suffering of one being could be removed by the suffering of many beings, then that suffering should be created and taken on.

original: snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dam pas rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o //
analyzed: snying rje'i bdag nyid can gyi dam pas rang dang gzhan gnyi ga'i sdug bsngal bsal bar bya'o //
translated: The compassionate ones, the best of beings, should remove the suffering of both themselves and others.

original: brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir /
analyzed: brtags pa ni ma yin no zhes bsnyad pa'i phyir /
translated: This is not a mere fabrication.

original: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: des na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi phyir snying rje can gyis rang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
analyzed: gang gi phyir snying rje can gyis rang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bskyed par bya ba nyid de /
translated: Because the compassionate ones should create the suffering of both themselves and others,

original: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' me tog zla mdzes kyis rgyal po nyams pa ste rgyal po las nyams te shes shing go yang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir byang chub sems dpa' me tog zla mdzes kyis rgyal po nyams pa ste rgyal po las nyams te shes shing go yang ngo //
translated: therefore the bodhisattva Supuṣpacandra, though knowing and understanding, was not angry with the king who had fallen from his status as king.

original: bdag gi sdug bsngal ma bsal ba ni ma bzlog pa yin te btang snyoms su byas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bdag gi sdug bsngal ma bsal ba ni ma bzlog pa yin te btang snyoms su byas zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: He did not remove his own suffering, that is, he did not avert it, but rather he was indifferent to it.

original: de bzhin du rgyal po'i phyir ma'i sdug bsngal yang ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du rgyal po'i phyir ma'i sdug bsngal yang ngo //
translated: In the same way, he did not remove the suffering of his mother and father.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi zad byas pa ste //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyis mi zad byas pa ste //
translated: He made himself an inexhaustible refuge for all beings.

original: sdug bsngal gyis zhes skabs su bab pa la drug pa'i mtha' can gyis 'brel to //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gyis zhes skabs su bab pa la drug pa'i mtha' can gyis 'brel to //
translated: The word “suffering” is supplied from the context.

original: gang me tog zla mdzes kyi de lta bu byung ba'i las 'di ltar yang 'das pa'i dus na rin po che pad ma'i rnam par dag pa mngon par 'phags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung zhing rgyal po yang byung bar gyur pa na
analyzed: gang me tog zla mdzes kyi de lta bu byung ba'i las 'di ltar yang 'das pa'i dus na rin po che pad ma'i rnam par dag pa mngon par 'phags pa'i rgyal po zhes bya ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa byung zhing rgyal po yang byung bar gyur pa na
translated: “Just as Supuṣpacandra did, so also in the past there was a Tathāgata named Ratnapuṇḍarīka­viśuddha­abhyudgata­rāja.

original: bcom ldan 'das de yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad cing yun ring du bzhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de yang sangs rgyas kyi mdzad pa mdzad cing yun ring du bzhugs nas yongs su mya ngan las 'das so //
translated: After that Blessed One had performed all the activities of a Buddha and lived a long life, he passed into complete nirvāṇa.

original: de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bstan pa nub par gyur pa na rgyal po dpas byin zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de'i tshe yongs su mya ngan las 'das nas bstan pa nub par gyur pa na rgyal po dpas byin zhes bya ba byung bar gyur te /
translated: At that time, after the Parinirvāṇa, when the teachings had disappeared, there was a king named Śrībhadra.

original: de'i pho brang 'khor ni rin chen ldan pa zhes bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de'i pho brang 'khor ni rin chen ldan pa zhes bya ba yin la /
translated: His palace was called Ratnāvatī.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus na sems can rnams lta ba log par gyur to //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus na sems can rnams lta ba log par gyur to //
translated: At that time, sentient beings had fallen into wrong views.

original: de rnams la thugs brtse ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba mang po byung bar gyur te yul 'khor dang grong rdal de las de rnams kyang bskrad nas chos smra ba me tog zla mdzes dang lhan cig tu kun tu bzang po zhes bya
analyzed: de rnams la thugs brtse ba'i don du byang chub sems dpa' rab tu byung ba mang po byung bar gyur te yul 'khor dang grong rdal de las de rnams kyang bskrad nas chos smra ba me tog zla mdzes dang lhan cig tu kun tu bzang po zhes bya
translated: Out of compassion for them, many bodhisattvas went forth. Even they were expelled from that country and town. The Dharma teacher Supuṣpacandra

original: ba'i dgon pa'i nags khrod na brten cing gnas so //
analyzed: ba'i dgon pa'i nags khrod na brten cing gnas so //
translated: dwelt together with them in a forest hermitage called Samantabhadra.

original: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' me tog zla mdzes sems can rnams @169b la snying rje'i bsam pas dben par nang du yang dag 'jog la zhugs te /
analyzed: de nas yang byang chub sems dpa' me tog zla mdzes sems can rnams @169b la snying rje'i bsam pas dben par nang du yang dag 'jog la zhugs te /
translated: Then, the bodhisattva Supuṣpacandra, with a compassionate intention towards sentient beings, entered solitary meditative equipoise.

original: bdag gis grong dang grong rdal dang yul 'khor du song la sems can lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams dge ba'i lam la gzhag par bya'o zhes sems la rnam par rtog pa skyes te /
analyzed: bdag gis grong dang grong rdal dang yul 'khor du song la sems can lam ngan par zhugs pa rnams dge ba'i lam la gzhag par bya'o zhes sems la rnam par rtog pa skyes te /
translated: I will go to the towns, cities, and provinces and establish beings who have entered bad paths in the virtuous path.”

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la don de smras so //
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la don de smras so //
translated: He spoke of this matter to his fellow brahmacarins.

original: de rnams kyis bkag par gyur kyang bdag nyid nyams pa dang rgyal po yang nyams par shes bzhin du nags khrod de las byung bar gyur te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis bkag par gyur kyang bdag nyid nyams pa dang rgyal po yang nyams par shes bzhin du nags khrod de las byung bar gyur te /
translated: Although they tried to stop him, he left the forest, knowing that he himself would be ruined and that the king would be ruined.

original: rim gyis chos ston cing rgyal po de'i pho brang gi 'khor du phyin par gyur to //
analyzed: rim gyis chos ston cing rgyal po de'i pho brang gi 'khor du phyin par gyur to //
translated: In due course, teaching the Dharma, he arrived at the royal palace.

original: des rgyal po'i bu dang / blon po dang ; mdun na 'don la sogs pa sems can mang po rnams la /
analyzed: des rgyal po'i bu dang / blon po dang ; mdun na 'don la sogs pa sems can mang po rnams la /
translated: He established many beings, the king’s sons, ministers, priests, and so forth,

original: ji ltar 'dul bar thabs rnam pa du mas yang dag pa'i lam la 'jog pa'i tshe rgyal po de rgyal po'i lam du mthong ba bzhin du khros te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dul bar thabs rnam pa du mas yang dag pa'i lam la 'jog pa'i tshe rgyal po de rgyal po'i lam du mthong ba bzhin du khros te /
translated: in the true path by means of many methods of taming. When the king saw him on the king’s road, he was furious.

original: phrag dog gis bslangs pa'i sems kyis 'dis skye bo thams cad rangs par byas so snyam nas bsad pa'i don du rang gi bu rnams la bsgo ba dang / de rnams kyang de gsod pa la phyir phyogs par go nas gsod pa'i gshed ma dga' byed la bka' bsgo ba'o //
analyzed: phrag dog gis bslangs pa'i sems kyis 'dis skye bo thams cad rangs par byas so snyam nas bsad pa'i don du rang gi bu rnams la bsgo ba dang / de rnams kyang de gsod pa la phyir phyogs par go nas gsod pa'i gshed ma dga' byed la bka' bsgo ba'o //
translated: They, understanding that he was averse to killing him, ordered the executioner Nanda to kill him.

original: des kyang rgyal po'i bka' bzhin du byed pas lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa rim gyis bcad nas mig dag kyang skam pas byung ste /
analyzed: des kyang rgyal po'i bka' bzhin du byed pas lag pa dang / rkang pa la sogs pa rim gyis bcad nas mig dag kyang skam pas byung ste /
translated: He, acting according to the king's order, cut off his hands, feet, and so on in stages, and even gouged out his eyes.

original: srog dang bral bar byas so //
analyzed: srog dang bral bar byas so //
translated: He deprived him of life.

original: de nas dge slong de rgyal po'i lam du srog dang bral ba'i lus las ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba du ma de mthong nas /
analyzed: de nas dge slong de rgyal po'i lam du srog dang bral ba'i lus las ngo mtshar rmad du byung ba du ma de mthong nas /
translated: Then the monk, seeing many wonderful miracles in the body of the one who had been deprived of life on the king's road,

original: dge slong 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do zhes rgyal pos cho nge byas nas yongs su gdung bar gyur te /
analyzed: dge slong 'di ni byang chub sems dpa' nyid do zhes rgyal pos cho nge byas nas yongs su gdung bar gyur te /
translated: the king lamented, This monk is a bodhisattva! and became tormented.

original: rnam pa du mas smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: rnam pa du mas smre sngags 'don to //
translated: He lamented in many ways.

original: de ltar me tog zla mdzes kyi de lta bu byung ba cung zad 'dir mdor bsdus nas brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar me tog zla mdzes kyi de lta bu byung ba cung zad 'dir mdor bsdus nas brjod pa yin te /
translated: Thus, this brief summary of the story of Supuṣpacandra is told here.

original: yang rgyas par ni ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdor bstan pas de nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: yang rgyas par ni ting nge 'dzin rgyal po'i mdor bstan pas de nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: But it should be known in detail from the Sūtra of the King of Contemplations, which teaches it.

original: pha rol sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'i snying rje can rnams ni sdug bsngal chen pos kyang gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: pha rol sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba'i snying rje can rnams ni sdug bsngal chen pos kyang gnod par 'gyur ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: The compassionate ones, who suffer from the suffering of others, are not harmed even by great suffering.

original: de ltar rgyud ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rgyud ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To demonstrate this, he says,🔽“Thus, the mindstream…”

original: de ltar ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'o //
translated: Thus means equalizing self and other.🔽The mindstream is the mental continuum.

original: rgyud bsgoms pa ni sems kyi rgyud lhun gyis grub pas 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rgyud bsgoms pa ni sems kyi rgyud lhun gyis grub pas 'jug pa'o //
translated: The cultivation is the effortless engagement.

original: @170a * // gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi zhing mnyam par dga' ba ste //
analyzed: @170a * // gzhan gyi sdug bsngal zhi zhing mnyam par dga' ba ste //
translated: The pacification of the suffering of others is the joy of equality.

original: bde ba'i rgyu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
analyzed: bde ba'i rgyu gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya ste /
translated: The cause of happiness is what is meant by that.

original: bdag gi bde ba yang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba nyid gang rnams kyis yin pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba yang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bas sdug bsngal ba nyid gang rnams kyis yin pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of “those who” is that their own happiness is more painful than the suffering of others.

original: de rnams mnar med par 'jug pa rnams ni gzhan sdug bsngal las gdon pa'i don du sdug bsngal de nyid la bde bar sems pa rnams so //
analyzed: de rnams mnar med par 'jug pa rnams ni gzhan sdug bsngal las gdon pa'i don du sdug bsngal de nyid la bde bar sems pa rnams so //
translated: Those who enter Avīci, thinking that very suffering is happiness, for the sake of liberating others from suffering.

original: 'di nyid 'dir /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir /
translated: This very thing is stated here:

original: padma'i mtsho ru ngang pa ltar //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: padma'i mtsho ru ngang pa ltar // zhes gsungs te /
translated: Like geese in a lotus pond.

original: mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal yang bde ba nyid yin te /
analyzed: mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal yang bde ba nyid yin te /
translated: The suffering of Avīci is itself happiness,

original: gang rnams kyi gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyi don du yin pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan gang gis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang rnams kyi gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyi don du yin pas sdug bsngal gyi rgyu gzhan gang gis sdug bsngal bar 'gyur /
translated: because it is for the sake of the suffering of others. By what other cause of suffering would they suffer?

original: gzhan yang de rnams kyi bde ba yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang de rnams kyi bde ba yang thun mong ma yin pa nyid gzhan gyi sdug bsngal gyis skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, their happiness also arises from the suffering of others, because it is not shared.

original: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir /🔽sems can rnams ni grol ba na //
analyzed: de bas na bstan pa'i phyir / sems can rnams ni grol ba na //
translated: Therefore, in order to demonstrate this,

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: he says, “When sentient beings are liberated,” and so on.

original: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba las grol bar byed pa yod pa la'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la sdug bsngal gyi 'ching ba las grol bar byed pa yod pa la'o //
translated: It is in the existence of the liberation of sentient beings from the bondage of suffering.

original: gang yin de zhes pa ni de rnams nyid kyis nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir 'di tsam zhes brjod par nus pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang yin de zhes pa ni de rnams nyid kyis nyams su myong bas grub pa'i phyir 'di tsam zhes brjod par nus pa ma yin la /
translated: That which is, cannot be said to be this much, because it is established by the experience of those very ones.

original: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba'i rgya mtsho yin te mgu ba'i rgya mtsho snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgyud rnams la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir dga' ba'i rgya mtsho yin te mgu ba'i rgya mtsho snying rje dang ldan pa'i rgyud rnams la skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And for that very reason, it is the ocean of joy, the ocean of satisfaction, which arises in the mindstreams of those who have compassion.

original: dga' ba'i rgya mtsho de nyid kyis mthar phyin pa ni bde ba gzhan la phyir phyogs pa las yongs su thob pa ste /
analyzed: dga' ba'i rgya mtsho de nyid kyis mthar phyin pa ni bde ba gzhan la phyir phyogs pa las yongs su thob pa ste /
translated: The finality of that very ocean of joy is the attainment of the bliss that turns away from others.

original: bde ba thams cad spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: bde ba thams cad spangs pa yin no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is the abandonment of all bliss, is what is meant.

original: ci ste de nyid bde ba'i mthar thug pa ci ltar yin te /
analyzed: ci ste de nyid bde ba'i mthar thug pa ci ltar yin te /
translated: But how is that itself the finality of bliss?

original: gcig tu nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba nye bar zhi bas rnam par grol ba'i bde ba yin pa'i phyir shin tu lhag pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: gcig tu nyon mongs pa'i yongs su gdung ba nye bar zhi bas rnam par grol ba'i bde ba yin pa'i phyir shin tu lhag pa yin no zhe na /
translated: It is extremely superior, because it is the bliss of liberation, which is the complete pacification of the torment of the afflictions, all at once.

original: ro bral thar pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ro bral thar pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The line liberation is like a corpse and so on.

original: thar pa yang de la ltos nas de rnams ro dang bral ba nyid du snang ngo //
analyzed: thar pa yang de la ltos nas de rnams ro dang bral ba nyid du snang ngo //
translated: Liberation is like a corpse means that liberation appears to be like a corpse in dependence on those who are attached to the bliss of meditative concentration.

original: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: dgongs pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The intended meaning is this.

original: gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa nyid de rnams kyi ro'i mchog nyid kyis zhugs pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub pa nyid de rnams kyi ro'i mchog nyid kyis zhugs pa'i phyir de la mngon par zhen pa yin la /
translated: Since the attainment of the happiness and benefit of others is the supreme taste of those who enter the Mahāyāna, they are attached to it.

original: snying rje dang ldan pa rnams la bde ba de nyid dgos pa yin gyi thar pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: snying rje dang ldan pa rnams la bde ba de nyid dgos pa yin gyi thar pa ni ma yin no //
translated: For those who have compassion, that very happiness is the goal, not liberation.

original: de gal te nyams su len pa la ched cher byed na thar pa yang mngon du gyur na yang gzhan gyi don de @170b nyid la ched du gnyer ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de gal te nyams su len pa la ched cher byed na thar pa yang mngon du gyur na yang gzhan gyi don de @170b nyid la ched du gnyer ba ni ma yin no //
translated: If they were to value the practice of the Mahāyāna, even if liberation were to manifest, they would not strive for it, since it is not the benefit of others.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: 'gro ba ma lus rang bzhin mngon du mdzad gang gi //
analyzed: 'gro ba ma lus rang bzhin mngon du mdzad gang gi //
translated: Those who manifest the nature of all beings

original: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni zhar la byung ba ste //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa nyid ni zhar la byung ba ste //
translated: are the tathāgatas themselves.🔽The dependent nature is like a corpse

original: gzhan dbang gyur pa khyod kyi yon tan rnams las ni //
analyzed: gzhan dbang gyur pa khyod kyi yon tan rnams las ni //
translated: in that it is the basis of the afflicted and purified phenomena.

original: cung zad tsam zhig tshig gi rjod byed snyan dang gas mkhan //
analyzed: cung zad tsam zhig tshig gi rjod byed snyan dang gas mkhan //
translated: A mere trifle is the expression of words.

original: zhes so / gang gi phyir thar pa la rings pa med pa de'i phyir te /
analyzed: zhes so / gang gi phyir thar pa la rings pa med pa de'i phyir te /
translated: Because there is no haste for liberation, therefore,

original: rgyu 'di las gzhan gyi don byas kyang ste /🔽de la sems gzhol bar zhugs pas rlom sems dang rgyags pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu 'di las gzhan gyi don byas kyang ste / de la sems gzhol bar zhugs pas rlom sems dang rgyags pa ma yin la /
translated: even though he has worked for the benefit of others,🔽he does not become proud or conceited, because his mind is absorbed in that.

original: ngo mtshar ba yang med de dka' ba spyad pas rmad du byung ba'i blo yang de rnams la skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: ngo mtshar ba yang med de dka' ba spyad pas rmad du byung ba'i blo yang de rnams la skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Nor is he amazed, because he does not have a mind that is astonished by his difficult work.

original: bdag gis dam pa'i las byas pa 'di'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pha rol du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa yang skye ba ma yin no //🔽'di'i rgyu gcig tu gzhan don la dga' bas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gis dam pa'i las byas pa 'di'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu 'jig rten pha rol du 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu la 'dod pa yang skye ba ma yin no // 'di'i rgyu gcig tu gzhan don la dga' bas zhes gsungs te /
translated: Nor does he have a desire for the ripened effect of his action, thinking, “The result of the evolution of this good action of mine will occur in a future world.”🔽The cause of this is stated: “Because he is one who delights in the benefit of others.”

original: gang gzhan gyi don rnams la gcig tu ste /
analyzed: gang gzhan gyi don rnams la gcig tu ste /
translated: He is one who delights in the benefit of others alone.

original: dgos pa gzhan la ltos pa med pas khyad par du shin tu dga' ba yin te de nyams su len pa la tshim pa med pa yin la rgyu des so //
analyzed: dgos pa gzhan la ltos pa med pas khyad par du shin tu dga' ba yin te de nyams su len pa la tshim pa med pa yin la rgyu des so //
translated: because it is not dependent on any other purpose, it is especially very delightful.  It is not satisfied with practicing that, and for that reason.

original: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i 'bras bu'i skabs kyi khyad par de bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis ni bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa'i 'bras bu'i skabs kyi khyad par de bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: This shows the difference in the context of the result of sameness of self and other.

original: de ltar na zhar la byung ba de ltar brjod nas skabs su bab pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar na zhar la byung ba de ltar brjod nas skabs su bab pa mjug bsdu ba'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Thus, having spoken of that digression, in order to teach the present topic by way of summary,

original: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Therefore, etc.

original: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i rim pas bdag dang gzhan la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa de bas na'o //
analyzed: gang gi phyir brjod pa'i rim pas bdag dang gzhan la khyad par cung zad kyang med pa de bas na'o //
translated: Because, in the order stated, there is not the slightest difference between self and other, therefore.

original: chung ngu na zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu cung zad tsam mi snyan pa las kyang bdag bsrung zhing sba bar bya'o //
analyzed: chung ngu na zhes pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu cung zad tsam mi snyan pa las kyang bdag bsrung zhing sba bar bya'o //
translated: Even in the case of a slight cause of suffering, a slight unpleasantness, one should protect and guard oneself.

original: de ltar gyur na yang bdag dang gzhan du mnyam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di nyams su blang bar mi nus pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang bdag dang gzhan du mnyam par bsgrub pa zhes bya ba 'di nyams su blang bar mi nus pa nyid yin la /
translated: Even so, it is not possible to practice what is called “the achievement of sameness between self and other.”

original: de bas kyang bdag dang gzhan du brje ba ni shin tu yang mi nus pa yin te /
analyzed: de bas kyang bdag dang gzhan du brje ba ni shin tu yang mi nus pa yin te /
translated: And even more than that, it is utterly impossible to exchange oneself and others.

original: de ji ltar na blang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na blang bar bya ba yin zhe na /
translated: How could that be something to be undertaken?

original: goms pa yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: goms pa yis ni zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The verse “Through habituation…” is stated.

original: de bzhin du brjod pa'i rim pas 'dir dngos po goms pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ni dka'o zhes pa'i blo bskyed par mi bya ste /🔽gang gi phyir gzhan dag ste pha ma dang 'brel pa'i khu ba khrag gi @171a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du brjod pa'i rim pas 'dir dngos po goms pa'i spyod yul du 'gyur ba ni dka'o zhes pa'i blo bskyed par mi bya ste / gang gi phyir gzhan dag ste pha ma dang 'brel pa'i khu ba khrag gi @171a * //
translated: In the same way, one should not develop the idea that it is difficult to make the object of habituation here, following the stated procedure.

original: thigs pa la lus zhes zhen pa rnams la goms pas bdag go zhes shes par 'gyur te bstan pa nyid kyis 'jug go //
analyzed: thigs pa la lus zhes zhen pa rnams la goms pas bdag go zhes shes par 'gyur te bstan pa nyid kyis 'jug go //
translated: Because others, i.e., those who are attached to the drops of semen and blood connected with their parents, come to know it as “I” through habituation, and are thus introduced by that very teaching.

original: 'on te bdag gi zhes shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa yin te /
analyzed: 'on te bdag gi zhes shes pa'i rgyu mtshan gzhan yod pa yin te /
translated: But there is another reason for the idea of “mine.”

original: ci'i phyir 'dir mi 'thad ce na dngos po med par gyur kyang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir 'dir mi 'thad ce na dngos po med par gyur kyang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “Even though the thing does not exist,” and so forth.

original: bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa med na yang goms pa 'ba' zhig las de ltar sgom par byed pas gzhan la yang nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag la sogs pa'i dngos po'i rgyu mtshan du gyur pa med na yang goms pa 'ba' zhig las de ltar sgom par byed pas gzhan la yang nges pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: Even though there is no ground for the thing, the self, and so on, one cultivates that very thing through mere habituation, and so it is certain for others as well.

original: de nyid de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nyid de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said, “That very thing is just like that,” and so forth.

original: bdag ces ci'i phyir mi bzung ste gzung bar bya ba nyid du shin tu nus pa yin la /
analyzed: bdag ces ci'i phyir mi bzung ste gzung bar bya ba nyid du shin tu nus pa yin la /
translated: Why not take the self as the object of apprehension? It is quite capable of being taken as the object of apprehension.

original: de'i rang bzhin nyid du rang gi lus grub pa nyid do //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin nyid du rang gi lus grub pa nyid do //
translated: The body is established as having the nature of that very thing.

original: gzhan du na de dang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na de dang mnyam pa nyid du yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, it would not be the same as that.

original: de ltar na bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bka' bas bsgrub dgos pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bka' bas bsgrub dgos pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, the exchange of self and other is not something to be accomplished by the Buddha’s word.

original: de ltar bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag dang gzhan du mnyam pa bstan nas /
translated: Having thus taught the sameness of self and other,

original: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bstan par bzhed nas /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bstan par bzhed nas /
translated: in order to teach the exchange of self and other,

original: bdag nyid skyon bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid skyon bcas zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse I will regard as myself and so on.

original: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yon tan dang skyon blang ba dang dor ba dag gi rgyu mtshan bdag dang gzhan la de mthong nas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba dag bsgom zhing goms par bya'o //🔽bdag lus yongs su dor ba ni bdag nyid la gzhan du bya'o //
analyzed: rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams kyis yon tan dang skyon blang ba dang dor ba dag gi rgyu mtshan bdag dang gzhan la de mthong nas blang ba dang dor bar bya ba dag bsgom zhing goms par bya'o // bdag lus yongs su dor ba ni bdag nyid la gzhan du bya'o //
translated: Those who have understanding should cultivate and become accustomed to the practice of taking up and rejecting, seeing the reasons for taking up and rejecting good qualities and faults in oneself and others.🔽One should regard oneself as another, that is, as other.

original: gzhan blang ba zhes pa ni gzhan rnams la bdag nyid du'o //
analyzed: gzhan blang ba zhes pa ni gzhan rnams la bdag nyid du'o //
translated: One should take up another, that is, regard another as myself.

original: de ltar na 'dis bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i thabs gzhan bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'dis bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i thabs gzhan bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this teaches the method of exchanging oneself and others.

original: de ltar gyur na sems can rnam pa tha dad pa mang po rnams la ji ltar so sor bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bsgom par nus she na /🔽ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na sems can rnam pa tha dad pa mang po rnams la ji ltar so sor bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bsgom par nus she na / ji ltar lag pa la sogs pa //
translated: If that is so, how can one cultivate the exchange of oneself and others with regard to the many different sentient beings?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse Just as I protect myself and so on.

original: gang ste yang lag pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang lus su zhen pa'i yan lag nyid kyis su zhes de la gcig tu yul du byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba yang ma lus pa gcig nyid du zhen pas de'i yan
analyzed: gang ste yang lag pa la sogs pa tha dad pa yin pa de lta na yang lus su zhen pa'i yan lag nyid kyis su zhes de la gcig tu yul du byed pa de bzhin du 'gro ba yang ma lus pa gcig nyid du zhen pas de'i yan
translated: But if the hand and so on are different, then just as the hand and so on are conceived as a body because they are its parts, in the same way, the world is conceived as a single thing because it is the part of a self.

original: lag nyid kyis srog chags la 'gro ba zhes gcig nyid du de ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
analyzed: lag nyid kyis srog chags la 'gro ba zhes gcig nyid du de ci'i phyir mi 'dzin /
translated: Why not apprehend the world as a single thing because it is the part of a self?

original: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba 'di la dka' ba'i blo gros mi bya ste /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba 'di la dka' ba'i blo gros mi bya ste /
translated: One should not be of the opinion that this exchange of self and other is difficult,

original: goms pas thob pa yin no zhes @171b bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: goms pas thob pa yin no zhes @171b bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: because it is attained through practice.

original: ji ltar bdag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ji ltar bdag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate this, it is said:🔽Just as, when one has eaten one’s fill, one does not desire the fruit of that in another world,

original: don bshad zin pa la bdag dang gzhan du brjes pa na 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu la 'dod pa skyes pa ma yin no //
analyzed: don bshad zin pa la bdag dang gzhan du brjes pa na 'jig rten pha rol du 'bras bu la 'dod pa skyes pa ma yin no //
translated: in the same way, when one has eaten one’s fill of the world, one does not desire the fruit of that in another world.

original: gang dang 'dra bar zhe na /
analyzed: gang dang 'dra bar zhe na /
translated: What is it like?

original: bdag nyid kyi zas zos nas te /
analyzed: bdag nyid kyi zas zos nas te /
translated: When one has eaten one’s fill of one’s own food.

original: sbyin pa 'dis bdag dang sems can longs spyod phun sum tshogs par gyur cig ces 'bras bu mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa 'dis bdag dang sems can longs spyod phun sum tshogs par gyur cig ces 'bras bu mi 'dod pa bzhin no //
translated: By this giving, may I and all sentient beings become replete with enjoyments!

original: de bzhin du ni de ltar ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du ni de ltar ro //
translated: Just like that, just so.

original: de ltar na 'di goms pa'i yul nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di goms pa'i yul nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Thus, having taught it as the very object of cultivation,

original: bzlog pa la goms par bya bar rang gi sems sbyar ba'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pa la goms par bya bar rang gi sems sbyar ba'i phyir /
translated: in order to apply one's mind to the cultivation of the opposite,

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Therefore, etc.

original: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po thob pa'i ched du gdung ba ste /
analyzed: 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa'i dngos po thob pa'i ched du gdung ba ste /
