translated: Desire is the torment for the sake of obtaining a desired thing.

original: sems kyi chos yin pa'am lus kyi sdug bsngal yin pa ni dper na 'go ba'i nad lta bu'o //
analyzed: sems kyi chos yin pa'am lus kyi sdug bsngal yin pa ni dper na 'go ba'i nad lta bu'o //
translated: It is a mental phenomenon or a bodily pain, like, for example, a contagious disease.

original: mya ngan ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
analyzed: mya ngan ni sdug bsngal dang bral ba la sogs pas byas pa'i sdug bsngal lo //
translated: Sorrow is the pain produced by separation from what is pleasant, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gzhan bzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni lus dang sems kyi sdug bsngal gzhan bzung ngo //
translated: The word etc. includes other bodily and mental pains.

original: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: de nyid dpe'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach just that by means of an example,

original: de bas mgon po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas mgon po zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, Therefore, the Lord, etc.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis rang gi mtshan yang byin gyis brlabs te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bcom ldan 'das 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug gis rang gi mtshan yang byin gyis brlabs te /
translated: Therefore, the Bhagavat Avalokitesvara blessed his own name.

original: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bdag nyid kyi mtshan byin gyis brlabs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
analyzed: 'phags pa spyan ras gzigs dbang phyug ces bdag nyid kyi mtshan byin gyis brlabs pa dang ldan pa yin la /
translated: The noble Avalokitesvara is endowed with the blessing of his own name, Avalokitesvara.

original: 'khor gyi 'jigs pa ni skrag pa yin te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi 'jigs pa ni skrag pa yin te /
translated: The fear of the retinue is fearfulness,

original: sems bskums nas 'jug pa yin la /
analyzed: sems bskums nas 'jug pa yin la /
translated: because the mind contracts and enters.

original: spobs pa dang bral zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: spobs pa dang bral zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to devoid of eloquence.

original: 'gro ba ni 'jig rten pa yin la de las 'jigs pa'am de nyid kyis 'jigs pa'o //
analyzed: 'gro ba ni 'jig rten pa yin la de las 'jigs pa'am de nyid kyis 'jigs pa'o //
translated: The world is the world; fear from that is fear of that.

original: de bsal ba'i phyir ni de spong ba'i don du'o //
analyzed: de bsal ba'i phyir ni de spong ba'i don du'o //
translated: For the sake of dispelling that is for the sake of abandoning that.

original: mtshan gang sems can 'ga' zhig sems mos pas kyang bdag gi ming 'dzin par byed na de la sdug bsngal thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
analyzed: mtshan gang sems can 'ga' zhig sems mos pas kyang bdag gi ming 'dzin par byed na de la sdug bsngal thams cad rnam pa thams cad du 'byung bar mi 'gyur la /
translated: If any sentient being, even with a devoted mind, holds my name, for that one all suffering will not arise in any way.

original: tha na 'khor gyis 'jigs shing skrag pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes byin gyis brlabs so //
analyzed: tha na 'khor gyis 'jigs shing skrag pa yang 'byung bar mi 'gyur ro zhes byin gyis brlabs so //
translated: Even fear and terror of the retinue will not arise.🔽Moreover, since one becomes happy through habituation to difficult feelings, it is not right for us to turn back.

original: gzhan yang dka' ba'i tshor ba la yang goms pas dga' bar 'gyur bas na bdag cag gi ldog par mi rigs pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dka' las shes pa la sogs pa @172a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang dka' ba'i tshor ba la yang goms pas dga' bar 'gyur bas na bdag cag gi ldog par mi rigs pa nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir dka' las shes pa la sogs pa @172a * //
translated: To demonstrate this, [the Buddha] declares, “One who knows difficulty, etc.”

original: gsungs te / 'di ni mi nus so zhes nas ldog par mi bya'o //
analyzed: gsungs te / 'di ni mi nus so zhes nas ldog par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not turn back, thinking, “I cannot do this!”

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang las goms pa'i stobs 'dir mthong ste /
analyzed: gang las goms pa'i stobs 'dir mthong ste /
translated: Because one sees here the power of habituation.

original: gang gis thos nas 'jigs pa zhes pa ni rna ba'i lam du gyur na skrag pa dang 'jigs pa skyo bar 'gyur ba la /
analyzed: gang gis thos nas 'jigs pa zhes pa ni rna ba'i lam du gyur na skrag pa dang 'jigs pa skyo bar 'gyur ba la /
translated: One who, having heard, is afraid, i.e., who becomes frightened, terrified, and depressed when it comes to the path of the ear,

original: phyi nas rgyu cung zad thob pa las sdug par goms pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis med par gyur na mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi nas rgyu cung zad thob pa las sdug par goms pa'i dbang gis 'jigs pa'i rgyu de nyid kyis med par gyur na mi dga' bar 'gyur ro //
translated: later, through the power of habituation to what is difficult to obtain, becomes unhappy when that very cause of fear is removed.

original: gzhan yang dgos pa 'di yang yod par mthong ba yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang dgos pa 'di yang yod par mthong ba yin te /
translated: Moreover, this purpose is also seen to exist:

original: de la gus pa'i sgo nas goms pa'i dbang du gyur par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang zhig bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽gang zhig myur zhing mgyogs pa nyid du sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa thams cad las bskyab cing bsrung bar 'dod pas de spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gus pa'i sgo nas goms pa'i dbang du gyur par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig bdag dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / gang zhig myur zhing mgyogs pa nyid du sdug bsngal gyi 'jigs pa thams cad las bskyab cing bsrung bar 'dod pas de spyad par bya ste /
translated: In order to demonstrate that one should become empowered through familiarization by means of devotion to that,

original: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'o //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'o //
translated: he says, “Whoever wishes to quickly protect himself and others from all the fears of suffering should practice this exchange of self and other.”

original: ci lta bur gyur pa zhe na /🔽gsang ba'i dam pa ste de'i rigs can ma yin pa rnams skrag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur pa zhe na / gsang ba'i dam pa ste de'i rigs can ma yin pa rnams skrag pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ram /
translated: What is it like?

original: ma dad pa bsal ba'i phyir shin tu yang gsang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa bsal ba'i phyir shin tu yang gsang bar bya ste /
translated: It is the highest secret, because it is the cause of fear for those who are not of its lineage, or it is to be kept very secret in order to remove lack of faith.

original: gzhan du na des spangs pas de rnams ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na des spangs pas de rnams ngan song du 'gro bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, by abandoning it, they will go to the lower realms.

original: gang bdag nyid skyon bcas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid nyes pa dang yon tan de rnams rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gang bdag nyid skyon bcas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa'i bdag nyid dang gzhan gyi bdag nyid nyes pa dang yon tan de rnams rgyas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate the faults of self and the qualities of others in detail, he says, “Whoever sees himself as having faults…” and so forth.

original: bdag lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse text says:

original: brtan chags pas zhes pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pas bskyed pa'i mngon par zhen pas so //
analyzed: brtan chags pas zhes pa ni bdag tu 'dzin pas bskyed pa'i mngon par zhen pas so //
translated: “Firmly” means by the manifest clinging produced by the conception of a self.

original: chung zhes pa ni 'khor gyi 'jigs pa skad cig ma cung zad las kyang ngo //
analyzed: chung zhes pa ni 'khor gyi 'jigs pa skad cig ma cung zad las kyang ngo //
translated: “Small” means from even a little instant of fear of the retinue.

original: 'khor gyi 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin pas na 'jigs pa'am /
analyzed: 'khor gyi 'jigs pa'i rgyu yin pas na 'jigs pa'am /
translated: Since it is the cause of fear of the retinue, it is fear.

original: rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i 'jigs pa 'di 'jigs pa zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pas brtags pa'i 'jigs pa 'di 'jigs pa zhes brjod do //
translated: Or this fear imagined by conceptual thought is called “fear.”

original: 'di lta bur gyur ba'i bdag nyid la sems dang ldan pa su zhig sdang bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid la sems dang ldan pa su zhig sdang bar mi byed de sdang bar bya ba nyid de zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di lta bur gyur ba'i bdag nyid la sems dang ldan pa su zhig sdang bar gyur pa'i bdag nyid la sems dang ldan pa su zhig sdang bar mi byed de sdang bar bya ba nyid de zhes pa'i don to //
translated: What person with a mind would not be angry at such a self? One should be angry at it, is the meaning.

original: de gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: de gang yin zhe na /
translated: What is it?

original: dgra bzhin du gang gi 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
analyzed: dgra bzhin du gang gi 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa ste /
translated: It is that which produces fear like an enemy.

original: brjod pa'i rim pas dgra bzhin du gang zhig 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pas dgra bzhin du gang zhig 'jigs pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: In the order of expression, it is that which produces fear like an enemy.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The thought is this:

original: dgra la yang sdang bar byed do //
analyzed: dgra la yang sdang bar byed do //
translated: One is also hostile to enemies.

original: sdug bsngal skyed par @172b byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sdug bsngal skyed par @172b byed pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the cause of producing suffering.

original: de 'di la yang yod pas ci'i phyir mi 'jigs te /
analyzed: de 'di la yang yod pas ci'i phyir mi 'jigs te /
translated: Since that exists for this one also, why is one not afraid?

original: 'jigs par bya ba'o //
analyzed: 'jigs par bya ba'o //
translated: One should be afraid.

original: de la nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la nyes pa gzhan yang brjod pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to state another fault in that regard,

original: dman gang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dman gang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “What is inferior,” and so on.

original: dman pa ni nad pa yin la /🔽bkres pa ni bru ba tsha ba yin zhing /
analyzed: dman pa ni nad pa yin la / bkres pa ni bru ba tsha ba yin zhing /
translated: “ Inferior” is sick.🔽“ Hungry” is having a burning sensation.

original: skom pa ni ltung ba 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: skom pa ni ltung ba 'dod pa yin la /
translated: “ Thirsty” is desiring to fall.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni gos la sogs pa dang bral ba'o //
translated: The word “and so on” includes being without clothes and so on.

original: 'di rnams las gso ba'i cho ga ni spyir 'chos pa yin te /🔽nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i tha tshig gam /
analyzed: 'di rnams las gso ba'i cho ga ni spyir 'chos pa yin te / nye bar zhi bar byed pa'i tha tshig gam /
translated: The rite of healing these is generally a remedy,🔽the meaning of which is to pacify.

original: 'di dag gi phyir 'chos pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag gi phyir 'chos pa ste /
translated: Or, it is a remedy for these.

original: de gso bar byed 'dod pa des gang zhig na ba'i zas dang sman la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bya dang nya dang ri dags dag gsod par byed de srog dang bral bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: de gso bar byed 'dod pa des gang zhig na ba'i zas dang sman la sogs pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis bya dang nya dang ri dags dag gsod par byed de srog dang bral bar byed pa'o //
translated: The one who desires to heal that, by the sign of the sick person’s food, medicine, and so on, kills birds, fish, and deer, that is, deprives them of life.

original: mkhas pa su zhig lus de la //
analyzed: mkhas pa su zhig lus de la //
translated: that body?

original: 'dod cing zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to //🔽lam sgug par byed pas gnas te /
analyzed: 'dod cing zhes pa la sogs pa 'chad par 'gyur ba dang 'brel to // lam sgug par byed pas gnas te /
translated: The text continues with the words “and so on.”🔽They are thieves because they lie in wait for the opportunity to enter the path.

original: lam ma yin pa nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i rkun mo nyid la brjod de //
analyzed: lam ma yin pa nas 'jug par byed par 'gyur ba'i rkun mo nyid la brjod de //
translated: They are thieves because they enter by way of the wrong path.

original: gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog par byed do zhes pa'i tha tshig go //🔽de bzhin du pha dang ma yang ste de dag kyang bdag nyid kyi rnyed pa'i rgyu dang rim gro'i rgyus kyang gsod par byed de /
analyzed: gzhan gyi rdzas 'phrog par byed do zhes pa'i tha tshig go // de bzhin du pha dang ma yang ste de dag kyang bdag nyid kyi rnyed pa'i rgyu dang rim gro'i rgyus kyang gsod par byed de /
translated: They steal the property of others.🔽They kill their own parents, thinking, “If they die, I will have the cause of acquiring wealth and the cause of being honored.”

original: 'di dag gson pa'i don gyis rnyed pa'am bkur sti bdag gir gyur cig ces bsams nas gsod par byed do //🔽dkon mchog gsum gyis ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi yin te /
analyzed: 'di dag gson pa'i don gyis rnyed pa'am bkur sti bdag gir gyur cig ces bsams nas gsod par byed do // dkon mchog gsum gyis ni sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun gyi bdag nyid kyi yin te /
translated: They kill the Three Jewels, the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.🔽The Three Jewels are the Buddha, the Dharma, and the Saṅgha.

original: dkor ni nor yin la /
analyzed: dkor ni nor yin la /
translated: The property of the Three Jewels is their wealth.

original: brkus nas ni blangs nas so //🔽sngar brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dir yang /
analyzed: brkus nas ni blangs nas so // sngar brjod pa'i rgyu mtshan du 'dir yang /
translated: They steal it.

original: mkhas pa su zhig lus de la //
analyzed: mkhas pa su zhig lus de la //
translated: The text continues with the words “What wise person would desire that body?”

original: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes bya ba dang 'brel to //
translated: The verse is connected with that.

original: gang gis te pha bsad pa la sogs pa byas pas mnar med pa la sogs pa'i mes de'i las kyis skyes pa ste sreg par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang gis te pha bsad pa la sogs pa byas pas mnar med pa la sogs pa'i mes de'i las kyis skyes pa ste sreg par 'gyur te /
translated: By whom? By one who has committed patricide, etc.

original: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin la /
analyzed: 'di ni mtshon pa tsam yin la /
translated: This is merely an illustration;

original: de las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba'i bud shing gis kyang sreg go //🔽yang na dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku bar byed pa de rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dmyal ba'i bud shing gis kyang sreg go // yang na dkon mchog gsum gyi dkor rku bar byed pa de rab tu tsha ba la sogs pa'i sdug bsngal yin te /
translated: he is also burned by the fuel of the other hells.

original: mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mnar med pa'i sdug bsngal dang 'dra ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Or else, the suffering of the Tapana, etc. is the suffering of the Avici hell, because it is the suffering of the Avici hell.

original: 'di ltar nyes pa 'di mthong ba na mkhas pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar nyes pa 'di mthong ba na mkhas pa ste /
translated: Thus, seeing this fault, what wise person,

original: rig pa dang ldan pa su zhig gis de lta bu'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu bdag nyid 'dod cing de la dga' ba'o //
analyzed: rig pa dang ldan pa su zhig gis de lta bu'i sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu bdag nyid 'dod cing de la dga' ba'o //
translated: what intelligent person would desire such a self, the cause of all suffering, and delight in it?

original: @173a * // srung ba ste yongs su skyong ba dang mchod par byed pa ste rnyed pas mchod par byed /
analyzed: @173a * // srung ba ste yongs su skyong ba dang mchod par byed pa ste rnyed pas mchod par byed /
translated: He is protected, i.e., he is guarded, and he is worshipped, i.e., he is worshipped with gain.

original: 'di la dgra bzhin du lta bar mi byad de 'on kyang de bzhin du bde blag tu de lta bar rigs te /
analyzed: 'di la dgra bzhin du lta bar mi byad de 'on kyang de bzhin du bde blag tu de lta bar rigs te /
translated: One should not view it as an enemy, but rather it is proper to view it as a friend, since it is easy to do so.🔽

original: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes zur gyis ston pa yin no //
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir zhes zur gyis ston pa yin no //
translated: One should not view this as an enemy, but rather, it is proper to view it as such, i.e., as a friend, for it is the cause of all suffering.

original: 'di ltar spyo ba'i gnas la su zhig ste mkhas pa gang zhig brnyas par mi byed cing bsten par byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: 'di ltar spyo ba'i gnas la su zhig ste mkhas pa gang zhig brnyas par mi byed cing bsten par byed ces pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Thus, what wise person would not despise, i.e., would despise, the one who is the object of contempt?

original: de ltar bdag gi nyes ba brjod nas bdag dang gzhan gyi nyes pa dang yon tan rnams bstan par bzhed pas /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gi nyes ba brjod nas bdag dang gzhan gyi nyes pa dang yon tan rnams bstan par bzhed pas /
translated: Having thus stated the faults of the self, in order to teach the faults and virtues of self and others, he says:

original: gal te byin na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te byin na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If one gives, etc.

original: dngos po 'di la rnyed nas don dug nyer ba yang 'ongs par gyur pa na de la ci 'di sbyin pa'am 'on te spyad par bya zhes rnam par rtog pas nges par byed do //
analyzed: dngos po 'di la rnyed nas don dug nyer ba yang 'ongs par gyur pa na de la ci 'di sbyin pa'am 'on te spyad par bya zhes rnam par rtog pas nges par byed do //
translated: When one has obtained this thing, and the one who is to be benefited has come, one should determine, i.e., decide, by means of discursive thought, whether to give it or not.

original: gal te sbyin na de'i tshe ci zhig spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te sbyin na de'i tshe ci zhig spyad par bya ste /
translated: If one gives it, then what is there to be used?

original: gzhan gyis rnam pa thams cad du dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyis rnam pa thams cad du dbang du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because others are completely controlled by it.

original: de ltar na bdag gi don du ste rang gi bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan la rgyab kyis phyogs pas 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro bar gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag gi don du ste rang gi bde ba bsgrub pa'i phyir gzhan la rgyab kyis phyogs pas 'jug par 'dod pa rnams kyi 'gro bar gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, it is said that those who are engaged in their own aim, who are intent on achieving their own happiness, turn their back on others,

original: ser sna gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro //🔽'di las bzlog pa gsungs pa ni gal te zhes pa ste /
analyzed: ser sna gtso bor gyur pa'i phyir ro // 'di las bzlog pa gsungs pa ni gal te zhes pa ste /
translated: because of the predominance of stinginess.🔽The opposite of this is stated in the verse: “If you practice generosity, what will you give?”

original: 'on te gal te spyad na 'on ci zhig sbyin par bya ste de'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba'i sgra'o //
analyzed: 'on te gal te spyad na 'on ci zhig sbyin par bya ste de'i dus la ltos nas da ltar byung ba'i sgra'o //
translated: The present tense of the verb “give” is used with reference to the time of the practice.

original: de'i phyir 'di ltar rang don la ltos pa med pa gzhan gyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i ched du zhugs pa rnams lha'i rgyal po ste lha'i dbang phyug go //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ltar rang don la ltos pa med pa gzhan gyi bde ba bsgrub pa'i ched du zhugs pa rnams lha'i rgyal po ste lha'i dbang phyug go //
translated: Therefore, those who are engaged in achieving the happiness of others without regard to their own aim are the kings of gods, the lords of the gods.

original: de ltar gzhan la phan pa dang mi phan pa dag brjod nas gzhan dang bdag gi gnod pa dang phan pa dag gi skyon dang yon tan rnams ji ltar srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar gzhan la phan pa dang mi phan pa dag brjod nas gzhan dang bdag gi gnod pa dang phan pa dag gi skyon dang yon tan rnams ji ltar srid pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Having thus described benefit and harm to others, in order to show the faults and virtues of harm and benefit to others and oneself, as they occur,

original: bdag phyir zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag phyir zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “For one’s own sake,” and so on.

original: bdag gi bde ba yid la byed bas lus dang ngag gi chad pa rnams kyis gzhan la gnod par byas nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan 'gro rnams su sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba yid la byed bas lus dang ngag gi chad pa rnams kyis gzhan la gnod par byas nas dmyal ba la sogs pa'i ngan 'gro rnams su sdug bsngal myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: For one’s own sake, one should not harm others with the punishments of body and speech, because by taking one’s own happiness to heart, one will experience suffering in the miserable realms of hell and so on.

original: bzlog pas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro //🔽bdag dang gzhan la sems tsam gyis kyang phan pa dang gnod par byed par 'dod pa las yon tan dang skyon gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bzlog pas ni 'jig rten pa dang 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs par 'gyur ro // bdag dang gzhan la sems tsam gyis kyang phan pa dang gnod par byed par 'dod pa las yon tan dang skyon gang yin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: By the opposite, one will have mundane and supramundane excellence.

original: bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag nyid ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to show what the virtues and faults are of wishing to benefit and harm others with just the mind, he says, “One’s own mind,” and so on.

original: mtho ba ni lang tsho dang gzugs dang nor la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan las mchog yin no zhes mngon par nga rgyal ba gang zhig de rnams nyid mtho bar 'dod cing gzhan la ste pha rol la spo ba ste 'pho bar byas na sngar gyi las bzlog🔽par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtho ba ni lang tsho dang gzugs dang nor la sogs pa rnams kyis gzhan las mchog yin no zhes mngon par nga rgyal ba gang zhig de rnams nyid mtho bar 'dod cing gzhan la ste pha rol la spo ba ste 'pho bar byas na sngar gyi las bzlog par 'gyur ro //
translated: If one transfers that very pride to others, to the opponent, then one reverses the previous action.

original: bdag dang gzhan @173b la ngag tsam du yang bde ba'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan @173b la ngag tsam du yang bde ba'i rgyu ma yin pa nyid po zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach that one's own and others' happiness is not just words,

original: bdag gi don du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi don du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, for the sake of my own, etc.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag gi dngos po mi sdug pa la sogs pa dang rje dpon nyid la sogs pa zhes pa 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras rigs la sogs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni bdag gi dngos po mi sdug pa la sogs pa dang rje dpon nyid la sogs pa zhes pa 'dir yang sogs pa'i sgras rigs la sogs pa dang / gzugs bzang ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The word etc. includes my own ugly body, my own master, and so on. Here the word etc. includes my own caste, my own good looks, and so on.

original: da ni brjod pa'i don nyid bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni brjod pa'i don nyid bsdus nas bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the meaning of the expression,

original: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, the world, etc.

original: bdag bde bar 'dod pas kyang de ltar bsgrub pa thams cad bya ba ma yin pa la yang bya ba nyid du zhen par byed do //
analyzed: bdag bde bar 'dod pas kyang de ltar bsgrub pa thams cad bya ba ma yin pa la yang bya ba nyid du zhen par byed do //
translated: Even one who desires his own happiness should not do that, and he should not cling to what is not to be done as being just what is to be done.

original: de'i phyir de'i las kyi sgrib pa las 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'dod pa'i las las byung ba'i sdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i las kyi sgrib pa las 'jig rten pha rol du mi 'dod pa'i las las byung ba'i sdug bsngal skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, from the obscuration of his karma, suffering arises from the karma of not desiring the other world.

original: bde ba zhes te bde ba dang 'brel pa yin la /
analyzed: bde ba zhes te bde ba dang 'brel pa yin la /
translated: The word happiness is connected with happiness.

original: gzhan bde 'dod ces pa ni pha rol po rnams la phan pa dang bde ba la sbyar ba'i ched du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan bde 'dod ces pa ni pha rol po rnams la phan pa dang bde ba la sbyar ba'i ched du bsgrubs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The word desiring the happiness of others is established because of being applied to the benefit and happiness of others.

original: da ni bstan pa'i don nyid dpes mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir /🔽mang du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da ni bstan pa'i don nyid dpes mdor bsdus te bstan pa'i sgo nas bstan par bya ba'i phyir / mang du zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Now, in order to teach by way of a brief summary of the meaning of the teaching through an example,🔽he says,

original: rgyas pas bshad pa ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: rgyas pas bshad pa ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Many words? What is the use of an extensive explanation?🔽Here, by way of a brief summary, the example should be understood as being clearly stated.

original: 'di nyid 'dir mdor bsdus pas gsal bar dper brjod pa rtogs par byas pa la bdag la gzhan du brje ba la 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di nyid 'dir mdor bsdus pas gsal bar dper brjod pa rtogs par byas pa la bdag la gzhan du brje ba la 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should strive to exchange oneself for others.

original: 'di ltar yang so so'i skye bo bdag nyid kyi dgos pa la zhugs pa'i yid can dang thub pa ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang so so'i skye bo bdag nyid kyi dgos pa la zhugs pa'i yid can dang thub pa ste /
translated: Thus, the difference between the mind of the ordinary person who is engaged in his own purpose and the Sage,🔽the Lord Buddha, who is engaged in the purpose of others, should be seen as distinct and should be understood.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don du gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i khyad par 'di bye brag tu ltos la nges par zung shig / ci ltar lung las dpe yod pa yin par bstan pa de ltar 'di rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das gzhan gyi don du gzhan dbang du gyur pa'i khyad par 'di bye brag tu ltos la nges par zung shig / ci ltar lung las dpe yod pa yin par bstan pa de ltar 'di rtogs par bya ste /
translated: Just as it is taught in the scriptures that there is an example, so it should be understood.

original: de'i las bzlog pa la sems dang ldan pas kyang ci'i phyir yang spro ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i las bzlog pa la sems dang ldan pas kyang ci'i phyir yang spro ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: How is it that the one who is endowed with mind would not be enthusiastic about the opposite of that?

original: de ltar na yang sangs rgyas don du gnyer ba'i gal te lam 'di nyid yin na yang /
analyzed: de ltar na yang sangs rgyas don du gnyer ba'i gal te lam 'di nyid yin na yang /
translated: Thus, if this is the very path for the one who is intent on Buddhahood,

original: gang rnams 'khor ba'i bde ba tsam 'dod pa de rnams la de ji ltar bde ba'i lam yin zhe na /
analyzed: gang rnams 'khor ba'i bde ba tsam 'dod pa de rnams la de ji ltar bde ba'i lam yin zhe na /
translated: how is it that for those who desire only the happiness of cyclic existence, it is a path to happiness?

original: bdag bde zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag bde zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “my happiness,” and so on.

original: sangs rgyas nyid de byang chub bsgrub par bya ba ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid de byang chub bsgrub par bya ba ste /
translated: Buddhahood is to be accomplished, that is, attained.

original: rdzogs par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i lam blang bar bya ba yin te /
analyzed: rdzogs par bya ba ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i lam blang bar bya ba yin te /
translated: The perfection is the path of exchanging self and other, which is to be taken up.

original: skyes bu mchog gi don yin pas so //
analyzed: skyes bu mchog gi don yin pas so //
translated: Because it is the aim of the highest person.

original: 'di 'ba' zhig bdag dang gzhan du brje ba med par mi 'grub pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di 'ba' zhig bdag dang gzhan du brje ba med par mi 'grub pa yin la /
translated: This alone is not accomplished without the exchange of self and other.

original: @174a * // 'khor ba na yang lha dang mi dag gi bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de ji ltar 'gyur ba yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: @174a * // 'khor ba na yang lha dang mi dag gi bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i mtshan nyid de ji ltar 'gyur ba yin te ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: And how could there be the perfection of happiness of gods and humans in cyclic existence? There could not be!

original: gang gis mi 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gang gis mi 'gyur zhe na /
translated: By what means could there not be?

original: bdag bde ba zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag bde ba zhes gsungs te /
translated: By the happiness of self, he says.

original: bdag gi bde ba dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal brje bar nges par ma byas pa'i'o //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba dang gzhan gyi sdug bsngal brje bar nges par ma byas pa'i'o //
translated: If one does not definitely exchange one's own happiness for the suffering of others,

original: bdag gi bde ba gzhan gyi yin pa dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gi yin no zhes 'pho bar ma byas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag gi bde ba gzhan gyi yin pa dang / gzhan gyi sdug bsngal bdag gi yin no zhes 'pho bar ma byas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: one does not exchange one's own happiness for the suffering of others, one does not exchange one's own happiness for the suffering of others, one does not exchange one's own happiness for the suffering of others, one does not exchange one's own happiness for the suffering of others.

original: ji ltar gal te byin na ci spyad ces //
analyzed: ji ltar gal te byin na ci spyad ces //
translated: How is it that if one gives, one will have nothing to enjoy?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: and so on.

original: gzhan yang bde ba gzhan yang skye ba 'di nyid la gzhan la phan btags pa med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: gzhan yang bde ba gzhan yang skye ba 'di nyid la gzhan la phan btags pa med par mi 'byung ngo zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'jig rten pha rol zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Furthermore, in order to demonstrate that happiness does not arise without benefiting others in this very life, he says “in the next world” and so on.

original: gang 'jig rten pha rol du gzhan la phan pa btags pa med par bde bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di re zhig gzhag ste ni re zhig de ltar gyur kyang ste /
analyzed: gang 'jig rten pha rol du gzhan la phan pa btags pa med par bde bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bya ba 'di re zhig gzhag ste ni re zhig de ltar gyur kyang ste /
translated: One might say, “Let us set aside for the time being the fact that in the next world one will not be happy without benefiting others.

original: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de ni shin tu lkog tu gyur pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Even if that were the case, that is very obscure.”

original: gang yang skye ba 'di nyid la mthong ba ste grub pa'i don yin la mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid mi grub ste mi rdzogs la /
analyzed: gang yang skye ba 'di nyid la mthong ba ste grub pa'i don yin la mngon par 'dod pa'i bsgrub bya'i mtshan nyid mi grub ste mi rdzogs la /
translated: In this very life, one does not accomplish the desired object, the characteristic of the probandum, and it is not completed.

original: der log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ce zhig brjod par bya /
analyzed: der log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir ce zhig brjod par bya /
translated: Since there is no misconception there, why say anything?

original: gang gis mi 'grub ce na /
analyzed: gang gis mi 'grub ce na /
translated: By what is it not accomplished?

original: bran g-yog ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: bran g-yog ces pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: He says “slaves” and so on.

original: rje dpon ni bdag po yin la bran g-yog ni las kyi 'bras bu len pa bran gyis rjes su 'tsho ba yin te /
analyzed: rje dpon ni bdag po yin la bran g-yog ni las kyi 'bras bu len pa bran gyis rjes su 'tsho ba yin te /
translated: The master is the owner, and the servant is the one who receives the fruit of the action, the servant who lives by the master's work.

original: de'i las ma byas pa na gnyi ga yang mthong ba'i chos la mi 'grub par de mthong ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i las ma byas pa na gnyi ga yang mthong ba'i chos la mi 'grub par de mthong ba nyid do //
translated: When that action is not done, both of them are not successful in this life, and that is seen.

original: de yang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du de'i bsgrub par bya ba bsnyen bkur gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang de las byung ba'i zas dang gos la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de yang go rims ji lta ba bzhin du de'i bsgrub par bya ba bsnyen bkur gyi bde ba la sogs pa dang de las byung ba'i zas dang gos la sogs pa yin no //
translated: And that is, in order, the accomplishment of the master's happiness of service, etc., and the food, clothing, etc. that come from that.

original: 'di ltar shes kyang bdag dang gzhan la yod pa'i spyod pa phyin ci log ni rmongs pa'i mthu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di ltar shes kyang bdag dang gzhan la yod pa'i spyod pa phyin ci log ni rmongs pa'i mthu yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In this way, even though it is known, the error in the conduct that exists for oneself and others is the power of delusion.🔽In order to teach that, he says,

original: mthong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mthong dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: seeing and so forth.

original: phan tshun bde ba skyed pa ni bde bsgrub par byed do //
analyzed: phan tshun bde ba skyed pa ni bde bsgrub par byed do //
translated: The mutual production of happiness is the accomplishment of happiness.

original: ci lta bur gyur ba zhig ce na /
analyzed: ci lta bur gyur ba zhig ce na /
translated: What is it like?

original: mthong dang ma mthong bde 'grub pa ste /
analyzed: mthong dang ma mthong bde 'grub pa ste /
translated: The accomplishment of happiness is seen and unseen.

original: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i 'jig rten du bde ba 'grub pa ste chen po nyid yin la /🔽bde ba'i dga' ston gyi dga' ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: mthong ba dang ma mthong ba'i 'jig rten du bde ba 'grub pa ste chen po nyid yin la / bde ba'i dga' ston gyi dga' ba gang la yod pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.

original: de bor nas phan tshun du mi 'dod pa byas pas sdug bsngal ba'i phyir @174b sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa yin pas sdug bsngal len cing 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: de bor nas phan tshun du mi 'dod pa byas pas sdug bsngal ba'i phyir @174b sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa yin pas sdug bsngal len cing 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.

original: mi bzad pas ni dmyal ba la sogs par byas pa'i shin tu 'jigs su rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //🔽rmongs pa zhes pa ni smad pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bzad pas ni dmyal ba la sogs par byas pa'i shin tu 'jigs su rung ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro // rmongs pa zhes pa ni smad pa yin te /
translated: It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.🔽It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.

original: rmongs pa'i dbang gis phan pa dang mi phan pa ma mthong ba yin la /
analyzed: rmongs pa'i dbang gis phan pa dang mi phan pa ma mthong ba yin la /
translated: It is the great one because it is the cause of the attainment of happiness in the seen and unseen worlds.

original: yang na rmongs pa zhes pa ni 'dir gtan tshogs kyi tshig yin no //🔽gang gi phyir rmongs pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams phyir ci log gi 'jug pa yin te /
analyzed: yang na rmongs pa zhes pa ni 'dir gtan tshogs kyi tshig yin no //🔽gang gi phyir rmongs pa yin pa de'i phyir 'di rnams phyir ci log gi 'jug pa yin te /
translated: It is the great one because

original: de ltar na rmongs pa 'di nyid sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan bcos mdzad pas snying brtse bar mdzad do //
analyzed: de ltar na rmongs pa 'di nyid sems can rnams la gnod par byed pa yin no zhes bstan bcos mdzad pas snying brtse bar mdzad do //
translated: Thus, the author of the treatise, out of compassion, teaches that this very delusion harms sentient beings.

original: 'di yid la byas pas kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'di yid la byas pas kyang bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pa mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to show that one should not cling to the conception of self by keeping this in mind,

original: 'jig rten dag na nyer gnod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la nye bar gnod pa ni yid mi bde ba'i rgyu gnod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'jig rten dag na nyer gnod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la nye bar gnod pa ni yid mi bde ba'i rgyu gnod pa yin no //
translated: he says, “In the world, harm, etc.” Harm is the cause of mental unhappiness.

original: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni lus kyi tshor ba rnams so //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba rnams ni lus kyi tshor ba rnams so //
translated: Sufferings are bodily feelings.

original: 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams la skrag pa'o //
analyzed: 'jigs pa ni sdug bsngal gyi rgyu rnams la skrag pa'o //
translated: Fear is the dread of the causes of suffering.

original: 'di thams cad kyi rgyu ni bdag tu 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad kyi rgyu ni bdag tu 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: The cause of all this is the conception of self.

original: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su bzung ba 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de ltar yin pa de bas na sdug bsngal gyi rgyu yongs su bzung ba 'dis ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Since this is so, what is the use of this appropriation, which is the cause of suffering?

original: dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: It has no purpose at all.

original: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yod na sdug bsngal la ldog pa med do zhes 'jig rten dag na zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa ni sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de yod na sdug bsngal la ldog pa med do zhes 'jig rten dag na zhes pa la sogs pa smos te /
translated: Thus, since the apprehension of a self is the cause of all suffering, if it exists, there is no escape from suffering.

original: bdag ni bdag tu 'dzin pa yin la bdag yongs su dor ba 'di nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su dor ba yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni bdag tu 'dzin pa yin la bdag yongs su dor ba 'di nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su dor ba yin no //
translated: The self is the apprehension of a self, and the relinquishment of the self is the relinquishment of the apprehension of a self.

original: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su ma dor ba de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: de ltar na bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su ma dor ba de nyid bdag tu 'dzin pa gang yin pa nyid do //
translated: Thus, the very apprehension of a self that has not been relinquished is the very apprehension of a self that has not been relinquished.

original: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su mdor na sdug bsngal ldog pa med do zhes rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa yongs su mdor na sdug bsngal ldog pa med do zhes rig par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it should be understood that as long as the apprehension of a self has not been relinquished, there is no escape from suffering.

original: 'dir rjes mthun pa'i dpe ji ltar me ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dir rjes mthun pa'i dpe ji ltar me ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Here, the example that is consistent with this is stated in the lines beginning “Just as, for example, as long as one does not relinquish fire.”

original: gang zhig sreg pa mi 'dod cing me yongs su ma dor na de'i sreg pa ldog par yang mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gang zhig sreg pa mi 'dod cing me yongs su ma dor na de'i sreg pa ldog par yang mi 'gyur te /
translated: As long as one does not relinquish fire, one cannot escape being burned,

original: rgyu la nus pa de yod na 'bras bum skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu la nus pa de yod na 'bras bum skye bar rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not logical that an effect would not arise when the cause is present.

original: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin la nyams par thal ba'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //🔽de'i phyir sdug bsngal ldog par @175a * //
analyzed: de'i 'bras bu nyid yin la nyams par thal ba'i phyir dang / rnam pa thams cad mi skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir ro // de'i phyir sdug bsngal ldog par @175a * //
translated: Because it would follow that the result would be lost, and because it would follow that nothing would arise at all.🔽Therefore,

original: 'dod pas bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'dod pas bdag tu 'dzin par mi bya'o //
translated: one who wishes to stop suffering should not grasp at a self.

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa skabs su bab pa mjug sdud pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa skabs su bab pa mjug sdud pa ste /
translated: The conclusion that is relevant here is stated in the following:

original: gang gi phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag la sdug bsngal thams cad skyed par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag tu 'dzin pa 'di ni bdag la sdug bsngal thams cad skyed par byed pa yin la /
translated: Since this grasping at a self produces all suffering for oneself

original: gzhan la yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de lta bas na bdag nyid gzhan la gtang bya ste /🔽bdag la gzhan nyid du gzung bar bya ste bdag nyid gzhan yin la /
analyzed: gzhan la yang sdug bsngal skyed par byed pa de lta bas na bdag nyid gzhan la gtang bya ste / bdag la gzhan nyid du gzung bar bya ste bdag nyid gzhan yin la /
translated: and also produces suffering for others, one should give oneself to others.🔽One should hold others as oneself, for others are oneself and oneself is not another.

original: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa'am /
analyzed: gzhan ni ma yin no zhes pa'am /
translated: Or else, one should hold others as oneself, and oneself as others, for oneself is not another.

original: gzhan gyi dbang du bya'o zhes te de brten pa lhur byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dbang du bya'o zhes te de brten pa lhur byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: One should be governed by others, because one is devoted to them.

original: de bzhin du gzhan pha rol po gzung bar bya ba ni khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan pha rol po gzung bar bya ba ni khas blang bar bya ba yin la /
translated: In the same way, one should hold others as oneself, that is, one should accept them.

original: bdag bzhin du gzhan la bdag gi dngos por gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: bdag bzhin du gzhan la bdag gi dngos por gzung bar bya ste /
translated: One should hold others as one holds oneself.

original: 'di nyid bdag yin la bdag ni bdag ma yin no zhes so //
analyzed: 'di nyid bdag yin la bdag ni bdag ma yin no zhes so //
translated: This very person is the self, and the self is not the self.

original: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni 'dir bsdus pa'i don yin te /
translated: This is the condensed meaning here.

original: ji ltar sngar yongs su ma shes pas bdag la yongs su ngal bas phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i phyir spyad la /
analyzed: ji ltar sngar yongs su ma shes pas bdag la yongs su ngal bas phan pa dang bde ba skyed pa'i phyir spyad la /
translated: Just as one previously engaged in the practice of self-mortification for the sake of the self, not fully understanding,

original: da ni gzhan rnams dang bdag gi lus yongs su brje ba spyad par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni gzhan rnams dang bdag gi lus yongs su brje ba spyad par bya ste /
translated: now one should engage in the practice of exchanging oneself for others.

original: dper na gzhan la sngar spyad pa de bzhin du bdag la gzhan nyid du brjes pas na spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dper na gzhan la sngar spyad pa de bzhin du bdag la gzhan nyid du brjes pas na spyad par bya'o //
translated: Just as one previously engaged in the practice for the sake of another, so now one should engage in the practice for the sake of oneself, having switched to oneself the practice for another.

original: ci ste ci ltar bdag med pas bdag la bdag nyid 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang yin te /
analyzed: ci ste ci ltar bdag med pas bdag la bdag nyid 'khrul pa yin pa de bzhin du gzhan la yang yin te /
translated: But if one asks, “Just as the self is deluded with respect to the self because of non-self, so also is it with respect to another,

original: de la yang de med pa'i phyir de la ji ltar na 'khrul par khyad par med pa la 'bras bu la khyad par yod ce na /
analyzed: de la yang de med pa'i phyir de la ji ltar na 'khrul par khyad par med pa la 'bras bu la khyad par yod ce na /
translated: and since it is the same in both cases, why is there a difference in the result, when there is no difference in the delusion?”

original: 'khrul par khyad par med pa la yang 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
analyzed: 'khrul par khyad par med pa la yang 'bras bu'i khyad par mthong ba ma yin nam /
translated: But isn’t it seen that there is a difference in the effects even though there is no difference in the error?

original: dper na mar me'i 'od la nor bu zhes zhen pas de'i yul du phyin pa na nor bu dang phrad pa med la /
analyzed: dper na mar me'i 'od la nor bu zhes zhen pas de'i yul du phyin pa na nor bu dang phrad pa med la /
translated: For example, when one thinks that the light of a lamp is a jewel, and goes to the place where it is, one does not find a jewel there.

original: yang gzhan du nor bu'i 'od la nor bu mthong ngo zhes yid la byas nas de'i yul du phyin pas nor bu dang phrad par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gzhan du nor bu'i 'od la nor bu mthong ngo zhes yid la byas nas de'i yul du phyin pas nor bu dang phrad par 'gyur te /
translated: But when one thinks that the light of a jewel is a jewel, and goes to the place where it is, one finds a jewel there.

original: de la gnyi ga la yang 'khrul ba zhes pa yod de 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'bras bu la khyad par yod pa yin no //
analyzed: de la gnyi ga la yang 'khrul ba zhes pa yod de 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'bras bu la khyad par yod pa yin no //
translated: In both cases, there is the error called “error,” and there is no difference in the error, but there is a difference in the effect.

original: de ltar yang /🔽mar me nor bu'i 'od dag la //
analyzed: de ltar yang / mar me nor bu'i 'od dag la //
translated: As it is said:🔽The light of a lamp and the light of a jewel,

original: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
analyzed: nor bu blo yis mngon rgyug pa //
translated: the mind apprehends them as a jewel.

original: log pa'i shes par khyad med par ;
analyzed: log pa'i shes par khyad med par ;
translated: There is no difference in the erroneous cognition,

original: / ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
analyzed: / ji ltar don byed la khyad yod //
translated: but there is a difference in their efficacy.

original: ces gang brjod pa'o //
analyzed: ces gang brjod pa'o //
translated: This is what is said.

original: de ltar na yang ji srid du gang bu brgyud pa yod pa de srid du shes pa dngos po dang 'brel pa yod pa der thob pa yod la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang ji srid du gang bu brgyud pa yod pa de srid du shes pa dngos po dang 'brel pa yod pa der thob pa yod la /
translated: But as long as there is a series of pots, there is contact between consciousness and things, and thus there is obtainment.🔽But where there is no contact between consciousness and things, even indirectly, there is no obtainment.

original: gang du shes pa dang dngos po la brgyud pas kyang 'brel pa med pa na der thob pa yod pa ma yin la thob par @175b bya bar thob par byas pa'i khyad par yod pa ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: gang du shes pa dang dngos po la brgyud pas kyang 'brel pa med pa na der thob pa yod pa ma yin la thob par @175b bya bar thob par byas pa'i khyad par yod pa ni rigs pa nyid yin te /
translated: And it is logical that there is a difference between that which has been obtained and that which is to be obtained.

original: 'dir yang de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir yang de bzhin du yod pa ma yin te /
translated: But this is not so in the case of the past and future.

original: gnyi ga la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir la /
analyzed: gnyi ga la yang khyad par med pa'i phyir la /
translated: There is no difference between them.

original: de ltar na 'di ni dpe dang mi mthun pa yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di ni dpe dang mi mthun pa yin no zhe na /
translated: In that case, this example is not similar.

original: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ni rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: That is illogical.

original: 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'bras bu la khyad par mthong ste /
analyzed: 'khrul par khyad par med kyang 'bras bu la khyad par mthong ste /
translated: Even though there is no difference in error, a difference is seen in the result.

original: 'di tsam gyi khyad par gyis dper brjod pa dang mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di tsam gyi khyad par gyis dper brjod pa dang mthun pa yin te /
translated: This small difference makes the example similar.

original: gang 'khrul la de thams cad la 'bras bu thun mong ba ma yin no zhes khyab pa dran pa tsam 'dir mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
analyzed: gang 'khrul la de thams cad la 'bras bu thun mong ba ma yin no zhes khyab pa dran pa tsam 'dir mngon par 'dod pa yin no //
translated: But it is not the case that all errors are equally common.

original: dpe'i chos dang thams cad du mthun par ni sbyar bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: dpe'i chos dang thams cad du mthun par ni sbyar bar bya ba yang ma yin no //
translated: Nor is it the case that all examples are equally appropriate.

original: de la gal te dpe dang mthun pa ma yin pa de lta na yang ci ltar yang dpe dang mthun par yod pas nyis pa med do //
analyzed: de la gal te dpe dang mthun pa ma yin pa de lta na yang ci ltar yang dpe dang mthun par yod pas nyis pa med do //
translated: Even if the example is not appropriate, since it is still an example, there is no fault.

original: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o //
analyzed: shin tu lkog tu gyur pa'i don la rtogs pa dang ldan pa rnams bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' nyid kyis 'jug par bya'o //
translated: Those who are knowledgeable about extremely hidden objects should be guided by the scriptures of the Bhagavān himself.

original: de ltar 'dir 'khrul pa khyad par med kyang de lta bu'i 'bras bu bsgrubs pa la nus pa yod la /
analyzed: de ltar 'dir 'khrul pa khyad par med kyang de lta bu'i 'bras bu bsgrubs pa la nus pa yod la /
translated: Thus, although error is not distinguished here, it is possible to establish such effects.

original: 'ga' zhig gi yin gyi thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni lung nyid kyis rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'ga' zhig gi yin gyi thams cad kyi ma yin no zhes bya ba de ni lung nyid kyis rtogs par bya ste /
translated: That some, but not all, is to be understood from the scriptures themselves.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir yang ngo //
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba bsam gyis mi khyab pa'i phyir yang ngo //
translated: Also, because dependent origination is inconceivable.

original: ji ltar yang gzhan gyi don med par rang gi don kyang mi 'grub ste /🔽de ltar / bran g-yog las byed mi btub la //
analyzed: ji ltar yang gzhan gyi don med par rang gi don kyang mi 'grub ste / de ltar / bran g-yog las byed mi btub la //
translated: In any case, one’s own aim is not accomplished without the aim of others.🔽Thus, it is shown in the present life by such passages as:🔽“The servant who is not skilled in his work,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i chos kyi cung zad bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pas mthong ba'i chos kyi cung zad bstan pa yin no //
translated: and so on.

original: 'dir kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa la ni cung zad kyang 'khrul ba yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dir kun rdzob tu rgyu dang 'bras bu yod pa la ni cung zad kyang 'khrul ba yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Here, there is not the slightest error in the existence of cause and effect in the conventional,

original: de ltar log pa'i kun rdzob tu byas pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de ltar log pa'i kun rdzob tu byas pa dang khyad par yod pa ma yin no //
translated: and thus there is no difference between the correct and the incorrect conventional.

original: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad kyi tha snyad ni 'khrul pa nyid yin te /🔽phyi rol gyi don la brten pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa thams cad 'khrul ba yin //
analyzed: rnal 'byor spyod pa'i gzhung gis kyang rgyu dang 'bras bu thams cad kyi tha snyad ni 'khrul pa nyid yin te / phyi rol gyi don la brten pa'i phyir dang / dmigs pa thams cad 'khrul ba yin //
translated: Also, according to the Yogacara scriptures, all conventions of cause and effect are just error,🔽because they are based on external objects, and because of the passage:

original: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: “All objectifications are error.

original: de'i phyir 'khrul pa khyad par med kyang rgyu mtshan la khyad par yod pas thams cad 'tsham mo //
analyzed: de'i phyir 'khrul pa khyad par med kyang rgyu mtshan la khyad par yod pas thams cad 'tsham mo //
translated: Therefore, although there is no difference in error, everything is appropriate because there is a difference in the reasons.

original: de ltar na mthar thug pa'i bsam pas bskul nas rang gi sems bya ba de nyid la sbyar bar bya'o zhes /
analyzed: de ltar na mthar thug pa'i bsam pas bskul nas rang gi sems bya ba de nyid la sbyar bar bya'o zhes /
translated: Thus, having been urged by the ultimate thought, one should apply one's mind to that very action.

original: bdag ni gzhan gyi dbang gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ni gzhan gyi dbang gyur zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, he says, I am subject to others, and so forth.

original: yid khyod nges par zhes pa ni 'dir the tshom dang phyin ci log tu mi bya'o zhes pa yin te /🔽'di nas bzung nas khyod kyis sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa @176a * //
analyzed: yid khyod nges par zhes pa ni 'dir the tshom dang phyin ci log tu mi bya'o zhes pa yin te / 'di nas bzung nas khyod kyis sems can thams cad kyi dgos pa @176a * //
translated: Here, you, mind, must definitely means that one should not be doubtful or mistaken.

original: las ma gtogs par rang gzhan de rang gi dgos pa la sogs pa bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: las ma gtogs par rang gzhan de rang gi dgos pa la sogs pa bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: From here on, one should not think about one's own purpose, and so forth, except for the purpose of all sentient beings.

original: yid kyis kyang mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yid kyis kyang mi bya zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should not do it even mentally.

original: ci'i phyir yang rang gi dgos pa yang bsam par mi bya zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang rang gi dgos pa yang bsam par mi bya zhe na /
translated: Why should one not even think about one's own purpose?

original: gzhan ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzhan ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, Others, and so forth.

original: rang gi don ni rang gi dgos pa'o //
analyzed: rang gi don ni rang gi dgos pa'o //
translated: One's own purpose is one's own aim.

original: mig ste lta bar byed pa dang sogs pa'i sgras nyan pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
analyzed: mig ste lta bar byed pa dang sogs pa'i sgras nyan pa la sogs pa yang yin no //
translated: The eye is the seer, and the words and so forth include the hearer, and so on.

original: de'i ste gzhan gyi yin la mig la sogs pas rna ba la sogs pa gzhan yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: de'i ste gzhan gyi yin la mig la sogs pas rna ba la sogs pa gzhan yang gzung ngo //
translated: The other’s, i.e., the other sentient beings’ eyes, etc., are to be grasped as the ears, etc.

original: lag pa la sogs pa zhes pa 'dir yang rkang pa la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: lag pa la sogs pa zhes pa 'dir yang rkang pa la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: Here, the hands, etc., are to be grasped as the feet, etc.

original: gang gis gzhan dang 'brel par khyed kyis nges pa na rgyu de nyid kyis sems can gtso bor byas te /
analyzed: gang gis gzhan dang 'brel par khyed kyis nges pa na rgyu de nyid kyis sems can gtso bor byas te /
translated: When you are certain that they are connected with the other, then, for that very reason, you should make sentient beings primary,

original: sems can gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas de'i dgos pa la zhugs pa'i zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sems can gzhan gyi dbang du byas nas de'i dgos pa la zhugs pa'i zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: and, taking the other sentient beings as your standard, you should apply yourself to their welfare.

original: bdag gi lus la zhes pa ni de la rten par gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: bdag gi lus la zhes pa ni de la rten par gyur pa yin te /
translated: “To my body” means that it is to be relied upon.

original: gang dang gang gos la sogs pa bde ba'i yo byad mthong zhing rtogs pa de dang de zhes zlos pa'i tshig gis khyad par gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang dang gang gos la sogs pa bde ba'i yo byad mthong zhing rtogs pa de dang de zhes zlos pa'i tshig gis khyad par gsungs pa yin te /
translated: “Whatever” is a reiterative particle, which indicates a particular.

original: thams cad nyid yin la cung zad tsam ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: thams cad nyid yin la cung zad tsam ni ma yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that it is all of them, and not just a few.

original: rang gi lus las phrogs shing phral nas phan zhing 'dod pa'i dngos po sbyar ro //
analyzed: rang gi lus las phrogs shing phral nas phan zhing 'dod pa'i dngos po sbyar ro //
translated: Having taken it away from your body, you should apply it to the things that are desired and helpful.

original: da ni dman pa la sogs pa rnams la nga rgyal la sogs pa'i sems kyi sdig pa bsal bar bskyed nas /
analyzed: da ni dman pa la sogs pa rnams la nga rgyal la sogs pa'i sems kyi sdig pa bsal bar bskyed nas /
translated: Now, having generated the mental sins of pride and so forth in regard to the inferior and so forth,

original: dman sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: dman sogs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he speaks of the inferior and so forth.

original: dman pa la ltos nas nga rgyal dang / mnyam pa la ltos nas 'gran pa dang / mchog la ltos nas phrag dog skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni byis pa'i chos yin te /
analyzed: dman pa la ltos nas nga rgyal dang / mnyam pa la ltos nas 'gran pa dang / mchog la ltos nas phrag dog skye bar 'gyur ba 'di ni byis pa'i chos yin te /
translated: This is the Dharma of the childish, that pride arises in regard to the inferior, rivalry in regard to the equal, and envy in regard to the superior.

original: gang sngar / mtho la phrag dog mnyam la 'gran //
analyzed: gang sngar / mtho la phrag dog mnyam la 'gran //
translated: This is what was said earlier: “Envious of the high, rivaling the equal,

original: zhes gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa'o //
translated: and so forth.

original: 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin yang bdag dang gzhan du brjes pas rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid du sgyur bar byed do //
analyzed: 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa'i rgyu yin yang bdag dang gzhan du brjes pas rnam par byang ba'i rgyu nyid du sgyur bar byed do //
translated: Although all of these are causes of afflictions, by exchanging oneself for others, they are transformed into causes of purification.

original: de ltar na 'di nyid rnam rtog med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'di nyid rnam rtog med pa'i zhes pa la sogs pas brjod par bya ste /
translated: Thus, this very [exchanging] is expressed by “without conceptualization” and so forth.

original: rnam rtog med pa zhes pa ni the tshom med pas so //
analyzed: rnam rtog med pa zhes pa ni the tshom med pas so //
translated: “Without conceptualization” means without doubt.

original: bsgom par bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
analyzed: bsgom par bya ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis so //
translated: “Cultivated” means in the manner to be explained.

original: phrag dog bsgom pa de nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung gis ston pa ni /
analyzed: phrag dog bsgom pa de nyid 'chad par 'gyur ba'i gzhung gis ston pa ni /
translated: The text that will be explained teaches the cultivation of envy.

original: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa yin te /
translated: It is stated:

original: tshul khrims dang yon tan la sogs pas bdag tu mtho ba dang gzhan ni de @176b dang bral bas dma' ba nyid du mthong bar byas pas /
analyzed: tshul khrims dang yon tan la sogs pas bdag tu mtho ba dang gzhan ni de @176b dang bral bas dma' ba nyid du mthong bar byas pas /
translated: Having seen that one is high by way of morality, good qualities, and so on, and that others are low due to being devoid of those,

original: bdag la 'di ni bkur byas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas phrag dog bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag la 'di ni bkur byas zhes pa la sogs pa'i rnam pas phrag dog bsgom par bya'o //
translated: one should cultivate envy by way of the thought, “This one is honored,” and so on.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan du brjes pa nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni bdag dang gzhan du brjes pa nyid yin te /
translated: “ This one” is the one who has been exchanged for oneself and others.

original: gzhan nyid la nga zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan nyid la nga zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: “ That one” is taught to be “I.”

original: 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad la gzhan dang bdag tu brjes nas yod pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'chad par 'gyur ba thams cad la gzhan dang bdag tu brjes nas yod pa la sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: In all that is to be explained, one should apply “that one” and “this one” after exchanging oneself and others.

original: bstod pa zhes pa ni yon tan bsgrags pa'i sgo nas bsngags pa'o //
analyzed: bstod pa zhes pa ni yon tan bsgrags pa'i sgo nas bsngags pa'o //
translated: “ Praise” is to be praised by way of proclaiming good qualities.

original: bdag la smod pa zhes pa ni dman pa nyid kyi sgo nas smad par bya ba'o //
analyzed: bdag la smod pa zhes pa ni dman pa nyid kyi sgo nas smad par bya ba'o //
translated: “ Disparage” is to be disparaged by way of being inferior.

original: las rnams bdag gis byed pa ni dman pa'i las khur khyer ba la sogs pa byed pa'o ;
analyzed: las rnams bdag gis byed pa ni dman pa'i las khur khyer ba la sogs pa byed pa'o ;
translated: “I do the work” means I take on the burden of inferior work.

original: / bde bar gnas pa zhes pa ni sems bde bar gnas pa'ang yin no //
analyzed: / bde bar gnas pa zhes pa ni sems bde bar gnas pa'ang yin no //
translated: “I live happily” means I live with a happy mind.

original: 'di 'jig rten la che bar grags pa ni 'dis chen po nyid kyang goms shing 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'jig rten la che bar grags pa ni 'dis chen po nyid kyang goms shing 'bad pas bsgrub par bya ba yin te /
translated: “This is renowned in the world as great” means that greatness is also achieved through effort and practice.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang khyod dang 'dra bar rnyed dka' ba ma yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gyis kyang khyod dang 'dra bar rnyed dka' ba ma yin no //
translated: “It is not difficult for others to be like you” means that others can also achieve greatness.

original: gong ma gong ma mthong bas na khyed chen po phul du byung bar yang gnas pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gong ma gong ma mthong bas na khyed chen po phul du byung bar yang gnas pa ma yin te /
translated: “You are not the greatest because you see higher and higher” means that you are not the greatest because you see higher and higher.

original: tshu rol mthong ba thams cad dman pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshu rol mthong ba thams cad dman pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because all those who see only this side are inferior.

original: de ltar na ji ltar bdag kyang yon tan chen po dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na ji ltar bdag kyang yon tan chen po dang ldan pa nyid du 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis bya ste /
translated: “Thus, I will act in such a way that I too will have great qualities” means that you should act in such a way that you too will have great qualities.

original: grags pa'i sgras ni 'di gnyi ga la yang bya dog gi lta stangs kyis sbyar bar bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: grags pa'i sgras ni 'di gnyi ga la yang bya dog gi lta stangs kyis sbyar bar bstan pa yin no //
translated: “By the sound of fame” shows that both of these are to be applied with a view to their purpose.

original: de ltar gyur na yang bdag gi yon tan med pa ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang bdag gi yon tan med pa ci zhig bya ste /
translated: Even if that were the case, what is the use of my having good qualities?

original: yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du bya'o zhes ba bskyang ngo //
analyzed: yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du bya'o zhes ba bskyang ngo //
translated: I will make sure that I have good qualities.

original: dgos pa cung zad kyang med pas bdag nyid la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du nges par byang pa 'di nyid kyis mchog ste /
analyzed: dgos pa cung zad kyang med pas bdag nyid la yon tan dang ldan pa nyid du nges par byang pa 'di nyid kyis mchog ste /
translated: Since there is not the slightest purpose in being certain that I have good qualities, this very certainty is supreme.

original: gang gzhan su la yang 'dir yon tan gyi cha shas nyid kyang yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: gang gzhan su la yang 'dir yon tan gyi cha shas nyid kyang yod pa ma yin la /
translated: For no one else has even a portion of good qualities here.

original: gang gi phyir bdag yon tan thams cad ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag yon tan thams cad ldan pa yin te /
translated: And because I have all good qualities,

original: sems can gzhan la ni yod pa ma yin zhing rnam pa thams cad du yon tan dang ldan pa yang yin te /
analyzed: sems can gzhan la ni yod pa ma yin zhing rnam pa thams cad du yon tan dang ldan pa yang yin te /
translated: I have good qualities in every way,

original: lta bas phongs pas kyang yon tan thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig las so //
analyzed: lta bas phongs pas kyang yon tan thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i tshig las so //
translated: and I will obtain good qualities even from those who are destitute of good qualities.

original: gzhan yang mthon po dang dma' ba dag ni ltos pas byas pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mthon po dang dma' ba dag ni ltos pas byas pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, high and low are made by dependence.

original: 'di rnams las bdag nyid mthon por byas pa'i skye bu dam pa de ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: 'di rnams las bdag nyid mthon por byas pa'i skye bu dam pa de ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no person who makes himself high in relation to these.

original: bdag las shin tu ngan pa'i dman pa yang yod pa yin zhing /
analyzed: bdag las shin tu ngan pa'i dman pa yang yod pa yin zhing /
translated: There are those who are inferior to me, who are even worse.

original: gang la ltos nas bdag kyang mchog yin te gang rnams las bdag nyid @177a * //
analyzed: gang la ltos nas bdag kyang mchog yin te gang rnams las bdag nyid @177a * //
translated: And there are those in relation to whom I am superior,🔽in relation to whom I am the best.

original: dam pa'o // de ltar na thams cad las bdag ni dman pa ma yin te /
analyzed: dam pa'o // de ltar na thams cad las bdag ni dman pa ma yin te /
translated: Thus, I am not inferior to all,

original: 'di ni thams cad las mtho ba yang ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni thams cad las mtho ba yang ma yin no //
translated: and I am not superior to all.

original: de ltar na yang khyed ni tshul khrims la sogs pas phongs pas sdig pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dman pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar na yang khyed ni tshul khrims la sogs pas phongs pas sdig pa dang bcas pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir dman pa yin la /
translated: But you are inferior because you are poor in morality and so on and you have a sinful nature.

original: bdag la ni de yod pa ma yin pas dman pa ma yin no zhe na /
analyzed: bdag la ni de yod pa ma yin pas dman pa ma yin no zhe na /
translated: But I do not have that, so I am not inferior.

original: tshul khrims lta bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: tshul khrims lta bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: The verse beginning with “Morality, view” responds to that.

original: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa blangs pa nyams pa yin la lta bas phongs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lta ba lnga po yin te de nyid phongs pa yin pa'am ;
analyzed: tshul khrims kyis phongs pa ni so sor thar pa'i sdom pa blangs pa nyams pa yin la lta bas phongs pa ni 'jig tshogs la lta ba la sogs pa rnam pa lta ba lnga po yin te de nyid phongs pa yin pa'am ;
translated: “Poor in morality” means to have violated the vows of individual liberation. “Poor in view” means to have the five views such as the view of the transitory collection.

original: de rnams kyis phongs par byas pa yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyis phongs par byas pa yin te /
translated: They are impoverished by those.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni spyod pas phongs pa la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni spyod pas phongs pa la sogs pa yang gzung ngo //
translated: The word “etc.” includes the impoverished by conduct, and so on.

original: 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams kyi stobs kyis bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pa ma yin no //
analyzed: 'di thams cad nyon mongs pa rnams kyi stobs kyis bdag nyid kyi 'dod pa'i dbang du gyur pa ma yin no //
translated: All of this is not under the power of one’s own desire by the power of the afflictions.

original: de la gal te khyed snying rje dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe bdag gso bar bya ba yin te khyed la gang dang gang du gso ba'i nus pa yod pa ci lta ba bzhin du ste /
analyzed: de la gal te khyed snying rje dang ldan pa yin na de'i tshe bdag gso bar bya ba yin te khyed la gang dang gang du gso ba'i nus pa yod pa ci lta ba bzhin du ste /
translated: If you have compassion, then I am to be healed, in whatever way you have the ability to heal me.

original: gang gi nyes pa dang bral bar bsgrub par bya ba'i blo yod na zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi nyes pa dang bral bar bsgrub par bya ba'i blo yod na zhes pa'i don to //
translated: If you have the mind to accomplish the removal of my faults, is the meaning.

original: yang na nus pa ci lta bar bdag gis gnod kyang dang du blang ngo zhes phyi ma dang 'brel te /
analyzed: yang na nus pa ci lta bar bdag gis gnod kyang dang du blang ngo zhes phyi ma dang 'brel te /
translated: Or, in whatever way I have the ability, I will accept even harm, is the connection with the latter.

original: brtul zhugs dang nges pa'i dka' ba'i bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: brtul zhugs dang nges pa'i dka' ba'i bya ba la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: It is suffering by the characteristic of the difficult practices of asceticism, vows, and so on.

original: gal te khyed la bdag gis gso ba'i blo cung zad yod na de yang bdag gir khas blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te khyed la bdag gis gso ba'i blo cung zad yod na de yang bdag gir khas blang bar bya'o //
translated: If you have the slightest inclination to heal yourself, you should accept that as well.

original: de ltar gyur na yang gcig tu khyod la 'di gso ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang gcig tu khyod la 'di gso ba'i nus pa yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Even if that were the case, you are not capable of healing this one thing,

original: bsgrub bya'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di rigs so zhe na /🔽'on te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽'on te zhes pa ni rnam pa gzhan dgod pa yin te /
analyzed: bsgrub bya'i nyes pa dang ldan pa'i phyir 'di rigs so zhe na / 'on te zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / 'on te zhes pa ni rnam pa gzhan dgod pa yin te /
translated: because of the fault of the probandum.🔽If you say, But if I am not capable of healing this one thing,🔽why is it that this one is low and I am high?

original: gal te 'di la bdag gso ba'i nus pa med na de rgyu cis bdag ni mthol 'di ni dma' ba yin no zhes 'di nus pa med par yang bdag la brnyas par byed /
analyzed: gal te 'di la bdag gso ba'i nus pa med na de rgyu cis bdag ni mthol 'di ni dma' ba yin no zhes 'di nus pa med par yang bdag la brnyas par byed /

original: 'on te gal te yang gso ba'i nus pa dang bral ba de lta na yang gzhan gyi yon tan de yis bdag la ci zhig bya ste /🔽dgos pa cung zad kyang med la rnam pa thams cad du nye bar mkho ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'on te gal te yang gso ba'i nus pa dang bral ba de lta na yang gzhan gyi yon tan de yis bdag la ci zhig bya ste /🔽dgos pa cung zad kyang med la rnam pa thams cad du nye bar mkho ba dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: If you say, But if I am not capable of healing this one thing, why is it that

original: 'di nyid 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas te /
analyzed: 'di nyid 'ba' zhig gi dbang du byas te /
translated: In this very regard,

original: gang las bdag nyid de rang nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa 'di yin la /
analyzed: gang las bdag nyid de rang nyid kyi yon tan dang ldan pa 'di yin la /
translated: from which the self is endowed with its own qualities,

original: de las yon tan gyi cha cung zad kyang bdag la yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de las yon tan gyi cha cung zad kyang bdag la yod pa ma yin no //
translated: not even the slightest part of the quality is in me.

original: de ltar @177b gyur na yang snying rje'i yon tan dang ldan pas de las gzhan la yang de'i yon tan nye bar mkho ba yin no zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar @177b gyur na yang snying rje'i yon tan dang ldan pas de las gzhan la yang de'i yon tan nye bar mkho ba yin no zhe na /
translated: Even though it is so, since it is endowed with the quality of compassion, it is necessary to take up its quality from that.

original: snying rje yang dngos po la mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: snying rje yang dngos po la mthong ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that compassion also does not see an entity,

original: ngan 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ngan 'gro zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “the wretched,” and so on.

original: gang zhig sdig pa byed pa de ngan 'gror nges pa'i phyir ngan 'gro'i khar gnas par brjod do //
analyzed: gang zhig sdig pa byed pa de ngan 'gror nges pa'i phyir ngan 'gro'i khar gnas par brjod do //
translated: Since the one who commits evil is certain to go to a miserable realm, he is said to stand at the edge of a miserable realm.

original: yang na ngan 'gror gnas pas 'dir kha zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: yang na ngan 'gror gnas pas 'dir kha zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Or, since he stands in a miserable realm, he is connected with “edge.”

original: yang na ngan 'gro ni dman pa'am mkho ba'i yo byad dang bral ba der gnas pa yin no //
analyzed: yang na ngan 'gro ni dman pa'am mkho ba'i yo byad dang bral ba der gnas pa yin no //
translated: Or, the miserable realm is the inferior or the lack of necessary provisions.

original: gdug pa'i khar gnas zhes pa la gdug pa ni sbrul dang gcan gzan gtum po la yang brjod do //
analyzed: gdug pa'i khar gnas zhes pa la gdug pa ni sbrul dang gcan gzan gtum po la yang brjod do //
translated: The phrase dwelling in the mouth of a poisonous snake refers to snakes and fierce wild animals.

original: de rnams kyi khar gnas pa'i skye bo la snying rje ba'i yid kyis snying rje ma yin te /
analyzed: de rnams kyi khar gnas pa'i skye bo la snying rje ba'i yid kyis snying rje ma yin te /
translated: It is not compassion for a person dwelling in the mouth of those, because of a compassionate attitude.

original: de sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'bad par byed pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de sdug bsngal dang bral bar 'bad par byed pa ma yin no //
translated: It is not an effort to free them from suffering.

original: de tsam 'ba' zhig ni yod pa ma yin la khyad par 'di yang yin te /
analyzed: de tsam 'ba' zhig ni yod pa ma yin la khyad par 'di yang yin te /
translated: That is not the only thing, but there is this difference:
