original: gang yon tan rlom bas te yon tan lhag pa yin no zhes nam yang mkhas pa rnams la rgyal bar bsngo ste rgyal bar 'dod do //🔽de ltar re zhig mtho la phrag dog bshad nas /
analyzed: gang yon tan rlom bas te yon tan lhag pa yin no zhes nam yang mkhas pa rnams la rgyal bar bsngo ste rgyal bar 'dod do // de ltar re zhig mtho la phrag dog bshad nas /
translated: Those who are proud of their good qualities, thinking I am superior, never dedicate their merit to the wise, but rather desire victory over them.

original: mnyam pa la brjod pa'i phyir bdag dang mnyam pa la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mnyam pa la brjod pa'i phyir bdag dang mnyam pa la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having explained envy of those who are higher in this way, in order to explain envy of one's equals, he says toward those who are equal to me, and so on.

original: gzhan dang lhan cig tu yon tan la sogs pas bdag mnyam par bltas shing gsal bar byas nas /
analyzed: gzhan dang lhan cig tu yon tan la sogs pas bdag mnyam par bltas shing gsal bar byas nas /
translated: Having seen and made clear that one is equal to others in terms of good qualities and so on,

original: gang de las lhag par bya ba'i phyir te /
analyzed: gang de las lhag par bya ba'i phyir te /
translated: one should strive to be superior to them.

original: gzhan las yon tan rnams kyis bdag lhag par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan las yon tan rnams kyis bdag lhag par bya ba'i phyir 'bad par bya'o //
translated: One should strive to surpass oneself with good qualities.

original: gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'di la lhag pa mthong na de'i tshe 'di las phrogs nas gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: gal te rnyed pa dang bkur sti 'di la lhag pa mthong na de'i tshe 'di las phrogs nas gzung bar bya'o //
translated: If one sees that someone else has more gain and honor, then at that time one should take it away from him and hold it for oneself.

original: de ltar na'ang mi ster na rtsod pa dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pas kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar na'ang mi ster na rtsod pa dang mtshang 'bru ba la sogs pas kyang bsgrub par bya ste /
translated: If it is still not given, then one should even resort to quarreling and slander.

original: bdag gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti zhes zlas dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ma ning gi rtags so //
analyzed: bdag gi rnyed pa dang bkur sti zhes zlas dbye ba yin pa'i phyir ma ning gi rtags so //
translated: The term my is neuter, because it is a compound of my and gain and honor.

original: bdag gi zhes pa ni rang gi gang yin pa ste /
analyzed: bdag gi zhes pa ni rang gi gang yin pa ste /
translated: The term my refers to what is one's own.

original: ji lta 'di bzung nas 'dug ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji lta 'di bzung nas 'dug ces pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is, How is it that this is being held by him?

original: gzhan yang gal te rnyed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong ba rnams kyis 'di mchod pa de ltar bdag gis bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan yang gal te rnyed pa la sogs pa'i yon tan mthong ba rnams kyis 'di mchod pa de ltar bdag gis bya'o //
translated: Moreover, if this one is worshipped by those who see the good qualities of gain and so forth, then I should do the same.

original: gang gis rnyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di 'grib par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes /
analyzed: gang gis rnyed pa la sogs pa'i rgyu 'di 'grib par 'gyur bar bya'o zhes /
translated: By what means should this cause of gain and so forth be diminished?

original: yang ni bdag gi yon tan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yang ni bdag gi yon tan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Again, it is said, my good qualities, and so forth.

original: yang ni zhes pa ni brtag pa bzung ba'i tshig dag go //
analyzed: yang ni zhes pa ni brtag pa bzung ba'i tshig dag go //
translated: “Again” is a word for taking up the investigation.

original: ji ltar bdag gi yon tan gsal bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis brtsam par bya ste /🔽bdag gi nus pa @178a * //
analyzed: ji ltar bdag gi yon tan gsal bar 'gyur ba de ltar bdag gis brtsam par bya ste / bdag gi nus pa @178a * //
translated: “I will undertake it in such a way that my good qualities will be evident.”

original: brtan par bya zhe na /
analyzed: brtan par bya zhe na /
translated: “How will I stabilize my ability?”

original: bdag gi skyon yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag gi skyon yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “Even if my faults are evident,” and so on.

original: yang ni sngar bzhin no //
analyzed: yang ni sngar bzhin no //
translated: “Again” is as before.

original: 'dis kyang cir 'gyur na bdag ni mchod 'gyur 'di la min par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis kyang cir 'gyur na bdag ni mchod 'gyur 'di la min par 'gyur ro //
translated: “What will happen if that is so? I will be worshipped, not him.”

original: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na zhes dogs nas bdag deng rnyed pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: des kyang cir 'gyur zhe na zhes dogs nas bdag deng rnyed pa zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: “What will happen if that is so?” He says, “Today I have gained,” and so on.

original: gang gis bdag ni bkur 'gyur 'di la min te /
analyzed: gang gis bdag ni bkur 'gyur 'di la min te /
translated: “By what means will I be worshipped, not him?

original: shin tu legs par rnyed pa des bdag gis thob ces bdag nyid la bstod pa ston par byed de bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: shin tu legs par rnyed pa des bdag gis thob ces bdag nyid la bstod pa ston par byed de bsgrub bya grub pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that very good gain, I will show myself to be praised, because the one to be accomplished is accomplished.”

original: slar yang shin tu dga' ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: slar yang shin tu dga' ba gsal bar bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Again, in order to make clear the great joy,

original: 'di ni ma rungs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni ma rungs zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “This one is wicked,” and so on.

original: rgyas pa'i mig dang ldan pa'i gdong dang yid rab tu dga' bar re zhig blta'o //
analyzed: rgyas pa'i mig dang ldan pa'i gdong dang yid rab tu dga' bar re zhig blta'o //
translated: With eyes wide open, and with a mind full of joy, look for a while.

original: de ltar rnyed pa 'dod pas ma rungs pas byas pa rnyed pa bkur sti las phyi rol du bya ste bsal bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de ltar rnyed pa 'dod pas ma rungs pas byas pa rnyed pa bkur sti las phyi rol du bya ste bsal bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Thus, one should reject, should set aside, the disrespect that is done by the greedy, who are in the grip of desire for gain.

original: yun ring po ni dus shin tu ring bar ro //
analyzed: yun ring po ni dus shin tu ring bar ro //
translated: For a long time, for a very long time.

original: nam yang 'di la brten nas kho bo cag la 'di ltar dga' ba skye bar ma gyur pa'o //
analyzed: nam yang 'di la brten nas kho bo cag la 'di ltar dga' ba skye bar ma gyur pa'o //
translated: Never, on the basis of this, has there arisen in us such joy.

original: 'dis kyang ma rungs par byas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gro ba kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'dis kyang ma rungs par byas pa zhes bstan pa'i phyir 'gro ba kun gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this is also done by the greedy, he says, All the world, etc.

original: de'i nyes pa brjod pas gzhad gad du byed pa'o //
analyzed: de'i nyes pa brjod pas gzhad gad du byed pa'o //
translated: They laugh at him, by mentioning his faults.

original: de der zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
analyzed: de der zhes pa ni phyogs thams cad du'o //
translated: There, in all directions.

original: 'dir yang blta zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: 'dir yang blta zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: Here, too, it is connected with the word “look.”

original: da ni lhag pa thob par gyur pas sems rangs pas bdag nyid dman pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni lhag pa thob par gyur pas sems rangs pas bdag nyid dman pa nyid du bsgom par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to demonstrate that one should cultivate a sense of one’s own inferiority by being satisfied with what one has obtained, he says,

original: nyon mongs 'di yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nyon mongs 'di yang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This affliction, and so forth.

original: 'di yang ni de ltar spyo ba'i gnas thams cad du dman pa la 'dug pa yang yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang ni de ltar spyo ba'i gnas thams cad du dman pa la 'dug pa yang yin te /
translated: This one is also in all the places of such scolding, and is also low, and so forth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir na nyon mongs pa yin la bdag dang lhan cig tu 'gran te mnyam por byed par grags so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir na nyon mongs pa yin la bdag dang lhan cig tu 'gran te mnyam por byed par grags so //
translated: For that very reason, it is an affliction, and it is known to compete with me, to be equal to me.

original: grags zhes pa ni mi 'dod pa dang 'di mi rigs zhes pa nyid do //
analyzed: grags zhes pa ni mi 'dod pa dang 'di mi rigs zhes pa nyid do //
translated: The known is the very one who does not want and says, This is not right.

original: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
analyzed: ji ltar mi rigs she na /
translated: How is it not right?

original: 'di bdag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di bdag ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: This I, and so forth.

original: thos pas ni bstan bcos la sogs pa rnams thos pa yin la /
analyzed: thos pas ni bstan bcos la sogs pa rnams thos pa yin la /
translated: By hearing, one hears the treatises and so forth.

original: re zhig 'di dang bdag mnyam mam ci zhes te /🔽shes rab ni blo khyad par du gyur pa yin la /
analyzed: re zhig 'di dang bdag mnyam mam ci zhes te / shes rab ni blo khyad par du gyur pa yin la /
translated: Is this one equal to me?

original: gzugs rigs nor gyis kyang mnyam mam zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: gzugs rigs nor gyis kyang mnyam mam zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: Wisdom is a special intelligence, and form, family, and wealth are also equal, is the meaning.

original: de ltar nyid du skye bo rnams kyis kyang bdag gi yon tan phyogs bcur bsgrags pa thos shing mnyan nas spu ldang ba skyes par gyur pa ste lus la ba spu ldang ba @178b dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de ltar nyid du skye bo rnams kyis kyang bdag gi yon tan phyogs bcur bsgrags pa thos shing mnyan nas spu ldang ba skyes par gyur pa ste lus la ba spu ldang ba @178b dang ldan pa'o //
translated: In the same way, when people hear and listen to the proclamation of my virtues in the ten directions, they will experience the hairs on their bodies standing on end, and their bodies will be covered with goose bumps.

original: dga' ba ni yid rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing yongs su longs spyod pa ste bde ba'i dga' ston no //
analyzed: dga' ba ni yid rab tu dga' ba dang ldan zhing yongs su longs spyod pa ste bde ba'i dga' ston no //
translated: Joy is the mind being filled with delight and the celebration of happiness.

original: 'on te brgya la 'ga' zhig nas 'dis bag med pas rnyed par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te brgya la 'ga' zhig nas 'dis bag med pas rnyed par gyur na de'i tshe ji ltar zhe na /
translated: But if somehow he should obtain wealth through carelessness, then what?

original: gal te 'di la rnyed yod kyang //
analyzed: gal te 'di la rnyed yod kyang //
translated: If he has wealth,

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de ltar 'di'i rnyed pa la bar du gcad pa'i phyir 'bad par byas kyang gal te ci ltar yang 'di la rnyed pa yod na de'i tshe 'di'i ske la rdog pas mnan nas blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / de ltar 'di'i rnyed pa la bar du gcad pa'i phyir 'bad par byas kyang gal te ci ltar yang 'di la rnyed pa yod na de'i tshe 'di'i ske la rdog pas mnan nas blang bar bya ste /
translated: and so on.

original: bdag gis 'di la stobs kyis blang ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la stobs kyis blang ngo //
translated: Even though he strives to obstruct his wealth in that way, if somehow he should have wealth, then at that time he should be seized by the neck and be told, I will take it by force!

original: ci ste rnam pa thams cad du 'di'i srog dang bral bar bya ba yin nam zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste rnam pa thams cad du 'di'i srog dang bral bar bya ba yin nam zhe na /
translated: But if it is to be deprived of life in every way,

original: nga'i las ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: nga'i las ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “My work” and so on.

original: 'tsho ba tsam zhig ni re zhig srog 'dzin pa de tsam 'di la byin nas gzhan thams cad bdag gis yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'tsho ba tsam zhig ni re zhig srog 'dzin pa de tsam 'di la byin nas gzhan thams cad bdag gis yongs su gzung bar bya'o //
translated: For the time being, I will give him just the bare necessities of life, and I will take everything else for myself.

original: de lta na yang nam zhig nga'i las ni byed ce na zhes te /
analyzed: de lta na yang nam zhig nga'i las ni byed ce na zhes te /
translated: But when will my work be done?

original: gal te 'di kho bo'i bka' nyan pa la sbyor na'am ma smras kyang rjes su mthun par byed na de'i tshe 'di la 'tsho ba tsam zhig sbyin par bya ste /
analyzed: gal te 'di kho bo'i bka' nyan pa la sbyor na'am ma smras kyang rjes su mthun par byed na de'i tshe 'di la 'tsho ba tsam zhig sbyin par bya ste /
translated: If he is engaged in obeying my orders, or if he does what is appropriate even without being told, then at that time I will give him just the bare necessities of life.

original: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
analyzed: gzhan du ni ma yin no //
translated: But not otherwise.

original: yang 'di ji ltar na dman pa'i gnas skabs su khyer bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang 'di ji ltar na dman pa'i gnas skabs su khyer bar byed ce na /
translated: But how does he lead him to a lowly state?

original: gang 'di bde las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang 'di bde las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “Whatever” and so on.

original: gang zhes pa ni gang las te bde ba las yin la /
analyzed: gang zhes pa ni gang las te bde ba las yin la /
translated: “Whatever” means from whatever.

original: nyams par bya ba ni bral bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyams par bya ba ni bral bar bya'o //
translated: “To be destroyed” means to be deprived of.

original: 'di tsam gyis gtong bar bya ba ni ma yin te 'on kyang bdag gis gnod la rtag tu sbyar bar bya ste dus thams cad du bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi khur 'di'i spyo bar yang dag par bzhag ste de'i phyir 'di la de ltar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di tsam gyis gtong bar bya ba ni ma yin te 'on kyang bdag gis gnod la rtag tu sbyar bar bya ste dus thams cad du bdag gi sdug bsngal gyi khur 'di'i spyo bar yang dag par bzhag ste de'i phyir 'di la de ltar bya'o //
translated: This alone is not the thing to be given away, but rather, I will always apply myself to harming myself, and at all times I will properly place the burden of my suffering on myself, and for that reason I will do it in this way.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar khyod 'di la zhe sdang bar byed ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar khyod 'di la zhe sdang bar byed ce na /
translated: Again, why do you get angry at him in this way?

original: 'di yis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di yis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “By this one,” and so on.

original: sdang ba'i sems can 'dis sngar 'khor ba thams cad du bdag la lan grangs brgya phrag du mar gnod pa byas pa yin te /
analyzed: sdang ba'i sems can 'dis sngar 'khor ba thams cad du bdag la lan grangs brgya phrag du mar gnod pa byas pa yin te /
translated: This angry sentient being has harmed me many hundreds of times in all of cyclic existence in the past.

original: bcing ba dang bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal bar byas pa yin no //
analyzed: bcing ba dang bsad pa dang brdeg pa la sogs pa rnams kyis sdug bsngal bar byas pa yin no //
translated: He has caused me suffering by binding me, killing me, beating me, and so on.

original: da ni sdug bsngal 'di bzod par ma nus te brgya la 'di las sems ldog par dogs nas thabs sla ba'i rim pas de nyid la sbyar bar bya ba'i ched du nye bar ston pa ni yid khyod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar gzhal bar mi nus pa'i bskal par rang gi don byed 'dod pas te goms pas ngal ba chen pos dub par gyur pas sdug bsngal @179a * //
analyzed: da ni sdug bsngal 'di bzod par ma nus te brgya la 'di las sems ldog par dogs nas thabs sla ba'i rim pas de nyid la sbyar bar bya ba'i ched du nye bar ston pa ni yid khyod ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te / thog ma med pa'i 'khor bar gzhal bar mi nus pa'i bskal par rang gi don byed 'dod pas te goms pas ngal ba chen pos dub par gyur pas sdug bsngal @179a * //
translated: Now, not being able to bear this suffering, fearing that the mind might turn away from this, in order to apply it to that very [suffering] through the stages of an easy method, the teaching is presented with the words O mind! and so forth.🔽In beginningless cyclic existence, for eons that cannot be measured, by desiring to accomplish one's own purpose, through habituation, one becomes exhausted by great hardship, and thus experiences great suffering for a long time.

original: chen po dus yun ring por myong bar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal nyid bsgrubs pa yin te /
analyzed: chen po dus yun ring por myong bar gyur pa'i mtshan nyid kyis sdug bsngal nyid bsgrubs pa yin te /
translated: The characteristic of that is the accomplishment of suffering itself.

original: las de dang de las dgos pa cung zad kyang thab pa ma yin no //
analyzed: las de dang de las dgos pa cung zad kyang thab pa ma yin no //
translated: There is not the slightest purpose in that karma and that action.

original: byung bar gyur pa de dang de re zhig bzlog par bya ba ma yin par gyur na yang da lta 'ong ba la ci ltar rigs she na /
analyzed: byung bar gyur pa de dang de re zhig bzlog par bya ba ma yin par gyur na yang da lta 'ong ba la ci ltar rigs she na /
translated: Even if that which has arisen were not to be stopped for the time being, how could it be appropriate for what is coming now?

original: de ltar bdag gis gsol pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar bdag gis gsol pa 'debs pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, with the words I make this request, and so forth, [the Buddha] teaches.

original: gsol ba 'debs pa ni bsnyen bkur sngon du song ba'i tshig brjod pa nyid kyis te /
analyzed: gsol ba 'debs pa ni bsnyen bkur sngon du song ba'i tshig brjod pa nyid kyis te /
translated: The supplication is the very utterance of the respect that precedes the service.🔽Just as you have engaged in this or that activity previously, so you should engage in this familiarization with the exchange of self and other.

original: ji ltar sngar rang nyid kyi las de dang de la zhugs pa de ltar bdag dang gzhan du brje ba la goms pa 'di la yang 'jug par gyis shig / dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don la dpyod pa dang bral🔽ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sngar rang nyid kyi las de dang de la zhugs pa de ltar bdag dang gzhan du brje ba la goms pa 'di la yang 'jug par gyis shig / dpyod pa med pa zhes bya ba shin tu lkog tu gyur ba'i don la dpyod pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Without analysis means that you are free from analysis of a matter that is extremely obscure.

original: ci ste bsgrub bya'i don rtogs pa med par ci ltar 'di la 'jug pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: ci ste bsgrub bya'i don rtogs pa med par ci ltar 'di la 'jug pa nyid du 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If you ask, How can one engage in this without understanding the meaning of what is to be accomplished?

original: thub pa'i bka' zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thub pa'i bka' zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, The words of the Sage are true.

original: phyis ni dus phyis nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyis ni dus phyis nas rtogs par 'gyur te /
translated: Later means that you will understand later on.

original: de'i ste bdag gi tshig gis zhugs pa 'am bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i yon tan las so //
analyzed: de'i ste bdag gi tshig gis zhugs pa 'am bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i yon tan las so //
translated: By that, that is, by my words, you will engage in it, or by the good qualities of the exchange of self and other.

original: de khyod kyis nyams su blangs nas der 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de khyod kyis nyams su blangs nas der 'gyur ro //
translated: You will become like that by practicing it.

original: ji ltar shes she na /
analyzed: ji ltar shes she na /
translated: How do you know that?

original: thub pa'i bka' ni yang dag pa yin pa ste /
analyzed: thub pa'i bka' ni yang dag pa yin pa ste /
translated: The words of the Sage are true.

original: yang dag phyin ci ma log pa rtogs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag phyin ci ma log pa rtogs par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is the correct, unerring realization.

original: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin pa de'i phyir shes so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bcom ldan 'das kyi bka' yin pa de'i phyir shes so //
translated: Because it is the speech of the Bhagavat, therefore, it is known.

original: de ltar gyur na yang bdag gis las 'di du mar byas kyang de ltar na yang khyad par cung zad kyang ma rtogs so zhes dogs nas gal te khyod kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang bdag gis las 'di du mar byas kyang de ltar na yang khyad par cung zad kyang ma rtogs so zhes dogs nas gal te khyod kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Even though one has done this action many times, still, one does not realize even the slightest difference.

original: khyod ni bden par smra ba ma yin te gzhan du gal te las 'di sngar byas nas de tshe byed la las kyi 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: khyod ni bden par smra ba ma yin te gzhan du gal te las 'di sngar byas nas de tshe byed la las kyi 'bras bu yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you say, “You are not speaking the truth,” then, if you had done this action previously, at that time, you would have done it, and the result of the action would have arisen.

original: de la sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs ba'i bde ba sangs rgyas nyid ma yin pa sangs rgyas nyid kyi bde ba por nas srid par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de la sangs rgyas kyi phun sum tshogs ba'i bde ba sangs rgyas nyid ma yin pa sangs rgyas nyid kyi bde ba por nas srid par mi 'gyur te /
translated: The happiness of the perfection of the Buddha, which is not Buddhahood, would not be the happiness of Buddhahood.

original: gnas skabs ngan pa 'di'i skabs mi srid do //
analyzed: gnas skabs ngan pa 'di'i skabs mi srid do //
translated: It would not be possible in this bad situation.

original: las de ma byas na 'bras bu yang skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
analyzed: las de ma byas na 'bras bu yang skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin no //
translated: If that action were not done, the result would not arise.

original: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rang gi sems de nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni mjug bsdu ba'i tshul gyis rang gi sems de nyid la bstan par bya ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach one’s own mind by way of a concluding summary,

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “Therefore,” and so on.

original: gang las 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu 'di goms pa las skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir byas shing bsgrubs pa de ltar ro //
analyzed: gang las 'di lta bu'i 'bras bu 'di goms pa las skye bar 'gyur ba de'i phyir byas shing bsgrubs pa de ltar ro //
translated: Since this kind of result arises from cultivation, it is like that which is done and accomplished.🔽Therefore, by one who desires the stated result, having removed weariness with its performance, one should practice its nature.

original: de'i phyir brjod pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas de'i bya ba la skyo ba @179b bsal nas rang bzhin nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so //🔽sems can gzhan gyi rtog mkhan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir brjod pa'i 'bras bu 'dod pas de'i bya ba la skyo ba @179b bsal nas rang bzhin nyams su blang bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir gzhan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs so // sems can gzhan gyi rtog mkhan zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to teach that, he says “another’s,” and so on.

original: rab tu sbas nas de'i dgos par byed pa yin no //
analyzed: rab tu sbas nas de'i dgos par byed pa yin no //
translated: Having thoroughly concealed the thinker of another sentient being, and so on, one should do its purpose.

original: da ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bor nas slar yang phrag dog bsgom pa la rang gi sems sbyang ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bdag dang gzhan du brje ba bor nas slar yang phrag dog bsgom pa la rang gi sems sbyang ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, having abandoned the exchange of self and other, in order to train one’s mind again in the cultivation of envy,

original: bdag skyed pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag skyed pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “I should generate,” and so on.

original: de bas gnas pa'i phyir skyid pa yin la sdug bsngal gyi gnas pas mi skyid pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas gnas pa'i phyir skyid pa yin la sdug bsngal gyi gnas pas mi skyid pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, because of abiding, it is happiness. Because of abiding in suffering, it is unhappiness.

original: de ltar phrag dog gyis shig ces rang gi sems la 'di ltar gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar phrag dog gyis shig ces rang gi sems la 'di ltar gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, having said to one's own mind, Be jealous like that,

original: bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he declares, I am... and so on.

original: bdag ni zhes pa ni bdag gi lus la'o //
analyzed: bdag ni zhes pa ni bdag gi lus la'o //
translated: I am is with regard to my body.

original: gang tshe zhes pa ni dus nam zhig na'o //
analyzed: gang tshe zhes pa ni dus nam zhig na'o //
translated: When is at what time.

original: ci byed ces pa ni rang gi don nam /
analyzed: ci byed ces pa ni rang gi don nam /
translated: What is done is whether one's own aim or

original: gzhan yi don nam /🔽dam pa'i las sam /
analyzed: gzhan yi don nam / dam pa'i las sam /
translated: another's aim,🔽whether a holy action

original: dam pa ma yin pa'i las sam /
analyzed: dam pa ma yin pa'i las sam /
translated: or an unholy action,

original: tha mal pa'i las ci byed cing gnas zhes so //
analyzed: tha mal pa'i las ci byed cing gnas zhes so //
translated: what is done and how one abides.

original: de ltar 'di'i lus la glags brtags te btsal lo //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i lus la glags brtags te btsal lo //
translated: Thus, one should investigate and search for an opportunity in this body.

original: 'on te gang gi tshe 'di la glags ma rnyed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gi tshe 'di la glags ma rnyed na de'i tshe ji ltar bya zhe na /
translated: But if one does not find an opportunity in this, then what should one do?

original: gzhan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
analyzed: gzhan gyi zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs pa la /
translated: If another... and so on is stated.

original: gzhan gyis byas pa'i nyes pa 'di yang khyod nyid kyi nyes par spyad pa yin no zhes gang gis 'di'i spyod pa yin no zhes de ltar 'di nyid kyi lus kyi mgo la bsgyur bar byos shig / yang na gzhan gyis byas pa'i nyes pa yang 'di nyid
analyzed: gzhan gyis byas pa'i nyes pa 'di yang khyod nyid kyi nyes par spyad pa yin no zhes gang gis 'di'i spyod pa yin no zhes de ltar 'di nyid kyi lus kyi mgo la bsgyur bar byos shig / yang na gzhan gyis byas pa'i nyes pa yang 'di nyid
translated: This fault committed by another is also your own misdeed. In this way, you should transfer to his body the fault that is his.🔽 Or, This fault committed by another is also your own.

original: zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa yang 'di nyid kyi mgo bo la bsgyur bar byos shig ces de'i las kyi 'bras bu'i cha nyid du gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: zhes bya ba ni nyes par spyod pa yang 'di nyid kyi mgo bo la bsgyur bar byos shig ces de'i las kyi 'bras bu'i cha nyid du gyis shig pa'o //
translated: That is, you should make it your own, as a part of the result of his karma.

original: gang / 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gang ci'ang rung //
analyzed: gang / 'gro ba'i sdug bsngal gang ci'ang rung //
translated: Whatever suffering there is in the world,

original: de kun bdag la smin gyur cig /
analyzed: de kun bdag la smin gyur cig /
translated: may it all ripen upon me.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i dge 'dun gyis //
translated: By the merit of the Bodhisattva Sangha,

original: 'gro ba bde la gnas par shog / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'gro ba bde la gnas par shog / ces 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: may beings come to dwell in happiness.🔽When you see even a small fault in him, you should not conceal it.

original: gang gi tshe yang nyes pa chung ngu yang 'di la mthong na de'i tshe sba bar mi bya'o zhes bdag gis nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang nyes pa chung ngu yang 'di la mthong na de'i tshe sba bar mi bya'o zhes bdag gis nyes pa zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, it is said, If I see even a small fault in him, I will not conceal it.

original: chung ngu ste lus 'di'i shin tu phra ba'i yang nyes pa rab tu shogs zhes te mngon par gyis shig pa'o //
analyzed: chung ngu ste lus 'di'i shin tu phra ba'i yang nyes pa rab tu shogs zhes te mngon par gyis shig pa'o //
translated: The small is the very subtle fault of this body. Confess means: make it manifest.

original: thub pa chen po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te de'i spyan sngar ro //
analyzed: thub pa chen po ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das te de'i spyan sngar ro //
translated: The great sage is the Buddha Bhagavat. In his presence.

original: gang gis 'di 'jigs pas slar yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa nyid kyis gnas so //
analyzed: gang gis 'di 'jigs pas slar yang mi byed pa'i sdom pa nyid kyis gnas so //
translated: By means of the very vow not to do it again out of fear of it, he dwells.

original: gal te 'di'i snyan pa gsal bar gyur pa mthong na de la gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di'i snyan pa gsal bar gyur pa mthong na de la gsungs pa /
translated: If one sees his fame clearly, one should say to him: You should do this.

original: gzhan gyi @180a * //
analyzed: gzhan gyi @180a * //
translated: The others are the people.

original: zhes pa sa sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa sa sogs pa ste /
translated: The etc. is the people.

original: 'di'i grags pa gzhan rnams kyi de bas lhag pa'i grags pa gsal bar dri ma can du gyis shig ces de rnyog pa dang bcas par gyis shig pa dang sba bar gyis shig ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'di'i grags pa gzhan rnams kyi de bas lhag pa'i grags pa gsal bar dri ma can du gyis shig ces de rnyog pa dang bcas par gyis shig pa dang sba bar gyis shig ces pa'i don to //
translated: You should make his fame, which is more famous than the others, clearly defiled, I say. The meaning is: You should make it turbid, you should conceal it.🔽One should not generate even the slightest compassionate thought toward him. I am a slave, etc.

original: 'di la snying rje'i sems cung zad tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bdag ni bran gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di la snying rje'i sems cung zad tsam yang bskyed par mi bya'o zhes bdag ni bran gyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: is stated.

original: nges par dman pa'i bran gyi tha ma ltar gzhan gyi dgos pa sems can gyi don rnams la 'di ltar bkol bar gyis shig ste khur khyer ba la sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: nges par dman pa'i bran gyi tha ma ltar gzhan gyi dgos pa sems can gyi don rnams la 'di ltar bkol bar gyis shig ste khur khyer ba la sbyor ba'o //
translated: One should be like the lowest of servants, and be employed in this way in the aims of others, the aims of sentient beings.

original: gal te 'di la yon tan gyi cha cung zad mthong ba de'i tshe ci bstod pa bya ba'am zhe na ;
analyzed: gal te 'di la yon tan gyi cha cung zad mthong ba de'i tshe ci bstod pa bya ba'am zhe na ;
translated: If one sees even the slightest quality in someone, then should one praise him?

original: 'di ni skyon can zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni skyon can zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He is faulty, etc.

original: brgya la yon tan lhag pa lhan cig skyes pa yod na yang 'di ni bstod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
analyzed: brgya la yon tan lhag pa lhan cig skyes pa yod na yang 'di ni bstod par bya ba ma yin pa nyid do //
translated: Even if there is some excellence that is innate and superior, he is not worthy of praise.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gang gi phyir 'di ni nyes pa du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gang gi phyir 'di ni nyes pa du ma'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because he is the embodiment of many faults.

original: gzhan yang yon tan rtogs pa'i sgo nas bstod par bya bar 'gyur na 'di nyid rtsa ba dang bcas pa nyams pa yin no zhes 'di'i yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
analyzed: gzhan yang yon tan rtogs pa'i sgo nas bstod par bya bar 'gyur na 'di nyid rtsa ba dang bcas pa nyams pa yin no zhes 'di'i yon tan zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs so //
translated: Moreover, if one were to praise him on the basis of his qualities, then he would be destroyed along with his roots.  His qualities, etc.

original: 'dir yang mang du brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: 'dir yang mang du brjod pas ci zhig bya ste /
translated: What is the use of saying much here?

original: mdor na 'di la chad ba'i las bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: mdor na 'di la chad ba'i las bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In brief, one should do the work of a servant to this.

original: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mdor na zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In brief, etc.

original: gnod pa zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba'am gnod pa byed pa'o //
analyzed: gnod pa zhes pa ni sdug bsngal ba'am gnod pa byed pa'o //
translated: Harm is suffering or the infliction of suffering.

original: 'di ltar gal te yang bdag gis sdug bsngal gyis khur khyer bar mi nus so zhes smras na de'i tshe 'dir ci ltar 'jug par bya zhe na /🔽gang gis ngag rtsub gyur tshul du //
analyzed: 'di ltar gal te yang bdag gis sdug bsngal gyis khur khyer bar mi nus so zhes smras na de'i tshe 'dir ci ltar 'jug par bya zhe na / gang gis ngag rtsub gyur tshul du //
translated: If one says, I am not able to carry the burden of suffering, then how can one engage in this?

original: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: By what means one becomes harsh-spoken, etc.

original: gang gis ngag rtsub par 'gyur ba ni phod pa che ba yin dang po nyid du 'di la de ltar skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
analyzed: gang gis ngag rtsub par 'gyur ba ni phod pa che ba yin dang po nyid du 'di la de ltar skabs dbye bar mi bya'o //
translated: By what means one becomes harsh-spoken, i.e. by what means one becomes bold, one should not at the very outset allow oneself to be in this way.

original: 'on kyang gzhag par bya ste gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang gzhag par bya ste gzung bar bya'o //
translated: However, one should be patient, i.e. one should bear it.

original: bag ma gsar ba'i 'jug pa bzhin du'o //
analyzed: bag ma gsar ba'i 'jug pa bzhin du'o //
translated: Like the conduct of a new bride.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽'jigs dang zhes te nams pa las skrag pa'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / 'jigs dang zhes te nams pa las skrag pa'o //
translated: That is stated:🔽Fear is fear of the unknown.

original: ngo tsha zhes pa ni bya ba ma yin pa la ngo tsha ba'o //
analyzed: ngo tsha zhes pa ni bya ba ma yin pa la ngo tsha ba'o //
translated: Shame is shame at what should not be done.

original: thams cad du mi mthun pa la 'jug pa las bzlog pa la brtson par bya la /
analyzed: thams cad du mi mthun pa la 'jug pa las bzlog pa la brtson par bya la /
translated: One should strive to reverse the tendency to engage in what is not conducive in all situations.

original: da ltar gnas pa na yang rnam pa thams cad lcags kyu med par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ltar gnas pa na yang rnam pa thams cad lcags kyu med par mi bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: And even when one is presently abiding in virtue, one should not let go of it in any way.

original: 'di ltar gyis shig ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gyis shig ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: To teach this, it is said:

original: 'di ltar bka' nyan pa la 'jug par byas nas lus 'di dbang du gyur par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar bka' nyan pa la 'jug par byas nas lus 'di dbang du gyur par bya ste /
translated: Thus, having engaged in listening to the teachings, one should bring this body under control.

original: @180b rang la rag las pas gzhag par bya ste /
analyzed: @180b rang la rag las pas gzhag par bya ste /
translated: One should place it under one's power and let it rest.

original: rta dul ba bzhin no /
analyzed: rta dul ba bzhin no /
translated: It is like a well-trained horse.

original: 'on te 'di ltar dbang du ma gyur na de'i chad pas gcad par bya ste /🔽de las 'das na ste gal te khyod bka' las 'das pas 'jug na de'i tshe chad pas gcad par bya ste spyo bar bya ba'am /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar dbang du ma gyur na de'i chad pas gcad par bya ste / de las 'das na ste gal te khyod bka' las 'das pas 'jug na de'i tshe chad pas gcad par bya ste spyo bar bya ba'am /
translated: But if it does not come under control in this way, it should be punished.

original: tshar gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: tshar gcad par bya'o //
translated: If one transgresses this, that is, if one engages in what is prohibited, then one should be punished, that is, one should be scolded or subdued.

original: da ni bdag gi sems dang bdag tha dad pa bzhin du yongs su brtags nas brtan pas bsdu ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni bdag gi sems dang bdag tha dad pa bzhin du yongs su brtags nas brtan pas bsdu ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to gather the mind and the self, as if they were separate, through firmness, it is said:

original: 'on te de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'on te de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: But if you do such things, etc.

original: gal te yang khyod 'di la rab tu zhugs par gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang khyod 'di la rab tu zhugs par gyur te /
translated: If you should become engaged in this,

original: brgya la nyams par gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa des khyod nyid tshar gcad par bya'o //
analyzed: brgya la nyams par gyur na de'i tshe nyes pa des khyod nyid tshar gcad par bya'o //
translated: and if you should fail, then by that fault you yourself will be destroyed.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: nyes pa thams cad khyod la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: nyes pa thams cad khyod la brten pa yin te /
translated: All faults are based on you.

original: rang nyid sems lus med par gyur pa yang khyod nyid kyi bsam pa nyid kyis 'di thams cad du 'jug par byed de /
analyzed: rang nyid sems lus med par gyur pa yang khyod nyid kyi bsam pa nyid kyis 'di thams cad du 'jug par byed de /
translated: Even though you yourself are bodiless, you alone, by your own intention, cause this whole thing to be engaged.

original: des gang 'ga' zhig tu ngan g-yo can du rten par byed do //
analyzed: des gang 'ga' zhig tu ngan g-yo can du rten par byed do //
translated: By that, you are supported in some place as a deceiver.

original: der khyod kyis drang po ma yin no zhes bsam pa'o //
analyzed: der khyod kyis drang po ma yin no zhes bsam pa'o //
translated: There you think, You are not honest!

original: de nas mi bzod pas rang gi sems nyid la bsdigs pa khyod kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de nas mi bzod pas rang gi sems nyid la bsdigs pa khyod kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Then, with intolerance, he threatens his own mind, you, etc.

original: bsdigs pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa'o //🔽gang du 'gro ba kho bos blta //
analyzed: bsdigs pa 'di ni 'jig rten pa'i brjod pa'o // gang du 'gro ba kho bos blta //
translated: This threat is a worldly expression.🔽Where will you go? I will see!

original: zhes pa ni de ni khyod kyis gang du 'bros par byed ces so //
analyzed: zhes pa ni de ni khyod kyis gang du 'bros par byed ces so //
translated: This means, Where will you run away? I will see!

original: ji ltar khyod kyis mi shes pa na glags rnyed pa de lta ni nus pa ma yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar khyod kyis mi shes pa na glags rnyed pa de lta ni nus pa ma yin te /
translated: Just as you found an opportunity when I was ignorant, it is not possible for you to do that now.

original: da ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas bdag nyid stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
analyzed: da ni rang bzhin yongs su shes pas bdag nyid stobs dang ldan pa yin te /
translated: Now, having fully understood reality, I am powerful.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He says just that:

original: dregs pa thams cad gzhom bya ste /
analyzed: dregs pa thams cad gzhom bya ste /
translated: All haughtiness should be destroyed.

original: zhes pa ni khyod kyi srog blang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa ni khyod kyi srog blang bar bya'o //
translated: This means that I will take your life.

original: 'on te 'di ltar khyod kyis sngar bzhin du bdag la da ltar yang stobs yod do zhes sems pa bsam par mi bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te 'di ltar khyod kyis sngar bzhin du bdag la da ltar yang stobs yod do zhes sems pa bsam par mi bya ste /
translated: Or, if you think, “Just as before, I have power now,” you should not think that way.

original: khyod kyis gang du kho bo brlag pa ste /
analyzed: khyod kyis gang du kho bo brlag pa ste /
translated: Where I was destroyed by you

original: lam ma yin par brid pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi dus yun ring po gzhan yin la /
analyzed: lam ma yin par brid pa ni gang gi phyir sngon gyi dus yun ring po gzhan yin la /
translated: and led astray, that was because the past was a long time ago.

original: da ni dus 'di gzhan yin te /
analyzed: da ni dus 'di gzhan yin te /
translated: Now, this time is different.

original: sngon dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sngon dang 'dra ba ma yin no //
translated: It is not the same as before.

original: da ni sngon gyi dus ma yin no zhes ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
analyzed: da ni sngon gyi dus ma yin no zhes ci ltar shes par bya zhe na /
translated: How is it known that now is not the same as before?

original: da dung zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: da dung zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Still” and so on is stated.

original: sngar ni rang gi don la zhes pa'i sems nyid kyis khyod kyis kho bo bslus pa yin la /
analyzed: sngar ni rang gi don la zhes pa'i sems nyid kyis khyod kyis kho bo bslus pa yin la /
translated: Previously, you deceived me with the thought, I am for my own benefit.🔽 And now, do not think, I exist!🔽 Having understood it in this way, engage in the welfare of many sentient beings.

original: de yang bdag la da lta yang yod do zhes yid la ma byed cig /'di ltar shes par byas nas sems can mang po'i don la rab tu zhugs shig / skyo bar sems te dka' ba'i blo por cig pa'o //🔽yang na sems can gyi don gyi khur khyad par @181a * //
analyzed: de yang bdag la da lta yang yod do zhes yid la ma byed cig /'di ltar shes par byas nas sems can mang po'i don la rab tu zhugs shig / skyo bar sems te dka' ba'i blo por cig pa'o // yang na sems can gyi don gyi khur khyad par @181a * //
translated: Do not be discouraged, thinking, This is difficult!

original: sems pa na /
analyzed: sems pa na /
translated: Or, when you are thinking of taking on the special burden of the welfare of sentient beings,

original: sdug bsngal ba'i blos dor bar ma byed cig //
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba'i blos dor bar ma byed cig //
translated: do not give up with a thought of suffering.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: bdag gis gzhan la khyod btsongs kyis //
analyzed: bdag gis gzhan la khyod btsongs kyis //
translated: Because I have sold you to others.

original: zhes te / sngar nyid du bdag dang gzhan du yongs su brjes pa na /
analyzed: zhes te / sngar nyid du bdag dang gzhan du yongs su brjes pa na /
translated: When I have already completely exchanged myself for others,

original: khyod bdag gis gzhan la rag las pa la sbyar ba yin no //
analyzed: khyod bdag gis gzhan la rag las pa la sbyar ba yin no //
translated: I have made you belong to others.

original: de lta na yang bdag nyes pa ma byas pa la yang khyed yongs su ma mgu ba gang gis yongs su gtang ba'i blo skyed ces dogs nas /
analyzed: de lta na yang bdag nyes pa ma byas pa la yang khyed yongs su ma mgu ba gang gis yongs su gtang ba'i blo skyed ces dogs nas /
translated: Even so, if you are thinking, I have not committed any faults, so why do you have the idea of giving me away?

original: gal te bag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te bag med ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: If you say, “But I was careless,” and so on,

original: gal te yang ji ltar bag med par gyur te /
analyzed: gal te yang ji ltar bag med par gyur te /
translated: then, if you were careless,

original: blo stor bas bag med pa'am dran pa nyams te sems can rnams la sems khyod ma byin te /
analyzed: blo stor bas bag med pa'am dran pa nyams te sems can rnams la sems khyod ma byin te /
translated: having lost your mind, or if you were heedless, having lost your memory, and you did not give sentient beings to yourself,

original: rang nyid kyir byas na de'i tshe khyod kyis kho bo dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams te /
analyzed: rang nyid kyir byas na de'i tshe khyod kyis kho bo dmyal ba'i srung ma rnams te /
translated: then at that time you certainly gave me to the guardians of the hells,

original: dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal skyed pa la sbyar ba gshin rje'i skyes bu rnams la byin par nges te the tshom yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: dmyal ba'i sdug bsngal skyed pa la sbyar ba gshin rje'i skyes bu rnams la byin par nges te the tshom yod pa ma yin no //
translated: the beings of the Lord of Death who cause the suffering of the hells.

original: de ltar rjes su mthun par byas kyang khyod rjes su mi mthun pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar rjes su mthun par byas kyang khyod rjes su mi mthun pa yin te /
translated: Even though I acted in accordance with you, you were not in accordance with me.

original: de'i phyir khyed la gtong ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir khyed la gtong ba'i blor 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, I will give you to the Lord of Death.

original: 'on te gang gis na de ltar rjod par byed pa brgya la de ltar gyur tam zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te gang gis na de ltar rjod par byed pa brgya la de ltar gyur tam zhe na /
translated: But if you say, “By what means could that happen?”

original: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says, “In that case,” and so on.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni khyod la rjes su mthun pa spyad pa las te /
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni khyod la rjes su mthun pa spyad pa las te /
translated: “In that case” means “from acting in accordance with you.”

original: lan grangs du mar khyod kyis kho bo sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig gi snod du byas pa yin la /
analyzed: lan grangs du mar khyod kyis kho bo sdug bsngal 'ba' zhig gi snod du byas pa yin la /
translated: You have made me a vessel of nothing but suffering many times.

original: yun ring ba ni dus ring por ro //
analyzed: yun ring ba ni dus ring por ro //
translated: For a long time means for a long period of time.

original: ci zhig byas nas she na /
analyzed: ci zhig byas nas she na /
translated: What have I done?

original: dmyal ba rnams la byin nas so //
analyzed: dmyal ba rnams la byin nas so //
translated: I have given myself to the hells.

original: khon rnams te sngar gyi dgra ste dgra nyid du gyur pa rnams yin te /
analyzed: khon rnams te sngar gyi dgra ste dgra nyid du gyur pa rnams yin te /
translated: The enemies are the former foes, the very enemies.

original: da ni de rnams dran par byas la gzhom par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de rnams dran par byas la gzhom par bya ste /
translated: Now, having remembered them, I will destroy them,

original: rtsa ba dang bcas pa brlag par bya'o //
analyzed: rtsa ba dang bcas pa brlag par bya'o //
translated: I will annihilate them along with their roots.

original: rang gi don te kho la dang bran nyid yin te /
analyzed: rang gi don te kho la dang bran nyid yin te /
translated: My own aim is to be his servant,

original: dus thams cad du de'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dus thams cad du de'i dbang du gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because I am under his control at all times.

original: de ltar na rang gi sems de la drag tu bsnun nas slar yang zhi ba'i rim pas bslab par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar na rang gi sems de la drag tu bsnun nas slar yang zhi ba'i rim pas bslab par bya ba'i phyir de'i tshe bdag ni zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Thus, having struck one's mind with that, again, in order to train in the sequence of peace, he says, at that time, I am...

original: gal te khyod bdag nyid yun ring po nges par legs pa 'dod pa'i yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid la dga' bar mi bya ste spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: gal te khyod bdag nyid yun ring po nges par legs pa 'dod pa'i yin na de'i tshe bdag nyid la dga' bar mi bya ste spang bar bya'o zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: If you are one who definitely desires your own welfare for a long time, then at that time you should not delight in yourself, you should abandon it, is the meaning of the verse.

original: gzhan du na bdag nyid la dga' ba nyid du byas par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bdag nyid la dga' ba nyid du byas par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Otherwise, you will not have made yourself into one who delights in himself.

original: gal te yang bdag nyid la khyod kyis 'jigs pa thams cad las bsrung ba'i blo yod na de'i tshe lus 'di bsrung bar rigs so zhes rang gi sems la brjod do //🔽ci ste de @181b lta na yang 'di la rjes su gzung bar bya bar rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
analyzed: gal te yang bdag nyid la khyod kyis 'jigs pa thams cad las bsrung ba'i blo yod na de'i tshe lus 'di bsrung bar rigs so zhes rang gi sems la brjod do // ci ste de @181b lta na yang 'di la rjes su gzung bar bya bar rigs pa nyid do zhe na /
translated: And if you have the idea that you should protect yourself from all fears, then it is right to protect this body.🔽But if you think that it is right to care for it in that way,

original: ci lta ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci lta ji ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then the verse beginning “How can it be right to care for it?” is stated.

original: 'di ni zhes pa ni rang bzhin phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i lus so //
analyzed: 'di ni zhes pa ni rang bzhin phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i lus so //
translated: “This” refers to the body, which has become perverted in its nature.

original: ci lta ci ltar te rnam pa gang dang gang gis ci srid de srid du de dang de'i bde ba'i yo byad bsgrubs pas 'phel bar byed par 'dod pa ni yongs su skyong bar byed pa yin no //
analyzed: ci lta ci ltar te rnam pa gang dang gang gis ci srid de srid du de dang de'i bde ba'i yo byad bsgrubs pas 'phel bar byed par 'dod pa ni yongs su skyong bar byed pa yin no //
translated: Whatever way, whatever manner, whatever extent, to that extent, by the accomplishment of the requisites of happiness, one wishes to increase, to protect.

original: de lta de ltar shin tu ni rang bzhin shin tu gzhon par gyur pas ltung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
analyzed: de lta de ltar shin tu ni rang bzhin shin tu gzhon par gyur pas ltung bar 'gyur ba nyid de /
translated: In that way, in that manner, very much, by the extreme youthfulness of the nature, there is the very falling itself.

original: rnam pa thams cad du las thams cad la las su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam pa thams cad du las thams cad la las su mi rung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In every way, in all actions, there is unfitness for action.

original: ci ste gal te lhung na yang lhung du chug mod nyams pa ci yod de /
analyzed: ci ste gal te lhung na yang lhung du chug mod nyams pa ci yod de /
translated: But if, if it falls, let it fall. What is the loss?

original: de ltar na yang mngon par 'dod pa thams cad du 'gyur ba las ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang mngon par 'dod pa thams cad du 'gyur ba las ldog par 'gyur ro zhe na /
translated: Even so, there is the turning away from all that is desired, from action.

original: 'di ni de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In response to that, “This” and so on is stated.

original: 'di zhes pa ni lus yin la /
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni lus yin la /
translated: “This” is the body.

original: de ltar zhes pa ni bde ba 'dod pa ste ltung bar gyur pa nas gzhi 'di dag thams cad ni 'dzam gling 'di thams cad do //
analyzed: de ltar zhes pa ni bde ba 'dod pa ste ltung bar gyur pa nas gzhi 'di dag thams cad ni 'dzam gling 'di thams cad do //
translated: “In that way” is the desire for happiness. “Having fallen” is all of these bases. “This entire world” is the entire Rose-Apple Land.

original: 'dod pa chog pa med pa ni 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa yin la /
analyzed: 'dod pa chog pa med pa ni 'dod pa ste mngon par 'dod pa yin la /
translated: Desire is the wish for something that is not yet obtained.

original: chog par 'gyur ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
analyzed: chog par 'gyur ba'i nus pa dang ldan pa ma yin te /
translated: One is not able to be satisfied.

original: dper na rgyal po nga las nu 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag por gyur pas ngoms par ma gyur nas yang gling bzhi'i bdag po thob par gyur cing brgya byin gyi stan phyed thob pa las kyang chog pa med pa bzhin no //
analyzed: dper na rgyal po nga las nu 'dzam bu'i gling gi bdag por gyur pas ngoms par ma gyur nas yang gling bzhi'i bdag po thob par gyur cing brgya byin gyi stan phyed thob pa las kyang chog pa med pa bzhin no //
translated: For example, King Mandhatr, having become the lord of Jambudvipa, was not satisfied and then became the lord of the four continents and obtained half of Sakra's throne, but he was not satisfied.

original: gang gi phyir da ltar su zhig ste dgang dka' ba'i lus 'di 'dod pa byed par 'gyur te ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir da ltar su zhig ste dgang dka' ba'i lus 'di 'dod pa byed par 'gyur te ma yin no //
translated: Why would anyone desire this body, which is difficult to fill?

original: ji ltar shin tu thal ches pa ni mi rigs la /
analyzed: ji ltar shin tu thal ches pa ni mi rigs la /
translated: How is it unreasonable to desire something that is completely impossible?

original: cung zad tsam gyi skabs yin pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
analyzed: cung zad tsam gyi skabs yin pa la nyes pa ci yod ce na /
translated: What is wrong with desiring something that is possible?

original: mi nus 'dod la zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: mi nus 'dod la zhen pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, Attachment to desire, etc. is impossible.

original: rnyed par dka' zhing mi nus par 'dod de mngon par 'dod na nyon mongs pa ste ma lus pa'i mngon par zhen pa dang / de thob pa'i gegs byed pa la zhe sdang ba dang / bsam pa nyams pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rnyed par dka' zhing mi nus par 'dod de mngon par 'dod na nyon mongs pa ste ma lus pa'i mngon par zhen pa dang / de thob pa'i gegs byed pa la zhe sdang ba dang / bsam pa nyams pa yang 'byung bar 'gyur te /
translated: If one desires to attain what is difficult to attain and impossible, then one will have affliction, i.e., complete attachment, and one will have hatred for the obstacles to attaining it.🔽One will also have a degenerated attitude.

original: de las yid mi bde bar 'gyur ram bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de las yid mi bde bar 'gyur ram bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: This is the idea.

original: cung zad tsam la rjes su zhugs nas slar yang gong nas gong du lhag pa mngon par 'dod pa la 'jug pas bzlog par mi nus pa'i 'dod pa 'phel ba yang yin te /
analyzed: cung zad tsam la rjes su zhugs nas slar yang gong nas gong du lhag pa mngon par 'dod pa la 'jug pas bzlog par mi nus pa'i 'dod pa 'phel ba yang yin te /
translated: Having engaged in a little, one again engages in the desire for higher and higher excellence, and so one cannot stop the increase of desire.

original: sred pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa 'di tsam zhes pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sred pa la nges pa med pa'i phyir 'dod pa 'di tsam zhes pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Since craving is uncertain, there is no desire for this much.

original: slar yang gang zhig dang po nyid du rnam pa thams cad du yul thams cad la skabs med par byas na de'i phun sum tshogs pa ma zhum pa ma yin te /
analyzed: slar yang gang zhig dang po nyid du rnam pa thams cad du yul thams cad la skabs med par byas na de'i phun sum tshogs pa ma zhum pa ma yin te /
translated: Again, if one from the beginning makes no opportunity for any object in any way, then his excellence is not depressed.

original: yi gar mi @182a * //
analyzed: yi gar mi @182a * //
translated: He does not delight in it.

original: 'ong ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / de la sems 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'ong ba skyed par byed pa'i phyir dang / de la sems 'jug par mi byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it generates the coming, and because the mind does not engage in that.

original: gang gi phyir cung zad la yang 'dod pas tshim pa med pa nyid yin pa de lta bas na lus kyi 'dod pa 'phel ba'i phyir skabs dbye bar mi bya'o ste /
analyzed: gang gi phyir cung zad la yang 'dod pas tshim pa med pa nyid yin pa de lta bas na lus kyi 'dod pa 'phel ba'i phyir skabs dbye bar mi bya'o ste /
translated: Since there is no satisfaction whatsoever with desire, therefore one should not open the door for the increase of bodily desire.

original: ci ste yul dam pa de lta bu las sems ji ltar bzlog par mi nus she na /
analyzed: ci ste yul dam pa de lta bu las sems ji ltar bzlog par mi nus she na /
translated: But if one is not able to turn the mind away from such an excellent object,

original: gang gis yid 'ong zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gang gis yid 'ong zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: then one should say, “By whom is the attractive . . . ” and so on.

original: sngar 'di nyid du brjod pa /🔽rang nyid kyis ni 'gro nyid la //
analyzed: sngar 'di nyid du brjod pa / rang nyid kyis ni 'gro nyid la //
translated: This was already said above:🔽“One should understand that one’s own going

original: brten par byas te rab tu rtogs //
analyzed: brten par byas te rab tu rtogs //
translated: is based on the earth.”

original: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes gang gsungs pa'o //
translated: This is what was said.

original: gzhan yang gang 'dod par bya ba nyid mi 'dzin pa de nyid ni dngos po bzang po yin te /
analyzed: gzhan yang gang 'dod par bya ba nyid mi 'dzin pa de nyid ni dngos po bzang po yin te /
translated: Moreover, that which is not grasped as an object of desire is itself an excellent thing,

original: gzhan du na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po nyid 'phel bar 'gyur ro //
translated: otherwise there would be an increase in the mass of suffering.

original: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du mi bden pa la mngon par zhen pas bdag gis sdug bsngal bsag par bya ba yin zhes khyod rang nyid kyis dpyad par bya'o zhes /
analyzed: gzhan yang rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du mi bden pa la mngon par zhen pas bdag gis sdug bsngal bsag par bya ba yin zhes khyod rang nyid kyis dpyad par bya'o zhes /
translated: Moreover, you should examine yourself, thinking, “I have accumulated suffering because of my attachment to what is not true, without any reason.”

original: tha mar thal ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽tha mar thal pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
analyzed: tha mar thal ba'i zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / tha mar thal pa'i gnas skabs yin la /
translated: In the end, it is reduced to ashes, etc.🔽In the end, it is reduced to ashes.

original: mthar gtugs pa ni de la thug pa yin te /
analyzed: mthar gtugs pa ni de la thug pa yin te /
translated: The final state is reduced to that.

original: 'di gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
analyzed: 'di gang gi yin pa de la de skad ces bya'o //
translated: That which has that is so-called.

original: shi bar gyur pa na lus po 'di'i mthar thug pa ni tha mar thal ba yin te /
analyzed: shi bar gyur pa na lus po 'di'i mthar thug pa ni tha mar thal ba yin te /
translated: When it dies, the final state of this body is reduced to ashes.

original: de las gzhan pa'i rten yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i rten yod pa ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that there is no other basis than that.

original: mi gtsang lus 'di lus kyi rnam pa gzung ba yin la /
analyzed: mi gtsang lus 'di lus kyi rnam pa gzung ba yin la /
translated: This impure body is grasped as a bodily form.

original: mi bzad pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'am 'jigs par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: mi bzad pa ni 'jigs su rung ba'am 'jigs par byed pa yin te /
translated: It is unbearable, frightening, or terrifying.

original: 'jigs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jigs pa thams cad kyi rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is the cause of all fear.

original: mi g-yo ba ni bong ba dang shing lta bu yin no //
analyzed: mi g-yo ba ni bong ba dang shing lta bu yin no //
translated: It is motionless, like a lump of earth or wood.

original: rang nyid byed pa med pa yin na 'di 'gro ba dang 'chag pa la sogs par cir 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: rang nyid byed pa med pa yin na 'di 'gro ba dang 'chag pa la sogs par cir 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is devoid of activity, what is it that moves and walks, etc.?

original: gzhan gyis bskyod pa yin te /
analyzed: gzhan gyis bskyod pa yin te /
translated: It is moved by another.

original: gzhan yid kyis byed pas 'di bya ba dang ldan pa bzhin du dmigs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yid kyis byed pas 'di bya ba dang ldan pa bzhin du dmigs pa yin no //
translated: Since it is made to act by another, i.e., by the mind, it is observed to be endowed with activity.

original: zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir rgyu cis lus po 'di la bdag tu 'dzin te rjes su 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhen pa'i rgyu mtshan med pa'i phyir rgyu cis lus po 'di la bdag tu 'dzin te rjes su 'jug pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: What is the reason for clinging to this body as “I,” since it is devoid of a reason for clinging?

original: gzhan 'di yang khyod kyis dpyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: gzhan 'di yang khyod kyis dpyad par bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that this should be investigated, he says:

original: ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Why, etc.

original: 'khrul 'khor 'di ste lus kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
analyzed: 'khrul 'khor 'di ste lus kyi bdag nyid kyis so //
translated: This machine, i.e., the body, is by its very nature.

original: gson pa'am shi ba yang rung ste /
analyzed: gson pa'am shi ba yang rung ste /
translated: Whether alive or dead,

original: bdag la ci zhig bya ste /
analyzed: bdag la ci zhig bya ste /
translated: what is it to the self?

original: bdag las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dir rang nyid la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: bdag las tha dad pa yin pa'i phyir dang / 'dir rang nyid la bya ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Since it is different from the self and since it is devoid of activity in this regard,

original: de'i phyir bong ba la sogs pa dang khyad phar ci @182b yod do zhes ston par byed do //
analyzed: de'i phyir bong ba la sogs pa dang khyad phar ci @182b yod do zhes ston par byed do //
translated: what is the difference between it and a clod of earth, etc.?

original: 'on te bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid kyis khyad yod do zhe na /
analyzed: 'on te bdag tu 'dzin pa'i gzhi nyid kyis khyad yod do zhe na /
translated: But if you say that there is a difference because of the very basis of the conception of self,

original: 'dir gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'dir gsungs pa /
translated: here it is said:

original: kyi hud nga rgyal sel mi byed de /
analyzed: kyi hud nga rgyal sel mi byed de /
translated: Alas! You do not eliminate pride,

original: 'di ltar brtags na yang yun ring po nas 'dris par gyur pa'i phyir ro /
analyzed: 'di ltar brtags na yang yun ring po nas 'dris par gyur pa'i phyir ro /
translated: because, although you examine it, you have been familiar with it for a long time.

original: khyod ji ltar 'jigs par mi byed cing ji ltar yang brlag par mi byed ces ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: khyod ji ltar 'jigs par mi byed cing ji ltar yang brlag par mi byed ces ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: How is it that you do not fear it and how is it that you do not destroy it? This is the meaning.

original: de nyid bstan par 'dod nas /
analyzed: de nyid bstan par 'dod nas /
translated: Desiring to teach just that,

original: lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says “body” and so on.

original: 'di ni bdag gi lus yin no zhes /
analyzed: 'di ni bdag gi lus yin no zhes /
translated: “This is my body”

original: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pas khyod kyi rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung po nga rgyal la sogs par byed /
analyzed: bdag tu 'dzin pa'i mngon par zhen pas khyod kyi rgyu mtshan med pa nyid du sdug bsngal gyi phung po nga rgyal la sogs par byed /
translated: is the manifest clinging to the conception of self. You make it the basis of the suffering aggregates, such as pride, without any reason.

original: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar brjod ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir 'di ltar brjod ce na /
translated: Again, why is it said in this way?

original: rjes su chags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rjes su chags pa dang zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: He says “attachment” and so on.

original: bong ba dang 'dra ba'i lus po 'di la rgyu mtshan med par zhe sdang ste khong khro ba dang / rjes su chags pa ste mngon par zhen pas ci zhig bya ste cung zad kyang ma yin no //
analyzed: bong ba dang 'dra ba'i lus po 'di la rgyu mtshan med par zhe sdang ste khong khro ba dang / rjes su chags pa ste mngon par zhen pas ci zhig bya ste cung zad kyang ma yin no //
translated: What is the point of being angry or hostile toward this body, which is like a clod of earth, or of being attached to it, that is, of being infatuated with it? Nothing at all!🔽Why is it so?

original: ci'i phyir yang 'di ltar yin zhe na /🔽bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: ci'i phyir yang 'di ltar yin zhe na / bdag gis zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: It is said:🔽Since it is protected and nourished in this way,

original: 'di ltar thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i rnam pas bskyangs shing gsos pa'am /🔽bya rgod dang ce sbyang la sogs pa rnams kyis za ba na yang phan pa med pa de la chags par byed /
analyzed: 'di ltar thams cad rjes su gzung ba'i rnam pas bskyangs shing gsos pa'am / bya rgod dang ce sbyang la sogs pa rnams kyis za ba na yang phan pa med pa de la chags par byed /
translated: in all circumstances,🔽why be attached to it, which is useless,🔽or hostile to those who eat it,

original: gnod par byed pa'i bya rgod la sogs pa rnams la yang gang la zhe sdang ba med pa'o //
analyzed: gnod par byed pa'i bya rgod la sogs pa rnams la yang gang la zhe sdang ba med pa'o //
translated: such as vultures and jackals?

original: de lta bu shing dang mtshungs pa sems med pa de nyid la chags par byed /
analyzed: de lta bu shing dang mtshungs pa sems med pa de nyid la chags par byed /
translated: Why be attached to that very thing, which is like a log of wood, which is mindless?

original: shing dang mtshungs pa nyid du bstan nas /
analyzed: shing dang mtshungs pa nyid du bstan nas /
translated: Having taught that it is like a log of wood,

original: de ma bzung bas 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ma bzung bas 'bras bu dang bcas par bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to teach that it is fruitful because it is not grasped,🔽it is said:

original: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽lus bdag gir ma byas shing spangs pa las khro ba ste zhe sdang ba 'di la med pa dang gang la yang mchod pa ste bsnyen bkur byas pas mgu ba ste /
analyzed: gang zhig ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te / lus bdag gir ma byas shing spangs pa las khro ba ste zhe sdang ba 'di la med pa dang gang la yang mchod pa ste bsnyen bkur byas pas mgu ba ste /
translated: The verse beginning with “To whom” and so forth.

original: rab tu dga' ba bdag la skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba bdag la skye bar 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: Since the body is not taken as “mine” and is abandoned, there is no anger, that is, hostility, toward it. And since it is not worshipped, that is, revered, by anyone, there is no delight, that is, joy, in it.

original: de nyid la sems med pa'i phyir mi shes pa yin te /
analyzed: de nyid la sems med pa'i phyir mi shes pa yin te /
translated: Because it is devoid of mind, it is ignorant,

original: rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: that is, it does not understand.

original: de la brten nas khong khro ba dang rjes su chags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ngal zhing dub pas gang la byas pas bdag la cung zad kyang dgos pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de la brten nas khong khro ba dang rjes su chags pa'i bdag nyid kyis ngal zhing dub pas gang la byas pas bdag la cung zad kyang dgos pa med do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Since it is based on that, it is exhausted by the nature of anger and attachment. Therefore, since it is done, there is no need for me in the least. This is the meaning.

original: de ltar khyed kyis bslab par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar khyed kyis bslab par bya'o //
translated: Thus, you should train.

original: de ltar rang gi sems rtogs par byas nas bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i rang bzhin mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir /🔽gang zhig lus 'di zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de ltar rang gi sems rtogs par byas nas bdag dang gzhan du brje ba'i rang bzhin mjug bsdus te bstan pa'i phyir / gang zhig lus 'di zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Having understood one’s mind in that way, the nature of exchanging oneself and others is summarized and taught.🔽The verse beginning with “To whom” and so forth.

original: 'di zhes @183a * //
analyzed: 'di zhes @183a * //
translated: This is the body.

original: pa ni bdag gi ste /🔽'ga' zhig gis lus 'dod pa ste phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par 'dod pa'am /
analyzed: pa ni bdag gi ste / 'ga' zhig gis lus 'dod pa ste phan pa dang bde ba bsgrub par 'dod pa'am /
translated: This is mine.

original: yid bde bar mthong ba'o //
analyzed: yid bde bar mthong ba'o //
translated: Someone desires the body, that is, wishes to achieve benefit and happiness, or sees it as a source of pleasure.

original: de yang bdag gi bshes yin te sdug cing chags pa'i yul yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: de yang bdag gi bshes yin te sdug cing chags pa'i yul yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: And that is my friend, that is, an object of affection and attachment.

original: yang gi sgras ni bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gi ma yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni bdag nyid 'ba' zhig gi ma yin no //
translated: The word also means that it is not just one's own.

original: kho bo zhes pa ni rigs pas brtags na mi bden pa nyid do //
analyzed: kho bo zhes pa ni rigs pas brtags na mi bden pa nyid do //
translated: The word I is not really true when examined by reasoning.

original: de lta yin du chu ga na yang gzhan dang yang thun mong yin no zhes rigs pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de lta yin du chu ga na yang gzhan dang yang thun mong yin no zhes rigs pa nye bar bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Even if that were so, it is shared with others. In order to demonstrate this reasoning, he says:

original: thams cad rang gi lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: thams cad rang gi lus zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: All of them desire their own body.

original: gal te rang gi lus la rjes su chags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhan pa gzhan te de las gzhan pa'i sems can yang rang gi lus 'dod do //
analyzed: gal te rang gi lus la rjes su chags pa'i rgyu mtshan gyis zhan pa gzhan te de las gzhan pa'i sems can yang rang gi lus 'dod do //
translated: If it is the case that other people, that is, sentient beings other than oneself, desire one's own body because of attachment to one's own body,

original: brjod pa'i rim pa rgyu mtshan la khyad par med pas de rnams la bdag ci'i phyir mi dga' ste /
analyzed: brjod pa'i rim pa rgyu mtshan la khyad par med pas de rnams la bdag ci'i phyir mi dga' ste /
translated: then why do I not like them? There is no difference in the reason for the expression.

original: bdag la ni rgyu'i khyad par sngar nyid du bsal ba'i phyir de rnams la yang bdag dga' bar rigs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bdag la ni rgyu'i khyad par sngar nyid du bsal ba'i phyir de rnams la yang bdag dga' bar rigs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that it is fitting for me to delight in them, since the special cause has already been removed.

original: da ni bstan pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni bstan pa'i don mjug bsdu ba'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to conclude the meaning of the teaching,

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “Therefore,” and so on.

original: gang gi phyir bdag la zhen pa ma spangs par 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed mi nus pa'i spobs pa med pa thams cad kyi thams cad la ltos pa spangs pas so //
analyzed: gang gi phyir bdag la zhen pa ma spangs par 'gro ba'i don rdzogs par byed mi nus pa'i spobs pa med pa thams cad kyi thams cad la ltos pa spangs pas so //
translated: Since one is unable to accomplish the welfare of beings without abandoning attachment to self, one should abandon all concern for oneself.

original: 'gro la phan pa zhes pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa bsgrub pa'i don du gang las 'gro ba la phan pa dang ldan pa des na lus po 'di la nyes pa mang yang ste /
analyzed: 'gro la phan pa zhes pa ni sems can thams cad la phan pa bsgrub pa'i don du gang las 'gro ba la phan pa dang ldan pa des na lus po 'di la nyes pa mang yang ste /
translated: “For the sake of beings” means that one should take up this body, which is full of faults, for the sake of accomplishing the welfare of all sentient beings.

original: nyes pa du ma'i gnas yin yang las byed pa'i spyad bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
analyzed: nyes pa du ma'i gnas yin yang las byed pa'i spyad bzhin du gzung bar bya ste /
translated: Even though it is a locus of many faults, it should be taken up, like a tool for doing work.

original: gzhag par bya ba'am bsrung bar bya ste dgos pa'i don la mkho ba'i dngos po bzhin du'o //
analyzed: gzhag par bya ba'am bsrung bar bya ste dgos pa'i don la mkho ba'i dngos po bzhin du'o //
translated: It should be sustained, or protected, like a thing that is necessary for a purpose.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: bsam pa gzhan ni kun btang ste /
analyzed: bsam pa gzhan ni kun btang ste /
translated: All other thoughts are given up.

original: bdag gi sems ni mchog gcig bus //
analyzed: bdag gi sems ni mchog gcig bus //
translated: With a single thought I will

original: zhes pa la sogs pa de mjug bsdu ba'i phyir des na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa de mjug bsdu ba'i phyir des na zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: In order to conclude that, he says, Therefore, etc.

original: gang la sems mnyam par gzhag pa med na nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba des na 'jig rten gyi spyod pas chog ste dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang la sems mnyam par gzhag pa med na nyon mongs pa spong bar mi 'gyur ba des na 'jig rten gyi spyod pas chog ste dgos pa cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Since there is no abandonment of afflictions without the mind being set in equipoise, worldly conduct is not enough, and it is not necessary at all.

original: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni don med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi spyod pa ni don med pa'i rgyu yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because worldly conduct is the cause of meaninglessness.

original: de'i phyir mkhas pa ste de kho na nyid mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de las gzhan de'i bstan pa la gnas pa rnams kyi rjes su bsnyegs te de'i bslab pa la rjes su slob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir mkhas pa ste de kho na nyid mkhyen pa'i sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams dang / de las gzhan de'i bstan pa la gnas pa rnams kyi rjes su bsnyegs te de'i bslab pa la rjes su slob bo //
translated: Therefore, following the wise, the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas who know reality, and those who abide in their teachings, the wise should train in their precepts.

original: ji @183b ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji @183b ltar zhe na /
translated: How?

original: bag yod gtam ni dran byas nas te /
analyzed: bag yod gtam ni dran byas nas te /
translated: Having remembered the discourse on heedfulness.

original: le 'u bzhi pa dang bdun par brjod pa dang / gzhan yang bslab pa kun las btus pa la sogs par brjod pa'o //
analyzed: le 'u bzhi pa dang bdun par brjod pa dang / gzhan yang bslab pa kun las btus pa la sogs par brjod pa'o //
translated: and in the fourth and seventh chapters, and also in the Siksasamuccaya, etc.

original: bag med pa ni lus dang sems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin la de las bzlog pa ni bag yod pa yin te /
analyzed: bag med pa ni lus dang sems kyi rnam par g-yeng ba yin la de las bzlog pa ni bag yod pa yin te /
translated: Carelessness is the distraction of body and mind. The opposite of that is heedfulness.

original: de la bag yod pa'i don du bag med pa bzlog pa'i gtam ste /
analyzed: de la bag yod pa'i don du bag med pa bzlog pa'i gtam ste /
translated: The story of the reversal of carelessness for the sake of heedfulness is there.

original: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung dran par byas nas te sems la bzhag nas ji ltar brtsams pa'i don la 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ston par byed pa'i gzhung dran par byas nas te sems la bzhag nas ji ltar brtsams pa'i don la 'khrul par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Having remembered the text which teaches that, having placed it in the mind, one does not err in the meaning of what is to be composed.

original: gnyid dang rmugs pa zlog par byed la /
analyzed: gnyid dang rmugs pa zlog par byed la /
translated: One should reverse sleep and torpor.

original: rmugs pa ni lus po zhum pa yin te /
analyzed: rmugs pa ni lus po zhum pa yin te /
