translated: Torpor is the sinking of the body.

original: le lo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: le lo zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: It is a synonym for laziness.

original: gnyid ni gnyid kyis sems dman par byas pa yin la /
analyzed: gnyid ni gnyid kyis sems dman par byas pa yin la /
translated: Sleep is the depression of the mind by sleep.

original: de bzlog pa na mkhas pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: de bzlog pa na mkhas pa'i rjes su 'brang bar bya'o zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: When one reverses that, one should follow the wise.

original: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas mnyam par gzhag pa la gcig tu gzhol bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de ltar mnyam par gzhag pa la mi mthun pa'i phyogs spangs nas mnyam par gzhag pa la gcig tu gzhol bar bya'o zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to demonstrate that, having abandoned the adverse conditions to meditative equipoise, one should be intent on meditative equipoise,

original: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
analyzed: de bas zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te ;
translated: [the Bhagavān] declares, “Therefore, having abandoned the obscurations . . . ” and so on.

original: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa yin la /
analyzed: sgrib pa ni nyon mongs pa la sogs pa yin la /
translated: “ Obscurations” are afflictions and so on.

original: bsal ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis de dag spong bar 'dod pa ste /
analyzed: bsal ba ni 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis de dag spong bar 'dod pa ste /
translated: “ Abandoning” them is the desire to abandon them in the manner that will be explained.

original: mnyam par gzhag pa ste zhi gnas la 'brel par bya'o //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa ste zhi gnas la 'brel par bya'o //
translated: One should be “in meditative equipoise,” that is, in śamatha.

original: rnam pa gang gis she na /
analyzed: rnam pa gang gis she na /
translated: By what sort of aspect?

original: log pa'i lam las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: log pa'i lam las zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares, “from the wrong path . . . ” and so on.

original: sngar brjod pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams las so //
analyzed: sngar brjod pa'i 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa rnams las so //
translated: From the previously mentioned discursive thoughts of desire and so on.

original: yang na log pa'i lam ni le lo la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la brjod de /
analyzed: yang na log pa'i lam ni le lo la sogs pa'i nyon mongs pa rnams la brjod de /
translated: Alternatively, the “wrong path” is said to be the afflictions such as laziness.

original: ji ltar mdor bsdus na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa ni rnam pa drug yin te /
analyzed: ji ltar mdor bsdus na ting nge 'dzin thams cad kyi nyes pa ni rnam pa drug yin te /
translated: In brief, the faults of all samādhis are of six kinds.

original: le lo dang / dmigs pa la brjod nges pa dang / bying pa dang ; rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba'o //
analyzed: le lo dang / dmigs pa la brjod nges pa dang / bying pa dang ; rgod pa dang / mi rtsol ba dang / rtsol ba'o //
translated: Laziness, forgetting the instruction, laxity and excitement, lack of application, and application.

original: 'di rnams kyi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom par bya ba yin te /
analyzed: 'di rnams kyi gnyen po spong ba'i 'du byed bsgom par bya ba yin te /
translated: The antidotes to these are the applications of mindfulness, the right exertions, the bases of psychic power, the faculties, and the powers.

original: 'di ltar dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang btang snyoms rnams so //
analyzed: 'di ltar dad pa dang / 'dun pa dang / rtsol ba dang / shin tu sbyangs pa dang / dran pa dang / shes bzhin dang / sems pa dang btang snyoms rnams so //
translated: They are faith, will, effort, pliancy, mindfulness, vigilance, intention, and equanimity.

original: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po'o //
analyzed: de la dang po bzhi ni le lo'i gnyen po'o //
translated: The first four are antidotes to laziness.

original: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa de la mngon par 'dod pa skye la /
analyzed: 'di ltar ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan rnams la mngon par yid ches pa'i mtshan nyid kyi dad pas rnal 'byor pa de la mngon par 'dod pa skye la /
translated: Thus, through faith, which has the nature of clarity about the good qualities of meditative concentration, the practitioner gives rise to longing.

original: mngon par 'dod pa de las brtson 'grus rtsom zhing /
analyzed: mngon par 'dod pa de las brtson 'grus rtsom zhing /
translated: From longing, effort is aroused.

original: brtson 'grus kyi stobs de las lus dang sems @184a * //🔽las su rung ba sgrub par byed de /
analyzed: brtson 'grus kyi stobs de las lus dang sems @184a * // las su rung ba sgrub par byed de /
translated: From the power of effort, physical and mental pliancy are achieved.

original: de las ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i lus dang sems yin te /
analyzed: de las ni shin tu sbyangs pa'i lus dang sems yin te /
translated: From that, the body and mind are pliable.

original: le lo zlog par byed do //
analyzed: le lo zlog par byed do //
translated: It wards off laziness.

original: des na dad pa la sogs pa rnams le lo spang ba'i ched du bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: des na dad pa la sogs pa rnams le lo spang ba'i ched du bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Therefore, faith, etc. should be cultivated in order to eliminate laziness.

original: dran pa la dmigs pa ni brjed pa'i gnyen po yin la /
analyzed: dran pa la dmigs pa ni brjed pa'i gnyen po yin la /
translated: The object of mindfulness is the antidote to forgetfulness.

original: shes bzhin ni bying pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
analyzed: shes bzhin ni bying pa dang rgod pa'i gnyen po yin te /
translated: Awareness is the antidote to laxity and excitement,

original: yang dag pa'i yon tan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i yon tan nye bar mtshon pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it reveals the true qualities.

original: bying ba dang rgod pa'i rab tu zhi ba'i dus na yang mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
analyzed: bying ba dang rgod pa'i rab tu zhi ba'i dus na yang mi rtsol ba nyes pa yin te /
translated: When laxity and excitement are pacified, non-exertion is a fault.

original: de'i gnyen por bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi ba na sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i gnyen por bying ba dang rgod pa rab tu zhi ba na sems pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The antidote to that is the cultivation of intention when laxity and excitement are pacified.

original: gang gi tshe sems gdul dka' ba de'i tshe rtsol pa nyes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems gdul dka' ba de'i tshe rtsol pa nyes pa yin no //
translated: When the mind is difficult to tame, exertion is a fault.

original: da ni de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: da ni de'i gnyen por btang snyoms bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The antidote to that is the cultivation of equanimity.

original: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: spong ba'i 'du byed brgyad po 'di rnams dang ldan pa'i ting nge 'dzin mchog tu las su rung bar 'gyur ro zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: The concentration endowed with these eight formative factors of abandonment becomes supremely serviceable.

original: de ltar 'di'i phyir log pa'i lam las sems blan te bzlog nas so //
analyzed: de ltar 'di'i phyir log pa'i lam las sems blan te bzlog nas so //
translated: Thus, it is the turning back of the mind from the wrong path.

original: 'dis ni dam pa'i las kyi sbyor ba bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'dis ni dam pa'i las kyi sbyor ba bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains the application of the practice of the holy.

original: rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /
analyzed: rang bzhin ci yin zhe na /
translated: What is its nature?

original: yang dag dmigs la rtag pa ste /
analyzed: yang dag dmigs la rtag pa ste /
translated: It is constant in the right object.

original: gang cung zad dmigs pa mdor bsdus pas sam rgyas pas sems kyi nges pa de la brtan pa yin te /
analyzed: gang cung zad dmigs pa mdor bsdus pas sam rgyas pas sems kyi nges pa de la brtan pa yin te /
translated: It is firm in the ascertainment of the mind, whether in brief or in detail, in whatever object is apprehended.

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems par mchod par te de'i bar chod dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi sems par mchod par te de'i bar chod dang bral ba zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go ;
translated: It is not shaken by the mind of resistance. The meaning is that it is free from its obstacles.

original: /'dis ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin brjod do //
analyzed: /'dis ni mnyam par gzhag pa'i rang bzhin brjod do //
translated: This explains the nature of meditative concentration.

original: sems rtse gcig pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir /
translated: It is the nature of one-pointedness of mind.

original: rgyan mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba yang brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: rgyan mi 'chad pa'i sbyor ba yang brjod pa yin no //
translated: It also explains the application of the uninterrupted ornament.

original: zhi gnas bsgom pa bsgrub pa'i rim pa 'di yang ka ma la sh'i la'i bsgom pa'i rim pa las gsal bar bstan te /
analyzed: zhi gnas bsgom pa bsgrub pa'i rim pa 'di yang ka ma la sh'i la'i bsgom pa'i rim pa las gsal bar bstan te /
translated: This stage of the practice of the cultivation of serenity is clearly taught in the Stages of Meditation in the Ornament of the Mahāyāna Sūtras.

original: der brjod pa ni 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi chogs rnams la gnas nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byas nas /
analyzed: der brjod pa ni 'di ltar tshul khrims la sogs pa zhi gnas kyi chogs rnams la gnas nas yid dang rjes su mthun pa'i gnas rnams su sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams la phyag 'tshal ba la sogs pa byas nas /
translated: To explain this, first, having remained in the collection of calm abiding and so forth, in places that are suitable for the mind, one should pay homage to the Buddhas and Bodhisattvas and so forth.

original: sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba yang byas te 'gro ba mtha' dag gdon pa'i bsam pas snying rje chen po nyid mngon du byas te /
analyzed: sdig pa bshags pa dang bsod nams la rjes su yi rang ba yang byas te 'gro ba mtha' dag gdon pa'i bsam pas snying rje chen po nyid mngon du byas te /
translated: Having confessed one's sins and rejoiced in the merit, one should manifest great compassion with the intention to liberate all beings.

original: bde ba'i stan la 'dug nas lus drang por bsrang ste skyil mo krung bcas nas ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
analyzed: bde ba'i stan la 'dug nas lus drang por bsrang ste skyil mo krung bcas nas ting nge 'dzin bskyed par bya'o //
translated: Having sat on a comfortable seat, straightened one's body, and sat cross-legged, one should generate samādhi.

original: de la dang por re zhig gang dngos po de la dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: de la dang por re zhig gang dngos po de la dpyad par bya ste /
translated: To that end, first one should analyze the thing that is the object of meditation.

original: ji srid du rnam pa gang gis dngos po dngos po @184b mtha' dag bsdus par gyur pa de la sems brtan par bya'o //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam pa gang gis dngos po dngos po @184b mtha' dag bsdus par gyur pa de la sems brtan par bya'o //
translated: One should stabilize the mind on that thing, by whatever aspect, for as long as it includes all things.

original: yang mdor bsdus na dngos po thams cad ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: yang mdor bsdus na dngos po thams cad ni gzugs dang gzugs med pa'i dbye bas rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, all things are of two kinds, divided into form and that which is not form.

original: de la yang las dang po pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir re zhig mdor bsdus pa la dmigs par rigs so //
analyzed: de la yang las dang po pa'i rnam par g-yeng ba'i nyes pa spang ba'i phyir re zhig mdor bsdus pa la dmigs par rigs so //
translated: Among them, it is proper to focus on the brief in order to avoid the fault of distraction for a beginner.

original: gal te yid la byed pa dul bar gyur na /
analyzed: gal te yid la byed pa dul bar gyur na /
translated: If mental attention becomes disciplined,

original: de'i tshe phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam par sbyangs te rgyas pa la yang dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
analyzed: de'i tshe phung po dang khams la sogs pa'i dbye bas rnam par sbyangs te rgyas pa la yang dmigs par bya ba nyid do //
translated: then at that time, it is proper to focus on the extensive, which is purified by the divisions of aggregates, media, etc.

original: ji srid du de las nges par byas nas dngos po thams cad bsdus pa de nyid la yang sems kyi rgyun bsdam par bya'o ;
analyzed: ji srid du de las nges par byas nas dngos po thams cad bsdus pa de nyid la yang sems kyi rgyun bsdam par bya'o ;
translated: As long as one is not certain about that, one should bind the stream of mind to just that which includes all things.

original: / gang gi tshe bar skabs su 'dod chags la sogs pas sems kyi phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs par tshor bar byas la /
analyzed: / gang gi tshe bar skabs su 'dod chags la sogs pas sems kyi phyi rol du rnam par g-yengs pa de'i tshe rnam par g-yengs par tshor bar byas la /
translated: When at some time the mind is distracted externally by attachment, etc., then one should notice the distraction,

original: myur du mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar byas nas myur du de nyid la sems phyir zhing 'jug par bya'o ;
analyzed: myur du mi sdug pa bsgom pa la sogs pas rnam par g-yeng ba zhi bar byas nas myur du de nyid la sems phyir zhing 'jug par bya'o ;
translated: Quickly pacifying distraction by meditating on the repulsive, and so on, one should quickly re-engage the mind in that object.

original: / gang gi tshe de la sems mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong ba de la mngon par dga' ba bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: / gang gi tshe de la sems mngon par mi dga' bar mthong ba de'i tshe ting nge 'dzin gyi yon tan mthong ba de la mngon par dga' ba bsgom par bya'o //
translated: When one sees that the mind is not gladdened in that object, then one should cultivate gladdening it by seeing the virtues of samādhi.

original: rnam par g-yeng ba la nyes par mthong bas kyang mi dga' ba rab tu zhi bar bya'o //🔽ci ste rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis non te rgyu ba mi gsal bas sems bying ba'am bying du dogs par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes sangs rgyas kyi yon tan la sogs pa mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pas myur du bying ba
analyzed: rnam par g-yeng ba la nyes par mthong bas kyang mi dga' ba rab tu zhi bar bya'o // ci ste rmugs pa dang gnyid kyis non te rgyu ba mi gsal bas sems bying ba'am bying du dogs par mthong ba de'i tshe snang ba'i 'du shes sangs rgyas kyi yon tan la sogs pa mchog tu dga' ba'i dngos po yid la byed pas myur du bying ba
translated: By seeing the faults of distraction, one should also pacify nongladdening.🔽If one is overcome by lethargy and sleep, and one sees that the mind is slack or in danger of slackness due to unclear mental activity, then one should quickly pacify slackness

original: zhi bar byas la /
analyzed: zhi bar byas la /
translated: by bringing to mind the perception of light and the supreme joys, such as the qualities of the Buddha.

original: yang dmigs pa de kho na nyid shin tu brtan por gzung bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang dmigs pa de kho na nyid shin tu brtan por gzung bar bya'o //
translated: One should then firmly grasp just that object.

original: ci ste gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang rtses pa rjes su dran par gyur pas bar skabs bar skabs su sems 'phyar ba'am /
analyzed: ci ste gang gi tshe sngon dgod pa dang rtses pa rjes su dran par gyur pas bar skabs bar skabs su sems 'phyar ba'am /
translated: But when you recall past laughter and play, your mind is agitated from time to time.🔽

original: rgod du dogs par mthong ba de'i tshe gong ma bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byas la /
analyzed: rgod du dogs par mthong ba de'i tshe gong ma bzhin du mi rtag pa la sogs pa yid 'byung bar 'gyur ba'i dngos po yid la byas la /
translated: But when, by recollecting past laughter and play, the mind becomes agitated or you see that it is about to become agitated, then, as before, bring to mind things that cause you to feel disenchanted, such as impermanence.

original: g-yeng ba zhi bar bya zhing /
analyzed: g-yeng ba zhi bar bya zhing /
translated: Calm the agitation.

original: de nas yang de kho na nyid la sems mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug par 'bad par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas yang de kho na nyid la sems mngon par 'du bya ba med par 'jug par 'bad par bya'o //
translated: Then, strive to rest in the suchness of reality without mental fabrication.

original: gang gi tshe bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral bar gyur nas mnyam par zhugs te /
analyzed: gang gi tshe bying ba dang rgod pa dang bral bar gyur nas mnyam par zhugs te /
translated: When you are free from laxity and excitement and enter into evenness,

original: de kho na nyid de nyid la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug par gyur pa de'i tshe rtsol ba glod de btang snyoms su bya'o //🔽gal te sems mnyam @185a * //
analyzed: de kho na nyid de nyid la sems rang gi ngang gis 'jug par gyur pa de'i tshe rtsol ba glod de btang snyoms su bya'o // gal te sems mnyam @185a * //
translated: and the mind naturally engages that suchness, then relax your effort and remain in equanimity.

original: par zhugs pa la brtsal bar byas na de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: par zhugs pa la brtsal bar byas na de'i tshe sems rnam par g-yeng bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If you make an effort when the mind is in equipoise, then the mind will become distracted.

original: yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas ji ltar 'dod par 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yang gang gi tshe dmigs pa de la mngon par 'du byed pa med par 'jug pas ji ltar 'dod par 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, when one enters into the object of meditation without the application of mental construction, then one enters as one wishes.

original: de'i tshe zhi gnas grub par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de'i tshe zhi gnas grub par rig par bya'o //
translated: At that time, one should know that śamatha has been accomplished.

original: 'di yang zhi gnas thams cad kyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di yang zhi gnas thams cad kyi thun mong gi mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: This is also the common characteristic of all śamatha,

original: sems rtse gcig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sems rtse gcig pa tsam gyi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it has the nature of mere one-pointedness of mind.

original: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yang ma nges pa de nyid yin no zhes rgyas par bshad do //🔽'dis dmigs pa la bar med pa nyid du bshad pa'am /
analyzed: zhi gnas kyi dmigs pa yang ma nges pa de nyid yin no zhes rgyas par bshad do // 'dis dmigs pa la bar med pa nyid du bshad pa'am /
translated: The object of meditation for śamatha is also just that, as explained in detail.🔽This explains the uninterrupted nature of the object of meditation,

original: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba yang bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: mi mthun pa'i phyogs bsal ba yang bstan pa yin no //
translated: or it shows the removal of counteragents.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i dka' 'grel shes rab 'byung gnas blo gros kyis mdzad pa las bsam gtan gyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i spyod pa la 'jug pa'i dka' 'grel shes rab 'byung gnas blo gros kyis mdzad pa las bsam gtan gyi le'u ste brgyad pa'o /
translated: This concludes the eighth chapter of the Bodhisattvacaryāvatāra, on meditation.

original: // /'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: // /'phags pa 'jam dpal gzhon nur gyur pa la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Homage to the noble Mañjuśrī Kumārabhūta!

original: gang dag gos pa med pa nyid kyis spros pa kun spangs bla med go 'phang ldan //
analyzed: gang dag gos pa med pa nyid kyis spros pa kun spangs bla med go 'phang ldan //
translated: Those who are unstained, who have abandoned all conceptual elaboration, who possess the unsurpassed state,

original: shes rab la sogs pha rol phyin par kun rdzob tshig gis brjod de zag pa med //
analyzed: shes rab la sogs pha rol phyin par kun rdzob tshig gis brjod de zag pa med //
translated: Are said to have perfected wisdom and so forth, but only conventionally, in words, for they are without outflows.

original: gang zhig yang dag rtogs pas dri med blo dag mya ngan 'das mchog brnyes de la //
analyzed: gang zhig yang dag rtogs pas dri med blo dag mya ngan 'das mchog brnyes de la //
translated: Those who, through perfect realization, have attained the supreme nirvāṇa, with stainless minds,

original: phyag 'tshal nas ni de yi 'grel par bab tu gsal ba'i tshig gis rim pa bzhin du bya //
analyzed: phyag 'tshal nas ni de yi 'grel par bab tu gsal ba'i tshig gis rim pa bzhin du bya //
translated: Having paid homage to them, I will compose this commentary, clearly and in proper sequence.

original: yon tan gter gyur slob dpon zhi ba'i lha 'dis gang du gsal bar ni //
analyzed: yon tan gter gyur slob dpon zhi ba'i lha 'dis gang du gsal bar ni //
translated: This master Śāntarakṣita, a treasure of good qualities, has clarified

original: gsung rab rgya mtsho chen po'i pha rol son pas brjod par spyod pa yin //
analyzed: gsung rab rgya mtsho chen po'i pha rol son pas brjod par spyod pa yin //
translated: The other shore of the great ocean of scriptures, and so I will speak.

original: blo gros rmongs pa bdag gis de don ji ltar brjod nus de lta na'ang //
analyzed: blo gros rmongs pa bdag gis de don ji ltar brjod nus de lta na'ang //
translated: Though I, with a deluded mind, am incapable of expressing his meaning,🔽Still, since the practice of the unequaled one is well done through the cultivation of wisdom, I will enter into it.

original: shes rab goms pas legs byas gang phyir mnyam med des na de la 'jug / yon tan phra ba 'ga' yi bag chags blo gros med pa ste //
analyzed: shes rab goms pas legs byas gang phyir mnyam med des na de la 'jug / yon tan phra ba 'ga' yi bag chags blo gros med pa ste //
translated: The mind is without understanding, a mere trace of subtle good qualities,

original: bdag la spobs pa'i yon tan bsags pa yod pa ma yin la //
analyzed: bdag la spobs pa'i yon tan bsags pa yod pa ma yin la //
translated: I do not have the good qualities of eloquence.

original: de lta mod kyi gang phyir bshes gnyen dam pa bstan pa yi //
analyzed: de lta mod kyi gang phyir bshes gnyen dam pa bstan pa yi //
translated: Nevertheless, because of the good spiritual teachers,

original: 'bras bu de ltar de lta bu la ngag ni rab tu rgyas //
analyzed: 'bras bu de ltar de lta bu la ngag ni rab tu rgyas //
translated: the fruit of the teaching is like this.

original: de la gang zhig rigs kyi khyad par 'ga' las dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa nyid kyis 'gro ba gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i skye bo ma lus pa sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal phar gyur pa'i srog 'dzin pa thams cad sdug bsngal ma lus pa las gdon
analyzed: de la gang zhig rigs kyi khyad par 'ga' las dge ba'i bshes gnyen bsten pa nyid kyis 'gro ba gsum gyi nang du gtogs pa'i skye bo ma lus pa sdug bsngal gyis sdug bsngal phar gyur pa'i srog 'dzin pa thams cad sdug bsngal ma lus pa las gdon
translated: Among those who have relied on spiritual teachers of some kind, there is not a single being in the three worlds who does not hold life dear, who has not been touched by suffering and who has not formed the intention to save all beings from suffering.

original: pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid kyi @185b sdug bsngal khyad du bsad de /
analyzed: pa'i bsam pas bdag nyid kyi @185b sdug bsngal khyad du bsad de /
translated: They have disregarded their own suffering.

original: de zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa sangs rgyas yin par 'di ltar bsams nas /
analyzed: de zhi ba'i thabs su gyur pa sangs rgyas yin par 'di ltar bsams nas /
translated: They have thought, “The Buddha is the means to achieve that.”

original: de thob par 'dod pas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa sgrub pa'i thabs su gyur pa tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la rim gyis 'jug ste /
analyzed: de thob par 'dod pas byang chub kyi sems bskyed pa'i che ba'i bdag nyid bde bar gshegs pa sgrub pa'i thabs su gyur pa tshogs gnyis yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams la rim gyis 'jug ste /
translated: One who wishes to attain that, having generated the Thought of Enlightenment, in order to complete the two collections as the means of accomplishing the Sugata, the greatness of the self, engages in the sequence of generosity and so forth.

original: de de ltar zhugs pa na zhi gnas dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pas bdag kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa shes rab dang bral ba nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub pa'i rgyus sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin par bsams nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las
analyzed: de de ltar zhugs pa na zhi gnas dang yang dag par ldan par gyur pas bdag kyang sbyin pa la sogs pa shes rab dang bral ba nyid kyis 'gro ba'i don bsgrub pa'i rgyus sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin par bsams nas 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal las
translated: When one engages in that way, having become endowed with calm abiding, one should think, “I will not attain Buddhahood by the cause of accomplishing the welfare of beings through generosity and so forth alone, without wisdom.”

original: nges par 'byung bar 'dod pas shes rab bskyed pa'i don du 'bad par bya ste /
analyzed: nges par 'byung bar 'dod pas shes rab bskyed pa'i don du 'bad par bya ste /
translated: One should strive to generate wisdom in order to attain definite emergence from the suffering of cyclic existence.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //
analyzed: zhi gnas rab tu ldan pa'i lhag mthong gis //
translated: Through insight endowed with calm abiding,

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs pas so //
translated: and so forth.

original: de la zhi gnas bstan nas /
analyzed: de la zhi gnas bstan nas /
translated: Having explained calm abiding,🔽now, insight is explained.

original: da ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i lhag mthong gi ming can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: da ni de'i rjes la thob pa'i lhag mthong gi ming can shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: Now, in order to teach the perfection of wisdom, which is the name of the insight that is attained subsequently to that,

original: yan lag 'di dag thams cad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: yan lag 'di dag thams cad ces pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: he says, “All these branches,” and so on.

original: 'di dag ces pa ni bstan bcos 'dir brjod ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid can sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag ces pa ni bstan bcos 'dir brjod ma thag pa'i mtshan nyid can sbyin pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “ These” refers to generosity and so on, which have just been mentioned in this treatise.

original: 'di zhes pa ni mngon sum du gyur ba nyid la dpyod par byed do //
analyzed: 'di zhes pa ni mngon sum du gyur ba nyid la dpyod par byed do //
translated: “ This” refers to the very thing that is directly perceived.

original: yan lag 'di dag ces pa ni 'khor te ris yin la tshogs zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: yan lag 'di dag ces pa ni 'khor te ris yin la tshogs zhes pa'i tha tshig go //
translated: “ These branches” are the members, which is to say the collection.

original: brjod pa dang rjod pa'i rnam pa dang gzhan yang ste /
analyzed: brjod pa dang rjod pa'i rnam pa dang gzhan yang ste /
translated: “ Expression” is the expressed form, and also something else.

original: shes rab don du thab pas gsungs //
analyzed: shes rab don du thab pas gsungs //
translated: It is taught for the sake of wisdom.

original: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
analyzed: zhes pa dang 'brel to //
translated: This is the connection.

original: shes rab ni ji ltar gnas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la de nyid don yin te /
analyzed: shes rab ni ji ltar gnas pa'i rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid rab tu rnam par 'byed pa'i mtshan nyid can yin la de nyid don yin te /
translated: Wisdom has the characteristic of the thorough differentiation of the thatness of things, which is dependent origination as it abides. That itself is the aim.

original: byang chub kyi rgyu'i dngos po yang dag par 'dren par byed pas gang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag ni dgos pa yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
analyzed: byang chub kyi rgyu'i dngos po yang dag par 'dren par byed pas gang gi sbyin pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid kyi yan lag ni dgos pa yin pa de la de skad ces brjod do //
translated: The limbs of generosity, etc. are its purpose, since they are the means of correctly attracting the entities that are the causes of enlightenment.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po rnams las chos rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i dngos po rnams las chos rnam par 'byed pa'i rang bzhin gyi shes rab gtso bo yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The perfection of wisdom, which has the nature of the differentiation of phenomena, is foremost among the entities of the perfections, generosity, etc.

original: de ltar yang sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa'i phyir rgyu'i dang po yin te /
analyzed: de ltar yang sbyin pa ni sangs rgyas kyi byang chub thob pa'i phyir rgyu'i dang po yin te /
translated: Thus, generosity is the first cause for the attainment of the enlightenment of the Buddhas,

original: bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de yang tshul khrims kyi rgyun du byas pa nyid bde 'gro brgyud par bde ba'i longs spyod kyi nye bar mkho ba phun sum tshogs @186a * //
analyzed: bsod nams kyi tshogs su gtogs pa'i phyir ro // de yang tshul khrims kyi rgyun du byas pa nyid bde 'gro brgyud par bde ba'i longs spyod kyi nye bar mkho ba phun sum tshogs @186a * //
translated: because it belongs to the accumulation of merit.

original: pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas bla na med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
analyzed: pa 'byung bar 'gyur bas bla na med pa'i ye shes 'byung ba'i rgyu yin no //
translated: Moreover, it is the cause of the arising of unsurpassed intuition, since it is the cause of the continuity of morality, and the perfection of the requisites for the happiness of the succession of happy states of existence.

original: bzod pa yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa khong khro'i gnyen po nyid kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyis legs par spyad pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs rjes su skyong bar byed pa yin te bde 'gro nyid thob pa'i ched du rab tu 'jug go //
analyzed: bzod pa yang de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs su gyur pa khong khro'i gnyen po nyid kyis sbyin pa dang tshul khrims kyis legs par spyad pa'i rang bzhin gyi tshogs rjes su skyong bar byed pa yin te bde 'gro nyid thob pa'i ched du rab tu 'jug go //
translated: And patience, by being the antidote to anger, which is its opposite, sustains the collection of the nature of good conduct by means of giving and morality, and it engages in order to attain happy rebirth.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum po las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs su brjod pa 'di yang dge ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa gsum po las byung ba'i bsod nams kyi tshogs su brjod pa 'di yang dge ba yin te /
translated: This collection of merit that arises from the three, giving and so on, is also virtue.

original: bsam gtan la sogs pa las byung ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs zhes pa yin la /
analyzed: bsam gtan la sogs pa las byung ba ni ye shes kyi tshogs zhes pa yin la /
translated: The collection of wisdom that arises from the concentrations and so on is also virtue.

original: de dag brtson 'grus med par mi 'byung bas de ltar na yang tshogs gnyis ka'i rgyu yin pas sgrub pa thams cad spong ba'i ched du byung ba yin no //
analyzed: de dag brtson 'grus med par mi 'byung bas de ltar na yang tshogs gnyis ka'i rgyu yin pas sgrub pa thams cad spong ba'i ched du byung ba yin no //
translated: Since they do not occur without effort, they are also the cause of the two collections. Thus they occur for the sake of abandoning all that is to be abandoned.

original: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rgyu ru 'gyur ba yin no //
analyzed: sems mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin shes par 'gyur bas bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang bla na med pa'i ye shes thob pa'i rgyu ru 'gyur ba yin no //
translated: Since one knows reality just as it is through the mind being in equipoise, the perfection of meditative stabilization also becomes the cause for attaining unsurpassed pristine wisdom.

original: de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di rnams gus par byas pas bsgrubs na yang /
analyzed: de ltar sbyin pa la sogs pa 'di rnams gus par byas pas bsgrubs na yang /
translated: Thus, if one practices these perfections of generosity and so forth with respect,

original: shes rab dang bral na bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur zhing pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang thob pa ma yin te /
analyzed: shes rab dang bral na bla na med pa'i go 'phang thob pa'i rgyur mi 'gyur zhing pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang thob pa ma yin te /
translated: if they are devoid of wisdom, they will not become the cause for attaining the unsurpassed state and will not even obtain the name perfection.

original: shes rab kyis dag par byas pa la bsten pas de yang bar chad med par rgya che ba la 'jug pas de'i rjes su 'jug pa na de'i rgyu'i dngos po thob par 'gyur ro /
analyzed: shes rab kyis dag par byas pa la bsten pas de yang bar chad med par rgya che ba la 'jug pas de'i rjes su 'jug pa na de'i rgyu'i dngos po thob par 'gyur ro /
translated: Since one relies on that which is purified by wisdom, one enters into the vast without interruption. When one engages in that, one obtains the entity of its cause.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming yang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One also obtains the name perfection.

original: de bzhin du gtong ba po dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po la sogs pa gsum po rnams mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyis yongs su sbyangs te /
analyzed: de bzhin du gtong ba po dang / sbyin par bya ba dang / len pa po la sogs pa gsum po rnams mi dmigs pa'i sbyor bas shes rab kyis yongs su sbyangs te /
translated: Likewise, through the application of not observing the three—the giver, the gift, and the receiver—one should train in wisdom.

original: gus shing par tshad med par dus yun ring por goms par byas pas rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro zhing //
analyzed: gus shing par tshad med par dus yun ring por goms par byas pas rab kyi mthar thug par 'gro zhing //
translated: Through respect, through immeasurable joy, and through long-term practice, one will reach the highest degree.

original: ma rig pas bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral te /🔽nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las grol ba'i bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis thugs su chud pa'i rang bzhin bdag dang gzhan la phan pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa /
analyzed: ma rig pas bskyed pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag dang bral te / nyon mongs pa dang shes bya'i sgrib pa las grol ba'i bdag med pa rnam pa gnyis thugs su chud pa'i rang bzhin bdag dang gzhan la phan pa thams cad kyi gzhir gyur pa /
translated: Free from the entire net of concepts produced by ignorance,

original: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku mngon par thob par byed pas shes rab ni gtso bo yin la /
analyzed: don dam pa'i de kho na nyid kyi bdag nyid de bzhin gshegs pa'i chos kyi sku mngon par thob par byed pas shes rab ni gtso bo yin la /
translated: one will attain the dharmakāya of the Tathāgata, which is the nature of the realization of the two types of selflessness, the basis of all benefit for oneself and others, the ultimate reality.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni phal par brjod do //
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa ni phal par brjod do //
translated: Therefore, wisdom is primary, and generosity and so on are said to be secondary.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa las shes rab gtso bo yin na byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu de nyid @186b 'ba' zhig zhog la /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa las shes rab gtso bo yin na byang chub sgrub par byed pa'i rgyu de nyid @186b 'ba' zhig zhog la /
translated: If wisdom is the most important of the perfections such as generosity, then why should one practice generosity and the others?

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams kyis ci zhig bya zhes ni brjod par mi bya ste /
translated: One should not say that,

original: de las gzhan gyi dgos pa brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las gzhan gyi dgos pa brjod zin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because the need for the others has already been stated.

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni mig dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa 'ba' zhig ni mig dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Generosity and the others are like the blind,

original: shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa nyid kyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis sar 'gro bar 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab la 'dren par brjod de /
analyzed: shes rab kyi mig dang ldan pa nyid kyis ji ltar mngon par 'dod pa'i bde bar gshegs pa nyid kyis sar 'gro bar 'gyur bar byed pa'i phyir shes rab la 'dren par brjod de /
translated: because they are led by wisdom, which is like the eyes, to the state of a sugata, which is the desired goal.

original: shes rab 'ba' zhig kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: shes rab 'ba' zhig kyang yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub sgrub par byed pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Wisdom alone is not the means of accomplishing perfect enlightenment.

original: de lta bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor ni shes rab kyi don du grub bo //
analyzed: de lta bas na sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor ni shes rab kyi don du grub bo //
translated: Therefore, the retinue of generosity and the other perfections is established for the sake of wisdom.

original: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa thams cad spangs pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Or, because it abandons all conceptualization,

original: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis po mi gsung ba'i phyir ram /
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa dang skur pa 'debs pa'i mtha' gnyis po mi gsung ba'i phyir ram /
translated: Because he does not speak the two extremes of superimposition and denial.

original: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid thub pa gsum dang 'brel pa'i phyir thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: mi slob pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyi las kyi mtshan nyid thub pa gsum dang 'brel pa'i phyir thub pa ni sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Or, because he is related to the three silences, the characteristics of the body, speech, and mind of a non-learner. The Muni is the Blessed Buddha.

original: sdug bsngal gsum gyis sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i dgongs pas gsungs te gsungs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
analyzed: sdug bsngal gsum gyis sdug bsngal ba'i 'gro ba thams cad yongs su bskyab pa'i dgongs pas gsungs te gsungs pa dang ldan no zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //
translated: He spoke with the intention of protecting all beings who suffer from the three sufferings. The meaning is that he possesses speech.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo rnams su shes rab kyi don du rim pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la sogs pa'i mdo rnams su shes rab kyi don du rim pas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor gsungs pa yin no //
translated: In the sutras such as the Perfection of Wisdom, the retinue of generosity and so on is taught in sequence for the sake of wisdom.

original: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
analyzed: ji skad du 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa stong phrag brgya pa las /
translated: As it is said in the noble Perfection of Wisdom in One Hundred Thousand Stanzas:

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na /
translated: Subhuti, it is like this:

original: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing /
analyzed: nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor dang zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ni gling bzhir las byed cing /
translated: The orb of the sun and the orb of the moon perform their functions in the four continents.

original: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: it follows the four continents,

original: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
analyzed: gling bzhi'i rjes su 'brang ngo //
translated: it accompanies the four continents.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lngar las byed cing /
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa yang pha rol tu phyin pa lngar las byed cing /
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, the perfection of wisdom performs the work of the five perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro'o //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'gro'o //
translated: it follows the five perfections,

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang ste /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga'i rjes su 'brang ste /
translated: it accompanies the five perfections.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa la pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: Without the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections do not get the name ‘perfections.’

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang bral na /
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na 'khor los sgyur ba'i rgyal po dang bral na /
translated: For example, Subhūti, without a universal monarch,

original: rin po che sna bdun gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: rin po che sna bdun gyis 'khor los sgyur ba'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: the seven precious things of a universal monarch do not get the name ‘seven precious things of a universal monarch.’

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang bral na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob bo //
translated: In the same way, Subhūti, without the perfection of wisdom, the five perfections do not get the name ‘perfections.’

original: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na chu klung gang ci snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ni chu klung chen po gang+g'a @187a * //
analyzed: rab 'byor 'di lta ste dper na chu klung gang ci snyed cig yod pa de dag thams cad ni chu klung chen po gang+g'a @187a * //
translated: Subhūti, it is like this: whatever rivers there are, all of them go to the great river Ganges,

original: gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
analyzed: gang na ba der 'dong ngo //
translated: and they go to where the great river Ganges is.

original: de dag chu klung gang+g'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
analyzed: de dag chu klung gang+g'a dang 'grogs shing rgya mtsho chen po'i nang du 'dong ngo //
translated: They go to the great ocean in company with the great river Ganges.

original: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
analyzed: rab 'byor de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga yang shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid gang na ba der 'dong ngo zhes rgya cher gsungs so //
translated: Subhūti, in the same way, when the five perfections are assisted by the perfection of wisdom, they go to where the knowledge of all aspects is.

original: de yang ji skad du /
analyzed: de yang ji skad du /
translated: And that is stated in detail.🔽And that is stated in detail.

original: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: koo shi ka byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams kyi shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa 'dis ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //
translated: Kauśika, this perfection of wisdom of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas surpasses the perfection of giving.

original: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to //🔽koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na dmus long brgya'am stong ngam brgya phrag stong yang rung ste /
analyzed: tshul khrims kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bzod pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / brtson 'grus kyi pha rol tu phyin pa dang / bsam gtan gyi pha rol tu phyin pa zil gyis gnon to // koo shi ka 'di lta ste dper na dmus long brgya'am stong ngam brgya phrag stong yang rung ste /
translated: They surpass the perfection of morality, the perfection of patience, the perfection of perseverance, and the perfection of concentration.

original: dmigs bu med par lam du 'jug par yang mi nus na grong khyer du 'gro bar lta ga la nus /
analyzed: dmigs bu med par lam du 'jug par yang mi nus na grong khyer du 'gro bar lta ga la nus /
translated: “Kauśika, it is like this: a hundred or a thousand or a hundred thousand blind people cannot set out on a road without a guide, so how could they reach a city?

original: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni dmus long lta bur gyur pa ste /
analyzed: koo shi ka de bzhin du pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni dmus long lta bur gyur pa ste /
translated: Kauśika, in the same way, these five perfections are like blind people.

original: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na de dag la dmigs bu med pas byang chub kyi lam yang skyed par mi nus na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug par lta ga la nus /
analyzed: shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa med na de dag la dmigs bu med pas byang chub kyi lam yang skyed par mi nus na rnam pa thams cad mkhyen pa nyid kyi grong khyer du 'jug par lta ga la nus /
translated: Without the perfection of wisdom they have no guide, so they cannot even give rise to the path to enlightenment, so how could they enter the city of omniscience?”

original: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig dang ldan par gyur te /
analyzed: koo shi ka pha rol tu phyin pa lnga nam shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su zin par gyur pa de'i tshe mig dang ldan par gyur te /
translated: Kauśika, when the five perfections are possessed by the perfection of wisdom, then they have eyes.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa lnga po 'di dag ni shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pas yongs su bzung na pha rol tu phyin pa'i ming mi 'thob po zhes rgya cher gsungs pa yin no //
translated: If the five perfections are possessed by the perfection of wisdom, then they obtain the name perfections.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang 'dir mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas ji lta ba bzhin du go bar bya'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang 'dir mdo gzhan gyi rjes su 'brangs nas ji lta ba bzhin du go bar bya'o ;
translated: In the same way, here one should understand in accordance with another sūtra.

original: /'di skad du /
analyzed: /'di skad du /
translated: It says:

original: dre med smad pa med khyod la //🔽pha rol phyin pa thams cad rnams //
analyzed: dre med smad pa med khyod la // pha rol phyin pa thams cad rnams //
translated: You are without fault, without blame,🔽you follow all the perfections

original: thams cad du ni rjes 'brang ste //
analyzed: thams cad du ni rjes 'brang ste //
translated: everywhere,

original: zla ba'i rjes su rgyu skar bzhin //
analyzed: zla ba'i rjes su rgyu skar bzhin //
translated: like the moon follows the stars.

original: zhes gsungs pa yin no //🔽yang na 'di dag ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: zhes gsungs pa yin no // yang na 'di dag ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Or it says:🔽You follow all the perfections🔽like the moon follows the stars.

original: de bzhin du gzhan yang ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyur ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan yang ba ni 'das ma thag pa'i zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi rgyur ro //
translated: Also, the word “these” refers to the immediately preceding state of calm abiding.

original: yang lag ces pa ni shes rab kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu tshogs sam gzhi yin no //
analyzed: yang lag ces pa ni shes rab kun nas slong bar byed pa nyid kyis de'i rgyu tshogs sam gzhi yin no //
translated: Again, “hand” is the collection or basis of its cause, since it is the very thing that motivates wisdom.

original: shes rab don du zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab de nyid dgos pa yin zhing bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis gang gi yin pa ni zhi gnas kyis yongs su @187b dag par byas pa'i sems kyi rgyun la shes rab skye ba'i phyir /
analyzed: shes rab don du zhes pa ni sngar brjod pa'i shes rab de nyid dgos pa yin zhing bsgrub par bya ba nyid kyis gang gi yin pa ni zhi gnas kyis yongs su @187b dag par byas pa'i sems kyi rgyun la shes rab skye ba'i phyir /
translated: “For the sake of wisdom” means that very wisdom mentioned previously is the purpose and what is to be accomplished. Since wisdom arises in the continuum of mind that is purified by śamatha,

original: legs par sbyangs pa'i zhing las 'bru skye ba dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: legs par sbyangs pa'i zhing las 'bru skye ba dang 'dra'o //
translated: it is like a grain that grows from a well-prepared field.

original: ji ltar bslab pa kun las bsdus par yang zhi gnas 'di'i bdag nyid che ba ji lta zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar bslab pa kun las bsdus par yang zhi gnas 'di'i bdag nyid che ba ji lta zhe na /
translated: How is the greatness of this śamatha summarized in the Śikṣāsamuccaya?

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyed par nus pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du shes pa skyed par nus pa yin te /
translated: It is the ability to generate knowledge of things just as they are.

original: gang gi phyir mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes brjod de thub pas gsungs so zhes pa yin no //
analyzed: gang gi phyir mnyam par gzhag pas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes so zhes brjod de thub pas gsungs so zhes pa yin no //
translated: Because it is said that “one who is equipoised knows things just as they are,” as stated by the Sage.

original: 'di yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
analyzed: 'di yang 'phags pa chos yang dag par sdud pa las /
translated: This is also stated in the noble Sūtra on Chanting the Dharma Together:

original: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mnyam par gzhag pa'i sems kyis yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “When the mind is in equipoise, one sees things as they are in reality.

original: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
analyzed: yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du mthong ba'i byang chub sems dpa' sems can rnams la snying rje chen po 'jug ste /
translated: When bodhisattvas see things as they are in reality, great compassion engages sentient beings.

original: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di bsgrub par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag gis sems can thams cad la ting nge 'dzin gyi sgo 'di bsgrub par bya'o //
translated: I must accomplish this door of meditative absorption for all sentient beings.

original: snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rdzogs par bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: snying rje chen po des bskul bas lhag pa'i tshul khrims dang lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bslab pa yongs su rdzogs pas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub rdzogs par bya'o zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: And, urged on by that great compassion, I must complete unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment by perfecting the trainings in superior morality, superior meditative stabilization, and superior wisdom.”

original: ni zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
analyzed: ni zhes pa ni gang gi phyir te /
translated: “Indeed” means “for what reason?”

original: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor ram zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi 'khor shes rab kyi don du yin par thub pas gsungs te /
analyzed: sbyin pa la sogs pa'i 'khor ram zhi gnas kyi bdag nyid kyi 'khor shes rab kyi don du yin par thub pas gsungs te /
translated: The Sage has said that the retinue of generosity and so on, or the retinue of the nature of meditative stabilization, is for the sake of wisdom.

original: de lta bas na shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bas na shes rab bskyed par bya'o zhes sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should generate wisdom.

original: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'am mngon sum du bya ba'am /🔽bsgom par bya ba'am /🔽bsten par bya ba'am /
analyzed: bskyed par bya'o zhes pa ni bsgrub par bya'o zhes pa'am mngon sum du bya ba'am / bsgom par bya ba'am / bsten par bya ba'am /
translated: “ Generate” means to accomplish, to actualize,🔽to cultivate,🔽to rely on,

original: mang ched du bya ba'o //
analyzed: mang ched du bya ba'o //
translated: or to increase.

original: shes rab de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: shes rab de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Wisdom is of two kinds:

original: rgyur gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa dang / 'bras bur gyur pa'o //
translated: that which is a cause and that which is a result.

original: rgyur gyur pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: rgyur gyur pa'ang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: That which is a cause is also of two kinds:

original: mos pas spyod pa dang / sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
analyzed: mos pas spyod pa dang / sa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i'o //
translated: that of the bodhisattva who practices with devoted interest and that of the bodhisattva who has attained the stages.

original: 'bras bur gyur pa yang mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor bas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: 'bras bur gyur pa yang mtshan ma med pa'i sbyor bas rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i chos thams cad kyi stong pa nyid rtogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: That which is a result is the realization of the emptiness of all things, endowed with the highest of all aspects, by means of the practice of the signless.

original: de la dang por rgyur gyur pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pa goms pas sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i shes rab skyed par byed pa yin te /
analyzed: de la dang por rgyur gyur pa ni thos pa dang bsam pa dang bsgom pa'i rim pa goms pas sa la rab tu zhugs pa'i shes rab skyed par byed pa yin te /
translated: The first of these, that which is a cause, generates the wisdom of one who has entered the stages by means of the practice of hearing, reflection, and meditation.

original: de yang sa gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa'i sbyor bas mchog tu 'phel bar gyur pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang sa gzhan dang gzhan 'thob pa'i sbyor bas mchog tu 'phel bar gyur pa yin te /
translated: Moreover, it is supreme, since it increases through the practice of attaining other and other stages.

original: ji srid du sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag spangs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi shes rab kyi rang bzhin yongs su rdzogs par @188a * //
analyzed: ji srid du sgrib pa gnyis dang bral ba rtog pa'i dra ba mtha' dag spangs pa'i sangs rgyas nyid kyi shes rab kyi rang bzhin yongs su rdzogs par @188a * //
translated: It is the perfection of wisdom, which is the nature of the wisdom of a buddha, free from the two obstructions and free from the net of all conceptual thought.

original: byed de / de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: byed de / de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: Therefore,

original: sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal zhi bar 'dod pas zhes gsungs te /
translated: it is said, “One who wishes to pacify suffering.”

original: sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i 'gro ba ris lngas yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi phung por gtogs pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i skye ba dang / nad pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i rang bzhin dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ni 'khor ba'i 'gro ba ris lngas yang dag par bsdus pa'i sems can gyi phung por gtogs pa'i bdag nyid la yod pa'i skye ba dang / nad pa dang / rga ba dang / 'chi ba'i rang bzhin dang / sdug pa dang bral ba dang /
translated: Suffering is the nature of birth, sickness, aging, and death, which exist in the collection of sentient beings subsumed by the five types of transmigrating beings. It is the nature of being separated from what is pleasant,

original: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pa tshol ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po'i bdag nyid kyang ngo //
analyzed: mi sdug pa dang phrad pa dang / 'dod pa tshol ba'i gegs byed pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mdor na nye bar len pa'i phung po'i bdag nyid kyang ngo //
translated: meeting with what is unpleasant, and the characteristic of being obstructed by the pursuit of what is desired. In brief, it is the nature of the appropriated aggregates.

original: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
analyzed: zhi ba ni mya ngan las 'das pa yin te /
translated: Peace is nirvana.

original: slar mi skye ba'i nye bar zhi ba'i chos nyid kyis shin tu rgyun chad pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: slar mi skye ba'i nye bar zhi ba'i chos nyid kyis shin tu rgyun chad pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is the complete cessation of the continuum of existence by the pacification of all the defilements and suffering, due to the cessation of the cause.

original: de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa dang 'dun pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go //🔽'di ltar phyin ci log pa'i 'du shes can mi bden pa'i de kho na nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bdag gi bar 'dzin par 'jug pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa las byung ba /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa ni mngon par 'dod pa dang 'dun pa zhes pa'i tha tshig go // 'di ltar phyin ci log pa'i 'du shes can mi bden pa'i de kho na nyid du sgro 'dogs pa'i mngon par zhen pa'i stobs kyis bdag gi bar 'dzin par 'jug pas tshul bzhin ma yin pa'i yid la byed pa las byung ba /
translated: Desire is the wish and longing for that.

original: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dod chags la sogs pa nyon mongs pa'i tshogs yang dag par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the mass of afflictions such as passion arise from the incorrect mental activity that occurs due to the power of the adherence of superimposition, which is the false notion that superimposes a reality that does not exist.

original: de las ni las yin la /
analyzed: de las ni las yin la /
translated: From that arise karma.

original: de las skye ba yin zhing de las kyang nad dang rga shi mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i yongs su ngal ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de las skye ba yin zhing de las kyang nad dang rga shi mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal dang / yid mi bde ba'i yongs su ngal ba yang 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: From that arises birth, and from that also arise sickness, old age, death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and total dejection.

original: de ltar na 'di 'ba' zhig las sdug bsngal kyi phung po chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na 'di 'ba' zhig las sdug bsngal kyi phung po chen po 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this great mass of suffering comes into being.

original: de las de ltar lugs las bzlog pa'i rnam pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis dmigs par byed pas /
analyzed: de las de ltar lugs las bzlog pa'i rnam pas rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba la yang dag pa'i shes rab kyis dmigs par byed pas /
translated: In this way, by means of the reverse order, he observes dependent origination with right wisdom.

original: yang de nyid bdag nyid med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis don dam par rang bzhin med par mthong bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes shing de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid rmongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ma rig pa srid pa'i🔽yan lag zlog par byed la /
analyzed: yang de nyid bdag nyid med pa dang / bdag po med pa dang / sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / dri za'i grong khyer dang / rmi lam dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i rnam pa nyid kyis don dam par rang bzhin med par mthong bas yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du yongs su shes shing de'i mi mthun pa'i phyogs kyi bdag nyid rmongs pa'i rang bzhin gyi ma rig pa srid pa'i yan lag zlog par byed la /
translated: And, by seeing that it is ultimately devoid of intrinsic nature, by means of the aspect of its identitylessness, its lack of a controlling master, and its similarity to a magical creation, a mirage, a fairy city, a dream, a reflection, etc., he fully understands it as it really is. And, by the cessation of ignorance, which is the obscuration that is its counteragent, he causes the cessation of the links of existence.

original: ma rig pa 'gags pas de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir 'du byed 'gag go //
analyzed: ma rig pa 'gags pas de'i rkyen yin pa'i phyir 'du byed 'gag go //
translated: And, because of the cessation of ignorance, the conditioning factors cease, since they are conditioned by ignorance.

original: de ltar rgyur gyur pa snga ma snga ma rnams 'gags pas 'bras bur gyur pa phyi ma phyi ma rnams 'gag par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de ltar rgyur gyur pa snga ma snga ma rnams 'gags pas 'bras bur gyur pa phyi ma phyi ma rnams 'gag par rig par bya ste /
translated: Thus, it should be understood that the cessation of the former members, which are causes, results in the cessation of the latter members, which are effects.

original: ji srid du skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid @188b mi bde bas yongs su ngal ba yang 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid du skye ba 'gags pas rga shi dang mya ngan dang / smre sngags 'don pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / yid @188b mi bde bas yongs su ngal ba yang 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: As long as birth ceases, aging and death, sorrow, lamentation, suffering, unhappiness, and distress cease.

original: de ltar na gcig tu sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gcig tu sdug bsngal gyi phung po chen po 'di 'gag par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, this great mass of pure suffering ceases.

original: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam du rnam par chad la 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam du rnam par chad de /
analyzed: de la ma rig pa dang sred pa dang len pa ni nyon mongs pa'i lam du rnam par chad la 'du byed dang srid pa ni las kyi lam du rnam par chad de /
translated: In this regard, ignorance, craving, and grasping are the members that are the path of afflictions. Formation and becoming are the members that are the path of karma.

original: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal kyi lam du rnam par chad cing /
analyzed: yan lag lhag ma rnams ni sdug bsngal kyi lam du rnam par chad cing /
translated: The remaining members are the members that are the path of suffering.

original: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags pa ni 'gog pa'i lam du rnam par chad do //
analyzed: sngon dang phyi ma'i mtha' 'gags pa ni 'gog pa'i lam du rnam par chad do //
translated: The cessation of the past and future is the member that is the path of cessation.

original: de lta nyid du lam gsum ni bdag med pa ma yin la /
analyzed: de lta nyid du lam gsum ni bdag med pa ma yin la /
translated: The three paths are not the self.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa ste /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ba med pa ste /
translated: There is no self and no “mine.”

original: skye ba'i sbyor bas skye bar 'gyur zhing 'gag pa'i sbyor bas 'gag par 'gyur te /
analyzed: skye ba'i sbyor bas skye bar 'gyur zhing 'gag pa'i sbyor bas 'gag par 'gyur te /
translated: Since it is connected with arising, it arises; since it is connected with cessation, it ceases.

original: dngos po la smyug ma'i tshigs dang 'dra'o //
analyzed: dngos po la smyug ma'i tshigs dang 'dra'o //
translated: In things, it is like the joints of bamboo.

original: 'di yang phyi nas rigs pa dang lung gis rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di yang phyi nas rigs pa dang lung gis rgyas par bstan par bya'o //
translated: This will be extensively taught later on with reasoning and scripture.

original: de bas na 'di ltar 'dus byas la shes rab kyis rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du so sor rtog pa na chos thams cad dang rang bzhin med par rtogs pas don dam par khong du chud pa las bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes
analyzed: de bas na 'di ltar 'dus byas la shes rab kyis rmi lam dang sgyu ma la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du so sor rtog pa na chos thams cad dang rang bzhin med par rtogs pas don dam par khong du chud pa las bag chags dang bcas pa'i nyes
translated: Therefore, when one thus discerns conditioned phenomena with wisdom as having the nature of a dream, an illusion, and so on, one realizes that all phenomena are essenceless. By realizing the ultimate, the mass of faults together with their imprints

original: pa'i phung po ldog par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: pa'i phung po ldog par 'gyur zhing /
translated: are reversed.

original: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu shes rab skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: sdug bsngal thams cad nye bar zhi ba'i rgyu shes rab skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: The cause for the complete pacification of all suffering, wisdom, arises.

original: 'dis ji ltar lung dang rigs pa dag gis dpyod pa na dngos po'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'dis ji ltar lung dang rigs pa dag gis dpyod pa na dngos po'i de kho na nyid phyin ci ma log pa gsal bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this, when analyzed with scripture and reasoning, illuminates the unerring suchness of things.

original: kun rdzob dang ma rig pa dang rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ma rig pa dang rmongs pa dang phyin ci log ces bya ba ni rnam grangs yin no //
translated: “Convention,” “ignorance,” “delusion,” and “error” are synonyms.

original: ma rig pa yang mi bden pa'i don gyi rang bzhin sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang mi bden pa'i don gyi rang bzhin sgro 'dogs par byed pa yin la /
translated: Ignorance is the superimposition of an unreal meaning.

original: rang bzhin mthong ba la bsgribs pas na kun rdzob tu 'thad do //
analyzed: rang bzhin mthong ba la bsgribs pas na kun rdzob tu 'thad do //
translated: Since it obscures the vision of reality, it is tenable as a convention.

original: gang s'a lu ljang pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang s'a lu ljang pa las gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said in the Rice Seedling Sutra:

original: gzhan yang de kho na nyid ma rig pa dang log par rtogs pa ni mi shes pa dang ma rig pa yin no zhes so //
analyzed: gzhan yang de kho na nyid ma rig pa dang log par rtogs pa ni mi shes pa dang ma rig pa yin no zhes so //
translated: “Moreover, the non-apprehension and ignorance of reality is the non-knowledge and ignorance of the unreal.”

original: yang gsungs pa /🔽ma rig skyes pa nyid kyis //
analyzed: yang gsungs pa / ma rig skyes pa nyid kyis //
translated: And it is also said:🔽“The arising of ignorance

original: yang dag min pa'i don snang zhing //
analyzed: yang dag min pa'i don snang zhing //
translated: Causes the appearance of the unreal,🔽And obscures the real; it functions

original: yang dag sgrib par byed la 'jug / mig ser gyis ni gnod pa bzhin //
analyzed: yang dag sgrib par byed la 'jug / mig ser gyis ni gnod pa bzhin //
translated: Like a cataract that impairs the eye.”

original: zhes so // des nye bar bstan pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa de kun rdzob ces bya ste /
analyzed: zhes so // des nye bar bstan pa yang rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin yin pa de kun rdzob ces bya ste /
translated: The reality that is indicated by that is the nature of dependently originated things. That is called “the conventional.”

original: de nyid la 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod la /
analyzed: de nyid la 'jig rten pa'i kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod la /
translated: That is called the conventional truth of the world.

original: 'jig rten pa nyid kyi kun rdzob kyis de la bden pa zhes bya ba las so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid kyi kun rdzob kyis de la bden pa zhes bya ba las so //
translated: It is called “truth” because of the conventional of the world itself.🔽It is said:

original: gang ; gti mug kun rdzob yin te rang bzhin la bsgribs pas //
analyzed: gang ; gti mug kun rdzob yin te rang bzhin la bsgribs pas //
translated: The conventional is ignorance, because it obscures the nature.

original: gang zhig bcos ma kho na de yis bden par @189a * //
analyzed: gang zhig bcos ma kho na de yis bden par @189a * //
translated: That which is merely fabricated is taught to be true by it.

original: ston ; / dngos po'i don dang byas pa yang ni kun rdzob tu //🔽'di ni kun rdzob bden pa zhes byar thub pas gsungs //
analyzed: ston ; / dngos po'i don dang byas pa yang ni kun rdzob tu // 'di ni kun rdzob bden pa zhes byar thub pas gsungs //
translated: Things, objects, and actions are also conventional.

original: zhes brjod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes brjod pa'o //
translated: This is called “conventional truth” by the Sage.

original: kun rdzob de yang 'jig rten pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su 'byed de /
analyzed: kun rdzob de yang 'jig rten pa nyid kyis rnam pa gnyis su 'byed de /
translated: That conventional is divided into two kinds by the world itself:

original: log pa'i kun rdzob dang / yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ces so ;
analyzed: log pa'i kun rdzob dang / yang dag pa'i kun rdzob ces so ;
translated: the false conventional and the correct conventional.

original: /'di ltar yang gang cung zad rkyen las skyes pa'i dngos po sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skyon med pa'i dbang pos dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid las bden pa nyid yin la /
analyzed: /'di ltar yang gang cung zad rkyen las skyes pa'i dngos po sngon po la sogs pa'i rang bzhin skyon med pa'i dbang pos dmigs pa ni 'jig rten pa nyid las bden pa nyid yin la /
translated: Thus, whatever thing arises from conditions, such as the nature of blue, is true as reality itself because of being perceived by a faultless sense faculty.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa yin yang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams dbang po nyes pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / ji ltar mu stegs can gyi rang gi grub mthas yongs su brtags pa yang 'jig rten pa nyid las log pa yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba las skyes pa yin yang sgyu ma dang / smig rgyu dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa rnams dbang po nyes pa dang ldan pas mthong ba dang / ji ltar mu stegs can gyi rang gi grub mthas yongs su brtags pa yang 'jig rten pa nyid las log pa yin te /
translated: Although they arise from dependent origination, illusions, mirages, reflections, and so forth are seen by those whose sense faculties are defective, and just as the world is imagined by the tīrthikas through their own tenets, it is also unreal.

original: de brjod pa /🔽gal te dbang po nyams par ma gyur pa'i //
analyzed: de brjod pa / gal te dbang po nyams par ma gyur pa'i //
translated: This is stated:🔽If the world were to conceive objects

original: drug po rnams kyis 'jig rten yul rtog byed //
analyzed: drug po rnams kyis 'jig rten yul rtog byed //
translated: with the six unimpaired faculties,

original: de ni 'jig rten nyid la bden yin te //
analyzed: de ni 'jig rten nyid la bden yin te //
translated: that would be true only for the world;

original: lhag ma brtags pa 'jig rten nyid la brdzun //🔽zhes so // de ltar de gnyi ga yang /
analyzed: lhag ma brtags pa 'jig rten nyid la brdzun // zhes so // de ltar de gnyi ga yang /
translated: the rest is false for the world.

original: yang dag pa gzigs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la ni brdzun pa yin te /
analyzed: yang dag pa gzigs pa'i 'phags pa rnams la ni brdzun pa yin te /
translated: Thus, both of these are false for āryas who see reality,

original: don dam pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i gnas skabs su kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'khrul pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because conventional reality is mistaken in the context of the ultimate.

original: 'di de ma thag nyid du rigs pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di de ma thag nyid du rigs pa'i sgo nas rtogs par bya ste /
translated: This will be understood immediately through reasoning.

original: de lta bas na ma rig pa dang ldan pa la dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang ngo //
analyzed: de lta bas na ma rig pa dang ldan pa la dngos po'i rang bzhin mi snang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the nature of entities does not appear to those who are ignorant.

original: dam pa ni mchog yin la /
analyzed: dam pa ni mchog yin la /
translated: The highest is the supreme.

original: don ni dam pa'i don yin te /
analyzed: don ni dam pa'i don yin te /
translated: The meaning is the highest meaning.

original: ma bcos pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gang gi rtog pas sgrib pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur pa'o //
analyzed: ma bcos pa dngos po'i rang bzhin gang gi rtog pas sgrib pa'i bag chags dang rjes su 'brel ba'i nyon mongs pa spong bar 'gyur pa'o //
translated: The nature of entities, which is unfabricated, is the object that causes the elimination of the afflictions that are associated with the latent impulses that obscure it.

original: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni rnam grangs yin la /
analyzed: chos thams cad ngo bo nyid med pa dang / stong pa nyid dang de bzhin nyid dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' dang chos kyi dbyings zhes pa ni rnam grangs yin la /
translated: The terms “naturelessness of all phenomena,” “emptiness,” “suchness,” “the perfect end,” and “the reality-limit” are synonyms.

original: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don thams cad rang bzhin med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i don thams cad rang bzhin med pa don dam pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: The meaning of dependent origination, which is the absence of intrinsic nature, is the nature of the ultimate.

original: ji ltar snang ba'i kun rdzob ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ji ltar snang ba'i kun rdzob ni mi 'thad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because the relative, which appears in this way, is not tenable.

original: 'di ltar yang re zhig ji ltar mthong ba'i ngo bos dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang re zhig ji ltar mthong ba'i ngo bos dngos po yod pa'i rang bzhin ma yin te /
translated: In this way, first, an entity does not have the nature of existing by way of its own entity as it is perceived.

original: de'i rjes kyi dus na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i rjes kyi dus na mi gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because it does not remain in the subsequent period.

original: rang bzhin yang thams cad du glo bur ba ma yin pas mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin yang thams cad du glo bur ba ma yin pas mi g-yo ba'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since its nature is not adventitious in any way, it is by nature immutable.

original: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni ji ltar nam yang ldog pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang zhig gang gi rang bzhin yin pa de ni ji ltar nam yang ldog pa ma yin te /
translated: How could that which is of a certain nature ever be reversed?

original: gzhan dun @189b de'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: gzhan dun @189b de'i rang bzhin nyams par thal bar 'gyur bas /
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that its nature would be lost.

original: rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang bzhin med pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: And that would make it essenceless.

original: de skye ba na yod pa'i ngo bos 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa'am /
analyzed: de skye ba na yod pa'i ngo bos 'ga' zhig nas 'ongs pa'am /
translated: When it arises, it does not come from anywhere.

original: 'gags pa na 'ga' zhig tu song bar gyur pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'gags pa na 'ga' zhig tu song bar gyur pa yang ma yin te /
translated: And when it ceases, it does not go to any place.

original: 'on kyang sgyu ma bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis skye'o //
analyzed: 'on kyang sgyu ma bzhin du rgyu dang rkyen tshogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis skye'o //
translated: Rather, like an illusion, it arises by the nature of the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de ma tshang ba las 'gag par 'gyur ba yang yin te /
analyzed: de ma tshang ba las 'gag par 'gyur ba yang yin te /
translated: And it ceases due to the incompleteness of those causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa tshang ba las byung zhing gzhan la rag las pas bdag nyid thob pa ni gzugs brnyan nyid du gyur pa yin la ji ltar de'i rang bzhin yin te gang gi don yang don dam pa ma yin la /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa tshang ba las byung zhing gzhan la rag las pas bdag nyid thob pa ni gzugs brnyan nyid du gyur pa yin la ji ltar de'i rang bzhin yin te gang gi don yang don dam pa ma yin la /
translated: Since it arises from the assembly of causes and conditions and is dependent on other factors, it is a reflection. How could it be its nature?
