original: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las byung ba srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen gyi tshogs pa las byung ba srid pa ma yin te /
translated: It is not possible for it to arise from the assembly of causes and conditions.

original: de yang gzhan la rag las pas tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba'i bdag nyid las ngo bo thob pa rnams ni rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de yang gzhan la rag las pas tshogs pa gzhan las byung ba'i bdag nyid las ngo bo thob pa rnams ni rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, since it is dependent on other factors, it is a nature that arises from another assembly. Therefore, it lacks intrinsic reality.

original: de bzhin du gzhan gang zhig snga ma snga ma las rang rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa las skye bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du gzhan gang zhig snga ma snga ma las rang rang gi rgyu'i tshogs pa las skye bas rang bzhin med pa nyid du blta bar bya'o //
translated: In the same way, any other thing should be seen as lacking intrinsic reality because it arises from its own assembly of causes and conditions.

original: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ji ltar dngos po med pa las dngos po'i rang bzhin skye bar khas blang bar bya /
analyzed: rgyu dang 'bras bu rjes su mthun pa 'dod pa rnams kyis ji ltar dngos po med pa las dngos po'i rang bzhin skye bar khas blang bar bya /
translated: Those who assert that cause and effect are similar, how could they accept that the intrinsic reality of an existent thing arises from a non-existent thing?

original: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba /
analyzed: gang 'chad par 'gyur ba /
translated: As will be explained:

original: sgyu mas sprul pa gang yin dang // rgyu rnams kyis ni gang sprul pa //
analyzed: sgyu mas sprul pa gang yin dang // rgyu rnams kyis ni gang sprul pa //
translated: What is conjured by an illusion, and what is conjured by causes?

original: de ni gang las 'ongs gyur cing //🔽gang du 'gro ba brtag par gyis //
analyzed: de ni gang las 'ongs gyur cing // gang du 'gro ba brtag par gyis //
translated: Where did they come from?🔽Where do they go?

original: gang zhig gang ni nye ba yis //
analyzed: gang zhig gang ni nye ba yis //
translated: What is seen by the proximity of something

original: mthong 'gyur de med na min pa //
analyzed: mthong 'gyur de med na min pa //
translated: is not seen when it is not there.

original: bcos bu gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa //
analyzed: bcos bu gzugs brnyan dang mtshungs pa //
translated: Like a created image,

original: de la bden nyid ci ltar yod //
analyzed: de la bden nyid ci ltar yod //
translated: how can it be real?

original: ces pa dang / yang brjod pa /
analyzed: ces pa dang / yang brjod pa /
translated: And it is also said:

original: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
analyzed: gang zhig rkyen las skyes pa de ma skyes //
translated: What arises from conditions does not arise.

original: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
analyzed: de la skye ba'i rang bzhin yod ma yin //
translated: It does not have the nature of arising.

original: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad ;
analyzed: rkyen la rag las gang de stong par bshad ;
translated: What depends on conditions is explained to be empty.

original: / gang gi stong nyid shes de bag yod min //
analyzed: / gang gi stong nyid shes de bag yod min //
translated: One who knows emptiness is not heedless.🔽And:

original: zhes pa dang / stong pa kho na'i chos rnams las //
analyzed: zhes pa dang / stong pa kho na'i chos rnams las //
translated: From only empty phenomena

original: stong pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes pas so //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos rnams 'byung bar 'gyur //🔽zhes pas so //
translated: empty phenomena arise.

original: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rgyu med pa dang 'brel pa las dngos po skye ba ni shin tu legs par 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga'i rgyu dang 'brel pa dang / rgyu med pa dang 'brel pa las dngos po skye ba ni shin tu legs par 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: It is utterly untenable that things arise in dependence on themselves, in dependence on something other, in dependence on both, or in dependence on no cause.

original: 'di ltar yang rang gi bdag nyid dngos po rnams rang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gal te yin na skyes pa'am ma skyes pa la yin /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang rang gi bdag nyid dngos po rnams rang skye ba'i rgyu mtshan gal te yin na skyes pa'am ma skyes pa la yin /
translated: In this regard, if the reason for the arising of things from themselves is their own nature, then does it arise from that which has arisen or from that which has not arisen?

original: skyes pa ni re zhig ma yin te /
analyzed: skyes pa ni re zhig ma yin te /
translated: First, it does not arise from that which has arisen.

original: rang gi bdag nyid rgyu yin pa na de'i bdag nyid thams cad rang nyid kyis skyes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rang gi bdag nyid rgyu yin pa na de'i bdag nyid thams cad rang nyid kyis skyes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is its own cause, then all of its nature would have arisen from itself.

original: gang du yang 'di la bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba bskyed par @190a * //
analyzed: gang du yang 'di la bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur ba bskyed par @190a * //
translated: And it would not be tenable that it has activity,

original: bya ba yang 'di lam skyes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: bya ba yang 'di lam skyes pa gzhan gyi rang bzhin med pa'i phyir te /
translated: because that which has arisen does not have another nature that is to be arisen.

original: gcig po 'di la cha shas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gcig po 'di la cha shas dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because this one is endowed with parts.

original: phyis skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan 'di ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: phyis skye bar 'gyur ba gzhan 'di ni de'i rang bzhin du rigs pa ma yin te /
translated: It is also not tenable that that which has arisen later is the nature of that which has arisen earlier.

original: de grub pa dang ma grub pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de grub pa dang ma grub pa ni de'i rang bzhin ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that which is established or not established is not its nature.

original: de bas na rang gi bdag nyid las skyes pa ni cung zad kyang srid pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de bas na rang gi bdag nyid las skyes pa ni cung zad kyang srid pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, arising from itself is not possible in the least.

original: yang rang las skye ba'i phyogs la gang yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: yang rang las skye ba'i phyogs la gang yang 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, in the position of arising from itself, nothing is tenable.

original: sngar grub pa'i rang bzhin la gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
analyzed: sngar grub pa'i rang bzhin la gcig la gcig brten pa'i nyes par thal bar 'gyur bas so //
translated: Because the error of mutual dependence would ensue for an established nature.

original: de ma grub pa las kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: de ma grub pa las kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor does it arise from that which is not established,

original: nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra bar nus pa mtha' dag gis stong pa ni rang grub pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gro bar rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha'i me tog dang 'dra bar nus pa mtha' dag gis stong pa ni rang grub pa'i rgyu'i dngos por 'gro bar rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: because it is not tenable that that which is empty of all abilities, like a flower in the sky, is a cause that goes to establish itself.

original: gzhan du na bong bu'i rva yang rang rang gi dngos po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na bong bu'i rva yang rang rang gi dngos po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid du thal ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it would follow that even the rabbit’s horns would be causes that generate their own entities.

original: gzhan las zhes pa'i phyogs 'di yang ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan las zhes pa'i phyogs 'di yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is this position of arising from another.

original: nyi ma las kyang mun pa'am thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed par mi 'dod pa dag mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa ste gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nyi ma las kyang mun pa'am thams cad las thams cad skye bar thal bar 'gyur ba'i phyir dang / bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed par mi 'dod pa dag mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu la ltos pa ste gzhan nyid du khyad par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it would follow that darkness would arise from the sun or that everything would arise from everything, and because there is no difference between what is not asserted to be a producer and a product and what is asserted to be a product and a producer in terms of their dependence on the effect, that is, in terms of their being different.

original: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa rgyu gcig pa so sor nges pa yang 'bras bu ma skyes pa na brtags pa nyid kyis dngos po la rigs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: bskyed par bya ba dang skyed par byed pa rgyu gcig pa so sor nges pa yang 'bras bu ma skyes pa na brtags pa nyid kyis dngos po la rigs pa ma yin no //
translated: Also, the postulation of a specific cause and effect that are the same substantial entity is illogical in terms of entities because it is a mere imputation when the effect has not yet arisen.

original: ma 'ongs pa'i chos gnas pa la ltos nas 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: ma 'ongs pa'i chos gnas pa la ltos nas 'bras bu la sogs pa'i tha snyad dngos po ma yin te /
translated: The conventions of cause and effect in dependence on the endurance of future phenomena are not entities.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa dpyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin du yod pa dpyod par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because they would be analyzed as existing by the nature of entities.

original: sa bon gnas pa rnams la myu gu yod pa ltos pa ni sa bon las gzhan nyid yin par brtags pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: sa bon gnas pa rnams la myu gu yod pa ltos pa ni sa bon las gzhan nyid yin par brtags pa ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: The postulation that a sprout exists in dependence on the endurance of a seed and that it is different from the seed is illogical.

original: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid ni 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rgyu la 'bras bu yod pa nyid ni 'gegs par 'gyur ba yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the existence of the effect in the cause would be refuted.

original: gang du mthong ba nyid kyi dngos po rnam par dpyad pas gnas pa ma yin na der ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams srid pa'i bsam pa'ang ci yod /
analyzed: gang du mthong ba nyid kyi dngos po rnam par dpyad pas gnas pa ma yin na der ma 'ongs pa la sogs pa rnams srid pa'i bsam pa'ang ci yod /
translated: If the entity that is seen does not endure due to analysis, then what is the point of considering non-arisen and so on?

original: gnyi ga'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
analyzed: gnyi ga'i phyogs kyang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it both,

original: so so'i phyogs la brjod pas gnyi ga'i phyogs la skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: so so'i phyogs la brjod pas gnyi ga'i phyogs la skyon du 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because the faults of both positions would ensue due to the expression of each position.

original: 'bras bu ma skyes pa na yang gnyi ga'i rgyu'i ngo bo don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'bras bu ma skyes pa na yang gnyi ga'i rgyu'i ngo bo don dam par med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Also, when the effect is not arisen, the nature of both causes does not exist ultimately.

original: skyes pa la yang cung zad kyang bskyed par byar med pas gang la gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i rgyu'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
analyzed: skyes pa la yang cung zad kyang bskyed par byar med pas gang la gnyi ga'i ngo bo'i rgyu'i bya ba dang ldan par 'gyur /
translated: And when it is arisen, since it is not produced in the least, with respect to what would the activity of the cause that has the nature of both exist?

original: rgyu med pa @190b las zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang ma yin te /
analyzed: rgyu med pa @190b las zhes pa'i rnam par rtog pa yang ma yin te /
translated: Nor is it the conception that it arises without a cause,

original: gang gi phyir med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'di rgyu med pa las zhes pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gang gi phyir med par dgag pa'i bdag nyid kyis 'di rgyu med pa las zhes pa ni 'thad pa ma yin te /
translated: because it is not tenable to say that this is without a cause, since it has the nature of an external negation.

original: rgyu med pa na dngos po rnams kyi yul dang dus kyi nges pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: rgyu med pa na dngos po rnams kyi yul dang dus kyi nges pa med par thal bar 'gyur ba'am /
translated: If there were no cause, it would follow that things would not be restricted to particular places and times,🔽or else it would follow that they would always exist or never exist.

original: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang ; thabs las byung ba 'dod pas kyang so sor nges pa'i thabs nyams su len par yang mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rtag tu yod pa dang med par thal bar 'gyur ba dang ; thabs las byung ba 'dod pas kyang so sor nges pa'i thabs nyams su len par yang mi 'gyur ro //
translated: And those who desire to attain a goal would not have to practice a specific method,🔽because the cause would always be present.

original: gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams rgyu yin pa nyid 'di 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gtso bo dang dbang phyug la sogs pa rnams rgyu yin pa nyid 'di 'gegs par 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The assertion that the primal substance, Īśvara, and so on are the cause is refuted.

original: rgyu med pa las dngos po'i rang bzhin thob pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: rgyu med pa las dngos po'i rang bzhin thob pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Things do not obtain their nature without a cause.

original: de lta bas na dngos po rnams rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las yod pa skye ba mi 'thad do //
analyzed: de lta bas na dngos po rnams rang dang gzhan dang gnyi ga dang rgyu med pa las yod pa skye ba mi 'thad do //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable that things arise from themselves, from another, from both, or without a cause.

original: de skad du yang /
analyzed: de skad du yang /
translated: As it has been said:

original: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
analyzed: rang las ma yin gzhan las min //
translated: Not from itself, not from another,

original: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min //🔽dngos po gang dang gang na yang //
analyzed: gnyis las ma yin rgyu med min // dngos po gang dang gang na yang //
translated: not from both, not without cause,🔽in no place and in no time

original: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: skyes pa nam yang yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
translated: is there ever an existent arising.

original: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dpyad pas kyang dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bral bas yod pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no /
analyzed: gcig dang du ma dang bral ba dpyad pas kyang dngos po thams cad rang bzhin dang bral bas yod pa'i dngos po ni ma yin no /
translated: Since all things are devoid of intrinsic reality when analyzed, they are not existent things.

original: de lta bas na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rkyen las byung ba tsam nyid 'di ma brtags na nyams dga' bar gzhag ste ji ltar sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa mngon par zhen bas ci zhig bya ste
analyzed: de lta bas na rmi lam dang sgyu ma dang gzugs brnyan la sogs pa dang 'dra ba rkyen las byung ba tsam nyid 'di ma brtags na nyams dga' bar gzhag ste ji ltar sdug bsngal thams cad kyi rgyur gyur pa mngon par zhen bas ci zhig bya ste
translated: Therefore, like dreams, illusions, reflections, and so on, they are merely arisen from conditions. If not analyzed, they are delightful. What is the use of clinging to them, which is the cause of all suffering?

original: / dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: / dgos pa yod pa ma yin no //
translated: There is no need for that.

original: de'i phyir 'di ni don gyi de kho na nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'di ni don gyi de kho na nyid yin te /
translated: Therefore, this is the reality of the meaning:

original: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
analyzed: bdag dang gzhan smras dngos 'di dag / yang dag tu na gcig pa dang // du ma'i rang bzhin bral ba'i phyir //
translated: These things spoken of by ourselves and others,

original: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
analyzed: rang bzhin med de gzugs brnyan bzhin //
translated: in reality, are devoid of intrinsic reality,🔽like reflections, because they are devoid of the nature of oneness and manyness.

original: zhes so ; / de ltar na rang bzhin med pa nyid dngos po rnams kyi gnyug ma yin te don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin no //
analyzed: zhes so ; / de ltar na rang bzhin med pa nyid dngos po rnams kyi gnyug ma yin te don dam pa'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa ma yin no //
translated: Thus, essencelessness is the intrinsic reality of things, but it is not the intrinsic reality that is the ultimate.

original: de nyid la skyes bu'i dgos pa'i mchog dang khyad par du 'phags par brjod do //
analyzed: de nyid la skyes bu'i dgos pa'i mchog dang khyad par du 'phags par brjod do //
translated: That is said to be the supreme and special purpose of a person.

original: 'di la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la yang mngon par zhen par mi bya'o //
translated: But one should not cling to that.

original: gzhan du na dngos po la mngon par zhen pa la khyad par du cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: gzhan du na dngos po la mngon par zhen pa la khyad par du cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin te /
translated: Otherwise, there would not be the slightest difference between clinging to things and clinging to nonthings.

original: gnyi ga yang brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgribs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gnyi ga yang brtags pa'i bdag nyid kyis bsgribs pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because both are obscured by the conception of intrinsic reality.

original: med par brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo cung zad ni yod pa ma yin la /
analyzed: med par brtags pa'i rang bzhin gyis rang gi ngo bo cung zad ni yod pa ma yin la /
translated: There is no intrinsic reality whatsoever that is conceived as nonexistent.

original: dngos po log pa yang dngos po med pa ma yin te /🔽log pa ni rang bzhin @191a * //
analyzed: dngos po log pa yang dngos po med pa ma yin te / log pa ni rang bzhin @191a * //
translated: And the negation of things is not a nonthing.

original: med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: med pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because negation is essenceless.

original: gal te yang dngos po ma yin te /
analyzed: gal te yang dngos po ma yin te /
translated: If it were not a thing,

original: log pa ni rang bzhin nyid 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin yin na /
analyzed: log pa ni rang bzhin nyid 'ga' zhig gi rang bzhin yin na /
translated: then negation would be the intrinsic reality of something.

original: de'i tshe bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i tshe bkag pa'i bdag nyid kyang dngos po med par 'gyur ro //
translated: At that time, the nature of the negation would also be a non-entity.

original: dngos po'i rang bzhin med do zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rang bzhin med do zhes bstan pa nyid yin no //
translated: It is taught that entities do not have an intrinsic nature.

original: de'i phyir dngos po log pa'i ngo bo dngos med ces bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir dngos po log pa'i ngo bo dngos med ces bya ba cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, the essence of the negation of an entity is not an entity called “non-entity.”

original: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag brjod pa'i rim pas med par bstan pa na /
analyzed: dngos po dang dngos po med pa dag brjod pa'i rim pas med par bstan pa na /
translated: When entities and non-entities are taught to be nonexistent through the sequence of expressions,

original: de gnyis 'dres pa'i bdag nyid dam gnyi ga bkag pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de gnyis 'dres pa'i bdag nyid dam gnyi ga bkag pa'i rang bzhin nyid ni yod pa ma yin te /
translated: the nature of the combination of the two or the nature of the negation of both does not exist.

original: dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa nyid rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de bkag pa na 'di rnams thams cad nyid dgag pa gcig gis bsal ba yin no //
analyzed: dngos po'i rnam par rtog pa nyid rnam par rtog pa mtha' dag gi rgyu yin pa'i phyir de bkag pa na 'di rnams thams cad nyid dgag pa gcig gis bsal ba yin no //
translated: Because the conception of entities is the cause of all conceptions, when it is negated, all of these are eliminated by a single negation.

original: de'i phyir yod pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin pa la cung zad kyang mngon par zhen pa'i yul du brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yod pa dang / yod pa ma yin pa dang / yod pa dang med pa gnyi ga dang / gnyi ga'i bdag nyid kyang ma yin pa la cung zad kyang mngon par zhen pa'i yul du brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: Therefore, one should not conceive of anything whatsoever as an object of attachment, whether it is existent, non-existent, both existent and non-existent, or neither.

original: de 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: de 'phags pa shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa las gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the noble Perfection of Wisdom:

original: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
analyzed: rab 'byor gyis smras pa /
translated: Subhūti said:

original: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes pa ni zhen pa'o //🔽tshor ba stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa sha ra dva ti'i bu 'di la byang chub sems dpa'i theg pa pa'i rigs kyi bu'am rigs kyi bu mo thabs mi mkhas pas gzugs stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes pa ni zhen pa'o // tshor ba stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
translated: Venerable Śāradvatīputra, here, a son or daughter of good family in the Bodhisattva Vehicle, lacking skill in means, conceives of form as empty—that is attachment.🔽If they conceive of feeling as empty, that is attachment.

original: 'du shes stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //🔽'du byed stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'du shes stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o // 'du byed stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
translated: If they conceive of perception as empty, that is attachment.🔽If they conceive of volitional factors as empty, that is attachment.

original: rnam par shes pa stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o //
translated: If they conceive of consciousness as empty, that is attachment.

original: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / ji srid du chos kyi bar du stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: de bzhin du mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / ji srid du chos kyi bar du stong pa'o zhes yang dag par shes na zhen pa'o zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: Likewise, if one knows that the eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and so on up to the mental faculty are empty, one does not cling to them as real.

original: ji skad du yang /
analyzed: ji skad du yang /
translated: And as it is said:

original: kun rtog thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
analyzed: kun rtog thams cad spang ba'i phyir //
translated: In order to abandon all conceptualization,

original: stong nyid bdud rtsi ston mdzad la //
analyzed: stong nyid bdud rtsi ston mdzad la //
translated: you have taught the nectar of emptiness.

original: gang zhig de la zhen gyur na //🔽de nyid khyed kyis shin tu smad //
analyzed: gang zhig de la zhen gyur na // de nyid khyed kyis shin tu smad //
translated: But if one clings to that,

original: ces gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin no //
translated: you have said that this is a great fault.

original: yod min med min yod med min ;
analyzed: yod min med min yod med min ;
translated: It is not existent, not nonexistent, not existent and nonexistent,

original: / gnyis kyi bdag nyid du yang med //
analyzed: / gnyis kyi bdag nyid du yang med //
translated: nor does it have the nature of being both.

original: mtha' bzhi dag las nges grol ba //
analyzed: mtha' bzhi dag las nges grol ba //
translated: Liberated from the four extremes,

original: de nyid dbu mar mkhas rnams bzhed //
analyzed: de nyid dbu mar mkhas rnams bzhed //
translated: the wise accept this as the middle path.

original: ces so // de ltar mtha' bzhi las grol ba gdod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa rtag pa dang chad pa med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis spros pa dang / @191b bral ba'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du chags pa med pa gnas med par 'gro ba ma lus par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: ces so // de ltar mtha' bzhi las grol ba gdod ma nas zhi ba ma skyes pa ma 'gags pa rtag pa dang chad pa med pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin gyis spros pa dang / @191b bral ba'i phyir nam mkha' bzhin du chags pa med pa gnas med par 'gro ba ma lus par blta bar bya'o //
translated: Thus, one should view the entire world as being like space, free from attachment and without abode, because of being free from the four extremes, primordially peaceful, unborn, unceasing, without eternalism or nihilism, and so on, and because of being free from the elaborations of intrinsic reality.

original: 'di ni bden pa gnyis su 'dod //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa gnyis su 'dod //
translated: The two truths are asserted.

original: ces te / gang zhe na /
analyzed: ces te / gang zhe na /
translated: What are they?

original: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang ni don dam ste //
translated: The conventional and the ultimate.

original: zhes 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes 'og tu sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: This is to be applied below.

original: kun rdzob ni gcig yin la bden pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob ni gcig yin la bden pa ni phyin ci ma log pa yin no //
translated: The conventional is one and the truth is nonerroneous.

original: yang don dam pa ste bden pa gzhan yin la /
analyzed: yang don dam pa ste bden pa gzhan yin la /
translated: The ultimate is another truth.

original: dang gi sgras ni bden pa tsam du mtshungs par sdud par byed do //
analyzed: dang gi sgras ni bden pa tsam du mtshungs par sdud par byed do //
translated: The word “and” includes the mere truth.

original: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo yin la don dam pa'i bden pa la yang bden pa ni slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'jig rten pa'i phyin ci ma log pa'i ngo bo yin la don dam pa'i bden pa la yang bden pa ni slu bar mi byed pa yin no //
translated: Conventional truth is the nonerroneous nature of the world. Ultimate truth is also a truth, because it does not deceive.

original: de kho na nyid ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
analyzed: de kho na nyid ni 'phags pa rnams kyi'o zhes pa ni khyad par ro //
translated: The reality of the noble ones is the distinction.

original: don gyi khyad par 'di lta bu mthong bas kyang dang gi sgra ni rigs pa yin no //
analyzed: don gyi khyad par 'di lta bu mthong bas kyang dang gi sgra ni rigs pa yin no //
translated: Since this kind of distinction in meaning is seen, the word “also” is reasonable.

original: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'di skad brjod par 'gyur te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di thams cad rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis 'dzin pas yang dag par skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: phyi rol dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dngos po 'di thams cad rang bzhin rnam pa gnyis 'dzin pas yang dag par skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: All these things with external and internal natures arise in reality by apprehending two kinds of natures.

original: 'di lta ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di lta ste kun rdzob dang don dam pa zhes pa'o ;
translated: They are the conventional and the ultimate.

original: / de la gcig ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yul brdzun par mthong ba nyid na yang dag par mthong bar zhen to //
analyzed: / de la gcig ni ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis bsgribs pa'i mig can yang dag pa ma yin pa'i bdag nyid mthong ba'i so so'i skye bo rnams kyis yul brdzun par mthong ba nyid na yang dag par mthong bar zhen to //
translated: Among them, the first is the object seen by ordinary beings whose eyes are covered by the cataracts of ignorance, who see an unreal nature, and who are attached to what is seen as real.

original: gzhan ni rnam par 'byed pa'i mig sman gyi thur mas ma rig pa'i ling tog bsal bas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig can de kho na nyid rig pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pas rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa yin
analyzed: gzhan ni rnam par 'byed pa'i mig sman gyi thur mas ma rig pa'i ling tog bsal bas yang dag pa'i shes pa'i mig can de kho na nyid rig pa'i 'phags pa rnams kyis yang dag pa'i shes pa'i yul du gyur pas rang bzhin rnam par gzhag pa yin
translated: The other is the reality that is the object of the eye of right knowledge of the āryas who know suchness, who have removed the cataracts of ignorance with the spoon of the eye medicine of discernment.

original: no // de ltar dngos po 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gnyis 'dzin pa yin no //
analyzed: no // de ltar dngos po 'di dag thams cad rang bzhin gnyis 'dzin pa yin no //
translated: Thus all these things are apprehended as having two natures.

original: rang bzhin 'di dag las byis pa brdzun pa mthong ba rnams kyi yul de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
analyzed: rang bzhin 'di dag las byis pa brdzun pa mthong ba rnams kyi yul de ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin la /
translated: The object of those childish beings who see the false is called “conventional truth.”

original: gang yang dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams kyi yul de ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bstan bcos rigs pas rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: gang yang dag pa'i gnas skabs kyi de kho na nyid rtogs pa rnams kyi yul de ni don dam pa'i bden pa zhes bstan bcos rigs pas rnam par gzhag go //
translated: The object of those who realize suchness, the way things really are, is called “ultimate truth.” This is how the treatises present things through reasoning.

original: gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: yang dag dang ni brdzun pa'i dngos mthong ba //
analyzed: yang dag dang ni brdzun pa'i dngos mthong ba //
translated: Seeing things as real or false,

original: 'thob pas dngos kun ngo bo gnyis 'dzin la //
analyzed: 'thob pas dngos kun ngo bo gnyis 'dzin la //
translated: one apprehends all things as having two natures.

original: yang dag gzigs yul gang de de nyid de //
analyzed: yang dag gzigs yul gang de de nyid de //
translated: The object of those who see reality is suchness.

original: brdzun pa mthong ba kun rdzob bden par brjod //
analyzed: brdzun pa mthong ba kun rdzob bden par brjod //
translated: The seeing of the unreal is called the conventional truth.

original: ces so // de ltar gnyis bsdus pa la gnyis so zhes rigs so //
analyzed: ces so // de ltar gnyis bsdus pa la gnyis so zhes rigs so //
translated: Thus, it is correct to say that the two truths are included in the two realities.

original: 'dod ces pa ni mngon par bzhed pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod ces pa ni mngon par bzhed pa'o //
translated: “ Desire” means to accept.

original: gang rnams she na /🔽sgrib pa spangs @192a * //
analyzed: gang rnams she na / sgrib pa spangs @192a * //
translated: What do they accept?

original: pa'i thugs dang ldan pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de'i rjes su zhugs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
analyzed: pa'i thugs dang ldan pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das rnams de'i rjes su zhugs pa'i 'phags pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams so //
translated: The Buddhas, the Bhagavans, who have eliminated the obscurations, and the noble disciples, the noble solitary realizers, and the noble bodhisattvas who follow them.

original: 'di nyid bden pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: 'di nyid bden pa gnyis yin te /
translated: This is the two truths.

original: gzhan bden pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dang gi sgra nges par gzung ba'i don du yang 'thad do //
analyzed: gzhan bden pa ni yod pa ma yin no zhes dang gi sgra nges par gzung ba'i don du yang 'thad do //
translated: There is no other truth. The word “only” is also tenable as having the meaning of restriction.

original: de skad du /🔽bden pa gnyis la brten nas ni //
analyzed: de skad du / bden pa gnyis la brten nas ni //
translated: As it is said:🔽The Dharma of the Buddhas is taught

original: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams kyi chos bstan pa //
translated: in dependence on the two truths:🔽the conventional truth of the world

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // dam pa'i don gyi bden pa'o // zhes gsungs so //
translated: and the ultimate truth.

original: yab sras mjal ba las kyang /
analyzed: yab sras mjal ba las kyang /
translated: And in the Meeting of Father and Son:

original: 'jig rten mkhas pa'i bden pa 'di gnyis te //
analyzed: 'jig rten mkhas pa'i bden pa 'di gnyis te //
translated: These two truths of the worldly wise

original: khyed kyis gzhan las ma gsan rang gis gzigs //
analyzed: khyed kyis gzhan las ma gsan rang gis gzigs //
translated: You have seen for yourself, not heard from others.

original: de ni kun rdzob bden dang don dam ste //
analyzed: de ni kun rdzob bden dang don dam ste //
translated: They are the conventional truth and the ultimate truth;

original: bden pa gsum pa gang yang ma mchis so //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: bden pa gsum pa gang yang ma mchis so // zhes gsungs so //
translated: There is no third truth whatsoever.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi mtshan nyid chos mngon pa las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa bden pa bzhi po sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang 'gog pa dang lam gyi mtshan nyid chos mngon pa las gsungs pa ma yin nam /
translated: The Bhagavān has not taught the characteristics of the four noble truths—suffering, origin, cessation, and path—in the Abhidharma?

original: de ji ltar na bden pa gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar na bden pa gnyis kho na yin zhe na /
translated: How is it that there are only two truths?

original: bden te 'on kyang gdul bya'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi dbang gis gnyis po nyid bzhir byas nas bstan pa yin te /
analyzed: bden te 'on kyang gdul bya'i bsam pa dang bag la nyal gyi dbang gis gnyis po nyid bzhir byas nas bstan pa yin te /
translated: It is true, but they are taught as four by the power of the inclinations and latent tendencies of the disciples, even though they are two.

original: 'di rnams gnyis po nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams gnyis po nyid du 'dus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are subsumed within just these two.

original: 'di ltar yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden par 'dus la /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang sdug bsngal dang kun 'byung ba dang lam rnams ni kun rdzob kyi bden pa'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden par 'dus la /
translated: Thus, suffering, origin, and path are subsumed within conventional truth because they are the nature of conventional truth.🔽Cessation is subsumed within ultimate truth because it is the nature of ultimate truth.

original: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin te /
analyzed: 'gog pa'i bden pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin te /
translated: The truth of cessation is the ultimate truth.

original: cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: cung zad kyang 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is not the slightest contradiction.

original: de ltar gyur na yang kun rdzob ni ma rig pas nye bar bstan pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad pa las lan brgya phrag tu nyams par gyur na yang ci ltar bden pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang kun rdzob ni ma rig pas nye bar bstan pas yang dag pa ma yin pa'i sgro btags pa'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir rnam par dpyad pa las lan brgya phrag tu nyams par gyur na yang ci ltar bden pa yin zhe na /
translated: Even though it is so, since the conventional is the nature of false superimposition, taught by ignorance, it is damaged a hundred times by analysis. How can it be true?

original: de la yang bden mod kyi /
analyzed: de la yang bden mod kyi /
translated: That is true, but

original: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i zhen pa las kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'jig rten pa'i zhen pa las kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes brjod de /
translated: nevertheless, the conventional truth is said to be so from the perspective of worldly clinging.

original: 'jig rten pa nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes 'dod cing /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa nyid kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes 'dod cing /
translated: The world itself is asserted to be the conventional truth.

original: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de kho na'i don de nyid btang snyoms su gzhag nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i rjes su 'brangs nas bcom ldan 'das kyis kyang de kho na'i don de nyid btang snyoms su gzhag nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa zhes gsungs te /
translated: Following that, the Transcendent Conqueror also, setting aside the meaning of reality, said “conventional truth.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir /
translated: For that very reason,

original: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // zhes bstan bcos su khyad par dang bcas pas slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs so //
analyzed: 'jig rten kun rdzob bden pa dang // zhes bstan bcos su khyad par dang bcas pas slob dpon gyi zhal snga nas kyis gsungs so //
translated: The Master himself has stated this with a qualification.

original: @192b dngos po la ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho na yin te /
analyzed: @192b dngos po la ni don dam pa'i bden pa gcig pu kho na yin te /
translated: In reality, there is only one truth.

original: de bas na cung zad kyang nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de bas na cung zad kyang nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, nothing is lost.

original: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
analyzed: ji skad du bcom ldan 'das kyis /
translated: As the Lord has said:

original: dge slong dag 'di ni gcig pu ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag 'di ni gcig pu ste don dam pa'i bden pa'o //
translated: “Monks, this is the one truth, the ultimate truth.

original: 'di lta ste mi bslu ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos yin la /
analyzed: 'di lta ste mi bslu ba mya ngan las 'das pa'i chos yin la /
translated: It is the Dharma of nirvana, which is nondeceptive.

original: 'dus byas thams cad ni brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: 'dus byas thams cad ni brdzun pa bslu ba'i chos so zhes gsungs so //
translated: All conditioned things are deceptive and false.”

original: 'di ni bden pa gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di ni bden pa gnyis su brjod pa yin no //
translated: This is the statement of the two truths.

original: de la ma rig pas bslang ba'i sems de'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes rtogs la /
analyzed: de la ma rig pas bslang ba'i sems de'i rang bzhin gyis kun rdzob kyi bden pa yin no zhes rtogs la /
translated: The nature of the mind, which is aroused by ignorance, is understood to be conventional truth.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa ni ji lta bu dang mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang rang bzhin gang yin pa ma shes pas de'i tshe mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste /🔽'di ltar / don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa ni ji lta bu dang mtshan nyid gang yin pa dang rang bzhin gang yin pa ma shes pas de'i tshe mtshan nyid brjod par bya ste / 'di ltar / don dam blo yi spyod yul min //
translated: Since the ultimate truth is not known in terms of what it is, what its characteristics are, and what its nature is, at this time its characteristics will be stated.

original: zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus it is said: The ultimate is not an object of the mind.

original: blo ni shes pa thams cad yin te /
analyzed: blo ni shes pa thams cad yin te /
translated: The mind is all consciousnesses.

original: shes pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa ste yul ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: shes pa thams cad kyi yul las 'das pa'i phyir spyod yul ma yin pa ste yul ma yin pa'o //
translated: Since it is beyond the object of all consciousnesses, it is not an object, not an object of the mind.

original: blo de thams cad kyi rnam pa gang gis kyang yul du bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
analyzed: blo de thams cad kyi rnam pa gang gis kyang yul du bya bar mi nus pa yin no zhes pa'i tha tshig ste /
translated: It is impossible for any aspect of the mind to objectify it.

original: ji ltar de'i rang bzhin de ltar bstan par nus /
analyzed: ji ltar de'i rang bzhin de ltar bstan par nus /
translated: How can its nature be taught in such a way?

original: 'di ltar yang spros pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid don dam pa'i bden pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar yang rnam par rtog pas mthong ba ma yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar yang spros pa thams cad las rnam par grol ba'i rang bzhin de bzhin nyid don dam pa'i bden pa'i de kho na nyid yin pa de'i phyir ji ltar yang rnam par rtog pas mthong ba ma yin te /
translated: Thus, since the nature of the ultimate truth is suchness, which is free from all elaborations, it is not seen in any way by conceptual thought.

original: khyad par thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: khyad par thams cad dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is free from all distinctions.

original: brtags pa las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang sgra rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
analyzed: brtags pa las 'das pa'i rang bzhin yang sgra rnams kyi spyod yul ma yin te /
translated: Moreover, the nature that transcends conceptualization is not the domain of words,

original: sgra ni rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa yin la yul ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgra ni rnam par rtog pas bskyed pa yin la yul ma yin pa la rnam par rtog pa'i blo 'jug pa ma yin no //
translated: because words are produced by conceptual thought, and conceptual thought does not engage with what is not an object.

original: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa'i brjod pa thams cad dang bral bas sgro ma btags pa kun rdzob ma yin pa brjod du med pa ni don dam pa de kho na nyid ji ltar na 'di ltar bstan par nus /
analyzed: de lta bas na rnam par rtog pa'i brjod pa thams cad dang bral bas sgro ma btags pa kun rdzob ma yin pa brjod du med pa ni don dam pa de kho na nyid ji ltar na 'di ltar bstan par nus /
translated: Therefore, how can the ultimate, which is free from all conceptual expressions, which is not a conventional designation, and which is inexpressible, be taught in this way?

original: de lta na yang snod dang ldan pa'i nyan pa po rnams ji ltar yang rjes su gzung ba'i don du yongs su brtag pa bzung nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa dpe nye bar bstan pas cung zad brjod pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta na yang snod dang ldan pa'i nyan pa po rnams ji ltar yang rjes su gzung ba'i don du yongs su brtag pa bzung nas kun rdzob kyi bden pa dpe nye bar bstan pas cung zad brjod pa yin te /
translated: Nevertheless, in order to guide those who are suitable vessels, we will use conventional expressions and examples to explain it a little.

original: dper na rab rib can la rab rib kyi mthus nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad du skra shad kyis khyab par mthong nas de dang der gdong sgyur bar byed de /🔽de ltar byed pa de rab rib med pas rig nas 'di ci byed ces de'i gnad du song nas de ma mthong ba'i sgra'i yul du mig phye nas @193a * //
analyzed: dper na rab rib can la rab rib kyi mthus nam mkha'i phyogs thams cad du skra shad kyis khyab par mthong nas de dang der gdong sgyur bar byed de / de ltar byed pa de rab rib med pas rig nas 'di ci byed ces de'i gnad du song nas de ma mthong ba'i sgra'i yul du mig phye nas @193a * //
translated: For example, a person with myodesopsia sees hairs covering all directions of space due to the force of the myodesopsia. He turns his face this way and that.

original: bltas kyang skra'i gzugs ni mthong bar ma gyur la /
analyzed: bltas kyang skra'i gzugs ni mthong bar ma gyur la /
translated: A person without myodesopsia sees this and asks, “What are you doing?” He points out the error. The person with myodesopsia opens his eyes and looks at the place where the hairs are, but he does not see the form of the hairs.

original: skra shad de gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par rnams yongs su rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: skra shad de gzhir gyur pa'i dngos po dang dngos po med pa'i khyad par rnams yongs su rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not understand the difference between the real and the unreal that is based on the hairs.

original: gang gi tshe yang rab rib can gyis rab rib med pa la 'di ni skra yod do zhes rang gi bsam pas ston par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du de la 'di na skra shad cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang rab rib can gyis rab rib med pa la 'di ni skra yod do zhes rang gi bsam pas ston par byed pa de'i tshe de'i rnam par rtog pa spang ba'i don du de la 'di na skra shad cung zad kyang yod pa ma yin
translated: When the person with myodesopsia, through his own thoughts, points to the person without myodesopsia and says, “There are hairs,” in order to eliminate his misconception, the other person says, “There are no hairs at all here.”

original: no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di ston par byed de //
analyzed: no zhes yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin du 'di ston par byed de //
translated: Thus, he teaches this in a way that is completely true to fact.

original: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i ngor dgag pa lhur byed pa nyid kyi tshig 'di smras pa yin te /
analyzed: rab rib can gyis mthong ba'i ngor dgag pa lhur byed pa nyid kyi tshig 'di smras pa yin te /
translated: He says this in order to emphasize the refutation from the perspective of someone who has myodesopsia.

original: de rnams kyis de skad smras pa na yang dgag pa'am bsgrub par byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no //🔽skra shad kyi de kho na nyid de yang rab rib can gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de rab rib med pas mthong ba ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyis de skad smras pa na yang dgag pa'am bsgrub par byas pa ni yod pa ma yin no // skra shad kyi de kho na nyid de yang rab rib can gyis mthong ba gang yin pa de rab rib med pas mthong ba ni ma yin no //
translated: Even though they say this, there is no refutation or proof.🔽The reality of the floating hair is not seen by someone who does not have myodesopsia.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis nyams pa dang ldan pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i byis pas gang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin 'di dmigs pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i rab rib kyis nyams pa dang ldan pas de kho na nyid ma mthong ba'i byis pas gang phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi rang bzhin 'di dmigs pa ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, the reality that is not seen by the childish, who are impaired by the myodesopsia of ignorance, is not perceived by those who are free of the myodesopsia of ignorance.

original: de rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ngo bo phung po la sogs pa de rnams rang bzhin gang gis rab rib med pas mthong ba'i tshul gyis ma rig pa'i bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jigs pa de ni de rnams kyi don dam
analyzed: de rnams kyi kun rdzob kyi ngo bo phung po la sogs pa de rnams rang bzhin gang gis rab rib med pas mthong ba'i tshul gyis ma rig pa'i bag chags mtha' dag spangs pa'i sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das kyis 'jigs pa de ni de rnams kyi don dam
translated: The essence of the relative of those is the aggregates and so on. The essence of the ultimate of those is the essence of the aggregates and so on that is seen by the Bhagavān Buddha, who has abandoned all traces of ignorance, as if seeing without the impairment of blurred vision.🔽

original: pa'i bden pa yin no //
analyzed: pa'i bden pa yin no //
translated: The ultimate truth of those is the essence of the conventional, the aggregates and so on, which is seen by the Bhagavan Buddha, who has abandoned all traces of ignorance, as if he were free of eye disease.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it has been said:

original: bstan bcos mkhyen pas /
analyzed: bstan bcos mkhyen pas /
translated: The treatise master says:

original: gang zhig rab rib snang bas rnam brtags pa //
analyzed: gang zhig rab rib snang bas rnam brtags pa //
translated: That which is imagined by the appearance of eye disease,🔽The nature of hair and so on, is seen wrongly.

original: skra sogs ngo bo de nyid phyin ci log / mthong dag gang gis yang dag mthong de ni //
analyzed: skra sogs ngo bo de nyid phyin ci log / mthong dag gang gis yang dag mthong de ni //
translated: That which is seen correctly by one without eye disease

original: de nyid yin te de bzhin 'dir shes bya //🔽zhes gsungs pa yin no //
analyzed: de nyid yin te de bzhin 'dir shes bya // zhes gsungs pa yin no //
translated: Is the way things are, and so it is here.

original: de ltar don dam pa brjod par bya ba ma yin yang /🔽don dam pa'i de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i sgo nas nye bar brtags pa bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa brjod par bya ba ma yin yang / don dam pa'i de kho na nyid gzigs pa'i sgo nas nye bar brtags pa bzung ste /
translated: Thus, although the ultimate is not an object of expression,

original: kun rdzob ji ltar yang bstan pa yin la /
analyzed: kun rdzob ji ltar yang bstan pa yin la /
translated: it is taught conventionally by taking it as an object of examination through the perspective of one who sees the way things really are.

original: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad ma lus pa spangs pa des dngos po'i rang bzhin smra bar nus pa ni ma yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi tha snyad ma lus pa spangs pa des dngos po'i rang bzhin smra bar nus pa ni ma yin te /
translated: But that does not mean that the nature of things can be expressed by that which abandons all conventional expressions.

original: ji skad du /
analyzed: ji skad du /
translated: As it is said:

original: yi ge med pa'i chos rnams la //🔽nyan pa po gang ston pa gang //
analyzed: yi ge med pa'i chos rnams la // nyan pa po gang ston pa gang //
translated: In the Dharma of no letters🔽what is heard and what is taught?

original: don gang nyan cing ston byed pa //
analyzed: don gang nyan cing ston byed pa //
translated: What is heard and taught

original: sgro btags pas na yi ge med //🔽ces gsungs so //
analyzed: sgro btags pas na yi ge med // ces gsungs so //
translated: is the non-existent letter.

original: de lta bas na tha snyad pa'i bden pa nyid la brten nas don dam pa ston pa yin te /
analyzed: de lta bas na tha snyad pa'i bden pa nyid la brten nas don dam pa ston pa yin te /
translated: Therefore, the ultimate is taught in dependence on conventional truth.

original: don dam pa bstan pa rtogs pas kyang don dam @193b pa mngon du byed pa yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa bstan pa rtogs pas kyang don dam @193b pa mngon du byed pa yin te /
translated: And by understanding the teaching of the ultimate, the ultimate is realized,

original: de nyid de'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid de'i thabs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because that is the method for it.

original: gang bstan bcos las /🔽tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
analyzed: gang bstan bcos las / tha snyad la ni ma brten par //
translated: As the treatise says:🔽Without depending on the conventional,

original: dam pa'i don ni rtogs med par //
analyzed: dam pa'i don ni rtogs med par //
translated: the ultimate is not realized.🔽Without realizing the ultimate,

original: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: mya ngan 'das pa 'thob ma yin // zhes gsungs so //
translated: nirvana is not attained.

original: de ltar don dam pa bstan pa ni thabs yin la /
analyzed: de ltar don dam pa bstan pa ni thabs yin la /
translated: Thus, the teaching of the ultimate is the method,

original: don dam pa rtogs pa yang thabs las byung ba yin te /
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs pa yang thabs las byung ba yin te /
translated: and the realization of the ultimate arises from the method.

original: gzhan du na de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na de bstan par mi nus pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, it could not be taught.

original: ci ste yang de lta bur gyur pa yang de lta bur gyur pa'i blo'i yul yin te /
analyzed: ci ste yang de lta bur gyur pa yang de lta bur gyur pa'i blo'i yul yin te /
translated: But if it is the object of a cognition that is of such a nature,

original: don dam par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na /🔽'di la / blo ni kun rdzob yin par brjod //
analyzed: don dam par ci'i phyir mi 'gyur zhe na / 'di la / blo ni kun rdzob yin par brjod //
translated: why is it not ultimate?🔽In response to this, it is said:

original: ces gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: ces gsungs pa yin te /
translated: The cognition is said to be conventional.

original: blo la snang ba dang mi snang ba nyid kyi thams cad brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: blo la snang ba dang mi snang ba nyid kyi thams cad brtags pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: The appearance and nonappearance to cognition are the nature of all that is imagined.

original: rtog pa yang thams cad du ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
analyzed: rtog pa yang thams cad du ma rig pa'i rang bzhin yin te /
translated: Imagination is the nature of all that is ignorance.

original: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po med pa 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it grasps what is unreal.

original: gang rnam par rtog pa 'di rang nyid kyis ma rig pa'i ngo bor gyur zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa 'di rang nyid kyis ma rig pa'i ngo bor gyur zhes gsungs so //
translated: This is what is said: “This imagination is itself the essence of ignorance.”

original: ma rig pa yang kun rdzob yin te /
analyzed: ma rig pa yang kun rdzob yin te /
translated: Ignorance is also conventional.

original: de'i phyir brgya la yang blo ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par don dam par 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir brgya la yang blo ni don dam pa'i rang bzhin 'dzin par don dam par 'thad pa ni ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is not tenable in any way that cognition is ultimately the nature of the ultimate.

original: gzhan du na kun rdzob blo'i gzung bar bya ba yin pas don dam pa'i rang bzhin nyid de nyams par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na kun rdzob blo'i gzung bar bya ba yin pas don dam pa'i rang bzhin nyid de nyams par 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, since it would be the object of a conventional mind, it would lose its status as ultimate nature.

original: dngos po la don dam pa ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dngos po la don dam pa ni kun rdzob kyi shes pa'i yul yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: For, in regard to things, the ultimate is the object of a conventional consciousness.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa der yang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'phags pa bden pa gnyis la 'jug pa der yang /
translated: The Lord also says in the noble Two Truths:

original: lha'i bu gal te don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod yul du gyur na de don dam pa'i grangs su mi 'gro zhing kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha'i bu gal te don dam pa'i bden pa lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod yul du gyur na de don dam pa'i grangs su mi 'gro zhing kun rdzob kyi bden pa nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: “Son of a god, if the ultimate truth were the domain of activity of body, speech, or mind, it would not go into the enumeration of the ultimate, and it would be just the conventional truth.

original: lha'i bu 'on kyang don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa dang / yang dag par ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa dang bral ba yin te /
analyzed: lha'i bu 'on kyang don dam pa'i bden pa ni tha snyad thams cad las 'das pa dang / yang dag par ma skyes pa dang / ma 'gags pa dang / brjod par bya ba dang / rjod par byed pa dang / shes bya dang / shes pa dang bral ba yin te /
translated: Son of a god, however, the ultimate truth is beyond all conventions, not really arisen, not really ceased, free from the expressible and the expresser, the knower and the known.

original: ji srid du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
analyzed: ji srid du rnam pa thams cad kyi mchog dang ldan pa'i thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes kyi yul las 'das pa ni don dam pa'i bden pa yin no zhes rgyas par gsungs so //
translated: As long as it is beyond the domain of omniscient wisdom endowed with the supreme of all aspects, it is ultimate truth.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rnam par rtog pa rnams kyi yul ma yin te /
translated: Thus, it is not the domain of conceptual thought.

original: gang dngos po dang dngos po med pa yin pa /
analyzed: gang dngos po dang dngos po med pa yin pa /
translated: It is neither a thing nor a non-thing.

original: rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang /🔽bdag dang / @194a * //
analyzed: rang dang gzhan gyi dngos po dang / bden pa dang bden pa ma yin pa dang / rtag pa dang / chad pa dang / rtag pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / gtsang ba dang / mi gtsang ba dang / bdag dang / @194a * //
translated: It is neither one’s own nor another’s, neither true nor false, neither permanent nor impermanent, neither happy nor suffering, neither pure nor impure,🔽neither a self nor selfless, neither empty nor not empty, neither one nor many, neither arising nor ceasing, and so on.

original: bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / gcig dang du ma dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams de kho na nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang / stong pa dang / stong pa ma yin pa dang / gcig dang du ma dang / skye ba dang / 'gag pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams de kho na nyid du srid pa ma yin te /
translated: These distinctions are not possible in reality.

original: 'di rnams kun rdzob kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'di rnams kun rdzob kyi chos yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all of these are conventional phenomena.

original: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las ji skad du /
analyzed: 'di yang bcom ldan 'das kyis yab dang sras mjal ba'i mdo las ji skad du /
translated: This is also stated by the Blessed One in the Meeting of Father and Son Sūtra:

original: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis thugs su chud de /
analyzed: 'di ltar de bzhin gshegs pas kun rdzob dang / don dam pa gnyis thugs su chud de /
translated: Thus, the Tathāgata has realized both the conventional and the ultimate.

original: shes par bya ba yang kun rdzob dang / don dam pa 'dir zad do //
analyzed: shes par bya ba yang kun rdzob dang / don dam pa 'dir zad do //
translated: And what is to be known is exhausted in these two: the conventional and the ultimate.

original: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid du rab tu gzigs /
analyzed: de yang bcom ldan 'das kyis stong pa nyid du rab tu gzigs /
translated: Moreover, the Blessed One has seen emptiness as emptiness.

original: rab tu mkhyen /
analyzed: rab tu mkhyen /
translated: He has known it well.

original: legs par mngon du mdzad pas de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: legs par mngon du mdzad pas de'i phyir thams cad mkhyen pa zhes bya'o //
translated: He has realized it well. Therefore, he is called the Omniscient One.

original: de la kun rdzob ni 'jig rten gyi spyod par de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs so //
analyzed: de la kun rdzob ni 'jig rten gyi spyod par de bzhin gshegs pas gzigs so //
translated: Here, the conventional is seen by the Tathāgata as the conduct of the world.

original: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni brjod du med pa ste /🔽shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: don dam pa gang yin pa de ni brjod du med pa ste / shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: And what is ultimate is inexpressible.🔽It is not an object of knowledge.

original: rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: rnam par shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not an object of consciousness.

original: yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: yongs su shes par bya ba ma yin pa /
translated: It is not an object of thorough understanding.

original: ma bstan pa /
analyzed: ma bstan pa /
translated: It is not taught.

original: rab tu ma bstan pa nas bya ba med pa'i bar dang / byed pa med pa nas ji srid du thob pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: rab tu ma bstan pa nas bya ba med pa'i bar dang / byed pa med pa nas ji srid du thob pa ma yin pa /
translated: from not being taught up to not being an action, from not being an agent up to not being attained,

original: ma thob pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: ma thob pa ma yin pa /
translated: not being non-attained,

original: bde ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: bde ba ma yin pa /
translated: not being pleasure,

original: sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa /
analyzed: sdug bsngal ba ma yin pa /
translated: not being pain,

original: snyan pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: snyan pa ma yin pa /
translated: not being fame,

original: mi snyan pa ma yin pa /
analyzed: mi snyan pa ma yin pa /
translated: not being infamy,

original: gzugs ma yin pa /
analyzed: gzugs ma yin pa /
translated: not being form,

original: gzugs med pa ma yin pa zhes pa la sogs so //
analyzed: gzugs med pa ma yin pa zhes pa la sogs so //
translated: not being formless, and so on.

original: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi khyad par mtha' dag nub pa khyad par ma lus pa dang bral ba la dngos po mtha' yas shing yangs pa khyab pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la gsal ba'i nang gi bdag can bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'o🔽zhes gsungs so //
analyzed: de ltar na kun rdzob kyi khyad par mtha' dag nub pa khyad par ma lus pa dang bral ba la dngos po mtha' yas shing yangs pa khyab pa'i ye shes kyi snang ba la gsal ba'i nang gi bdag can bcom ldan 'das kyis don dam pa'i bden pa'o zhes gsungs so //
translated: Thus, the Blessed One, whose nature is the inner self, whose light is the appearance of the wisdom that pervades the infinite and vast entities, free from all distinctions, in which all distinctions of the conventional have disappeared, has declared this to be ultimate truth.

original: 'di 'phags pa rnams nyid kyis rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so so rang gis rig pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di 'phags pa rnams nyid kyis rang rig pa'i rang bzhin yin pas so so rang gis rig pa yin te /
translated: Since this is the nature of self-awareness of the noble ones themselves, it is individually self-cognized.

original: de'i phyir de nyid 'di la tshad ma yin no //
analyzed: de'i phyir de nyid 'di la tshad ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, that itself is the valid cognition in this case.

original: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la brten nas bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: kun rdzob kyi bden pa ni 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad la brten nas bstan pa yin no //
translated: The conventional truth is taught in dependence upon worldly conventions.

original: de 'di ltar rnam par dbye ba ji lta bar bden pa gnyis shes pas phyin ci ma log par chos rnam par 'byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de 'di ltar rnam par dbye ba ji lta bar bden pa gnyis shes pas phyin ci ma log par chos rnam par 'byed pa skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, by knowing the two truths in accordance with their divisions, the unmistaken differentiation of phenomena will arise.

original: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas /
analyzed: de ltar kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i dbye bas bden pa gnyis su rnam par gzhag nas /
translated: Having thus presented the two truths in terms of the division into the conventional and the ultimate,

original: de la dbang ba'i 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de la dbang ba'i 'jig rten yang rnam pa gnyis nyid do zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: in order to demonstrate that the world that is governed by them is also twofold,🔽it is said:

original: de la 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /🔽de la ni de dag la ste /
analyzed: de la 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te / de la ni de dag la ste /
translated: “The world is twofold.”🔽“There” refers to those who are governed by the conventional and the ultimate truths.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la dbang bar gnas @194b pa'i bden pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go //🔽'jig rten ni skye bo yin la gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis yin te /
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa la dbang bar gnas @194b pa'i bden pa gnyis rtogs par byed pa po zhes bya ba'i tha tshig go // 'jig rten ni skye bo yin la gnyis ni rnam pa gnyis yin te /
translated: The meaning is that they are the ones who realize the two truths.

original: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa dag go //
analyzed: kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa dag go //
translated: “World” refers to beings, and “twofold” means twofold in terms of the conventional and the ultimate truths.

original: 'jig rten zhes pa ni spyi'i tshig yin pa des na phung po gnyis yin no zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa ni spyi'i tshig yin pa des na phung po gnyis yin no zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The word “world” is a general term, so the meaning is that there are two aggregates.

original: mthong ba ni lung dang rigs pas rtogs pa'o //
analyzed: mthong ba ni lung dang rigs pas rtogs pa'o //
translated: “Seeing” means understanding through scripture and reasoning.

original: ji ltar na rnam pa gnyis su byas she na /
analyzed: ji ltar na rnam pa gnyis su byas she na /
translated: How are they divided into two?

original: rnal 'byor pa dang phal pa'o zhes pa ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa dang phal pa'o zhes pa ste /
translated: They are the yogi and the ordinary person.

original: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
analyzed: rnal 'byor ni ting nge 'dzin yin la /
translated: Yoga is concentration.

original: chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
analyzed: chos thams cad ma dmigs pa'i mtshan nyid yin te /
translated: It has the characteristic of not observing any phenomena.

original: de gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor ba yin la /
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de ni rnal 'byor ba yin la /
translated: One who has that is a yogi.

original: 'jig rten zhes phung po rnams gcig tu byas so //
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes phung po rnams gcig tu byas so //
translated: The world is the aggregate of ordinary people.

original: de bzhin du phal pa ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang srid pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du phal pa ni 'khor bar 'jug pa'i rgyu ma rig pa dang srid pa yin la /
translated: Similarly, the ordinary person is the cause of entering saṃsāra, which is ignorance and becoming.

original: de las byung ba ni phal pa yin te /
analyzed: de las byung ba ni phal pa yin te /
translated: One who arises from that is an ordinary person.

original: phal pa nyid phal pa yin la 'jig rten ni gnyis pa'o //
analyzed: phal pa nyid phal pa yin la 'jig rten ni gnyis pa'o //
translated: Ordinary people are ordinary people, and the world is the second.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa nyid ni gtso bo yin te phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin no //
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa nyid ni gtso bo yin te phyin ci ma log par mthong ba yin no //
translated: Among them, the yogi is the principal one, because he sees without error.

original: phal pas dngos po phyin ci log tu mthong ba yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phal pas dngos po phyin ci log tu mthong ba yin te 'khrul pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Ordinary people see things in a distorted way, because they are deluded.

original: de ltar na yang gnyi gas rang gi de kho na nyid ci lta ba mthong bas gang zhig ma 'khrul pa can yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar na yang gnyi gas rang gi de kho na nyid ci lta ba mthong bas gang zhig ma 'khrul pa can yin zhe na /
translated: In that case, since both see their own reality as it is, who is non-deluded?

original: gang nyid la gzhan gyis gnod pa'o //
analyzed: gang nyid la gzhan gyis gnod pa'o //
translated: It is the one who is not harmed by the other.

original: yang 'di dag las gang gis gnod pa yin zhe na /
analyzed: yang 'di dag las gang gis gnod pa yin zhe na /
translated: Again, by whom are they harmed?

original: de la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de la zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With respect to that, etc.

original: de la zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mtha' can spyir btang ba'i tshig dang dmigs kyis dga' ba la bdun pa'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mtha' can spyir btang ba'i tshig dang dmigs kyis dga' ba la bdun pa'o //
translated: With respect to that is a general statement with a seventh case ending, and specifically with respect to the yogis.

original: de la rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten phal pa de dag gi nang nas 'jig rten phal pa ni phal pa'i rigs kyi spyi las dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten phal pa de dag gi nang nas 'jig rten phal pa ni phal pa'i rigs kyi spyi las dmigs kyis bsal ba yin te /
translated: Among those, the ordinary world is excluded from the general class of ordinary people.

original: dmigs kyis bsal nas kyang gnod ces pa ni gnod par brjod do //
analyzed: dmigs kyis bsal nas kyang gnod ces pa ni gnod par brjod do //
translated: Having excluded that, they are harmed, i.e., they are said to be harmed.

original: gang las ltos nas she na /
analyzed: gang las ltos nas she na /
translated: With respect to what are they harmed?

original: rnal 'byor 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: rnal 'byor 'jig rten zhes bya ba la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: With respect to the yogi world, etc.

original: rnal 'byor pa nyid 'jig rten yin te rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa nyid 'jig rten yin te rnal 'byor pa'i 'jig rten pa'o //
translated: The yogi himself is the world, and the world of the yogi.

original: des gnod pa ni phyin ci log gi blor rnam gzhag byed pa'o //
analyzed: des gnod pa ni phyin ci log gi blor rnam gzhag byed pa'o //
translated: He is harmed by the erroneous mind.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How so?

original: blo khyad kyis zhes pa sbyar bar bya ste ;
analyzed: blo khyad kyis zhes pa sbyar bar bya ste ;
translated: One should add “by the difference in the mind.”

original: rnal 'byor ba la ni 'jig rten pas gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba la ni 'jig rten pas gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: The yogi is not harmed by the world.

original: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te /🔽ji ltar 'khrul pas bskyed pa'i dngos por rab rib kyis nyams par byas pa'i mig can gyi mi bden pa'i skra shad mthong ba'i shes pa la ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i de kho na nyid 'dzin pa rab rib med @195a * //
analyzed: 'dir bsam pa ni 'di yin te / ji ltar 'khrul pas bskyed pa'i dngos por rab rib kyis nyams par byas pa'i mig can gyi mi bden pa'i skra shad mthong ba'i shes pa la ni dngos po ji ltar gnas pa'i de kho na nyid 'dzin pa rab rib med @195a * //
translated: The idea here is this:

original: pa can gyi shes pas gnod do //
analyzed: pa can gyi shes pas gnod do //
translated: Just as the cognition of a false hair, which is produced by error and seen by a person whose eyes are impaired by cataracts, is harmed by the cognition of one without cataracts, which apprehends the reality of things just as it is,

original: de bzhin du rab rib med pa can gyi shes pa la ni rab rib can gyi shes pas mi gnod de /
analyzed: de bzhin du rab rib med pa can gyi shes pa la ni rab rib can gyi shes pas mi gnod de /
translated: in the same way, the cognition of one without cataracts is not harmed by the cognition of one with cataracts.

original: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i dri mi'i rab rib kyis blo'i mig skyon can du byas pas dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni phal pa'i shes pa yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin du ma rig pa'i dri mi'i rab rib kyis blo'i mig skyon can du byas pas dngos po'i rang bzhin phyin ci log tu 'dzin pa ni phal pa'i shes pa yin la /
translated: Likewise, the consciousness of ordinary beings, whose eye of intelligence is impaired by the cataracts of ignorance, apprehends the nature of things in a distorted way.

original: shes rab kyi chus bkrus pa'i mtshan nyid can dri ma dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i mig dag gis dngos po gnyug ma'i de kho na nyid rig pa'i rnal 'byor bas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa la gnod la /
analyzed: shes rab kyi chus bkrus pa'i mtshan nyid can dri ma dang bral ba zag pa med pa'i mig dag gis dngos po gnyug ma'i de kho na nyid rig pa'i rnal 'byor bas 'jig rten pa'i shes pa la gnod la /
translated: The yogi, whose eye is cleansed by the water of wisdom, is free of stains, and with his pure eye, free of contaminants, knows the intrinsic reality of things. Thus, the consciousness of ordinary beings is undermined.

original: slar tsig shos kyis ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
analyzed: slar tsig shos kyis ni rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la gnod pa ma yin no //
translated: But the consciousness of the yogi is not undermined by the other.

original: ji ltar mthong ba'i rab rib mig can gyis //
analyzed: ji ltar mthong ba'i rab rib mig can gyis //
translated: Just as one with cataracts

original: rab rib med pa'i ye shes la gnod min //
analyzed: rab rib med pa'i ye shes la gnod min //
translated: does not undermine the wisdom of one without cataracts,

original: de bzhin shes pa dri ma'i dbang gyur pas //
analyzed: de bzhin shes pa dri ma'i dbang gyur pas //
translated: so the consciousness affected by stains

original: dri med blo la gnod pa yod ma yin //🔽zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: dri med blo la gnod pa yod ma yin // zhes gsungs te /
translated: does not undermine the stainless mind.

original: de bas na phal pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa nyid la gnod do //
analyzed: de bas na phal pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa nyid la gnod do //
translated: Thus, the consciousness of ordinary beings is undermined by error.

original: 'on te ci phal pa nyid la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gnod dam /
analyzed: 'on te ci phal pa nyid la rnal 'byor pa rnams kyis gnod dam /
translated: Or, do the yogis harm the ordinary ones?

original: 'on te rnal 'byor ba la gnod ce na /
analyzed: 'on te rnal 'byor ba la gnod ce na /
translated: Or, do the ordinary ones harm the yogis?

original: gong ma zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gong ma zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse says, “The higher ones harm the higher ones.”

original: rnal 'byor pa la yang rnal 'byor pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis gnod de /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa la yang rnal 'byor pa gzhan dang gzhan gyis gnod de /
translated: The yogis are harmed by other yogis,

original: phal ba 'ba' zhig la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
analyzed: phal ba 'ba' zhig la ni ma yin no zhes bya ba ni yang gi sgra'i don to //
translated: and not by the ordinary ones alone. This is the meaning of the word “also.”

original: ji lta bur gyur ba zhe na /🔽gong ma gong ma'i zhes te /
analyzed: ji lta bur gyur ba zhe na / gong ma gong ma'i zhes te /
translated: What are they like?🔽The verse says, “The higher ones,”

original: gong ma las kyang gong ma de rnams kyis so ;
analyzed: gong ma las kyang gong ma de rnams kyis so ;
translated: those higher than the higher ones.

original: / yon tan gyi khyad par zhes gong nas gong du gnas pa'i dbye bas khyad par thob pa ste lhag cing lhag pas zhes pa'i don te /
analyzed: / yon tan gyi khyad par zhes gong nas gong du gnas pa'i dbye bas khyad par thob pa ste lhag cing lhag pas zhes pa'i don te /
translated: The verse says, “The special qualities,” which means that they attain a special status through the distinction of being higher and higher.

original: de la ltos nas yon tan chung bar gyur pa 'og ma'i gnod par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: de la ltos nas yon tan chung bar gyur pa 'og ma'i gnod par byed pa yin la /
translated: In relation to that, the lower ones, who have fewer qualities, are harmed.

original: ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis zil gyis gnon to //
analyzed: ye shes kyi che ba'i bdag nyid la sogs pa rnams kyis zil gyis gnon to //
translated: They are surpassed by the greatness of the wisdom of the higher ones.

original: ji ltar zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar zhe na /
translated: How is that?

original: blo khyad kyis te /
analyzed: blo khyad kyis te /
translated: The verse says, “By the distinction of intellect.”

original: blo ni ye shes yin te shes rab kyi khyad par des sgrib pa de dang bral bas mchog tu gyur pa yin la 'di yang mtshon pa tsam ste bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis kyang yin no🔽// 'di ltar yang sa dang po rab tu dga' bar grags pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan la ltos na de'i gong ma dri ma med par brjod pa'i sa gnyis pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi stobs la
analyzed: blo ni ye shes yin te shes rab kyi khyad par des sgrib pa de dang bral bas mchog tu gyur pa yin la 'di yang mtshon pa tsam ste bsam gtan dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa la sogs pa'i khyad par rnams kyis kyang yin no // 'di ltar yang sa dang po rab tu dga' bar grags pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i shes rab la sogs pa'i yon tan la ltos na de'i gong ma dri ma med par brjod pa'i sa gnyis pa thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi stobs la
translated: The mind is wisdom. Since that special wisdom is free from that obscuration, it is supreme. This is just an illustration; the special qualities of meditative stabilization, concentration, and meditative attainment are also like that.

original: sogs pa rnams kyi yon tan khyad par du 'phags so //🔽de bzhin du sa gong ma gong ma gzhun @195b 'thob pa rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
