analyzed: sogs pa rnams kyi yon tan khyad par du 'phags so // de bzhin du sa gong ma gong ma gzhun @195b 'thob pa rnams la yang rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, in comparison with the qualities of wisdom and so on of a bodhisattva who has attained the first ground, the Joyful, the qualities of the power of wisdom and so on of a bodhisattva who has attained the second ground, the Stainless, are superior.🔽The same should be understood for the attainment of the other higher grounds.

original: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa rnams la yang gong ma gong mas gnod par sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: de bzhin du bsam gtan dang po la sogs pa thob pa rnams la yang gong ma gong mas gnod par sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: The same should be understood for the attainment of the first concentration and so on, since the higher ones are able to harm the lower ones.

original: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams la zag pa med pa rnams kyis zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zag pa dang bcas pa rnams la zag pa med pa rnams kyis zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: up to “the uncontaminated [dharmas] with regard to the contaminated [dharmas].”

original: de ltar bden na yang rnal 'byor ba'i blo'i khyad par las phal pa'i shes pa 'khrul ba yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par nus she na /🔽gnyi ga yang ni 'dod pa'i dpes //
analyzed: de ltar bden na yang rnal 'byor ba'i blo'i khyad par las phal pa'i shes pa 'khrul ba yin no zhes ji ltar rtogs par nus she na / gnyi ga yang ni 'dod pa'i dpes //
translated: Even though that is so, how can it be understood that the cognition of ordinary people is mistaken due to the difference in the cognition of the yogi?

original: zhes gsungs te /
analyzed: zhes gsungs te /
translated: [The root text] says, “By the example that is accepted by both.”

original: rnal 'byor ba dang phal pa gnyi ga 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa'i dpe ste nye bar sbyar ba des so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba dang phal pa gnyi ga 'dod cing mngon par 'dod pa'i dpe ste nye bar sbyar ba des so //
translated: By that example that is accepted and desired by both the yogi and ordinary people.

original: gang 'dir mdo rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i dpe gsungs pa yin te /
analyzed: gang 'dir mdo rnams su bcom ldan 'das kyis sgyu ma dang smig rgyu dang dri za'i grong khyer dang / gzugs brnyan la sogs pa'i dpe gsungs pa yin te /
translated: Here in the sūtras, the Blessed One taught examples such as illusions, mirages, cities of gandharvas, and reflections.

original: de yang gnyi ga la rang bzhin med par grub pa yin la /
analyzed: de yang gnyi ga la rang bzhin med par grub pa yin la /
translated: And that is established as lacking intrinsic nature for both [the yogi and ordinary people].

original: de dang chos mthun pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dang chos mthun pas chos thams cad rang bzhin med pa nyid du ston pa'i phyir ro //
translated: By that similarity, [the Buddha] taught that all phenomena are devoid of intrinsic nature.

original: 'di ltar re zhig skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnal 'byor ba de dag nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ltar re zhig skye bo thams cad kyis rtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa rnams rnal 'byor ba de dag nyid kyis rang bzhin med pa nyid du rtogs pa yin te /
translated: Thus, the forms and so on that are realized by all beings are realized by those yogis to be essenceless.

original: don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: don dam pa'i bden pa rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they realize ultimate reality.

original: yang gang dag gis 'di rnams sgyu ma la sogs par dmigs pa de rnams phal ba rnams la yang 'grub ste /
analyzed: yang gang dag gis 'di rnams sgyu ma la sogs par dmigs pa de rnams phal ba rnams la yang 'grub ste /
translated: Also, those who perceive these as illusions and so on are ordinary beings.

original: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dpe'i chos rnams nyams pa med do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gnyi ga la yang log par rtogs pa med pa'i phyir dpe'i chos rnams nyams pa med do //
translated: Therefore, since neither of them has misconceptions, the properties of the example are not undermined.

original: yang dpyod pa la sogs pa gang rnams yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid dngos po nyid de de bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes 'dod de /
analyzed: yang dpyod pa la sogs pa gang rnams yul dang dus gzhan gyi bdag nyid dngos po nyid de de bzhin du snang ba yin no zhes 'dod de /
translated: Also, those who analyze and so on assert that objects and times that are of a different nature are real and appear to be otherwise.

original: de rnams kyang gzhan du sun phyung ba'i phyir de'i 'dod pa 'dir 'gegs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: de rnams kyang gzhan du sun phyung ba'i phyir de'i 'dod pa 'dir 'gegs pa ma yin no //
translated: Since they have been refuted elsewhere, their assertions are not refuted here.

original: rang gi sde pa gang dag kyang sems kyi dngos po yod pa nyid rmi lam la sogs pa rnams la de ltar snang bar 'dod de /
analyzed: rang gi sde pa gang dag kyang sems kyi dngos po yod pa nyid rmi lam la sogs pa rnams la de ltar snang bar 'dod de /
translated: And our own schools assert that the existence of the thing, mind, appears in that way in dreams and so on.

original: de rnams kyang skabs ji lta bar 'og nas rang rig pa 'gegs par sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyang skabs ji lta bar 'og nas rang rig pa 'gegs par sun 'byin par 'gyur ro //
translated: And those will be refuted later on, in the appropriate context, by the refutation of autocognition.

original: rigs pas grub pa yang gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //
analyzed: rigs pas grub pa yang gnyi ga la grub pa yin no //
translated: And the establishment by reasoning is established for both parties.

original: de'i phyir dpe des phyin ci log gi dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa tha ma la pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
analyzed: de'i phyir dpe des phyin ci log gi dngos po'i rang bzhin 'dzin pa tha ma la pa'i shes pa 'khrul pa zhes rnam par 'jog go //
translated: Therefore, by that example, the apprehension of the nature of a thing that is erroneous is posited as a mistaken consciousness.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la yang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor ba'i shes pa la yang ji ltar rigs par shes par bya'o //
translated: And in the same way, it should be understood that it is the same for the consciousness of a yogin, as is appropriate.

original: gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa zhes pa dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin na /
analyzed: gal te dngos po thams cad rang bzhin med pa zhes pa dngos po'i de kho na nyid yin na /
translated: If the reality of things is that all things are essenceless,

original: 'o na sems can thams cad gdon pa'i bsam @196a * //
analyzed: 'o na sems can thams cad gdon pa'i bsam @196a * //
translated: then what is the point of the thought to liberate all sentient beings?

original: bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: bas sbyin pa la sogs pa'i tshogs yongs su rdzogs pa'i don du de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i byang chub sems dpa' yang ji ltar 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: How could a Bodhisattva who has realized reality enter into the perfection of generosity and so forth in order to complete the collections?

original: de rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa yin pa'i phyir ro zhe na /
translated: Because those are also essenceless.🔽Therefore, it says:

original: de'i phyir / dgos pa'i don du ma dpyad phyir //🔽zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: de'i phyir / dgos pa'i don du ma dpyad phyir // zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: Because of the purpose, without analysis.

original: dgos pa ni bsgrub bya dang blang bya dang 'bras bur brjod la de'i don ni de'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
analyzed: dgos pa ni bsgrub bya dang blang bya dang 'bras bur brjod la de'i don ni de'i rgyu mtshan du'o //
translated: Purpose is said to be that which is to be accomplished, that which is to be taken up, and the result. Its meaning is its reason.

original: ma dpyad pa ni ma brtags par de'i rgyu la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: ma dpyad pa ni ma brtags par de'i rgyu la 'jug pa'i phyir te /
translated: Without analysis means without examination, because one engages in its cause.

original: de ltar gyur na yang de la 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nges pa yod pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang de la 'di ni rten cing 'brel par 'byung ba'i nges pa yod pa'i phyir rgyu dang 'bras bu la 'gal ba med do //
translated: Even though it is so, because there is a certainty of dependent origination in that, there is no contradiction in cause and effect.

original: 'di skad du ;
analyzed: 'di skad du ;
translated: This is what is said:

original: gal te yang sgyu ma la sogs pa rang bzhin med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin med pa de lta na yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas gus pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yongs su goms pa na /
analyzed: gal te yang sgyu ma la sogs pa rang bzhin med pas sbyin pa la sogs pa rnams rang bzhin med pa de lta na yang 'khor gsum yongs su dag pas gus pa la sogs pa'i sbyor ba yongs su goms pa na /
translated: Even though generosity and so forth are devoid of intrinsic reality, like an illusion and so on, still, when one is thoroughly familiar with the practice of respect and so on, due to the complete purity of the three sectors,

original: don dam pa rtogs pa'i ched du de lta bur gyur pa yang rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur te //
analyzed: don dam pa rtogs pa'i ched du de lta bur gyur pa yang rgyu'i dngos po nyid du 'gyur te //
translated: it becomes the very substance of the cause for the sake of realizing the ultimate.

original: de rnams kyi thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyi thabs yin pa'i phyir dang / rten cing 'brel bar 'byung ba yang bsam gyis mi khyab pa yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because they are the means for that, and because dependent origination is inconceivable.

original: 'di lta bu ni 'bras bur rtogs te de de'i thabs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu ni 'bras bur rtogs te de de'i thabs las byung ba yin pa'i phyir ro zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: This should be stated as follows: “This is understood as the result, because it arises from that means.”

original: de skad du /
analyzed: de skad du /
translated: As it is said:🔽The conventional truth is the means,

original: thabs su gyur ba tha snyad bden pa dang // thabs las byung ba'i don dam bden pa dag / ces gsungs so //
analyzed: thabs su gyur ba tha snyad bden pa dang // thabs las byung ba'i don dam bden pa dag / ces gsungs so //
translated: and the ultimate truth, which arises from the means, is the result.

original: 'di ni nges par de ltar yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni nges par de ltar yin te /
translated: This is definitely so.

original: gzhan du na dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na lam la sogs pa med na dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las dri ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las rtog pa med par ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan du na dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs na lam la sogs pa med na dri ma dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las dri ma med pa la gnas pa dang / rtog pa dang bcas pa'i gnas skabs las rtog pa med par ji ltar skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: Otherwise, if the path and so on do not exist in the defiled state, then how could one who abides in the stainless state arise from the defiled state, and how could one who abides in the nonconceptual state arise from the conceptual state?

original: de don dam par de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de don dam par de'i rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because ultimately they are its nature.

original: 'di ni gzhan du yang mtshungs pa yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni gzhan du yang mtshungs pa yin te /
translated: This is the same in other cases.

original: chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos thams cad don dam par rang bzhin med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because all phenomena are ultimately essenceless.

original: rgyu nyid dang de'i rang bzhin thams cad la 'bras bur 'dod do //
analyzed: rgyu nyid dang de'i rang bzhin thams cad la 'bras bur 'dod do //
translated: The cause itself and its nature are asserted to be the effect in all cases.

original: de'i phyir kun rdzob rang bzhin med pa las kyang rang bzhin med pa'i rtogs pa nyid 'bras bu yin no /
analyzed: de'i phyir kun rdzob rang bzhin med pa las kyang rang bzhin med pa'i rtogs pa nyid 'bras bu yin no /
translated: Therefore, the effect is the realization of essencelessness from the essenceless conventional.

original: ji ltar 'dus byas pa'i lam las gzhan 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur te /
analyzed: ji ltar 'dus byas pa'i lam las gzhan 'dus ma byas pa'i mya ngan las 'das pa thob par 'gyur te /
translated: How could nirvana, which is unconditioned, be attained from the conditioned path?

original: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po la rang bzhin med pa yin na yang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i ched du @196b sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs rjes 'dzin par mdzad de /
analyzed: de ltar na sbyin pa la sogs pa dngos po la rang bzhin med pa yin na yang don dam pa'i de kho na nyid rtogs pa'i ched du @196b sems can rnams la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi thugs rjes 'dzin par mdzad de /
translated: Thus, although generosity and so on are devoid of intrinsic reality, the bodhisattvas compassionately embrace sentient beings for the sake of realizing ultimate reality.

original: gzhan du na don dam pa rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzhan du na don dam pa rtog pa dang bral ba'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, since the ultimate is free from conceptual thought, it would be impossible to realize it.

original: des na sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma bkag pa nyid de /
analyzed: des na sbyin pa la sogs pa la 'jug pa ma bkag pa nyid de /
translated: Therefore, engaging in generosity and so on is not refuted.

original: de bas na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang spong bar 'dod pas dge ba dang mi dge ba dag la 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ste /
analyzed: de bas na 'dod pa dang mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thob pa dang spong bar 'dod pas dge ba dang mi dge ba dag la 'jug pa dang ldog par bya ste /
translated: Hence, those who wish to obtain the results of what is desirable and to abandon the results of what is not desirable should engage in virtue and turn away from nonvirtue.

original: 'di yang phyi nas gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di yang phyi nas gsal bar byed bar 'gyur ro //
translated: This will be clarified later.

original: de ltar gyur na sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa rtogs pa de nyid skye bo phal pas rtogs na ji ltar gong du log par rtogs pa yod par 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na sgyu ma la sogs pa dang mtshungs pa'i dngos po'i rang gi ngo bo'i rang bzhin rnal 'byor pa rtogs pa de nyid skye bo phal pas rtogs na ji ltar gong du log par rtogs pa yod par 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If that were so, then if the nature of the reality that is similar to an illusion and so on were realized by ordinary people, how could there be the above-mentioned wrong understanding?

original: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'jig rten zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: The verse beginning “Worldly people” and so on is stated.

original: 'jig rten pa ni skye bo phal pa ste rgyu dang / rkyen la brten nas dngos po rnams rang bzhin thob bo zhes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten pa ni skye bo phal pa ste rgyu dang / rkyen la brten nas dngos po rnams rang bzhin thob bo zhes so //
translated: “Worldly people” are ordinary people. They think that things obtain an essence in dependence on causes and conditions.

original: de ltar na dngos po'i sgras ni yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa brjod pa nyid du rtogs so //
analyzed: de ltar na dngos po'i sgras ni yod pa'i rang bzhin gyis dngos po med pa brjod pa nyid du rtogs so //
translated: Thus, the word “thing” is understood to express non-existence by way of an existent essence.

original: mthong ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi yang dag pa nyid du rtog par byed pa'ang yin te /
analyzed: mthong ba 'ba' zhig ni ma yin gyi yang dag pa nyid du rtog par byed pa'ang yin te /
translated: It is not just seeing, but it is also the correct conception.

original: ji ltar rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid don dam par zhen par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: ji ltar rang bzhin rtogs pa nyid don dam par zhen par byed do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that just as one realizes the nature, one should also conceive of the ultimate.

original: gang 'di ni bdag gi rtogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i ngo bo yin te /
analyzed: gang 'di ni bdag gi rtogs pa'i spyod yul du gyur pa'i ngo bo yin te /
translated: This is the essence that is the domain of my realization.

original: de dngos po nyid yin no zhes zhen pa'i phyir la sgyu ma bzhin du ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dngos po nyid yin no zhes zhen pa'i phyir la sgyu ma bzhin du ni ma yin te /
translated: Because of attachment to the very reality of things, not like an illusion.

original: yang ji ltar rnal 'byor pas sgyu ma bzhin du ste /
analyzed: yang ji ltar rnal 'byor pas sgyu ma bzhin du ste /
translated: And how is it that the yogi does not perceive things as they are?

original: sgyu ma lta bur don dam pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba de bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin no //
analyzed: sgyu ma lta bur don dam pa'i rang bzhin mthong ba de bzhin du rtogs pa ma yin no //
translated: He does not perceive the ultimate nature of things as they are, as like an illusion.

original: de'i phyir 'dir zhes te 'di la spyod pa ste log par rtogs pa yin la /
analyzed: de'i phyir 'dir zhes te 'di la spyod pa ste log par rtogs pa yin la /
translated: Therefore, here, in this regard, there is a misperception, a misperception of the yogi.

original: rnal 'byor ba dang 'jig rten pa spyod de rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pa lhan cig tu'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ba dang 'jig rten pa spyod de rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pa lhan cig tu'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The yogi and the world engage together, the yogi and the world together.

original: des rtogs pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid la 'jig rten pas ma rtogs pas yang 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu de rab tu rtogs pa la rnal 'byor pas ji lta ba'i don 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: des rtogs pa'i dngos po'i de kho na nyid la 'jig rten pas ma rtogs pas yang 'jig rten dang lhan cig tu de rab tu rtogs pa la rnal 'byor pas ji lta ba'i don 'gegs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The yogi, perceiving the reality of things as they are, does not perceive it as the world does. Therefore, together with the world, the yogi also perceives it as it is not, because he refutes the meaning as it is.

original: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bsam pa ni 'di yin te /
translated: The idea is this:

original: dngos po thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
analyzed: dngos po thams cad la kun rdzob dang don dam pa'i bden pa ngo bo nyid yod pa yin te /
translated: The conventional and ultimate truths exist by their own nature in all things.

original: de la gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa de nyid ni 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin la gang don dam pa'i bden pa de ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs so zhes brjod do /
analyzed: de la gang kun rdzob kyi bden pa de nyid ni 'jig rten pas rtogs pa yin la gang don dam pa'i bden pa de ni rnal 'byor pas rtogs so zhes brjod do /
translated: The conventional truth is understood by the world, and the ultimate truth is understood by the yogi.

original: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul ba'i glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid sngags la sogs pa'i mthus bslad pa'i mig can gyi skye bo rnams kyis @197a * //
analyzed: dper na sgyu ma mkhan gyis sprul ba'i glang po che la sogs pa'i gzugs nyid sngags la sogs pa'i mthus bslad pa'i mig can gyi skye bo rnams kyis @197a * //
translated: For example, the form of an elephant and so on conjured up by a magician is seen by people whose eyes have been affected by the power of the mantra and so on.

original: mthong ste / sgyu ma mkhan gyis ni de'i rang bzhin la sogs pa gnyug ma'i gzugs mthong ngo //
analyzed: mthong ste / sgyu ma mkhan gyis ni de'i rang bzhin la sogs pa gnyug ma'i gzugs mthong ngo //
translated: The magician sees the intrinsic form of the elephant and so on.

original: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pas kyang yin te ji ltar rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rnal 'byor pa dang 'jig rten pas kyang yin te ji ltar rigs par rtogs par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the yogi and the world see things as they are, as appropriate.

original: de ltar gyur na yang gang skye bo ma lus pa la thun mong du mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de don byed nus pa yin la /
analyzed: de ltar gyur na yang gang skye bo ma lus pa la thun mong du mngon sum gyi tshad mas mthong ba'i dngos po'i rang bzhin de don byed nus pa yin la /
translated: Even though this is so, the intrinsic nature of things that is seen by the valid cognition of direct perception, which is common to all people, is able to perform a function.

original: de la ji ltar bsnyon par nus zhes gzhan gyi sems kyi dogs pa bsu nas /
analyzed: de la ji ltar bsnyon par nus zhes gzhan gyi sems kyi dogs pa bsu nas /
translated: How can that be denied?

original: gzugs sogs mngon sum zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
analyzed: gzugs sogs mngon sum zhes pa la sogs pa gsungs te /
translated: “Even when form and so on are perceived” and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig mngon sum du byas na yang ngo //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gang zhig mngon sum du byas na yang ngo //
translated: Even when form and so on are perceived.

original: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
analyzed: sogs pa'i sgras ni sgra la sogs pa dang tshor ba la sogs pa gzung ngo //
translated: The word “and so on” includes sound and so on, and feeling and so on.

original: de yang yongs su grags pa yin te /
analyzed: de yang yongs su grags pa yin te /
translated: And that is well known.

original: 'jig rten pa'i yongs su grags pa yin la tshad mas min te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i yongs su grags pa yin la tshad mas min te /
translated: It is well known in the world, not by valid cognition.

original: tshad mas rtogs pa mngon sum gyi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa dang 'brel te /
analyzed: tshad mas rtogs pa mngon sum gyi gzugs la sogs pa yod pa ma yin no zhes pa dang 'brel te /
translated: The phrase “form and so on that are perceived by valid cognition do not exist” is connected to this.

original: mngon sum la sogs pa tha snyad pa'i tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mngon sum la sogs pa tha snyad pa'i tshad ma nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because perception and so on are just conventional valid cognitions.

original: des rtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang kun rdzob nyid yin te /
analyzed: des rtogs pa'i gzugs la sogs pa yang kun rdzob nyid yin te /
translated: The form and so on that are perceived by that are just conventional.

original: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
analyzed: 'jig rten pa'i tshad mas yang dag par rtogs par bya ba de kho na nyid kyi rang bzhin ni ma yin te /
translated: The nature of reality that is to be realized by worldly valid cognition is not reality.

original: skye bo thams cad kyis de kho na nyid rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
analyzed: skye bo thams cad kyis de kho na nyid rtogs par thal ba'i phyir ro ;
translated: This is because it follows that all beings would realize reality.

original: / gang gsungs pa /
analyzed: / gang gsungs pa /
translated: As it is said:

original: gang zhig / dbang pos gang zhig dmigs pa de //
analyzed: gang zhig / dbang pos gang zhig dmigs pa de //
translated: If the object perceived by the sense faculty

original: gal te de nyid yin gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid yin gyur na //
translated: Were the very same thing,
